description: AWS Partners learn how generative AI and Amazon Q Developer can accelerate their customer modernization initiatives. This chalk talk explores how Q Developer's code transformation, replatforming, and rearchitecture capabilities, combined with generative AI, streamline the modernization journey. The chalk talk shows how to apply internal developer platforms with self-service app templates, progressive delivery via CI/CD and GitOps, and database modernization using Backstage, Crossplane and AWS-managed services. In addition to technical capabilities, gain insights into how to deliver innovative solutions, reduce technical debt, and capture new revenue streams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services
2. Experience in software development and application modernization
3. Familiarity with CI/CD, GitOps, and developer platform technologies
4. Knowledge of database modernization and cloud-native architecture patterns
5. Awareness of generative AI and its potential applications in software development

title: Accelerating multitenant development with the SaaS Builder Toolkit
description: The SaaS Builder Toolkit (SBT) provides developers with a pre-built set of tools that decompose SaaS into a series of building blocks that can be used to create multitenant environments. This session digs into the moving parts of this toolkit, exploring the inner working of its core components, architecture, and extensibility model. It also looks at a real-world example of SBT in action, composing a working multitenant application from scratch. Additionally, it explores how SBT addresses core concepts, including building a control plane, onboarding tenants, authenticating tenants, supporting tiering, and provisioning tenant resources.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Understanding of Software as a Service (SaaS) architecture.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and technologies.
3. Basic knowledge of software development and application architecture.

title: Accelerating R&D outcomes in quantum computing using Amazon Braket
description: Quantum computing is advancing quickly toward demonstrating an exponential advantage over classical computing for certain problems, with new hardware, software libraries, and applications. In this session, learn about the latest updates to Amazon Braket, a fully managed quantum computing service with access to the latest quantum hardware technology using a single unified interface and familiar pay-as-you-go-pricing. Additionally, learn how customers, including national supercomputing hubs, enterprises, and start-ups, are using Braket to build services around quantum computing as a differentiator in their industries.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of quantum mechanics and quantum computing principles
2. Familiarity with classical computing and its limitations
3. Knowledge of cloud computing services and pay-as-you-go pricing models

title: Accelerating the shift from batch to stream processing [REPEAT]
description: In today’s fast-paced business environment, timely insights from data are crucial for organizations to maintain a competitive edge and respond effectively to dynamic market and customer demands. This chalk talk explores the transformative shift from traditional batch processing to stream processing, enabling real-time data-driven decision-making. Gain insights into key streaming concepts, architectural patterns, potential challenges, and best practices for a seamless migration journey. Through a compelling use case demonstrating the benefits of transitioning to real-time data processing with AWS streaming services, you can acquire a roadmap for embracing stream processing and unlocking agility, responsiveness, and competitive advantage.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data processing concepts
2. Familiarity with traditional batch processing
3. Awareness of the importance of real-time data-driven decision-making
4. Interest in exploring AWS streaming services

title: Accelerating the shift from batch to stream processing [REPEAT]
description: In today’s fast-paced business environment, timely insights from data are crucial for organizations to maintain a competitive edge and respond effectively to dynamic market and customer demands. This chalk talk explores the transformative shift from traditional batch processing to stream processing, enabling real-time data-driven decision-making. Gain insights into key streaming concepts, architectural patterns, potential challenges, and best practices for a seamless migration journey. Through a compelling use case demonstrating the benefits of transitioning to real-time data processing with AWS streaming services, you can acquire a roadmap for embracing stream processing and unlocking agility, responsiveness, and competitive advantage.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of data processing concepts
2. Familiarity with traditional batch processing techniques
3. Exposure to cloud computing and AWS services
4. Interest in real-time data-driven decision-making

title: Accelerating time to value with generative AI (sponsored by Atos Group)
description: Discover how Atos Group is transforming cloud journeys with cutting-edge generative AI solutions. In this lightning talk, discover how Atos’s AI-driven services—spanning cloud migration, application modernization, and cybersecurity—empower businesses to level up their digital transformation. Learn how to use generative AI to optimize your infrastructure, enhance security, and streamline operations all while accelerating time to value. Whether you’re modernizing legacy systems or enhancing cloud security, this talk provides actionable insights to boost your organization’s cloud strategy and future-proof your transformation journey. This presentation is brought to you by Atos Group, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and digital transformation
2. Familiarity with AI and its applications in business
3. Interest in cloud migration, application modernization, and cybersecurity
4. Desire to optimize infrastructure, enhance security, and streamline operations
5. Willingness to explore Atos Group's AI-driven services and solutions

title: Accelerating Web3: Blockchain innovation with AWS Cloud infrastructure
description: Discover how industry leaders leverage AWS to build scalable, secure Web3 solutions. Explore the complete Web3 stack on AWS, from optimized compute to our robust infrastructure backbone. Learn about Amazon Managed Blockchain and automated node runners for effortless blockchain deployment. Uncover AI-driven analytics for blockchain data and get tips for maximizing AWS compute in Web3 projects. Hear an introduction to Web3 blueprints for rapid development and see a showcase of real-world applications in decentralized technologies. Join this session and learn how AWS's comprehensive cloud services are revolutionizing blockchain innovation and unlocking new possibilities in the Web3 landscape.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Understanding of blockchain technology and Web3 principles.
3. Interest in exploring the integration of AWS services with decentralized technologies.

title: Accelerating your SaaS transformation with AWS Marketplace
description: In this lightning talk, explore how companies can leverage AWS Marketplace to rapidly transform their products as well as best practices to accelerate listing their SaaS offerings in AWS Marketplace. Whether you’re a startup looking to scale your SaaS offering or an enterprise seeking to drive innovation, this session provides practical insights and strategies to leverage AWS Marketplace and unlock the full potential of your product transformation journey.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS Marketplace
2. Knowledge of SaaS offerings and product transformation
3. Familiarity with scaling SaaS businesses
4. Interest in accelerating the listing of SaaS offerings on AWS Marketplace
5. Desire to unlock the potential of product transformation

title: Accessible live streaming: Using generative AI for inclusivity
description: Discover how AWS services can be used to provide accessible live streaming content delivery with multiple language captions, subtitles, and generative AI–powered American Sign Language (ASL) companion streams. Learn to architect and build live-streaming workflows by using deep learning and generative AI services to cost-effectively deliver inclusive digital experiences. This chalk talk guides you through the step-by-step process, highlighting opportunities to remove undifferentiated heavy lifting and enhance content accessibility for diverse audiences worldwide.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing
2. Familiarity with live streaming technologies and content delivery
3. Knowledge of accessibility standards and requirements
4. Experience with deep learning and generative AI concepts

title: Achieve low latency with AWS Local Zones
description: With over 40 Local Zones located in major metros across the world, AWS leverages these Local Zones to run applications that require low latency, bringing your services closer to users regardless of their location. This interactive chalk talk dives into real-world use cases to demonstrate how Local Zones can enhance network performance. Learn how you can run your low latency applications in Local Zones. Explore the power of Local Zones in optimizing your application’s responsiveness and security.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Knowledge of network performance and latency requirements.
3. Familiarity with application deployment and optimization strategies.

title: Achieve personalization at scale using Amazon Redshift and Twilio (sponsored by Twilio)
description: Knowing your customer starts with knowing your data, but that’s difficult to do when the data is disparate and inaccessible. Join Twilio’s CPO & VP of Product to learn about trends shaping customer data and how to structure your tech stack to increase customer engagement. This session explores how Twilio and AWS offerings—including Amazon Redshift, Amazon S3, Amazon Personalize, and Amazon SageMaker—can help you connect siloed data. See developer tools in action and hear from a Twilio and AWS customer on how to use contextual data and channels, combined with the power of generative and predictive AI, to build personalization at scale. This presentation is brought to you by Twilio, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of customer data management
2. Familiarity with data integration and data architecture
3. Knowledge of Twilio and AWS offerings, including Amazon Redshift, Amazon S3, Amazon Personalize, and Amazon SageMaker
4. Interest in leveraging contextual data and channels, combined with generative and predictive AI, for personalization at scale

title: Achieve seamless and secure data sharing
description: Data-driven organizations need to ensure that the right data is accessed by the right user for the right purpose—in accordance with the organization’s security regulations—without relying on individual credentials. Join this session to explore strategies for efficiently sharing data across teams and platforms while maintaining security and compliance with AWS analytics services. Learn best practices for managing permissions, encryption, and data governance to ensure secure and efficient data sharing across your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management and security principles
2. Familiarity with AWS analytics services
3. Knowledge of data governance and compliance requirements
4. Experience in managing user permissions and data access controls

title: Achieving a secure microservices architecture on Amazon ECS
description: This chalk talk dives into securing microservices on Amazon ECS. Explore best practices for exposing applications securely to external consumers using Amazon API Gateway and Amazon Cognito, and learn how to enable secure communication between downstream microservices (east-west traffic) within the cluster using Amazon ECS Service Connect. Gain practical insights into implementing a secure microservices architecture on Amazon ECS throughout the application lifecycle.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of microservices architecture.
2. Familiarity with Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service).
3. Knowledge of Amazon API Gateway and Amazon Cognito.
4. Familiarity with secure communication patterns in distributed systems.
5. Understanding of the application lifecycle in a microservices environment.

title: Achieving breakthrough results using IT and OT data contextualization (sponsored by Hitachi)
description: In today’s complex, high-mix environment of products, platforms, compute options, and environments, IT and operational lines of business need proven partners to help design the right systems, integrate critical IT and OT data systems, make them cloud-ready, and then use insights from gen AI to help them manifest their ideas at scale. In this session, hear Hitachi and Verizon discuss how one of the world’s largest communications companies is benefiting from Hitachi’s expertise to build an agile, secure, and scalable enterprise infrastructure on AWS. Also learn about professional engineering services, IT and OT system integration services, and storage and infrastructure solutions. This presentation is brought to you by Hitachi, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Understanding of complex, high-mix environments in IT and operational lines of business.
2. Interest in leveraging proven partners to design, integrate, and cloud-ready IT and OT data systems.
3. Desire to utilize insights from generative AI to scale business ideas.
4. Familiarity with enterprise infrastructure and the benefits of agile, secure, and scalable solutions.
5. Interest in professional engineering services, IT and OT system integration services, and storage and infrastructure solutions.

title: Achieving governance at scale
description: As businesses scale their cloud operations, maintaining consistent enforcement of policies and standards becomes increasingly complex. This breakout session delves into the powerful capabilities of AWS Control Tower, AWS Config, and AWS Organizations, providing attendees with a comprehensive understanding of how to achieve governance at scale. Learn how to integrate AWS services to automate governance processes, streamline incident response, and enforce security best practices across AWS environments. Also hear from a customer and their governance journey on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) and AWS Organizations.
3. Knowledge of AWS Config and its capabilities.
4. Awareness of AWS Control Tower and its governance features.

title: Achieving learning excellence for the AWS tech stack (sponsored by Udemy Business)
description: Join this lightning talk to hear Udemy Business share actionable insights that can help your organization excel in the AWS tech stack. As IT and L&D leaders navigate rapid technological change and tighter resources, the need for a strategic approach to upskilling has never been greater. Discover a powerful blueprint for linking your learning strategy with business objectives, leveraging advanced technologies, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement. Over 16,000 customers around the world trust Udemy to help grow their talent, boost productivity, and keep their tech skills sharp. Don’t miss this opportunity to stay ahead. This presentation is brought to you by Udemy Business, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Interest in upskilling and professional development
2. Familiarity with AWS and cloud technologies
3. Experience in IT or learning and development roles
4. Desire to align learning strategies with business objectives
5. Openness to leveraging advanced technologies for skill development

title: Achieving scale with Amazon Aurora Limitless Database
description: Amazon Aurora is a relational database service built for the cloud that is designed for unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale, with full MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility. In this session, learn how Amazon Aurora Limitless Database enables applications to scale to millions of transactions per second across petabytes of data. Explore the architecture, distributed transaction management, and serverless scaling capabilities of Aurora Limitless Database. Also, discover application patterns that are a good fit for Aurora Limitless Database and which patterns to avoid. Learn how Aurora Limitless Database makes it easier than ever to scale Aurora.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session on Amazon Aurora Limitless Database would be:

1. Basic understanding of relational databases.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and scalability concepts.
3. Knowledge of MySQL or PostgreSQL database management.
4. Interest in high-performance and highly available database solutions.
5. Desire to learn about distributed transaction management and serverless scaling.

title: A close look at how AWS builds generative AI on Amazon SageMaker
description: Amazon SageMaker offers purpose-built infrastructure and tools to accelerate foundation model development, including IDEs and notebooks backed by high-performance accelerated computing, resilient infrastructure for distributed training at scale, governance and MLOps tools, cost-effective inference options and recommendations, and model monitoring and evaluation. In this session, learn how SageMaker helps data scientists and ML engineers at AWS to build new foundation models that power its own generative AI innovations.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given statement would be:

1. Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS and its services, particularly Amazon SageMaker.
3. Understanding of foundation models and their development process.
4. Experience with distributed training and high-performance computing.
5. Familiarity with MLOps tools and model governance.

title: Adapting LLMs for domain-aware applications with AWS Trainium post-training
description: While large language models (LLMs) have broad knowledge and versatility, tailoring these powerful models to specific domains unlocks new levels of understanding and performance, allowing them to enhance user experience in domain-focused or industry-vertical applications. In this workshop, learn how to apply post-training techniques like supervised fine-tuning and model alignment on AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia using Amazon SageMaker and Hugging Face Optimum Neuron library. Explore how to deploy these models and evaluate the effects of these techniques with domain-specific accuracy tests. You must bring a laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon SageMaker and AWS Trainium/Inferentia.
3. Experience with Hugging Face Transformers and Optimum Neuron library.
4. Ability to work with a laptop during the workshop.

title: Adaptive defense strategies to enhance cyber resilience in the cloud (sponsored by Cohesity)
description: Learn how establishing a robust cyber resilience framework can help organizations respond and recover quickly from security events. Join Cohesity to explore the most recent threats landscape developments, effective security strategies, and practical tips for securing your cloud environment. This session offers valuable insights to bolster your cyber defenses and ensure uninterrupted business operations amidst ever-changing digital threats. This presentation is brought to you by Cohesity, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cybersecurity concepts
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud security
3. Familiarity with data management and protection strategies

title: Addressing data residency requirements with hybrid and edge services
description: Data residency is a critical consideration for organizations that collect and store sensitive information, including personal identifiable information (PII), financial data, healthcare data, or information pertaining to national security. To help organizations operating across multiple geographies drive innovation while meeting data residency requirements, AWS offers multiple global infrastructure offerings like AWS Regions, AWS Dedicated Local Zones, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts. In this interactive chalk talk, learn how these infrastructure offerings can help you accelerate digital transformation while meeting data residency needs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of data residency regulations and requirements.
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services.
3. Familiarity with digital transformation strategies.
4. Experience in managing sensitive data, such as PII, financial, or healthcare data.
5. Interest in leveraging AWS infrastructure offerings to address data residency challenges.

title: Add search to your existing databases with Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion
description: Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion provides a low-touch, no-code way to move data from diverse systems like Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon DocumentDB to OpenSearch for search and analytics. OpenSearch Ingestion, powered by open source Data Prepper, provides a rich set of configurable processors and pipelines to move data from source to sink. This chalk talk covers best practices for configuring and using OpenSearch Ingestion. Whether you need to augment your key-value store with rich search or bring OpenTelemetry data to OpenSearch for observability, OpenSearch Ingestion is your tool.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon DocumentDB.
2. Familiarity with OpenSearch and its use cases.
3. Knowledge of data ingestion and processing concepts.
4. Familiarity with the open-source Data Prepper project.
5. Familiarity with configuring and managing data pipelines.

title: A developer’s survival kit: Tools for building beyond the AWS console
description: Unlock the full potential as a developer on AWS with a “survival kit” of resources and tools to maximize productivity. In this session, discover techniques for managing resources beyond the management console using integrated development environments (IDEs), AWS command line interface (CLI), and services like Amazon Q Developer, and the AWS Toolkit. Watch as programming examples are demonstrated using Python and JavaScript to automate deployments and manage cloud resources effectively. Join the talk and learn how to survive in the wild with the skills needed to explore and build applications on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with programming languages like Python and JavaScript
3. Exposure to AWS services and the AWS Management Console

title: Adopt AWS operations management culture on your team
description: AWS knows that service reliability is something that you rely on. In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon has used cultural and technical mechanisms to help teams more effectively operate in a decentralized organization, especially for critical processes like incident management. Dive into the mechanisms and tools that AWS on-call operators use to triage, prioritize, respond to, and mitigate events while exploring how the Amazon culture influences all of these. This talk breaks down and shares the practical methodologies and tools that AWS uses to ensure a low day-to-day ops load and a lower mean time to resolution (MTTR) for incidents.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Knowledge of incident management and service reliability principles
4. Awareness of organizational culture and its impact on operations
5. Interest in learning about AWS's internal practices and tools

title: Adopting the SaaS mindset to drive growth
description: Moving to SaaS is a significant business model change. Learn how to modify the entire organization structure, processes, reporting, and measurements. In this session look at the implications of moving to SaaS and how to adopt a SaaS mindset. Learn how AWS can support your business transformation, which tools are available to help you build faster, and what programs are available to help you successfully grow your revenue.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of business models and organizational structures
2. Knowledge of software-as-a-service (SaaS) industry and its characteristics
3. Familiarity with AWS services and tools
4. Experience in business transformation and change management
5. Awareness of revenue growth strategies for SaaS businesses

title: Advanced analytics with AWS Cost and Usage Reports
description: In this code talk, dive deep into AWS Cost and Usage Reports (AWS CUR) and learn how to write queries, analyze usage, derive insights, and connect other datasets. Learn the different data export options, including Legacy CUR, CUR 2.0, and FinOps Open Cost and Usage Specification (FOCUS) 1.0. Whether you're a FinOps practitioner, an experienced AWS user, or a DevOps engineer, this talk equips you with knowledge and techniques to harness the full potential of your AWS cost and usage data. Join us to take your cloud cost management to the next level!
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with data analysis and querying tools (e.g., SQL, Python, etc.).
3. Experience in cloud cost management or FinOps practices.

title: Advanced cost allocation for AWS containerized workloads
description: Due to the dynamic nature of cloud workloads and the inherent use of shared services, organizations are looking for simple ways to analyze spend and allocate their shared costs to teams and applications that utilize them. In this hands-on workshop, learn about the tools and techniques that can help you build your cost allocation strategy. Discover best practices for tagging and analyzing spend, and find out how to improve the cost visibility of your containerized Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS workloads with the split cost allocation data feature. Also, learn how to visualize your detailed cost and usage data with Amazon QuickSight dashboards. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services, specifically Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS
3. Proficiency in data analysis and visualization
4. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities

title: Advanced cross-Region DR patterns on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Join this hands-on workshop to explore a resilient, cloud-native architecture that surpasses the stringent availability and recovery regulations for financial markets utility providers. This highly available design uses Amazon ECS, Java Spring Boot, Amazon MQ, Amazon Kinesis, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Aurora, Amazon Application Recovery Controller, and AWS Systems Manager. Delve into key design decisions, including cross-Region data stores, messaging, and cross-Region state replication. Also learn about exactly-once transaction processing, reliable global traffic shifting, and best practices for fail-safe disaster recovery orchestration. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this workshop:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with Java and Spring Boot
3. Experience with distributed systems and microservices architecture
4. Knowledge of data storage and messaging technologies

title: Advanced cross-Region DR patterns on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Join this hands-on workshop to explore a resilient, cloud-native architecture that surpasses the stringent availability and recovery regulations for financial markets utility providers. This highly available design uses Amazon ECS, Java Spring Boot, Amazon MQ, Amazon Kinesis, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Aurora, Amazon Application Recovery Controller, and AWS Systems Manager. Delve into key design decisions, including cross-Region data stores, messaging, and cross-Region state replication. Also learn about exactly-once transaction processing, reliable global traffic shifting, and best practices for fail-safe disaster recovery orchestration. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
2. Experience with Java and Spring Boot framework
3. Understanding of distributed systems and messaging architectures
4. Knowledge of database concepts, including Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon Aurora
5. Familiarity with disaster recovery and high availability strategies

title: Advanced data modeling for Amazon ElastiCache
description: This session delves into the intricacies of Amazon ElastiCache data modeling using the purpose-built Valkey data types to optimize application performance and scalability. Explore the use of strings, sets, sorted sets, hashes, bitmaps, and geospatial indexes to model complex relationships and solve use cases such as caching, session store, feature store, real-time analytics, geospatial applications, and rate limiters.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon ElastiCache
2. Familiarity with data structures (strings, sets, sorted sets, hashes, bitmaps, and geospatial indexes)
3. Knowledge of application performance and scalability concepts

title: Advanced data modeling with Amazon DynamoDB
description: Amazon DynamoDB is a popular choice for modern applications because it’s a serverless database that provides single-digit millisecond performance at any scale. Optimizing your usage of DynamoDB requires a different approach to data modeling than traditional relational databases. In this session, AWS Data Hero Alex DeBrie shows you advanced techniques to help you get the most out of DynamoDB. Learn how to “think in DynamoDB” by learning the DynamoDB foundations and principles for data modeling. Further, learn practical strategies and DynamoDB features to handle difficult use cases in your application.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and serverless architectures
2. Basic knowledge of database concepts and data modeling
3. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS ecosystem

title: Advanced networking on Amazon S3
description: Whether your apps are running on premises, within an AWS Region, across multiple AWS Regions, or a mix of all three, AWS gives you a broad range of options to connect your applications to Amazon S3. This session will provide a deep dive into AWS networking topics specific to S3, including building resiliency with S3 Multi-Region Access Points and connecting privately with AWS PrivateLink for Amazon S3.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session would be:

1. Understanding of AWS networking concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon S3 and its features
3. Knowledge of AWS multi-region architecture
4. Familiarity with AWS PrivateLink
5. Experience with building resilient and highly available applications

title: Advanced patterns for distributed systems
description: Today’s applications are interconnected: they expose APIs, publish events, call third-party services, and externalize states. They must therefore address the fundamental challenges of distributed systems, such as out-of-order delivery, retries, idempotence, or partial failures. To balance those characteristics, architects have a range of options, including reducing the level of coupling through indirection, transformation, and asynchrony. In this session, learn about common design trade-offs for distributed systems and how to navigate them with design patterns, illustrated with real-world examples.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of distributed systems concepts
2. Knowledge of API design and event-driven architectures
3. Familiarity with design patterns and architectural principles
4. Experience with asynchronous communication and message-based integration
5. Awareness of common challenges in distributed systems, such as partial failures and idempotence

title: Advanced security patterns on Amazon S3 [REPEAT]
description: Amazon S3 security settings and access controls are suitable for virtually any workload. In this chalk talk, equip yourself with proven patterns for managing access at scale. Learn how to optimize policy usage, scale beyond AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy limits, and secure your data lake perimeter.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
2. Familiarity with Amazon S3 concepts and features
3. Knowledge of data lake architecture and security considerations
4. Experience with AWS services and their integration
5. Awareness of AWS security best practices

title: Advanced security patterns on Amazon S3 [REPEAT]
description: Amazon S3 security settings and access controls are suitable for virtually any workload. In this chalk talk, equip yourself with proven patterns for managing access at scale. Learn how to optimize policy usage, scale beyond AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy limits, and secure your data lake perimeter.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
2. Familiarity with Amazon S3 storage service
3. Knowledge of data lake architecture and security considerations
4. Experience with AWS policy management and scaling
5. Awareness of AWS service limits and optimization techniques

title: Advanced strategies for prompt engineering in gen AI app deployment
description: Join this engaging chalk talk to dive into prompt engineering techniques to simplify the creation, evaluation, versioning, and sharing of prompts, and learn how to get the best responses from foundation models for your own use cases. Discover visual tools to author executable flows, enabling rapid prototyping and collaboration. This interactive technical talk features discussions and hands-on guidance. Leave this talk equipped to design, refine, and deploy sophisticated AI solutions driven by powerful prompts and interconnected prompt flows. Enhance your skills and take your AI deployments to the next level with expert insights and real-world strategies.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and AI concepts.
2. Familiarity with foundation models (e.g., GPT-3, DALL-E).
3. Interest in prompt engineering and AI solution development.

title: Advanced VPC design and what’s new in VPC
description: Amazon VPC is a foundational service on AWS, giving you control over your virtual networking environment. Every year, AWS makes updates to Amazon VPC to help improve functionality, security, and usability. In this session, learn about the latest updates to Amazon VPC and how you can use them to enhance your current architectures.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and networking concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS Management Console.
3. Knowledge of virtual private cloud (VPC) and its components.
4. Experience with network security and access control.
5. Familiarity with AWS networking services and their integration with Amazon VPC.

title: Advancing physical AI: NVIDIA Isaac Lab and AWS for next-gen robotics (sponsored by NVIDIA)
description: The future of robotics lies in physical AI—robots capable of autonomously performing intricate tasks in the real world. To meet this grand challenge, accelerating the development of AI-powered robots is essential. This requires a simulation-first approach to safely and efficiently train these advanced systems. In this developer-centric session, learn how to fast-track your robotics projects using NVIDIA Isaac Lab, an open source, modular framework designed for reinforcement learning. By integrating Isaac Lab with AWS Batch on GPU-accelerated Amazon EC2 instances, you can use scalable cloud resources to rapidly train robots against a comprehensive set of policies in a simulated environment. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session would be:

1. Familiarity with robotics and AI
2. Understanding of reinforcement learning
3. Experience with simulation-based training for robotics
4. Knowledge of NVIDIA Isaac Lab and its integration with AWS Batch
5. Familiarity with GPU-accelerated cloud computing on Amazon EC2

title: Advancing responsible AI: Managing generative AI risk [REPEAT]
description: Risk assessment is an essential part of responsible AI (RAI) development and is also required to meet industry standards and laws such as ISO 42001 and the EU AI Act. This chalk talk gives an introduction to best practices for RAI risk assessment for generative AI applications, covering controllability, veracity, fairness, robustness, explainability, privacy and security, transparency, and governance. Explore examples to estimate the severity and likelihood of potential events that could be harmful. Learn about Amazon SageMaker tooling for model governance, bias, explainability, and monitoring, and about transparency in the form of service cards as potential risk mitigation strategies.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Understanding of Responsible AI (RAI) principles and best practices.
2. Familiarity with industry standards and regulations, such as ISO 42001 and the EU AI Act.
3. Knowledge of risk assessment methodologies and techniques.
4. Familiarity with generative AI applications and their potential risks.
5. Understanding of Amazon SageMaker tooling for model governance, bias, explainability, and monitoring.

title: Advancing responsible AI: Managing generative AI risk [REPEAT]
description: Risk assessment is an essential part of responsible AI (RAI) development and is also required to meet industry standards and laws such as ISO 42001 and the EU AI Act. This chalk talk gives an introduction to best practices for RAI risk assessment for generative AI applications, covering controllability, veracity, fairness, robustness, explainability, privacy and security, transparency, and governance. Explore examples to estimate the severity and likelihood of potential events that could be harmful. Learn about Amazon SageMaker tooling for model governance, bias, explainability, and monitoring, and about transparency in the form of service cards as potential risk mitigation strategies.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Understanding of Responsible AI (RAI) principles and development.
2. Knowledge of industry standards and regulations related to AI, such as ISO 42001 and the EU AI Act.
3. Familiarity with generative AI applications and their potential risks.
4. Familiarity with concepts like controllability, veracity, fairness, robustness, explainability, privacy, security, transparency, and governance in the context of AI.
5. Basic understanding of Amazon SageMaker and its tools for model governance, bias, explainability, and monitoring.

title: Advancing security, reliability, and cost-efficiency [Japanese]
description: This session is delivered in Japanese. In this session, explore the key technological advancements at AWS in 2024 that are empowering businesses to securely run workloads, build resilient architectures, and optimize cloud spend. Hear directly from two customers who have successfully harnessed the power of the cloud to drive innovation and achieve their strategic objectives. Learn valuable insights and inspiration to accelerate your own cloud journey and unlock the full potential of AWS to transform your business.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Proficiency in the Japanese language
2. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Interest in exploring the latest technological advancements in the cloud
4. Desire to learn from successful customer case studies
5. Motivation to accelerate your own cloud journey and business transformation

title: Advancing state-of-the-art science and AI in financial services (sponsored by Capital One)
description: As organizations look to build and scale their AI efforts in a cloud-enabled enterprise, it’s more important than ever to take an integrated approach that mobilizes cross-functional partners, enables the use of cutting-edge tools, and stays at the forefront of the latest science and applied research. In this session, Capital One shares insights from building programs for generative AI at scale, tools and platforms that help data scientists and engineers put models into production, and insights for using state-of-the-art AI research advances to inform and evolve enterprise AI capabilities and applications. This presentation is brought to you by Capital One, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Cloud-enabled enterprise
2. Cross-functional collaboration
3. Familiarity with cutting-edge AI tools and platforms
4. Knowledge of the latest AI research and advancements
5. Experience in enterprise-level AI implementation

title: Agentic AI and the journey to gen AI value realization (sponsored by ZS)
description: AI agents and gen AI are revolutionizing industries by enhancing decision-making, boosting operational efficiency, and addressing diverse business challenges. In this lightning talk, explore real-life examples of how companies are bridging the gap between the potential of agentic gen AI and its practical, value-driven implementation. Learn how to use the power of AWS to deploy agentic workflows, gen AI for content generation experimentation, and on-demand analytics. Discover how to quickly identify and unlock value through specific use cases and tackle key challenges in the journey to value realization including enterprise enablement, scaling, and domain customization. This presentation is brought to you by ZS, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the lightning talk:

1. Understanding of AI agents and generative AI technologies.
2. Knowledge of practical applications and use cases of AI in various industries.
3. Familiarity with AWS cloud services and their role in deploying AI-powered solutions.
4. Awareness of the challenges and considerations in implementing AI-driven workflows and content generation.
5. Interest in learning how to unlock value and achieve practical, value-driven implementation of AI technologies.

title: Agentic evaluations using Amazon Bedrock and open source frameworks
description: This code talk dives deep into the evaluation of agentic applications built with large language models (LLMs), leveraging Amazon Bedrock and open source frameworks. Attendees will gain insights into concepts like Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), pipelines, agent evaluation, and LangSmith—a unified platform for debugging, testing, evaluating, and monitoring LLM applications. The talk explores techniques for assessing performance metrics, such as quality, cost, and latency, across the development lifecycle. Additionally, it highlights the role of LLM judges and agent metrics in evaluating retrieval, request quality, and overall application performance, enabling attendees to build robust and reliable agentic solutions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this talk:
1. Understanding of large language models (LLMs)
2. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and open-source frameworks
3. Knowledge of concepts like Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), pipelines, and agent evaluation
4. Familiarity with LangSmith, a platform for debugging, testing, evaluating, and monitoring LLM applications
5. Understanding of performance metrics, such as quality, cost, and latency, in the context of LLM applications

title: A guide to networking with AWS CloudWAN [REPEAT]
description: Embark on an adventure through the vast CloudWAN universe! From single-region greenfield explorations to multi-region global conquests, explore network segmentation, service insertion, AWS Direct Connect, and SD-WAN integration with Tuneless Connect. Discover the ultimate question: AWS Transit Gateway or Cloud WAN? Packed with real-world case studies and insights from seasoned experts, this mind-bending yet engaging session delivers a healthy dose of humor and networking puns. Don't panic, just network like a pro as we guide you through the dos and don'ts of these powerful AWS services. Get ready for an out-of-this-world networking experience!
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud networking concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS Direct Connect and AWS Transit Gateway
3. Knowledge of SD-WAN and network segmentation
4. Experience with real-world networking case studies and best practices
5. Appreciation for networking puns and humor

title: A guide to networking with AWS CloudWAN [REPEAT]
description: Embark on an adventure through the vast CloudWAN universe! From single-region greenfield explorations to multi-region global conquests, explore network segmentation, service insertion, AWS Direct Connect, and SD-WAN integration with Tuneless Connect. Discover the ultimate question: AWS Transit Gateway or Cloud WAN? Packed with real-world case studies and insights from seasoned experts, this mind-bending yet engaging session delivers a healthy dose of humor and networking puns. Don't panic, just network like a pro as we guide you through the dos and don'ts of these powerful AWS services. Get ready for an out-of-this-world networking experience!

2. Understanding of network segmentation and service insertion
3. Knowledge of AWS Direct Connect and SD-WAN integration
4. Awareness of AWS Transit Gateway and Cloud WAN
5. Interest in real-world networking case studies and insights

title: AI at production scale: Cloudera’s inference service with NVIDIA (sponsored by Cloudera)
description: Companies seeking to deploy AI models and applications in production face many barriers to success, including strict requirements for high availability, compute performance, fault tolerance, and scalability. In this lightning talk, discover Cloudera’s AI inference service with NVIDIA, which accelerates the development of AI models. See a live demo of the service (currently in technical preview), and learn how it helps data scientists and engineers quickly build, train, and deploy AI in production without worrying about the infrastructure or maintenance. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudera, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the presentation would be:

1. Knowledge of AI model deployment challenges
2. Interest in accelerating AI model development
3. Familiarity with Cloudera and NVIDIA's AI inference service
4. Desire to learn about a production-ready AI deployment solution
5. Curiosity about a live demo of the AI inference service

title: AI-driven traffic management for safer cities [REPEAT]
description: In this builders’ session, explore how AI and machine learning can revolutionize traffic management to enhance safety and reduce congestion in urban areas. Gain hands-on experience in deploying technologies to collect and analyze real-time traffic data, build predictive models, and optimize traffic flow dynamically. Create a simulated traffic environment, configure sensors, and establish a data pipeline. Build and train a machine learning model and then deploy it using serverless computing for real-time predictions. Ideal for developers, data scientists, and traffic management professionals, this session aims to create a functional AI-driven traffic management prototype. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with programming languages (e.g., Python, Java)
2. Basic understanding of machine learning concepts
3. Experience with data analysis and visualization tools
4. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)
5. Interest in traffic management and urban planning

title: AI-driven traffic management for safer cities [REPEAT]
description: In this builders’ session, explore how AI and machine learning can revolutionize traffic management to enhance safety and reduce congestion in urban areas. Gain hands-on experience in deploying technologies to collect and analyze real-time traffic data, build predictive models, and optimize traffic flow dynamically. Create a simulated traffic environment, configure sensors, and establish a data pipeline. Build and train a machine learning model and then deploy it using serverless computing for real-time predictions. Ideal for developers, data scientists, and traffic management professionals, this session aims to create a functional AI-driven traffic management prototype. 3. Familiarity with data analysis and visualization tools
4. Interest in traffic management and urban planning

title: AI-enhanced media archives: Classify, discover, and monetize
description: Significant amounts of archived media files remain undiscovered, leading to unrealized monetization opportunities for media owners. Learn how to use AWS services and advanced generative AI models to automate the classification, discovery, and promotion of archived media content. See examples of how you can effortlessly classify and catalog your media archive and enable natural language interactions for content discovery, and then accelerate time to market by automatically generating teasers and promotional content from the rediscovered gems. Discuss options to unlock new revenue streams and breathe life into your archived media treasures with a no-code, AI-driven approach.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with machine learning and natural language processing concepts
3. Experience in media management or content curation
4. Awareness of current trends and technologies in the media and entertainment industry
5. Ability to identify and analyze business opportunities in the media domain

title: AI in sports: How AI and Amazon Bedrock are changing the game
description: AI is disrupting industries at an alarming rate. What does this mean for the sports industry, which is deeply rooted in tradition? Join Infinite Athlete CTO Chris Brown to explore the use of AI in sports, what Infinite Athlete is doing to advance the state of the art, and how AWS makes it possible.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this topic would be:

1. Understanding of AI and its disruptive impact on various industries.
2. Knowledge of the sports industry and its traditional nature.
3. Familiarity with the use of AI in sports applications.
4. Awareness of Infinite Athlete and its work in advancing the state of the art in AI for sports.
5. Understanding of the role of AWS in enabling AI-powered solutions in the sports industry.

title: AI in the cloud: Heroes, "villains," and security strategies (sponsored by Trend Micro)
description: AI has completely transformed the realm of cloud computing, boosting efficiency, scalability, and performance. But the ubiquity and accessibility of AI can also expose cloud assets and workflows to a broader range of security risks. These new AI tools can be a double-edged sword, empowering developers and security teams to work smarter and faster while equipping villains to do the same. In this session, learn how to get your fairytale ending with actionable strategies to protect your cloud environment in the AI era. This presentation is brought to you by Trend Micro, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AI and its applications
3. Knowledge of cloud security risks and challenges
4. Awareness of the potential impact of AI on cloud environments
5. Interest in learning actionable strategies to secure cloud environments in the AI era

title: AI-managed telecom ecosystem: Closer than ever
description: In this lightning talk, discover how Amdocs transformed their SaaS platforms’ development and delivery processes by adopting serverless, AI-powered solutions on AWS. With AI models integrated into their development pipeline, Amdocs streamlined activities such as code generation, testing, and automation, enhanced overall productivity, and reduced manual efforts. Learn how leveraging services like Amazon Bedrock helps Amdocs' deployment teams transform from fixed codebase and complex implementation processes to a generative AI–based tenants creation and customer customization using natural language and simplified experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of SaaS platform development and delivery processes
2. Knowledge of serverless and AI-powered solutions on AWS
3. Familiarity with AI models and their integration into development pipelines
4. Awareness of services like Amazon Bedrock
5. Interest in streamlining development activities and enhancing productivity

title: AI on AMD in public cloud: Increased access at optimized cost & power (sponsored by AMD)
description: AI and ML applications require a broad range of foundational technologies. In this session, discover AMD’s portfolio of inference and training products that provide excellent performance and price performance for models small and large, and explore AMD’s broad software and solution ecosystem. In addition, AMD’s partner, Neural Magic, shows how DeepSparse CPU inference optimization technology enables cost efficiency, optimized performance, and energy efficiency for in-demand inference-driven applications. This presentation is brought to you by AMD, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)
2. Knowledge of inference and training processes in AI/ML applications
3. Familiarity with hardware and software components in the AI/ML ecosystem
4. Interest in exploring cost-efficient and energy-efficient solutions for inference-driven applications

title: AI on tap [REPEAT]
description: Discover an immersive, interactive beer experience that brings AI and ML to life. A smart kegerator with a virtual bartender lets customers chat, discover beers, and pour their choice. It showcases natural language processing, computer vision, and generative AI's future in hospitality and retail.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given project would be:

1. Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) and conversational AI
2. Expertise in computer vision and image recognition
3. Understanding of generative AI and its applications
4. Hardware engineering skills for designing and building the smart kegerator
5. Integration of various technologies (NLP, computer vision, generative AI) into a cohesive system

title: AI on tap [REPEAT]
description: Discover an immersive, interactive beer experience that brings AI and ML to life. A smart kegerator with a virtual bartender lets customers chat, discover beers, and pour their choice. It showcases natural language processing, computer vision, and generative AI's future in hospitality and retail.

5. Familiarity with the hospitality and retail industries

title: AI-powered analytics with Amazon Redshift Serverless & data sharing
description: Amazon Redshift Serverless uses AI and ML to automatically provision and scale data warehouse capacity and deliver fast performance for demanding and unpredictable workloads. It delivers a first-class data sharing experience where you can isolate workloads and read from and write to the same Redshift databases to build multi-warehouse, data mesh architectures and simplify SQL analytics. Join this session to learn best practices and key considerations for data sharing and SQL analytics with Redshift Serverless to optimize price-performance for your most demanding analytics workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data warehousing concepts
2. Familiarity with SQL and data analytics
3. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services
4. Experience with data sharing and multi-warehouse architectures
5. Interest in optimizing price-performance for demanding analytics workloads

title: AI-powered entertainment insights with Luminate and AWS
description: Discover how Luminate, AWS, and AI are revolutionizing the music and entertainment industry. This lightning talk explores the transformative power of AI to generate actionable insights from vast datasets, enabling more informed decisions and innovative strategies. Learn how AWS provides a robust foundation for AI applications, enhancing data analytics and unlocking new opportunities. See how Luminate leverages these technologies to drive success in the entertainment business by offering cutting-edge solutions that surface deep trends and patterns. Join us to explore the future of entertainment, powered by Luminate and AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AI and data analytics
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of the music and entertainment industry

title: AI-powered exo-skeleton [REPEAT]
description: Step into the future of assistive technology where robotics and computer vision along with AWS services come together to enhance human capabilities. We demonstrate how exoskeletons can improve mobility and strength with intuitive and natural controls. Through voice and gestures, the attendees can interact directly with the technology. This project highlights how exoskeletons can assist those with leg impairments, providing them with enhanced mobility and a more independent lifestyle.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of robotics and computer vision
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Understanding of exoskeleton technology
4. Experience in natural user interfaces (voice and gestures)
5. Awareness of assistive technologies and their applications

title: AI-powered exo-skeleton [REPEAT]
description: Step into the future of assistive technology where robotics and computer vision along with AWS services come together to enhance human capabilities. We demonstrate how exoskeletons can improve mobility and strength with intuitive and natural controls. Through voice and gestures, the attendees can interact directly with the technology. This project highlights how exoskeletons can assist those with leg impairments, providing them with enhanced mobility and a more independent lifestyle.
prerequisites:
1. Background in robotics or computer vision
2. Knowledge of AWS services and cloud computing
3. Understanding of human-computer interaction and assistive technologies
4. Familiarity with exoskeleton technology and its applications
5. Experience in developing interactive demonstrations or prototypes

title: AI-powered monitoring: Prometheus meets Amazon Bedrock
description: Discover how to tackle monitoring challenges by integrating Prometheus with Amazon Bedrock. Learn to convert natural language queries into PromQL, making your data more accessible and actionable. Gain practical skills and insights into leveraging AI to enhance monitoring, boost productivity, and streamline workflows. This talk provides real-world examples and innovative solutions to optimize your monitoring processes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Prometheus
2. Familiarity with PromQL (Prometheus Query Language)
3. Exposure to Amazon Bedrock or similar AI/ML platforms
4. Interest in leveraging AI for monitoring and workflow optimization

title: AI-powered vehicle diagnostics and root cause identification
description: Join this hands-on session to build a generative AI–powered vehicle diagnostics and troubleshooting application. Use the Generative AI Application Builder (GAAB) on AWS with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails to analyze vehicle issues, diagnostic data (DTCs, CAN bus data), and sensor readings. Explore how to configure and deploy generative AI applications with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to query repair manuals and historical records, use vehicle symptoms or DTCs to generate root cause analyses and recommended repairs, and build a workflow using Amazon Bedrock Agents for multistep automotive diagnostic tasks. Also learn how to use prompt engineering to generate outcomes in different languages. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing.
3. Experience with programming languages like Python.
4. Interest in automotive diagnostics and troubleshooting.

title: AI self-service support with knowledge retrieval using PostgreSQL
description: In this session, see how you can build a WhatsApp assistant that uses Amazon Bedrock Agents, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) using Knowledge Base with Amazon Aurora Serverless PostgreSQL-Compatible edition, and Amazon DynamoDB. Learn how to create an AI-powered system that handles complex queries, provides personalized assistance, and manages support tickets efficiently. Be guided through the process using AWS CDK with Python, and see how to construct a scalable solution that improves customer satisfaction. This session is ideal for developers aiming to upgrade their customer service capabilities with generative AI and databases.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services (Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Aurora Serverless, Amazon DynamoDB, AWS CDK)
2. Experience with Python programming language
3. Understanding of natural language processing and generative AI concepts
4. Knowledge of database management and relational databases
5. Familiarity with customer service and support ticket management

title: Aisera and AWS breaking boundaries: A dive into enterprise agentic AI (sponsored by Aisera)
description: Aisera and AWS have collaborated to revolutionize employee and customer experiences through agentic AI. Aisera’s agentic reasoning architecture enables intentless natural language requests, proactively and autonomously making decisions and taking actions to drive business outcomes. Powered by AWS, Aisera’s universal agentic AI Copilot leverages domain-specific LLMs to resolve requests across IT, HR, finance, engineering, procurement, customer service, and more. For agents and contact centers, Aisera’s Voice Bot and Agent Assist provide case summarization, next-best-action recommendations, and real-time agent support, automating request resolution and reducing average call handling time. Together, Aisera and AWS help enterprises boost revenue, improve user productivity, and lower costs. This presentation is brought to you by Aisera, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given text would be:

1. Knowledge of agentic AI and its applications in various business domains.
2. Understanding of natural language processing and its role in enabling intentless requests.
3. Familiarity with the collaboration between Aisera and AWS and their joint offerings.
4. Awareness of the benefits of Aisera's solutions, such as improved user productivity, reduced costs, and increased revenue.
5. Knowledge of the role of AWS as a platform provider and Aisera's status as an AWS Partner.

title: A least privilege journey made easier by IAM Access Analyzer
description: Effective access management is critical for balancing security and operational efficiency across your AWS environment. Join for an interactive discussion on strategies to jumpstart and accelerate your least privilege journey using AWS IAM Access Analyzer. Learn how centralized security teams and IAM policy authors are using IAM Access Analyzer to gain visibility into unused, overly permissive access and use actionable recommendations to achieve least privilege at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
2. Familiarity with AWS security best practices
3. Experience in managing access and permissions in AWS environments
4. Interest in optimizing security and operational efficiency in AWS

title: Allianz Germany: Accelerating legacy migration with generative AI
description: Allianz Germany faced the challenge of migrating thousands of insurance contracts to their core insurance system, requiring hours of manual effort per contract. In this lightning talk, learn how Allianz built an intelligent document processing pipeline using Amazon Bedrock and additional AWS services, including AWS Lambda and AWS Step Functions, to automatically extract critical details from scanned PDFs and supplementary documents. The pipeline can pull over 150 unique contract attributes with 92% accuracy, significantly reducing manual effort. View a live demo and learn how you can apply this approach to streamline legacy processes within your own organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of document processing and extraction techniques.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and other AWS services like Lambda and Step Functions.
3. Knowledge of legacy insurance contract management processes.
4. Experience in automating and streamlining legacy business processes.
5. Ability to analyze and extract critical data from scanned PDFs and supplementary documents.

title: All-in on AWS: Transform production operations with Amazon Bedrock
description: In this session, learn about bpx energy's transformation of production operations on AWS. bpx shares its journey to simplify from multicloud and go all-in on AWS, including SAP and Esri ArcGIS. Discover how bpx leveraged generative AI using Amazon Bedrock to transform oil and gas production operations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Basic knowledge of oil and gas industry operations
3. Familiarity with SAP and Esri ArcGIS software
4. Awareness of generative AI and its applications
5. Interest in learning about digital transformation in the energy sector

title: All things patching: Manage and monitor at scale [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to implement a centralized approach to patching across your AWS organization, ensuring that Amazon EC2, on-premises, and multicloud instances are up to date with the latest operating system security patches. Learn how to deploy a patching policy that enables a central account to determine which instances, accounts, and applications are not compliant to the central policy. Furthermore, discover how to quickly determine which instances across your entire organization are missing specific patches, enabling you to reduce your mean time to remediation for fixing security vulnerabilities, increasing the security posture of your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the chalk talk:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts.
2. Knowledge of patch management and security best practices.
3. Familiarity with AWS Organizations and cross-account management.
4. Experience with AWS Config and AWS Systems Manager.
5. Understanding of multi-cloud and hybrid cloud environments.

title: All things patching: Manage and monitor at scale [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to implement a centralized approach to patching across your AWS organization, ensuring that Amazon EC2, on-premises, and multicloud instances are up to date with the latest operating system security patches. Learn how to deploy a patching policy that enables a central account to determine which instances, accounts, and applications are not compliant to the central policy. Furthermore, discover how to quickly determine which instances across your entire organization are missing specific patches, enabling you to reduce your mean time to remediation for fixing security vulnerabilities, increasing the security posture of your organization.

Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS Organization and its features.
2. Knowledge of AWS Config and AWS Systems Manager.
3. Familiarity with patch management and security best practices.
4. Experience in managing multi-account and multi-region AWS environments.
5. Basic understanding of operating system patching and security vulnerabilities.

title: Always on, always available with AWS resilience lifecycle framework
description: Customers expect an always-on, always-available experience. In this chalk talk, explore strategies to minimize downtime and enable customer-facing applications to withstand unexpected failures or to quickly recover from them. Discover practical guidance on using the resilience lifecycle framework to build resilient applications on AWS. Learn actionable techniques to architect robust, fault-tolerant applications that deliver exceptional reliability for your customers. This chalk talk is intended for AWS Partners.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
2. Understanding of application design and development principles
3. Knowledge of fault-tolerance and high-availability concepts
4. Familiarity with the resilience lifecycle framework

title: Amazon Aurora HA and DR design patterns for global resilience
description: Amazon Aurora is a fully managed relational database designed for unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale with full MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility. Aurora provides managed high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) capabilities in and across AWS Regions. In this session, explore the Aurora HA and DR capabilities and discover design patterns that enable the development of resilient applications. Learn how to establish in-Region and cross-Region HA and DR using Aurora features, including Multi-AZ deployments, Aurora Global Database, and Amazon RDS Proxy, and discover how to reduce failover times with a JDBC driver.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Understanding of relational databases and their architecture.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services.
3. Knowledge of high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) concepts.
4. Familiarity with MySQL and PostgreSQL database management systems.
5. Experience with application development and integration with database services.

title: Amazon Bedrock Agents for blockchain analysis and interaction
description: In this lightning talk, you will learn how to utilize Amazon Bedrock Agents to gain insights from blockchain data and interact with smart contracts using natural language. You will gain knowledge regarding how to build a natural language interface to query blockchain data from the AWS Public Blockchain datasets for Ethereum and Bitcoin data. You will also gain an understanding of how to create agents that are capable of calling Amazon Managed Blockchain Query APIs and writing to the blockchain.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with blockchain technology and concepts
2. Basic understanding of AWS services and their capabilities
3. Experience with natural language processing and conversational interfaces
4. Familiarity with Ethereum and Bitcoin blockchain data

title: Amazon Bedrock Agents: Revolutionize data analysis & customer service
description: Analyzing complex datasets can be time-consuming and resource intensive. In this workshop, learn how to move from analysis to action faster and with minimal manual effort. Build an agent-based generative AI application that quickly links multiple data sources and produces meaningful insights using Amazon Bedrock Agents and Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases. Discover how to integrate these agents with services like Amazon RDS and Amazon S3 as well as online data sources to improve customer interactions, personalize product offers, and identify new opportunities. Your application will demonstrate how financial institutions can revolutionize customer service while respecting guardrails for responsible AI. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with data analysis and data manipulation techniques.
2. Basic understanding of machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts.
3. Experience with cloud computing platforms, preferably Amazon Web Services (AWS).
4. Proficiency in a programming language, such as Python or Java.
5. Willingness to learn and apply new technologies, such as Amazon Bedrock Agents and Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases.

title: Amazon Bedrock: Analyzing Jira tickets using LLMs
description: Have you ever wanted to gain insights from Jira ticket data without having to read through them all yourself? Have you thought about using AI to gain insights? This dev chat demonstrates how you can connect to and query the Atlassian Jira API to pull ticket data using pagination and more advanced coding practices to create a repository of information. This repository can then be cleaned using data science libraries. Then, see how the cleaned data can be fed to Amazon Bedrock and queried for insights to help improve customer FAQ documentation and increase customer satisfaction.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Jira API
2. Familiarity with data extraction and pagination
3. Experience with data cleaning and data science libraries
4. Understanding of Amazon Bedrock and its capabilities
5. Ability to integrate various technologies and tools

title: Amazon Braket: Get hands-on with quantum computing [REPEAT]
description: Amazon Braket provides access to quantum computing hardware and simulators to speed up scientific research and software development for quantum computing. Join this workshop to implement your first quantum algorithm and gain hands-on experience with running quantum circuits on gate-based devices and simulators. Review service features and examples available in the AWS quantum algorithm library. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of quantum computing concepts
2. Familiarity with programming languages (e.g., Python)
3. Access to a laptop

description: Amazon Braket provides access to quantum computing hardware and simulators to speed up scientific research and software development for quantum computing. Join this workshop to implement your first quantum algorithm and gain hands-on experience with running quantum circuits on gate-based devices and simulators. title: Amazon CloudFront: Enhancing web performance one HTTP request at a time
description: Whether you're live streaming the Olympics, delivering seamless social media experiences, or providing the best online retail service, a fast, reliable, and secure content delivery network (CDN) is essential. In this session, discover how Amazon CloudFront integrates with Amazon Route 53 and AWS WAF to deliver your application's content with high availability, enhanced security, and lightning-fast performance—all in just milliseconds. Learn from Warner Bros.’ success in streaming major events like the Olympic Games Paris 2024 and UEFA Euro 2024 to millions of viewers, powered by AWS Global Infrastructure and CloudFront.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of content delivery networks (CDNs)
2. Familiarity with Amazon CloudFront, Amazon Route 53, and AWS WAF
3. Experience in delivering high-performance, secure, and highly available web applications
4. Knowledge of streaming technologies and large-scale event broadcasting
5. Familiarity with AWS Global Infrastructure and its capabilities

title: Amazon Connect: Beginning your contact center migration journey
description: This chalk talk addresses the challenges of upgrading legacy telephony, IVR, and chat systems to Amazon Connect. It covers Connect’s value proposition, customer success stories, and various migration strategies. Learn how to align your business needs and manage the technical, operational, and managerial aspects of the transition. The talk introduces AWS support options for contact center transformation, along with a migration readiness checklist. The goal is to accelerate adoption of Amazon Connect while ensuring a smooth migration. By focusing on potential disruption points, organizations can better prepare for a successful transformation journey to Amazon Connect.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the chalk talk:

1. Understanding of legacy telephony, IVR, and chat systems.
2. Knowledge of Amazon Connect and its capabilities.
3. Familiarity with contact center operations and management.
4. Awareness of AWS support options for contact center transformation.
5. Interest in migrating to Amazon Connect.

title: Amazon DocumentDB for expert practitioners [REPEAT]
description: As a fully managed database service for native document data model enterprise workloads, Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) removes the undifferentiated heavy lifting of operating a database so that you can focus your time on delivering value for your customers. In this chalk talk, dive deep into implementation trade-offs, including compression, performance, and cost, for various workloads. Learn how to architect a scalable Amazon DocumentDB–based solution using elastic clusters and other key features.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Familiarity with Amazon DocumentDB and its MongoDB compatibility.
2. Understanding of database management and operations.
3. Knowledge of database architecture and design principles.
4. Experience with data modeling and performance optimization.
5. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.

title: Amazon EC2 flex instances: Deliver performance at lower cost [REPEAT]
description: Amazon EC2 flex instances provide the easiest way to save costs and achieve better price performance for a majority of your workloads. In this session, dive deep into the new flex instances, explore how they deliver latest-generation performance at lower cost, and identify their most suitable workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
2. Familiarity with Amazon EC2 instances and their pricing models.
3. Knowledge of common workload types and their performance requirements.
