Your team uses AWS WAF and AWS Shield to mitigate distributed HTTP floods, web exploits, and malicious bots that disrupt the experience of your customers. This workshop offers a risk-free environment where teamwork is paramount as you work together under pressure. Watch a real-time scoreboard as your team works through each level. 4. Laptop for participation

title: AWS Global Passport: Your passport to international growth
description: The opportunities for growth through global expansion are tremendous, but it also introduces a wide range of challenges that can be difficult to balance with managing an existing business. In this breakout session, you’ll stamp your ticket to international markets, as you are introduced to AWS Global Passport, a bespoke program that fast-tracks global expansion with tailored AWS resources to help overcome strategic, operational, technical, and go-to-market challenges.
prerequisites:
Potential prerequisites:

1. Understanding of international business operations
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Experience in managing a growing business
4. Interest in expanding into global markets
5. Willingness to navigate the complexities of international expansion

title: AWS Graviton GameDay: Optimize your Amazon EC2 workload with Graviton [REPEAT]
description: Ready to learn more about AWS Graviton in an immersive environment? In this team-based gamified learning setting, perform a live migration of your workload to Graviton. You learn how to unlock Graviton’s full price-performance potential and optimize the size of an Amazon EC2 fleet. You have the opportunity to identify CPU-architectural incompatibilities with the Porting Advisor for Graviton tool, test performance, adjust a continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipeline to create ARM64 artifacts, and explore popular Graviton use cases. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts
2. Familiarity with EC2 instances and workload management
3. Exposure to containerization and CI/CD pipelines
4. Willingness to learn and experiment in a team-based, gamified environment
5. Access to a laptop for participation

title: AWS Graviton GameDay: Optimize your Amazon EC2 workload with Graviton [REPEAT]
description: Ready to learn more about AWS Graviton in an immersive environment? In this team-based gamified learning setting, perform a live migration of your workload to Graviton. You learn how to unlock Graviton’s full price-performance potential and optimize the size of an Amazon EC2 fleet. You have the opportunity to identify CPU-architectural incompatibilities with the Porting Advisor for Graviton tool, test performance, adjust a continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipeline to create ARM64 artifacts, and explore popular Graviton use cases. 2. Familiarity with Linux and command-line interfaces
3. Experience with containerization and CI/CD pipelines
4. Laptop for participation in the hands-on activities

title: AWS Graviton: The best price performance for your AWS workloads
description: AWS Graviton-based Amazon EC2 instances provide the best price performance for workloads in Amazon EC2. In this session, dive deep into the AWS Graviton processor and learn about its workload performance, energy efficiency, and software offerings. Learn about common use cases, best practices to optimize your workloads across various applications, customer success stories, and how you can accelerate your AWS Graviton journey.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Amazon EC2
2. Knowledge of processor architecture and performance
3. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
4. Interest in optimizing workload performance and cost-effectiveness

title: AWS hybrid cloud and edge computing from the lens of VMware architects
description: This chalk talk explores the Amazon EC2 concepts of instance recoverability, placement groups, and auto scaling from the perspective of AWS Outposts and how VMware architects can draw parallels to VMware features like High Availability (HA), Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS), Affinity Groups, and stretched clusters. The talk also covers how you can design resilient architectures between two Outposts in the same location using intra-VPC routing. Additionally, learn how you can leverage AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery to migrate on-premises workloads to AWS Outposts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Outposts
2. Knowledge of VMware features like High Availability (HA), Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS), Affinity Groups, and stretched clusters
3. Familiarity with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery

title: AWS IAM Identity Center: Secure access to generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: Integrating an identity-aware generative AI-powered assistant into a custom web experience for your workforce has never been easier. In this workshop, learn how to embed an identity-aware chat experience into a custom application, train it on a sample dataset, and connect it to an external workforce identity provider using native integration between Amazon Q Business and AWS IAM Identity Center. Throughout the process, learn tips on managing end-user session duration, enhancing security, and simplifying the overall developer experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with web development and custom application building.
2. Basic understanding of identity management and access control.
3. Familiarity with Amazon Q Business and AWS IAM Identity Center.
4. Availability of a laptop to participate in the workshop.

title: AWS IAM Identity Center: Secure access to generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: Integrating an identity-aware generative AI-powered assistant into a custom web experience for your workforce has never been easier. In this workshop, learn how to embed an identity-aware chat experience into a custom application, train it on a sample dataset, and connect it to an external workforce identity provider using native integration between Amazon Q Business and AWS IAM Identity Center. Throughout the process, learn tips on managing end-user session duration, enhancing security, and simplifying the overall developer experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.

3. Ability to work with a laptop

title: AWS infrastructure as code: A year in review
description: AWS provides services that enable the creation, deployment and maintenance of application infrastructure in a programmatic, descriptive, and declarative way. These services provide rigor, clarity, and reliability to application development. Join this session to learn about the new features and improvements for AWS infrastructure as code with AWS CloudFormation and AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) and discover how they can benefit your team.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and cloud infrastructure
2. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
3. Knowledge of infrastructure as code (IaC) principles
4. Familiarity with AWS CloudFormation or AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK)

title: AWS IoT for edge LLM deployment and execution
description: With the advent of generative AI and large language models (LLMs), you must be wondering, how can these technologies be applied at the IoT edge? After all, there are many benefits of running LLMs at the edge—from network bandwidth efficiencies, offline processing, lower latency, and data sovereignty to cost savings, security, and differentiation. In this session, learn how using AWS IoT services and LLMs at the edge can uplift your solutions with actionable outcomes and innovative capabilities, such as gesture recognition, natural language processing for voice control, real-time predictive maintenance, energy optimization, anomaly detection, and more.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of IoT (Internet of Things) concepts and technologies
2. Knowledge of AWS IoT services
3. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs) and their applications
4. Experience in edge computing and its benefits
5. Interest in exploring innovative use cases for LLMs at the IoT edge

title: AWS IoT race track revolution: Fuel the future with IoT smart cars [REPEAT]
description: Experience the thrill of racing with our IoT-powered racetrack! Control smart race cars using AWS IoT technology. Monitor real-time telemetry data, manage pit stops, and optimize race strategy. Use AWS IoT Core to communicate with cars and track sensors, while edge AI models help predict optimal racing lines. Interact with the physical track using an IoT interface, making split-second decisions to boost your car's performance. Compete against other attendees in exciting races, balancing speed with energy efficiency to claim victory on this futuristic circuit.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of IoT (Internet of Things) concepts and technologies.
2. Familiarity with AWS IoT Core and edge computing.
3. Experience with real-time data processing and analytics.
4. Knowledge of racing strategies and car performance optimization.
5. Ability to interact with physical systems using IoT interfaces.

title: AWS IoT race track revolution: Fuel the future with IoT smart cars [REPEAT]
description: Experience the thrill of racing with our IoT-powered racetrack! Control smart race cars using AWS IoT technology. Monitor real-time telemetry data, manage pit stops, and optimize race strategy. Use AWS IoT Core to communicate with cars and track sensors, while edge AI models help predict optimal racing lines. Interact with the physical track using an IoT interface, making split-second decisions to boost your car's performance. Compete against other attendees in exciting races, balancing speed with energy efficiency to claim victory on this futuristic circuit.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of IoT (Internet of Things) concepts and technologies.
2. Familiarity with AWS IoT Core and related services.
3. Understanding of edge computing and AI/ML models.
4. Experience with real-time data processing and visualization.
5. Interest in motorsports and racing strategy.

title: AWS Jam: DevOps and modernization
description: Are you looking to enhance your AWS DevOps and modernization skills? Immerse yourself in AWS DevOps challenges and collaborate with fellow enthusiasts. Activities are structured to accommodate AWS users of all skill levels, and you'll have a chance to win SWAG and prizes. Ask questions of the subject matter expert leading the study session, and enhance your DevOps knowledge with guided exercises. All you need to bring is your desire to learn and a laptop.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Interest in DevOps practices
3. Willingness to participate in collaborative learning activities
4. Access to a laptop
5. Enthusiasm for enhancing AWS DevOps and modernization skills

title: AWS Jam: Generative AI
description: Are you curious about the cutting-edge world of generative AI? Learn about the power of generative AI through AWS Jam challenges designed to spark fresh ideas by presenting real-world scenarios. Join us for the Jam session to gain hands-on experience with AWS services and offerings from AWS partners. The activities are structured to cater to AWS users of all skill levels, and you have a chance to win swag and prizes. AWS experts, along with guided exercises, are available to help enhance your generative AI knowledge. All you need to bring is your desire to learn and a laptop.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Interest in generative AI
3. Access to a laptop

title: AWS Jam: Security
description: Are you concerned about protecting sensitive data in the cloud? Are you ready to put your AWS security skills to the test and learn in a gamified, experiential, team-based competition? Join us for this Security Jam, and gain hands-on experience with AWS and AWS Partners services and offerings via simulated real-world scenarios. Activities are structured to accommodate AWS users of all skill levels, and you'll have a chance to win SWAG and prizes. Ask questions of the subject matter expert leading the study session, and enhance your security knowledge with guided exercises. All you need to bring is your desire to learn and a laptop.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS
2. Interest in cloud security
3. Desire to learn and participate in a hands-on, team-based competition
4. Access to a laptop

title: AWS journey: Customer’s path to hybrid cloud excellence (sponsored by SolarWinds)
description: During this lightning talk, SolarWinds shares why one of their customers migrated to the cloud and why they chose AWS. Learn the specific workloads and applications they are running on AWS and how observability is crucial in managing and optimizing their hybrid environment. Additionally, discover the benefits the customer achieved by moving to AWS, and learn how an observability approach supports their operational goals. Gain insights into their cloud journey and the strategic advantages of using AWS and observability for enhanced performance and reliability. This presentation is brought to you by SolarWinds, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS
2. Familiarity with observability and its importance in hybrid environments
3. Interest in customer cloud migration stories and strategic advantages

title: AWS Lambda and Apache Kafka for real-time data processing applications
description: In this session, gain practical insights into building scalable, serverless data processing applications by integrating AWS Lambda with Apache Kafka. Explore using event-driven models for real-time data streaming and processing. Discover different architectural patterns and best practices to achieve high throughput, fault tolerance, and low latency. Leave with the knowledge to design serverless data processing pipelines that extract valuable insights from real-time data streams efficiently and cost-effectively.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with serverless computing and event-driven architectures
3. Knowledge of Apache Kafka and real-time data streaming concepts

title: AWS Lambda performance tuning: Best practices and guidance [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, you learn about opportunities to optimize your serverless applications built with AWS Lambda, including optimizations in the function configuration and within your function code. This talk also covers how you can best measure and tune your function’s performance by configuring memory to get the right application performance. You also hear best practices for initialization logic and reuse to enable fast startup and fast function processing times.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Lambda
2. Familiarity with serverless architecture
3. Knowledge of function configuration and optimization
4. Experience with performance measurement and tuning
5. Awareness of best practices for initialization and function reuse

You also hear best practices for initialization logic and reuse to enable fast startup and fast function processing times.

title: AWS Mainframe Modernization accelerators for application transformation
description: In this workshop, learn about select AWS Mainframe Modernization accelerators, such as Application Testing, data replication, File Transfer, DevOps CI/CD, and managed services, that speed your time to value and deliver cost savings, agility, resilience, and innovation. Gain hands-on experience with some of the accelerators, and learn how they could complement refactor, replatform, reimagine, or augment patterns. Finally, discover how you can accelerate the modernization pace wherever you may be in your mainframe application modernization journey. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Basic understanding of mainframe applications and modernization
3. Hands-on experience with cloud-based development and deployment

title: AWS Marketplace: Deploy, govern & analyze spend of third-party software
description: AWS Marketplace makes it easy to find, subscribe, deploy, and manage third-party software, data, and services. In this workshop, choose between hands-on labs for buyers just starting to learn about AWS Marketplace or labs for experienced buyers looking to expand their knowledge. New buyers can explore how to buy and deploy different types of third-party products in AWS Marketplace. Experienced buyers can learn to govern purchases by setting up a private marketplace of approved products, sharing licenses, analyzing spend, and allocating costs. This session requires an active AWS account with admin rights. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Active AWS account with admin rights
2. Laptop to participate
3. Basic understanding of AWS Marketplace (for new buyers)
4. Experience in buying and managing third-party products in AWS Marketplace (for experienced buyers)
5. Familiarity with cost management and governance in AWS Marketplace (for experienced buyers)

title: AWS Marketplace sellers: Publish, update, and manage your product
description: In this workshop, choose between hands-on labs for new sellers just starting or labs for experienced sellers looking to optimize their operations in AWS Marketplace. Sellers just starting out can explore publishing virtual machine, container, or SaaS-based products. Established sellers can learn about API-enabled automations for their delivery pipelines, private offers, and other integrations with AWS Marketplace. The part of the workshop intended for established sellers requires a registered seller account with an existing published product. For new or interested sellers, an active AWS account is required. This workshop is intended for AWS Partners. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. AWS account
2. Registered seller account with an existing published product (for established sellers)
3. Laptop

title: AWS Partner Keynote with Dr. Ruba Borno
description: Join the AWS Partner Keynote, presented by Dr. Ruba Borno, Vice President, Global Specialists and Partners. Watch as she delves into the world of strategic partnerships to show the positive impact AWS and its partners are making possible for customers. Hear directly from partners and customers on the ways they’re reimagining business models and driving successful outcomes by utilizing AWS industry-changing services. And discover the ways AWS is improving the digital experience for partners and connecting them with higher-value opportunities that lead to long-term success.

title: AWS storage best practices for cost optimization
description: Whether you’re migrating from on premises to AWS or are already in the cloud, AWS offers storage solutions and features that help optimize your costs and reduce TCO—all while providing performance that boosts productivity and accelerates business growth. The AWS storage portfolio makes it easy and cost-effective for you to launch, run, and scale storage in the cloud, allowing you to dedicate more of your time to serving customers and innovating on their behalf. In this session, learn best practices you can put to use today to optimize your storage costs and extract the maximum value from your data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with AWS services and offerings
3. Knowledge of storage optimization techniques
4. Awareness of business growth strategies

title: AWS storage services: The foundation for data-driven innovation
description: AWS storage services serve as the cornerstone for data-driven innovation, providing the essential building blocks for modern enterprises. In this talk, explore how the fundamental attributes of AWS storage services—high durability, availability, scalability, and price performance—empower organizations to excel in virtually any workload scenario. From powering cutting-edge AI/ML initiatives to enabling real-time analytics and supporting business-critical applications, AWS storage services deliver the agility and resilience needed in today’s fast-paced digital landscape. Discover how businesses use these capabilities to accelerate insights, drive business growth, and fuel transformative innovations across diverse industries and use cases.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of data storage and management concepts

title: AWS Sustainability Showcase
description: Innovation is key to achieving sustainability goals. Technology drives sustainable transformation and addresses challenges like decarbonization and water conservation. AWS enables customers to build sustainability solutions ranging from carbon tracking to energy conservation and waste reduction using AWS services to ingest, analyze, and manage sustainability data. AWS offers the broadest and deepest set of capabilities in AI/ML, IoT, data analytics, and computing to reach your organization's sustainability goals. Visit the Sustainability Showcase to learn more about the tools available to organizations of all sizes and sectors to build and implement solutions that meet your sustainability goals.

title: AWS unplugged: Creating music remotely with UMG
description: Historically, creating music has required the musicians to all be in the same location—but that is changing. Universal Music Group’s (UMG) Republic Records Studios, in partnership with Open Sesame, is working with AWS to provide a synchronous and bidirectional recording system for artists, producers, and songwriters to share assets and ideas securely in a cost-effective and operationally efficient manner. After you learn how it works, experience a live music performance in which a real recording artist reimagines one of their favorite songs, seamlessly collaborating with producers at the world-famous UMG Republic Records Studios in Los Angeles in real time.
prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools
3. Understanding of secure data sharing and transfer

description: Dive into the mystery with our virtual escape room! Something sinister has happened to an AWS account and it's up to you to solve the case. Secrets and clues are hidden across various AWS services, each revealing more about the elusive murderer. Utilize your cloud skills, explore services like S3, Lambda, and DynamoDB, and piece together the evidence to crack the case. This immersive experience blends technology and intrigue, challenging your detective abilities in a race against time.

title: AWS WAF: What a BOT it? [REPEAT]
description: In the ever-evolving threat landscape, web applications face constant attacks from bot traffic and fraudulent activities. These threats can lead to devastating consequences, including data breaches, financial losses, and reputational damage. Explore AWS WAF, including its features for bot control, account takeover prevention, and account creation fraud prevention. This chalk talk offers you the opportunity to actively participate and learn from real-world use cases, exploring how these features can be effectively employed to detect and mitigate bot traffic, credential stuffing, web scraping, and other fraudulent activities.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of web application security
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of common web application threats, such as bot traffic, credential stuffing, and web scraping
4. Familiarity with web application architecture and deployment

3. Basic knowledge of bot traffic and common web application threats
4. Familiarity with OWASP Top 10 security risks

title: AWS wherever you need it: From the cloud to the edge
description: While most workloads can be migrated to the cloud, some remain on premises or at the edge due to low latency, local data processing, or digital sovereignty needs. In this session, learn how AWS services like AWS Outposts, AWS Local Zones, AWS Dedicated Local Zones, and AWS IoT support hybrid cloud and edge computing workloads such as multiplayer gaming, high-frequency trading, medical imaging, smart manufacturing, and generative AI applications with data residency requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and hybrid cloud architectures
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their use cases
3. Knowledge of low-latency, edge computing, and digital sovereignty requirements
4. Awareness of industries and applications that require on-premises or edge computing solutions

title: AWS Wickr: Secure, flexible & compliant mission-partner collaboration [REPEAT]
description: Simple and secure communications are essential for mission-partner collaboration. In this chalk talk, explore AWS Wickr federated communication capabilities in depth, and learn how these capabilities support mission-critical information sharing. Also learn about the role of federated communications in connecting the tactical edge to the cloud, the technical details of AWS Wickr architecture for data privacy and integrity, and real-world use cases that show the value of AWS Wickr for mission-partner coordination. Gain insights into strengthening multinational and cross-organizational communication while maintaining a strong security posture.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of secure communication principles.
2. Knowledge of cloud-based communication platforms.
3. Familiarity with mission-critical information sharing requirements.
4. Awareness of tactical edge to cloud connectivity challenges.
5. Interest in strengthening cross-organizational communication securely.

title: AWS Wickr: Secure, flexible & compliant mission-partner collaboration [REPEAT]

title: AWS Wickr: Secure messaging & collaboration with end-to-end encryption
description: Looking to simplify collaboration while meeting security, privacy, and data retention requirements? Join this session to discover how AWS Wickr, an end-to-end encrypted messaging and collaboration service, provides advanced protection for sensitive data, federation and guest access for seamless external communication, administrative controls for user and policy management, data residency controls to store data in the region of your choice, and data retention to help you meet recordkeeping requirements. Whether you're in the public or private sector, learn how to strategically use AWS Wickr features and deployment options to help you communicate with confidence.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of end-to-end encryption
2. Familiarity with collaboration and communication tools
3. Awareness of security, privacy, and data retention requirements
4. Interest in exploring AWS Wickr as a solution
5. Willingness to learn about deployment options and strategic use of AWS Wickr features

title: A YouTuber's magic wand: Converting videos to blogs
description: As former bloggers turned YouTubers, we automated blog creation from video transcripts to boost productivity and explore business potential. This session covers our journey using serverless automation and generative AI to transform transcripts into engaging posts. We'll share automation techniques, AI integration for transcription, and AWS deployment strategies, providing tools to streamline content creation and maximize audience reach efficiently.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with video production and transcription
2. Familiarity with serverless architecture and AWS services
3. Knowledge of natural language processing and generative AI
4. Understanding of content creation and audience engagement strategies
5. Ability to implement automation and integration techniques

title: Backup and disaster recovery strategies for increased resilience
description: Learn strategies for using AWS services to use AWS elasticity to protect your server-based applications, whether they are on premises or in the cloud, from downtime and data loss. This session offers a deep dive into how AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery can help organizations achieve recovery point objectives of seconds and recovery time objectives of minutes. It also covers how Elastic Disaster Recovery helps organizations protect against, respond to, and recover from ransomware events while lowering total cost of ownership. Finally, learn how you can combine this solution with AWS Backup for comprehensive data protection.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Experience with server-based application deployment and management
4. Knowledge of disaster recovery and business continuity planning

title: Balance consistency and developer freedom with platform engineering
description: Serverless empowers developers to build complex applications by shifting infrastructure and operational responsibility to AWS. Platform engineering plays an important role to ensure consistency and compliance and reduce the complexity of building in the cloud. Learn how platform teams can provide opinionated security, cost, observability, reliability, and sustainability patterns while maintaining developer flexibility and agility. Explore a real-world platform implementation on Backstage, with common application patterns for serverless APIs, event-driven architectures, and containerized applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and services.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities.
3. Knowledge of software development practices and architectures.
4. Exposure to platform engineering principles and practices.
5. Familiarity with Backstage or similar platform engineering tools.

title: Balancing resilience, security, and cost in cloud architecture
description: As organizations develop cloud infrastructure, they must balance resilience, security, and cost optimization in their architectures. This talk explores the complex relationships between these priorities, providing a framework for informed decision-making. Participants learn resilience strategies like multi-Region deployments; security measures for identity, access, and data protection; and cost optimization techniques using cost-effective services and resource utilization. Using real-world case studies, assess your organization's needs and make strategic architectural decisions that align with business objectives. By navigating the tradeoffs between resilience, security, and cost, learn to design reliable, secure, and cost-effective cloud systems.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts and architectures.
2. Familiarity with cloud service providers and their offerings.
3. Knowledge of resilience, security, and cost optimization principles in cloud environments.
4. Experience in cloud infrastructure design and deployment.
5. Ability to analyze and assess organizational needs and business objectives.

title: Balancing speed and durability with Amazon EBS and EC2 instance store
description: Customers who leverage Amazon EC2 instance store for high performance local storage may encounter durability, resiliency, or data protection challenges. Mirroring EC2 instance store with EBS volumes enables faster reads and secure writes that can be protected with EBS snapshots. Join this session to learn how to build a provisioned mirrored volume as well as the cost benefits and performance advantages of this design. Discover the unique value of blending the best of EC2 instance store and EBS volumes and snapshots, allowing you to adjust performance, flexibility, and security while keeping costs in mind.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon EC2 instance store
2. Knowledge of Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) volumes and snapshots
3. Familiarity with data storage performance and durability requirements

title: Battle of the bots: Tim vs. Tina [REPEAT]
description: Generative AI has evolved exponentially with every release of a newer and smarter foundational model (FM). But how do some of the most popular FMs stack up against each other? Please welcome Tim and Tina, our robot friends! You will get the chance to choose a FM for both Tim and Tina while they debate on a topic of your choice. Is a hot dog considered a sandwich? Ask Tim and Tina and grab some popcorn while they engage in an entertaining debate, and see how your favorite FMs stack up against each other while debating some of your favorite topics.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of popular foundational models in Generative AI
2. Understanding of the capabilities and limitations of different foundational models
3. Familiarity with the "is a hot dog a sandwich?" debate

Please welcome Tim and Tina, our robot friends! You will get the chance to choose a FM for both Tim and Tina while they debate on a topic of your choice. Is a hot dog considered a sandwich? 4. Curiosity about how different FMs perform in a conversational setting
5. Desire to explore the "is a hot dog a sandwich?" debate

title: BBVA: Building a multi-region, multi-country data platform at scale
description: BBVA relies on data and analytics to provide automated business and market insights, increase operational efficiencies, and attract customers. Learn how BBVA built a global data platform that powers its data lake and data mesh architectures. Explore the methodology BBVA employed to migrate their data infrastructure and deploy the multi-region, multi-country data platform with an emphasis on usage controls, security, and regulatory compliance. Learn about the tools developed to automate migration, reduce costs, and accelerate time to value with Amazon Athena, AWS Lake Formation, Amazon SageMaker, and Amazon EMR. Finally, see how the platform lays the foundation for generative AI and data governance.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of data and analytics concepts
2. Knowledge of data lake and data mesh architectures
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
4. Experience in data infrastructure migration and deployment
5. Understanding of data governance, security, and regulatory compliance

title: Become an expert on AWS observability services
description: This bootcamp is intended for AWS Partners. This bootcamp provides a deep dive into AWS observability services such as Amazon CloudWatch, AWS X-Ray, Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus, Amazon Managed Grafana, and AWS Distro for OpenTelemetry. Come gain hands-on experience with features, possibilities, and solutions offered by the AWS observability suite. This bootcamp covers creating custom dashboards, using feature experimentation, and using logging and monitoring for troubleshooting. By the end, you have the ability to champion the value of AWS observability services, even without prior AWS expertise. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. AWS Partner status
2. Basic understanding of cloud computing and monitoring concepts
3. Familiarity with AWS services (preferred, but not mandatory)
4. Ability to bring a laptop for hands-on activities

title: Becoming cloud-agnostic (sponsored by emma)
description: Multicloud adoption offers both opportunities and challenges for organizations. While business leaders see the value in leveraging services from multiple clouds, IT departments grapple with technical complexities. This lightning talk shares a cloud-agnostic approach that allows users to connect with other cloud providers. Discover how to make the right architectural choices with manageable initial investment, leading to long-term benefits. Learn how to streamline multicloud environments using common tools, integrate disaster recovery across platforms, and manage resources uniformly. Also learn how open source tools can achieve cloud independence, helping ensure high availability, resilience, and operational efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by emma, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud service providers and their offerings
3. Experience in IT infrastructure management
4. Knowledge of open-source tools and technologies
5. Interest in achieving cloud independence and operational efficiency

title: Benchmarking through cost insights: The way of the frugal architect
description: Does your infrastructure’s cost reflect best practices and recommended patterns? Are you using AWS services optimally while implementing robust, cost-optimized foundations? This workshop is designed to help you drive architectural improvements through cost observation. It explores how to uncover suboptimal architecture patterns, hidden failures, and noncompliant deployments by using costs to establish and visualize good baselines for foundational services and workload architectures. It demonstrates how to combine cost categories and usage data with design requirements, application profiles, and best practices to generate flexible visualizations and KPIs that empower the frugal architect. Join this workshop to gain expertise in creating a cost-effective architecture. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this workshop:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with cost management and optimization strategies in the cloud.
3. Ability to use data analysis tools and create visualizations.
4. Willingness to participate actively in the workshop activities.

title: Benchmark your SAP landscape against 100+ architecture best practices
description: In this workshop, learn how SAP customers are maximizing the scalability, reliability, security, sustainability, and performance of AWS. Explore architecture best practices developed by AWS while helping thousands of SAP customers run their mission-critical applications in the cloud. Gain hands-on experience setting up an automated health check solution that scans SAP on AWS environments and compares results against more than 100 architecture best practices. Then, use generative AI from Amazon Q in QuickSight to analyze the results and uncover opportunities for optimization. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of SAP
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts
3. Experience with data analysis and visualization tools

title: Be prepared: Learning from incident response [REPEAT]
description: Everyone needs a plan for when the worst happens. It’s not if things happen but when things happen. In this session, learn how AWS monitors, detects, and manages incidents. Find out what and how the tools AWS has at hand can help you learn and grow from each event and help make sure that responses are constantly improved. With this session get visibility into the operational excellence of real-world scenarios that not just affect an organization’s bottom line, but its reputation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their functionalities.
3. Knowledge of incident management and operational excellence principles.

Find out what and how the tools AWS has at hand can help you learn and grow from each event and help make sure that responses are constantly improved. title: Best practices for building flexible architectures across Regions [REPEAT]
description: As AWS continues to open new Regions worldwide, you may find yourself considering whether to migrate workloads from existing Regions or to expand your product offerings to new geographic areas. Whether you aim to improve application latency, meet evolving compliance standards, optimize costs, or tap into new markets, adopting a flexible architecture across Regions can unlock a world of opportunities. This informative chalk talk will guide you through best practices for building a flexible cloud infrastructure that can seamlessly operate across multiple AWS Regions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS Regions and their characteristics
2. Understanding of cloud architecture and application deployment
3. Knowledge of compliance requirements and cost optimization strategies
4. Desire to expand product offerings or improve application performance

title: Best practices for building full stack multi-tenant apps on AWS
description: Developing robust, multi-tenant applications that scale is complex. In this code talk, learn how AWS Amplify and AWS AppSync simplify building secure, high-performance full stack applications for multiple tenants. Discover best practices for architecting multi-tenant infrastructure on AWS leveraging Amplify’s frontend hosting and AWS AppSync’s managed GraphQL service. Through live demos and examples, see how Amplify and AWS AppSync work together to help you deliver enterprise-grade, multi-tenant experiences faster. Walk away with the knowledge to build scalable, multi-tenant applications that meet your customers’ needs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Understanding of web application development
3. Knowledge of GraphQL and API design

title: Best practices for building scalable IP addressing on AWS
description: Embark on a journey to explore best practices for IP addressing on AWS. In this chalk talk, learn how to build a VPC IP addressing plan—including deciding between global unicast addresses (GUAs) and unique local addresses (ULAs) for IPv6 based on their effects on security, connectivity, and network architecture—to ensure scalability. This talk also covers strategies for efficiently using public IPv4 addresses and reducing cost. You walk away with an understanding of how to use Amazon VPC IP Address Manager (IPAM) capabilities to build an IP addressing plan that is extensible as you grow your applications on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of IP addressing concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon VPC
3. Basic knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 addressing

title: Best practices for cloud governance [REPEAT]
description: As businesses adopt the cloud, cloud governance has emerged as a critical, yet complex, priority. Whether you’re new to the cloud or have an established presence, navigating the trade-offs between agility and control can be daunting. In this chalk talk, AWS experts share strategies to build an effective and scalable cloud governance foundation, including strategies for permission management, secure workload deployments, and environment governance. Join AWS and your peers to share and learn insights from organizations that have successfully adopted the cloud.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud governance
3. Experience in managing cloud environments or a desire to learn
4. Interest in strategies for balancing agility and control in the cloud
5. Willingness to engage in discussions and share insights with peers

title: Best practices for cost optimization with AWS Backup [REPEAT]
description: With AWS Backup, you can protect application data at exabyte scale across your AWS estate, including Amazon S3 and Amazon EBS. Effective data protection strategies and cost optimization can require different approaches, depending on the business need. In this chalk talk, learn key considerations to optimize AWS Backup costs while meeting your business requirements for recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO). Walk through cost optimization examples based on lessons learned from AWS customers and recommended best practices from the field. Also, discover how to use AWS Backup reporting and monitoring features to further optimize your costs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon S3 and Amazon EBS.
2. Understanding of data protection strategies and cost optimization principles.
3. Knowledge of recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO) concepts.
4. Familiarity with AWS Backup service and its features.
5. Interest in optimizing AWS Backup costs while meeting business requirements.

title: Best practices for creating and testing cross-platform apps on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to build applications for Android, iOS, and the web without the stress of maintaining different code bases. Use React Native libraries in AWS Amplify to create full-featured, cloud-powered applications. Learn how to add features such as authentication, API and data interactions, generative AI, and media/file storage. Also, test your application using AWS Device Farm. title: Best practices for creating multi-Region architectures on AWS
description: Architecting and building a multi-Region architecture comes with new challenges and best practices. In this session, learn the two critical areas you’ll need to consider. First, explore different failover strategies and the trade-offs between them. Then, learn how to make the decision to initiate a cross-Region failover as well as what goes into the process. Lastly, hear from Samsung Account about their multi-Region application and how they think about these two critical areas. Leave this session better prepared to approach these key challenges as they relate to your multi-Region application.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and architectures.
2. Knowledge of disaster recovery and high availability strategies.
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their regional availability.
4. Experience in designing and implementing distributed applications.
5. Interest in learning about multi-region application architecture and best practices.

title: Best practices for cyber readiness, recovery, and rebuild (sponsored by Commvault)
description: Cyber resilience is an essential skill for organizations with the recent rise of ransomware and security incidents. In this session, learn how to build for resilience for your cloud-native workloads and gen AI stacks, how to automate the testing of your cyber recovery practice in a clean, on-demand cloud environment, and how to simplify discovery and accelerate the rebuild of your composable application dependencies. Leave this session with actionable guidance on how to better secure and recover your AWS resources in line with AWS and Commvault best practices. This presentation is brought to you by Commvault, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud-native architecture
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of cybersecurity and incident response
4. Experience with backup and recovery strategies
5. Familiarity with Commvault solutions

title: Best practices for data ingestion
description: Ingesting data is typically the first step in building your data pipelines. The growing landscape of data types like unstructured data, incremental data, and open table formats such as Apache Iceberg makes it all the more critical to build durable data pipelines, land the data immediately, apply the desired schema structure, and provide quality outputs for different types of use cases. Join this session to explore best practices, robust architectures, and key strategies for efficiently ingesting and processing data with services like AWS Glue, Amazon Kinesis, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon OpenSearch Service.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data types (unstructured, incremental, open table formats)
2. Familiarity with data pipeline concepts and architecture
3. Knowledge of AWS services like Glue, Kinesis, Redshift, and OpenSearch Service
4. Experience with data ingestion and processing techniques
5. Awareness of data quality and use case requirements

title: Best practices for deploying critical applications with Amazon EBS [REPEAT]
description: Millions of customers deploy performance-intensive enterprise applications and databases on AWS. In this workshop, explore the detailed process of deploying a high-performance application on Amazon EC2 and Amazon EBS for optimized availability, resiliency, and cost performance. Discover how to select the ideal Amazon EC2 instance types and Amazon EBS volume types for various workloads. Learn about on-demand storage flexibility and performance using Elastic Volumes. Monitor and improve operational performance and resource optimization of Amazon EBS using Amazon CloudWatch metrics. Build resilience and fault tolerance using AWS Fault Injection Service. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with Linux/Windows operating systems
3. Experience with deploying and managing applications on cloud platforms
4. Familiarity with database concepts and performance optimization

title: Best practices for deploying critical applications with Amazon EBS [REPEAT]
description: Millions of customers deploy performance-intensive enterprise applications and databases on AWS. In this workshop, explore the detailed process of deploying a high-performance application on Amazon EC2 and Amazon EBS for optimized availability, resiliency, and cost performance. Discover how to select the ideal Amazon EC2 instance types and Amazon EBS volume types for various workloads. Learn about on-demand storage flexibility and performance using Elastic Volumes. Monitor and improve operational performance and resource optimization of Amazon EBS using Amazon CloudWatch metrics. Build resilience and fault tolerance using AWS Fault Injection Service. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Best practices for end-to-end digital experience monitoring
description: Gain full-stack visibility into application performance, from the internet down to your services. In this session, learn how AWS digital experience monitoring combines network and internet monitoring with user experience tracking to provide an outside-in view across all touchpoints. Understand how monitoring real user interactions, synthetic traffic, internet service provider data, and backend infrastructure metrics reveals a complete picture of frontend performance, user behavior, API efficiency, and potential failure points. See how correlating these insights allows you to turn end-to-end digital experience into actionable KPIs like release velocity, adoption rates, conversions, and availability for enhancing customer experiences.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of web application architecture
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Basic knowledge of performance monitoring and user experience tracking

title: Best practices for generative AI observability
description: As generative AI adoption grows, comprehensive observability is crucial for ensuring reliability, transparency, and optimization. In this session, learn about the observability challenges of different generative AI patterns, including large language models, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures, and other emerging approaches. Discover how to use Amazon CloudWatch with a wide range of metrics, logs, and distributed tracing to gain visibility into the lifecycle of generative AI workloads. Additionally, explore the role of LangChain, a powerful framework for building generative AI applications, and how it can be leveraged in conjunction with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker to enhance observability across the development and deployment pipeline.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session would be:

1. Understanding of generative AI and its different patterns (e.g., large language models, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures).
2. Familiarity with Amazon CloudWatch and its capabilities for monitoring and observability.
3. Knowledge of distributed tracing and its importance in understanding the lifecycle of generative AI workloads.
4. Familiarity with LangChain, a framework for building generative AI applications.
5. Understanding of Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, and how they can be leveraged for observability in the development and deployment pipeline.

title: Best practices for migrating and operating DB2 databases on Amazon RDS
description: Whether you’re evaluating migration paths for your DB2 databases or are interested in efficiently operating your already migrated DB2 databases on Amazon RDS, we’ve got you covered. In this chalk talk, learn about migration paths, including those with minimal downtime, for DB2 databases running on various platforms including Linux, Unix, Windows, AIX, and z/OS. Explore real-world examples to learn best practices that help ensure high availability, optimize performance, and meet your compliance needs. Bring your questions and challenges—this interactive talk offers the opportunity to hear directly from AWS experts and collaborate with your peers.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of DB2 database management
2. Understanding of database migration processes
3. Familiarity with Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service)
4. Interest in high availability and performance optimization for DB2 databases
5. Compliance requirements for database operations

title: Best practices for migrating to Amazon OpenSearch Service [REPEAT]
description: Migrating to Amazon OpenSearch Service involves five main steps: plan, POC, deploy, data migration, and cutover. In this chalk talk, learn how to build a successful migration strategy to OpenSearch Service. Hear technical guidance on the key milestones in each migration step, starting with your premigration inventory up to your cutover stage. This talk also teaches you how to use Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion to accelerate your migration journey to OpenSearch Service.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
2. Understanding of data migration concepts
3. Knowledge of OpenSearch (formerly Elasticsearch) and its ecosystem
4. Experience with data ingestion and processing
5. Ability to plan and execute complex migration projects

description: Achieving comprehensive observability by ensuring optimal performance, reliability, and user experience is crucial for businesses. In this interactive chalk talk, explore best practices for collecting and analyzing metrics, traces, and logs across your AWS environments. title: Best practices for operating at scale with Amazon EBS & EBS snapshots [REPEAT]
description: Many enterprises are running their mission-critical production workloads in multiple AWS Regions using Amazon EBS for block storage and EBS snapshots for data protection. With block storage, operating at scale can mean different things, including delivering high IOPS or I/O bandwidth to applications, managing and monitoring millions of volumes, or protecting petabytes of data with stringent RPO and RTO requirements. In this chalk talk, learn best practices for scaling and managing your EBS environment with cloud-native tools and techniques to help keep costs down while meeting your business needs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS)
2. Knowledge of data protection strategies using EBS snapshots
3. Familiarity with cloud-native tools and techniques for managing and scaling cloud infrastructure
4. Experience with running mission-critical production workloads in multiple AWS Regions
5. Understanding of cost optimization strategies in the cloud

title: Best practices for querying vector data for gen AI apps in PostgreSQL
description: PostgreSQL makes it easier to store and query vector data for artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) use cases with the pgvector extension. Learning best practices for vector search will help you deliver a high-performance experience to your customers. In this session, learn how to store data from Amazon Bedrock in an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition database and learn SQL queries and tuning parameters to optimize the performance of your application when working with AI/ML data, vector data types, exact and approximate nearest neighbor search algorithms, and vector-optimized indexing.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of PostgreSQL
2. Knowledge of AI/ML concepts and use cases
3. Familiarity with vector data and vector search algorithms
4. Experience with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition

title: Best practices for serverless developers
description: Do you want to take advantage of the full power of serverless architectures for your production workloads? Are you wondering how events can help your applications scale? Have you been trying to tune your applications for higher performance and lower cost? This session provides architectural best practices, optimizations, and useful shortcuts that experts can use to build secure, high-scale, and high-performance serverless applications.

description: Understand how to move your applications to production in alignment with best practices for optimizing your Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) application. title: Best practices to migrate your existing message broker to AWS
description: Message brokers for point-to-point and publish-subscribe messaging are among the most widely used middleware. These systems power critical systems and integrate software products around the globe. Join this chalk talk for an interactive discussion on how AWS customers are migrating from on-premises or self-managed RabbitMQ, IBM MQ, ActiveMQ, and others to Amazon MQ. Learn best practices for building durable, scalable, global systems without managing message brokers on your own.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with on-premises or self-managed message brokers (RabbitMQ, IBM MQ, ActiveMQ)
3. Knowledge of cloud-based messaging services (e.g., Amazon MQ)
4. Interest in migrating from on-premises to cloud-based messaging solutions
5. Desire to learn best practices for building durable, scalable, and global messaging systems.

title: Better together: GitHub Actions and AWS CodeBuild [REPEAT]
description: Learn how combining GitHub Actions with AWS CodeBuild can maximize development efficiency. In this chalk talk, learn about the trade-offs of using GitHub Actions runners hosted on Amazon EC2 or Amazon ECS with GitHub Actions hosted on CodeBuild. Explore integration with other AWS services to enhance workflow automation. Join this talk to learn how GitHub Actions on AWS can take your development processes to the next level.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with AWS services (CodeBuild, EC2, ECS)
3. Experience with software development and deployment workflows

title: Better together: Protecting data through culture and technology
description: AWS uses a combination of culture and technologies to share ownership and build security into every layer of the stack, then externalizes lessons learned through the managed services AWS provides to you. This session examines the full range of data protection capabilities available with AWS and how best practices and culture can complement them to improve security outcomes. Dive deep into a defense in depth perspective, which details how organizations can protect their data and bolster their security culture by consistently building security into every layer.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Knowledge of data protection and security best practices.
3. Familiarity with the concept of "defense in depth" in cybersecurity.
4. Interest in learning how AWS leverages culture and technology to enhance security.
5. Desire to improve security outcomes within an organization.

title: Beyond 11 9s of durability: Data protection with Amazon S3
description: Amazon S3 is designed for 11 9s of durability, strong resiliency, and high availability. This makes Amazon S3 an ideal storage option for workloads where strong data protection is non-negotiable. However, even the most durable storage cannot protect against unintended or accidental deletions. Additionally, ransomware events are a primary reason to evaluate additional protection for your critical data. Join this session to learn how you can use Amazon S3 features such as S3 Versioning, S3 Replication, S3 Object Lock, and more to implement comprehensive data protection measures, meet compliance requirements, and ensure your data remains accessible.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon S3 and its features
2. Knowledge of data protection and compliance requirements
3. Familiarity with ransomware and data loss prevention strategies

title: Beyond boundaries: Converging analytics and AI to reshape the future
description: The boundaries between data analytics and AI are blurring as data workers’ behaviors evolve and previously distinct data roles and use cases converge. Getting to near real-time, trustworthy insights has become paramount, so data workers are seeking seamless collaboration and interoperability across tools and data sources. In this talk, join Sirish Chandrasekaran, Director for Data Warehousing at AWS, and Rick Sears, Director for Data Processing at AWS, to envision a future with AWS where your data workers can effortlessly move between analyzing historical patterns, predicting future scenarios, and automating decision flows at scale, breaking through disparate tools and siloed workflows.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the talk:

1. Understanding of data analytics and AI concepts
2. Knowledge of data worker roles and use cases
3. Familiarity with the importance of real-time, trustworthy insights
4. Awareness of the need for seamless collaboration and interoperability across tools and data sources
5. Interest in the future of data workflows and the role of AWS in enabling it

title: Beyond chatbots: Generative AI and tracking AWS launches
description: Generative AI is rapidly becoming integral to everyday applications, extending far beyond chatbots. In this session, Alan reveals how he built an app that uses LLMs and serverless architectures to track AWS service releases across AWS Regions in real-time. Dive into real-world use cases, learn effective prompt engineering techniques, and gain insights from both the successes and failures experienced while building this app. Join to explore the potential of AI in your technical work and see how it can boost developer productivity.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs)
2. Familiarity with serverless architectures
3. Knowledge of AWS services and regions
4. Prompt engineering techniques
5. Experience in software development and deployment

title: Beyond connectivity: Transforming businesses with intelligent IoT
description: This session explores how recent advancements in AI are evolving the internet of things (IoT) into an engine for real-world intelligence, autonomy, and actionable insights. Learn about the evolution and anatomy of next-generation intelligent things and how AWS customers are using them to transform their businesses—across healthcare, consumer products, automotive, manufacturing, and energy and utilities. Find out how to get started with IoT and AI/ML services on AWS and discover patterns to accelerate time-to-value when building and deploying intelligent IoT products and solutions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of the Internet of Things (IoT)
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Introductory knowledge of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)

title: Beyond just observing, protecting your whole software supply chain (sponsored by Datadog)
description: How do you protect your software supply chain from threat actors, and how do you mitigate vulnerabilities across fleets? Observing the supply chain is only part of the answer. In this session, explore supply chain best practices, and learn about Datadog’s open source tool GuardDog and how they use it to protect critical repos. Also, gain insight into how Datadog AVM helps prioritize acting on security findings in your AWS environment. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Understanding software supply chain security
2. Familiarity with vulnerability management and mitigation
3. Knowledge of open-source security tools
4. Awareness of Datadog's products and services

title: Beyond productivity: Using generative AI to grow in financial services
description: The present has caught up with the future in financial services. New generative AI capabilities have helped financial institutions automate labor-intensive tasks like extracting information from unstructured data sources, summarizing complex documents, and curating market intelligence. These investments in improving productivity have paved the way for the industry to focus on harnessing generative AI to create business value. Companies are engaging more meaningfully with their customers, identifying sales opportunities more efficiently, increasing lead conversion, and driving adoption of new products. Hear from industry leaders how they built and are running new growth-focused generative AI applications in production on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of financial services industry
2. Knowledge of unstructured data processing and automation
3. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
4. Experience in building and deploying AI-powered applications
5. Familiarity with AWS cloud services

title: Beyond text: Unlock multi-modal AI with AWS AI chips [REPEAT]
description: Revolutionize your applications with multi-modal AI. Learn how to harness the power of AWS AI chips to create intelligent systems that understand and process text, images, and video. Explore advanced models, like Idefics2 and Chameleon, to build exceptional AI assistants capable of OCR, document analysis, visual reasoning, and creative content generation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow)
2. Understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts
3. Experience with AWS services and cloud computing
4. Knowledge of computer vision and natural language processing techniques
5. Familiarity with advanced AI models and architectures

title: Beyond text: Unlock multi-modal AI with AWS AI chips [REPEAT]
description: Revolutionize your applications with multi-modal AI. Learn how to harness the power of AWS AI chips to create intelligent systems that understand and process text, images, and video. Explore advanced models, like Idefics2 and Chameleon, to build exceptional AI assistants capable of OCR, document analysis, visual reasoning, and creative content generation.

2. Understanding of AWS services and cloud computing.
3. Experience with natural language processing and computer vision techniques.
4. Knowledge of deep learning architectures and model deployment.

title: Beyond the chatbot: How AI makes real-time business-critical decisions (sponsored by Aerospike)
description: Learn how AI and machine learning drive critical business decisions in real time. This session explores the intricacies of data science, from sourcing and modeling data to implementing online machine learning for adaptive intelligence. See a case study on how to scale these processes using AWS technologies like Karpenter for Kubernetes, achieving lightning-fast response times on 60% less infrastructure, and handling disruptions with ease—all while managing 200 billion writes per day with sub-millisecond latency. Discover how AI can have a measurable impact on your business operations. This presentation is brought to you by Aerospike, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data science concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Knowledge of Kubernetes and container orchestration

title: Bias detection in LLMOps: Embedding ID&E into LLM lifecycles
description: Large language models (LLMs) can perpetuate societal biases, leading to discriminatory outputs. This lightning talk explores techniques for detecting and mitigating biases throughout the LLMOps lifecycle, from data collection to model deployment and monitoring. Learn best practices for building inclusive datasets, implementing debiasing strategies, conducting bias testing, and navigating ethical considerations. Through case studies and hands-on examples, participants will gain practical insights into tools and methodologies for embedding inclusion, diversity, and equity into LLMOps processes. This talk equips attendees with strategies to build more trustworthy LLMs, ensuring responsible development and deployment of these powerful technologies.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given lightning talk:

1. Basic understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their applications.
2. Knowledge of common societal biases and their potential impact on AI systems.
3. Familiarity with data collection, model training, and deployment processes in the context of LLMOps.
4. Interest in ethical considerations and best practices for building inclusive and responsible AI systems.
5. Desire to learn practical techniques for detecting, mitigating, and monitoring biases in LLMs.

title: Bingo Night
description: Bingo Night returns to re:Invent! Join us for a fun night filled with bingo and prizes.
prerequisites:
1. Attend re:Invent conference
2. Interest in participating in Bingo
3. Desire to win prizes

title: Blackstone's AWS odyssey: Agility, automation, & efficiency unleashed
description: Discover how Blackstone achieved remarkable agility and efficiency through its cloud modernization journey on AWS. Learn its approach to application modernization and how it migrated quickly to AWS. Gain insights into how it boosted developer productivity leveraging automation and implementing actionable patterns. Uncover the secrets behind its success—the transformative process that demanded a cultural shift. Modernization is easier, faster, and more efficient on AWS, but realizing the full business benefits requires a builder-centric mindset. Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights from Blackstone's trailblazing experience.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Interest in application modernization and cloud migration strategies.
3. Familiarity with developer productivity tools and automation.
4. Appreciation for organizational culture and change management.
5. Desire to learn from real-world cloud transformation success stories.

title: “Black swan” vs. “green swan”: Powering sustainability with data & AI (sponsored by Capgemini)
description: In today's rapidly evolving financial landscape, traditional data and risk models are struggling to keep pace with the complexities of climate change and sustainability challenges. This session dives into pioneering a journey as a frontrunner in using data and technology to navigate this uncharted territory to proactively identify and mitigate climate-related financial risks while unlocking the opportunities presented by the sustainability transition. Explore how to harness the power of data and AI to drive growth for a sustainable future, and learn how to implement a forward-thinking approach to transform risk management into a competitive advantage. This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of financial markets and risk management
2. Knowledge of climate change and sustainability challenges
3. Familiarity with data and technology applications in the financial sector
4. Interest in innovative approaches to risk management and growth opportunities

title: Bloomberg: Lessons learned from building and training LLMs on AWS
description: Secure and efficient model training is essential to any organization looking to build generative AI capabilities that deliver return on investment. Bloomberg, a leader in AI/ML in financial services, shares lessons learned from building and training large language models—and, subsequently, small language models—on AWS. Find out how Bloomberg navigated challenges across the model development process, including managing massive data volumes across a large network of GPU nodes, and see how automating and templating infrastructure, data storage, and transit pathways help keep data safe and secure while rendering the training process less error-prone, helping teams quickly launch model training projects.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of large language model development and training
2. Experience with AWS infrastructure and services
3. Understanding of data management and security best practices
4. Familiarity with model development process and challenges
5. Ability to automate and template infrastructure, data storage, and transit pathways

title: BMW speeds car development with a new app for defect ticket routing
description: The development and production of cars progressively becomes more software driven as the number of sensors and other digital components increases. BMW faces the challenge of routing and resolving tickets during the testing and development phases of designing a new car platform. With over 140 software teams across many areas, BMW now leverages a generative AI large language model (LLM) that provides recommendations on the next best action, augmenting the previously manual process and considering more data for correct team routing. This innovative solution streamlines BMW's software-driven car development process.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Extensive use of sensors and digital components in car design.
2. Complexity in software development and integration across multiple teams.
3. Need for efficient ticket routing and resolution during the testing and development phases.
4. Availability of generative AI large language models (LLMs) capable of providing recommendations.
5. Desire to streamline the software-driven car development process.

title: Boeing’s transformation journey: Modernizing PLM with AWS
description: In this session, discover how Boeing embarked on a modernization journey to migrate their product lifecycle management (PLM) software to AWS. Boeing’s migration, automation, and infrastructure-as-code approach allowed them to deploy complex PLM environments in a single day compared two weeks on premises. Additionally, they worked with AWS Professional Services and a partner to leverage Amazon RDS, Amazon EFS, and Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to support disaster recovery, allowing for disaster recovery to be implemented in minutes rather than hours. Learn how their innovations have collectively improved the scalability, operational efficiency, and cost-effectiveness of their PLM systems.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of product lifecycle management (PLM) software
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code and automation concepts
4. Experience with disaster recovery and high availability architectures

title: Boom!! Bam!! Comic fan – Draw your jam [REPEAT]
description: Imagine turning your doodles and ideas into professional-quality comic strips with an LLM. Submit sketches or descriptions, and the AI creatively enhances them into visual stories that reflect your unique creativity. This process applies to marketing, editorial cartoons, and comic book creation, highlighting AI’s role in visual storytelling and merging human creativity with AI capabilities.

3. Ability to create or provide sketches, doodles, or textual descriptions

title: Boost Amazon EKS efficiency: Karpenter, Graviton, and EC2 Spot Instances [REPEAT]
description: Achieving optimal compute efficiency is a key goal for modern cloud architectures. This chalk talk explores how to optimize compute costs and performance for workloads running on Amazon EKS using Karpenter, AWS Graviton, and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances. Through practical examples and expert insights, learn how to integrate these technologies to achieve a more efficient, scalable, and cost-effective Amazon EKS environment.

Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Amazon EKS
2. Familiarity with container orchestration and Kubernetes
3. Knowledge of cloud computing concepts and cost optimization strategies

description: Achieving optimal compute efficiency is a key goal for modern cloud architectures. title: Boost code quality with generative AI
description: In this hands-on workshop, you unleash the power of generative AI to boost code quality using Amazon Q Developer. You learn to use Amazon Q Developer to generate unit tests and documentation automatically, addressing the challenge of balancing new feature development with writing unit tests and documentation. By the end of the workshop, you have firsthand experience streamlining your development process and freeing up time to focus on core feature development. Come follow along with step-by-step instructions and gain practical experience with this cutting-edge AWS service. You must bring your laptop to participate.

Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of software development and unit testing.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS Management Console.
3. Ability to use a code editor and command-line interface.

title: Boost consumer goods advertising performance with AWS and Amazon
description: In this chalk talk, consumer goods companies learn how to use innovative AWS and Amazon services to optimize advertising and marketing performance. Learn how to effectively segment and target customers, securely plan and collaborate with advertising and marketing partners, use generative AI to create engaging and visually rich experiences, and generate near real-time analytics that can be used to measure and enhance campaign results.
