In this workshop, discover how to build custom ML models through hands-on exercises, and learn how to fine-tune foundation models. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with data processing and analysis.
3. Ability to use a laptop and navigate the web.

title: Build highly performant data solutions with serverless analytics
description: Data professionals are challenged to build solutions that can quickly scale, deliver cost-effective results, and support the needs of various data users. Learn how AWS makes it faster and easier to carry out a modern data strategy without having to manage infrastructure across databases, analytics, and AI/ML. In this session, see how serverless AWS analytics services make it easier to quickly build event-driven data pipelines and microservice architectures that can help you innovate at hyperscale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with data management and analytics
2. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Basic knowledge of serverless architectures and event-driven data pipelines
4. Desire to learn how to build scalable, cost-effective data solutions
5. Interest in leveraging AWS services to support a modern data strategy

title: Build hybrid data workflows to Amazon S3 with AWS Storage Gateway
description: Learn how to leverage AWS AI/ML and compute technologies for on-premises data. With Amazon S3 File Gateway, you can upload objects from on-premises NFS or SMB file data to Amazon S3 and process data using AWS compute resources. See demos of end-to-end data workflows from on-premises environments to Amazon S3 using S3 File Gateway. Attendees leave this session with an understanding of how S3 File Gateway serves as the foundation for modernizing data infrastructure and unlocking new value from on-premises data investments. Learn best practices and common use cases to help you get started.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with on-premises data storage and management.
3. Knowledge of data processing and analytics.
4. Familiarity with Amazon S3 and its features.
5. Understanding of data workflows and integration between on-premises and cloud environments.

title: Build infrastructure as code with AWS CloudFormation
description: AWS CloudFormation helps you manage your AWS infrastructure as code, increasing automation and supporting infrastructure-as-code best practices. In this chalk talk, learn the fundamentals of CloudFormation, including templates, stacks, change sets, and stack dependencies. See a demo of how to describe your AWS infrastructure in a template format and provision resources in an automated, repeatable way.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and resources.
2. Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code concepts.
3. Familiarity with JSON or YAML data formats.
4. Understanding of AWS account management and access control.
5. Familiarity with AWS CLI or AWS Management Console.

title: Building advanced workflows with AWS Step Functions
description: Are you an experienced serverless developer building applications with AWS Step Functions workflows? Are you wondering when to use a Map state, a Parallel state, or a nested workflow? In this session, learn how you can use generative AI to generate state machines automatically from textual descriptions and chat with your workflow to optimize it. Learn about architectural best practices and repeatable patterns for building advanced workflows. Discover how to build secure, high-scale, and high-performance serverless applications while being cost-effective. This session shares real production scenarios to illustrate the benefits for you.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with AWS Step Functions and serverless development
2. Understanding of AWS Lambda and other serverless services
3. Familiarity with state machine concepts (Map, Parallel, nested workflows)
4. Interest in leveraging generative AI for workflow optimization
5. Desire to learn architectural best practices and patterns for advanced serverless workflows

title: Building a generative AI–based manufacturing digital thread
description: Manufacturers have vast amounts of knowledge dispersed across the product lifecycle, often resulting in limited visibility, significant knowledge gaps, and the inability to continuously improve. A digital thread offers an integrated approach to combine disparate data sources across enterprise systems to drive traceability, accessibility, collaboration, and agility. In this workshop, learn how to create an intelligent manufacturing digital thread using a combination of knowledge graph and generative AI technologies based on the data generated throughout the product lifecycle. Explore several use cases and discover actionable steps to kick-start your intelligent digital thread journey. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of manufacturing processes and product lifecycle
2. Familiarity with enterprise systems and data management
3. Interest in exploring digital transformation and Industry 4.0 technologies
4. Willingness to actively participate in the workshop and bring a laptop

title: Building AI agents in Slack using AWS services (sponsored by Slack from Salesforce)
description: The future of work is here, driven by integrating AI with Slack, the work OS. Learn how to use AWS services to build AI agents and assistants tailored for your organization. By integrating large language models like Anthropic’s model via Amazon Bedrock, you can create intelligent agents that automate tasks, enhance decision-making, and streamline workflows in Slack. This lightning talk provides insights into building and deploying AI agents on AWS, securely accessing enterprise data, automating complex processes, and connecting with other applications. Harness the power of AI and Slack to boost productivity and create a more efficient workplace. This presentation is brought to you by Slack from Salesforce, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Slack and its integration capabilities
2. Knowledge of AWS services, particularly Amazon Bedrock
3. Understanding of large language models and their applications in the workplace
4. Experience in building and deploying AI agents and assistants
5. Familiarity with enterprise data management and security considerations

title: Building an AI-powered shopping assistant
description: Many retailers are turning to AI-powered virtual assistants like Amazon Rufus to help shoppers find and buy the right products. To be effective, it is important that these virtual assistants provide accurate advice that is limited to the product catalog. During this lightning talk, learn how the AWS Generative AI Labs team accomplished just that and how you can build a digital shopping assistant using large language models.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of large language models
2. Understanding of product catalogs and e-commerce
3. Familiarity with AWS Generative AI Labs
4. Experience in building conversational AI applications
5. Awareness of virtual assistant technologies like Amazon Rufus

title: Building an AWS solutions architect agentic app with Amazon Bedrock
description: Navigating through complex cloud solutions can be a daunting task. In this session, see how generative AI can help solve this problem by building an AWS solutions architect agentic app. Using Amazon Bedrock, learn how to build an app that can query AWS documentation, deploy infrastructure, create diagrams, and more. The session ends with a live demo, where the generative AI app handles a variety of tasks, significantly reducing manual effort and error. Gain practical insights and the know-how to build generative AI agentic apps to alleviate similar pain points.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
3. Knowledge of Amazon Bedrock or similar generative AI platforms
4. Proficiency in programming and application development

title: Building and maintaining cost-effective generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk explores key design considerations for building cost-effective generative AI applications. We discuss model selection and optimization techniques, focusing on strategies for optimizing the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture. Learn about selecting the appropriate vector store and implementing efficient data storage and retrieval methods. Additionally, the talk covers prompt engineering best practices and demonstrates effective monitoring and cost-tracking approaches to ensure the overall cost-effectiveness of the generative AI solution.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of generative AI models and architectures.
2. Familiarity with vector stores and data storage/retrieval methods.
3. Knowledge of prompt engineering techniques.
4. Experience with cost optimization and monitoring for AI applications.

title: Building and maintaining cost-effective generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk explores key design considerations for building cost-effective generative AI applications. We discuss model selection and optimization techniques, focusing on strategies for optimizing the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture. Learn about selecting the appropriate vector store and implementing efficient data storage and retrieval methods. Additionally, the talk covers prompt engineering best practices and demonstrates effective monitoring and cost-tracking approaches to ensure the overall cost-effectiveness of the generative AI solution.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of generative AI models and architectures.
2. Knowledge of model selection and optimization techniques.
3. Familiarity with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture.
4. Experience with vector stores and data storage/retrieval methods.
5. Familiarity with prompt engineering best practices.

title: Building and releasing robust generative AI solutions on AWS
description: Discover how to release robust generative AI solutions with the Buy with Prime team. Learn best practices for building safe, reliable, and scalable merchant support and customer experiences on Amazon Bedrock, Connect, and Lex for direct-to-consumer merchants using Buy with Prime. Gain insights into evaluation and pilot approaches for quick iteration on relevancy, ensuring the best customer experience. Whether new or experienced with generative AI, explore the team's hands-on investigation of various options and frameworks for secure iteration.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with generative AI technologies and their applications.
2. Understanding of e-commerce platforms and merchant support services.
3. Experience in building scalable and reliable customer experiences.
4. Knowledge of evaluation and testing methodologies for iterative product development.
5. Willingness to explore and experiment with different AI frameworks and approaches.

title: Building an educational startup on AWS: A heroic journey
description: Gather 'round for the tale of two AWS heroes on their journey through the world of cloud. The goal: build and deploy an educational platform for AWS, on AWS. They will guide you over the hills & down the valleys of developing with MFA in Amazon Cognito, working with AWS Amplify, securing with AWS WAF, persisting users in Amazon DynamoDB, handling requests with Amazon API Gateway, and building with AWS Lambda and Powertools. Come see if our adventurers succeeded in their quest or end up at the last "Outpost."
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with web application development
3. Knowledge of authentication and authorization concepts
4. Experience with serverless architectures

title: Building an effective observability strategy [REPEAT]
description: Observability is crucial for understanding and optimizing modern cloud workloads, yet many organizations struggle to implement an effective strategy. In this session, learn how to evaluate your observability maturity and set up a comprehensive approach that measures the right signals. Gain insights into efficiently driving observability for diverse workloads, including containers and serverless applications. Through demos and practical examples, discover best practices for building a strategy that empowers you to unlock powerful insights from your observability data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and modern application architectures.
2. Familiarity with monitoring and observability concepts.
3. Exposure to container and serverless technologies.
4. Desire to improve observability maturity and gain insights from data.

title: Building an effective observability strategy [REPEAT]
description: Observability is crucial for understanding and optimizing modern cloud workloads, yet many organizations struggle to implement an effective strategy. In this session, learn how to evaluate your observability maturity and set up a comprehensive approach that measures the right signals. Gain insights into efficiently driving observability for diverse workloads, including containers and serverless applications. Through demos and practical examples, discover best practices for building a strategy that empowers you to unlock powerful insights from your observability data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and architectures.
2. Familiarity with modern application development and deployment practices, such as containers and serverless.
3. Basic knowledge of observability tools and techniques.
4. Desire to improve observability and gain deeper insights into cloud workloads.
5. Willingness to implement a comprehensive observability strategy.

title: Building an event sourcing system using AWS serverless technologies
description: In this chalk talk, explore strategies for building effective event sourcing architectures using AWS serverless technologies. Learn how event sourcing stores the application state as an append-only event log, preserving context and enabling traceability. Discover powerful benefits like auditing, fault tolerance, root cause analysis, and event-driven architectures across industries and applications. Learn how to distinguish event sourcing from patterns like event streaming and domain-driven design. Leave with practical insights into leveraging serverless for implementing event sourcing to gain audit visibility, fault tolerance, and visibility into your application state.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with event-driven architectures and domain-driven design
3. Basic knowledge of serverless computing and its benefits

title: Building an integration strategy for the future
description: Boost productivity and create better customer experiences by building a modern integration strategy. This session explores using AWS application, data, and file integration services to connect on-premises and cloud technologies securely and at scale. Discover common integration patterns, best practices, and practical use cases. Learn how to build a robust, extensible, scalable, and cost-effective integration strategy for the future.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with application, data, and file integration concepts.
3. Knowledge of on-premises and cloud-based technologies.
4. Interest in improving productivity and customer experiences through integration.
5. Willingness to learn about common integration patterns and best practices.

title: Building an interoperable healthcare data layer with AWS
description: Unlocking the power of data is key to driving healthcare innovation and improving patient outcomes. In this session, learn how to develop an interoperable healthcare data layer that seamlessly integrates analytics and generative AI capabilities using AWS HealthLake. Gain insights from a real-world customer case study featuring Greenway Health, a leading EHR provider, and their pioneering journey to build a unified healthcare data platform on HealthLake. Discover how they leveraged HealthLake to enable advanced analytics, a generative AI chatbot, and cutting-edge solutions while achieving cost reduction and performance boosts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of healthcare data management
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and data analytics
3. Interest in leveraging AWS services for healthcare applications
4. Desire to learn about interoperable healthcare data platforms
5. Curiosity about the potential of generative AI in healthcare

title: Building an optimized cloud workload with AWS
description: Like constructing a bridge, building a cloud workload requires careful consideration of design and materials to ensure it meets the desired qualities and effectively supports the intended business outcomes. Join this session to learn how to use the AWS Well-Architected Framework to determine the set of qualities a cloud workload needs to deliver an optimal business outcome, using services like AWS Health, AWS Trusted Advisor, and many others. Gain insights from an Australian multinational bank, Commonwealth Bank, in addressing their architecture challenges, using AWS Well-Architected to keep their cloud architecture robust, secure, and cost-effective.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing
2. Familiarity with the AWS platform and services
3. Knowledge of the AWS Well-Architected Framework

title: Building a resilient and effective culture of security
description: Organizations today face pressure to rapidly deliver innovative, secure solutions and embrace disruptive technologies like generative AI. This must be balanced against privacy and security requirements. At AWS, we have found that culture has a greater impact on success than either strategy or technology. This talk offers guidance on cultivating a resilient, empowering culture of security, including gaining leadership support, distributing security ownership, and embedding psychological safety to build trust, transparency, and a proactive security-first mindset. By fostering a resilient culture of security, companies can better protect customers, safeguard data, and achieve a sustainable competitive advantage.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of organizational challenges in balancing innovation and security.
2. Knowledge of the importance of culture in driving successful security practices.
3. Awareness of the key elements of a resilient, empowering culture of security.
4. Familiarity with strategies for gaining leadership support and distributing security ownership.
5. Appreciation for the role of psychological safety in building trust, transparency, and a proactive security-first mindset.

title: Building a Retrieval Augmented Generation assistant with Amazon Bedrock
description: In this workshop, learn how to build an advanced Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) assistant using Amazon Bedrock. RAG assistants combine the capabilities of LLMs with external knowledge retrieval to provide accurate and informative responses. Explore techniques for integrating diverse data sources, including structured databases and unstructured documents, to augment your assistant’s knowledge base. Additionally, learn best practices for implementing robust knowledge management pipelines, enabling efficient updates and maintenance of your assistant’s knowledge base. Leave this workshop with the skills to design and deploy a RAG assistant that delivers accurate, up-to-date, and context-aware responses, enhancing user experiences across various applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Familiarity with machine learning and natural language processing concepts.
2. Experience with Python programming and working with machine learning libraries.
3. Understanding of large language models and their applications.
4. Basic knowledge of database management and data integration.

title: Building a serverless web application for a theme park
description: In this workshop, learn how to build a complete serverless web application for a popular theme park called Innovator Island. The theme park is rolling out a mobile app that provides thousands of visitors with wait times, photo opportunities, notification alerts, and language translation. Get hands-on experience building a scalable serverless application with a single-page application frontend that delivers a feature-rich user experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of web development
2. Familiarity with JavaScript
3. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts

title: Building a smart factory with Amazon Q Business
description: Learn how to build and deploy an AI assistant that seamlessly integrates with AWS services, enabling interaction with your industrial data in real time. Imagine an assistant that can answer questions like “What is the OEE for this line?” or compose maintenance requests. This workshop walks through the process of deploying an API to interface with industrial IoT services and creating a custom plugin in Amazon Q Business. Coding experience isn’t required, but some API design and industrial automation knowledge is helpful. Leave this workshop with a functional AI assistant that can be tailored to your factory’s needs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Basic understanding of industrial automation and IoT.
2. Familiarity with API design.
3. Coding experience, though not required.

title: Building a strong data foundation for generative AI success (sponsored by DoiT)
description: In this session, DoiT breaks down how to set your organization up for success with generative AI. Learn how to measure the return on investment for AI projects, focusing on what really matters: business impact, data needs, and computing power. Discover how to build a strong data foundation using AWS tools and how to optimize your infrastructure to handle AI tasks smoothly. Gain practical tips on assessing investment opportunities, managing data, and boosting performance for your AI projects. This presentation is brought to you by DoiT, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of business impact and data needs for AI projects
2. Basic knowledge of AWS tools and infrastructure optimization
3. Interest in assessing investment opportunities and managing data for AI projects

title: Building a universal semantic layer on AWS using Cube.js
description: In today’s data-driven world, organizations are grappling with the challenge of providing consistent and trusted insights across multiple data consumers, including BI tools, embedded analytics, and AI agents. Enter Cube.js, an open source project that helps you build a universal semantic layer, bridging the gap between your data sources and data consumers. In this hands-on workshop, learn how to use Cube.js to create a unified data model that can be consumed by various applications, ensuring data consistency and governance. Explore how to connect to different data sources on AWS and define metrics and dimensions using Cube.js’s developer-friendly approach. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data analytics and business intelligence
2. Familiarity with AWS services and data sources
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., JavaScript, Python)
4. Ability to set up and configure a development environment on your laptop

title: Building a wearable AI personal assistant device
description: The integration of artificial intelligence into wearable technology represents the next frontier in personal assistance, offering new levels of convenience and functionality for end users. This session provides a detailed guide on how to develop and build solutions for wearable AI personal assistant devices. Using generative AI and multimodal large language models, participants learn how to create a smart, context-aware solution that can understand and respond to user needs in various ways. Developers discover how generative AI can be used to create innovative AI-driven products and solutions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of wearable technology and its applications
2. Understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning
3. Familiarity with generative AI and large language models
4. Experience in software development and application building
5. Familiarity with multimodal data processing and integration

title: Building AWS generative AI applications powered by anywhere data
description: Data is your differentiator, and where data resides should not be a blocker for innovation. In this chalk talk, learn how to use your data in multicloud environments to power generative AI applications on AWS. Especially for organizations new to AWS, there are ways to derive value without large-scale migrations of data lakes or warehouses. This talk explores the architectures and services that enable cross-environment data access to power and drive innovation through generative AI on AWS. It also covers the security and governance needed to securely operate in a multicloud environment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with data management and storage
3. Basic knowledge of generative AI
4. Awareness of AWS services and capabilities
5. Exposure to multicloud environments and data access challenges

title: Building common orchestrated workflows with AWS Step Functions [REPEAT]
description: Accelerate your data processing journey in this hands-on AWS Step Functions workshop. Build orchestrated data processing, async processing, and distributed transaction use cases. Discover how to simplify managing and scaling distributed data processing, offload undifferentiated tasks, and overcome serverless parallelism challenges. Through real-world examples and best practices, gain skills to unlock new business value. Leave with a deeper understanding of how to use AWS Step Functions to build scalable, efficient, cost-effective data processing architectures. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with data processing concepts
3. Experience with serverless computing or AWS Lambda

title: Building common orchestrated workflows with AWS Step Functions [REPEAT]
description: Accelerate your data processing journey in this hands-on AWS Step Functions workshop. Build orchestrated data processing, async processing, and distributed transaction use cases. Discover how to simplify managing and scaling distributed data processing, offload undifferentiated tasks, and overcome serverless parallelism challenges. Through real-world examples and best practices, gain skills to unlock new business value. Leave with a deeper understanding of how to use AWS Step Functions to build scalable, efficient, cost-effective data processing architectures. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Basic understanding of data processing concepts
3. Hands-on experience with AWS Console

title: Building common orchestrated workflows with AWS Step Functions [REPEAT]
description: Accelerate your data processing journey in this hands-on AWS Step Functions workshop. Build three orchestrated workflows: streamline data processing with Distributed Map state, integrate external systems using callback with task token, and establish consistency across distributed applications by implementing the saga pattern. Discover how to simplify managing and scaling distributed data processing, offload undifferentiated tasks, and overcome serverless parallelism challenges. Through real-world examples and best practices, gain skills to unlock new business value. Leave with a deeper understanding of how to use AWS Step Functions to build scalable, efficient, data processing architectures. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this workshop:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services.
2. Familiarity with data processing concepts.
3. Experience with serverless computing or a willingness to learn.
4. Access to an AWS account with appropriate permissions.
5. A laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Building core capabilities: The secret to innovation at scale
description: Unlock the potential of your business by learning the art of building core capabilities, the ultimate accelerators of innovation. From customer data platforms and personalization engines to fraud detection systems and conversational AI, discover how these platforms can empower your teams to innovate with speed and efficiency. Explore the patterns that define successful platforms, hear insights gathered from real-world customer interactions, and see a roadmap for initiating and scaling your own platform-driven transformation. Whether you’re a technical expert or a business leader, join this session to gain actionable strategies and start your journey toward scalable disruption and cost-efficient innovation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of business strategy and innovation
2. Familiarity with customer data management and personalization
3. Knowledge of emerging technologies like AI and fraud detection
4. Experience in digital transformation or platform-based business models

title: Building EDAs with Apache Kafka and Amazon EventBridge
description: In this chalk talk, explore the convergence of event-driven architectures (EDAs) and real-time event streaming to meet modern business needs. Learn about Amazon EventBridge, Apache Kafka, and their roles in facilitating real-time decision-making, business velocity, and operational autonomy. Discover how combining EventBridge and Kafka unlocks rapid event-driven processes. See how Amazon MSK, EventBridge event buses/pipes, and Kafka connectors empower building scalable, resilient EDAs. Leave with insights into leveraging this powerful combination.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of event-driven architectures (EDAs)
2. Familiarity with real-time event streaming
3. Knowledge of Amazon EventBridge and Apache Kafka
4. Awareness of Amazon MSK and Kafka connectors
5. Concepts of scalable and resilient EDAs

title: Building event-driven architectures [REPEAT]
description: Many organizations choose to build event-driven application architectures in which subscribers or target services automatically perform in response to events triggered by publisher or source services. This pattern can help development teams operate more independently to release new features faster and make their applications more scalable. In this workshop, learn about the basics of event-driven design using examples involving Amazon SNS, Amazon SQS, AWS Lambda, Amazon EventBridge, and more. Find out how to choose the right AWS service for the job and how you can optimize cost and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Hands-on experience with at least one programming language
4. Ability to access and use an AWS account
5. Laptop for participation

title: Building event-driven architectures [REPEAT]
description: Many organizations choose to build event-driven application architectures in which subscribers or target services automatically perform in response to events triggered by publisher or source services. This pattern can help development teams operate more independently to release new features faster and make their applications more scalable. In this workshop, learn about the basics of event-driven design using examples involving Amazon SNS, Amazon SQS, AWS Lambda, Amazon EventBridge, and more. Find out how to choose the right AWS service for the job and how you can optimize cost and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python, Java, or Node.js)
4. Ability to work with command-line interfaces and cloud-based tools
5. Willingness to participate actively in the workshop

title: Building event-driven architectures using Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate
description: Event-driven architecture (EDA) enables organizations to build highly flexible and resilient systems, and customers are leveraging serverless containers to run EDA workloads due to its ease of use, scalability, and deep integrations with AWS serverless services. This session explores practical aspects of implementing EDA on Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate, focusing on patterns for consuming events in containerized environments using AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, and Amazon EventBridge. Learn how to build scalable, fault-tolerant, and event-driven solutions that can adapt to changing business requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Familiarity with Event-driven architecture (EDA) concepts.
2. Understanding of containerization and Docker.
3. Knowledge of AWS services, including Amazon ECS, AWS Fargate, AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, and Amazon EventBridge.
4. Experience with serverless computing and its benefits.
5. Familiarity with building scalable and fault-tolerant systems.

title: Building explainable AI models with Amazon SageMaker
description: As AI systems are increasingly used in decision-making, explainable models have become essential. This dev chat explores tools and techniques for building these models using Amazon SageMaker. It walks through several techniques for interpreting complex models, providing insights into their decision-making processes. Learn how to ensure model transparency and fairness in machine learning pipelines and how to deploy these models using SageMaker endpoints. This dev chat is ideal for data scientists focusing on AI ethics and model interpretability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques.
2. Familiarity with Amazon SageMaker.
3. Knowledge of AI ethics and model interpretability.

title: Building generative AI applications with on-premises and edge data
description: Customers in regulated industries are looking to leverage generative AI with sensitive data that must remain on premises due to data residency requirements. Additionally, some customers with data generated at the edge need to run small language models (SLMs) locally for real-time processing. This session explores how to select, fine-tune, and deploy SLMs for on-premises and edge use cases using AWS hybrid and edge services. Learn how to run Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with on-premises data to improve prompt outcomes. Understand model trade-offs across accuracy, performance, and cost efficiency, and discover architectural best practices for security, scalability, and high availability.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session would be:

1. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications.
2. Understanding of data residency requirements and on-premises data processing.
3. Familiarity with small language models (SLMs) and their use cases.
4. Familiarity with AWS hybrid and edge services.
5. Understanding of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and its benefits.

title: Building GraphQL APIs with AWS AppSync
description: In this workshop, discover the functionality of AWS AppSync, a fully managed service that makes it easy to develop GraphQL APIs. Learn how AWS AppSync handles the heavy lifting of securely connecting to data sources like Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Bedrock, AWS Lambda, and more. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of GraphQL
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities

title: Building highly available and fault-tolerant edge applications [REPEAT]
description: Organizations need to be able to deploy highly available and fault-tolerant applications at the edge. These workloads are often some of the most demanding in terms of durability and availability requirements. Deploying workloads on AWS hybrid cloud and edge computing services like AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts requires planning for networking, compute, storage, and other failure modes. In this chalk talk, dive deep into each of these services, review use cases, and examine reference architectures. Learn design considerations, deployment patterns, and best practices for high availability and disaster recovery.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and services.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture.
3. Knowledge of edge computing and its use cases.
4. Experience with high availability and fault-tolerance requirements in application deployment.
5. Understanding of networking, compute, and storage concepts.

title: Building highly available and fault-tolerant edge applications [REPEAT]
description: Organizations need to be able to deploy highly available and fault-tolerant applications at the edge. These workloads are often some of the most demanding in terms of durability and availability requirements. Deploying workloads on AWS hybrid cloud and edge computing services like AWS Local Zones and AWS Outposts requires planning for networking, compute, storage, and other failure modes. In this chalk talk, dive deep into each of these services, review use cases, and examine reference architectures. Learn design considerations, deployment patterns, and best practices for high availability and disaster recovery.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and services
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architectures
3. Knowledge of edge computing and its applications
4. Experience with high availability and fault-tolerance requirements
5. Understanding of networking, compute, and storage concepts

title: Building modern API architectures: Which front door should I use? [REPEAT]
description: Architects have a number of options for building modern APIs, including REST, GraphQL, and real-time APIs. In this chalk talk, explore these options along with their benefits and drawbacks. The talk then covers practical use cases that show how to implement each style of API on AWS, including using managed services such as Amazon API Gateway, AWS IoT, and AWS AppSync.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of web services and API concepts
2. Basic knowledge of HTTP protocols and RESTful API design
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services

title: Building modern API architectures: Which front door should I use? [REPEAT]
description: Architects have a number of options for building modern APIs, including REST, GraphQL, and real-time APIs. In this chalk talk, explore these options along with their benefits and drawbacks. The talk then covers practical use cases that show how to implement each style of API on AWS, including using managed services such as Amazon API Gateway, AWS IoT, and AWS AppSync.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of web services and API concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Basic knowledge of software architecture and design patterns
4. Programming skills in a relevant language (e.g., Python, Java, Node.js)
5. Familiarity with data formats (JSON, XML) and protocols (HTTP, WebSocket)

title: Building modern data processing pipelines on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Organizations use their data to power everything from financial planning to generative AI. In order to be data-driven, organizations need to build highly scalable, efficient data pipelines to keep up with the rapidly-evolving modern data landscape. In this session, explore how organizations build petabyte-scale data processing pipelines with open source tools such as Apache Spark and AWS-managed services such as Amazon EMR on EKS. Learn the key architecture decisions for storage, networking, and compute that allow you to optimize data pipelines for cost or performance to meet your organization’s objectives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Understanding of data processing and data pipeline concepts.
2. Familiarity with Apache Spark and AWS-managed services like Amazon EMR on EKS.
3. Knowledge of storage, networking, and compute architecture considerations for data pipelines.
4. Awareness of cost optimization and performance optimization strategies for data pipelines.
5. Interest in building petabyte-scale data processing pipelines.

title: Building modern data processing pipelines on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Organizations use their data to power everything from financial planning to generative AI. In order to be data-driven, organizations need to build highly scalable, efficient data pipelines to keep up with the rapidly-evolving modern data landscape. In this session, explore how organizations build petabyte-scale data processing pipelines with open source tools such as Apache Spark and AWS-managed services such as Amazon EMR on EKS. Learn the key architecture decisions for storage, networking, and compute that allow you to optimize data pipelines for cost or performance to meet your organization’s objectives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data processing and pipeline architecture
2. Familiarity with open-source tools like Apache Spark
3. Knowledge of AWS services, particularly Amazon EMR on EKS
4. Experience in storage, networking, and compute optimization for data pipelines
5. Awareness of modern data landscape and organizational data-driven objectives

title: Building more sustainable AI solutions to tackle climate change
description: In this session, learn how AWS is committed to innovating with data center efficiency and lowering its carbon footprint to build a more sustainable business. Hear how AWS infrastructure is efficient for your AI workloads to minimize environmental impact as you innovate with compute, storage, networking, and more. Learn from Nasdaq, whose AI-powered environmental, social, and governance (ESG) platform uses Amazon Bedrock and AWS Lambda. Discover how their solution saves customers hours of manual effort by automating the analysis of tens of thousands of documents to better manage investor events, report internally to executive teams, and find new investors to target.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and infrastructure
2. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
3. Knowledge of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices
4. Interest in sustainability and reducing carbon footprint

title: Building on AWS: Best practices from a hypergrowth SaaS Leader (sponsored by Miro)
description: Discover how Miro uses AWS to accelerate innovation, streamline development, and achieve hypergrowth. The Miro infrastructure team shares how they use the Miro platform internally to manage and enhance their AWS buildout, aligning their product and infrastructure roadmaps while driving significant growth. Learn about Miro’s migration journey, the role of AI, and best practices for using Miro in project management and architecture visualization. Discover how Miro’s AWS-based infrastructure drives efficiency and scalability, helping them deliver an exceptional product. This presentation is brought to you by Miro, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS
2. Familiarity with project management and architecture visualization tools
3. Interest in learning about Miro's infrastructure and growth strategies

title: Building, operating, and testing resilient Multi-AZ applications [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, get hands-on experience building, operating, and testing a resilient Multi-AZ application. Use Amazon CloudWatch dashboards, insights rules, and composite alarms to observe the health of your application. Then, inject randomized faults using AWS Fault Injection Service to simulate a variety of Single-AZ impairments. Also, learn how to use AWS CodeDeploy to perform zonal deployments and experience deployment failures. Finally, use Amazon Application Recovery Controller zonal shift to recover from these failures and protect your customer experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and application architecture
3. Experience with AWS CLI or AWS Management Console
4. Ability to use a laptop and navigate the AWS Management Console

title: Building, operating, and testing resilient Multi-AZ applications [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, get hands-on experience building, operating, and testing a resilient Multi-AZ application. Use Amazon CloudWatch dashboards, insights rules, and composite alarms to observe the health of your application. Then, inject randomized faults using AWS Fault Injection Service to simulate a variety of Single-AZ impairments. Also, learn how to use AWS CodeDeploy to perform zonal deployments and experience deployment failures. Finally, use Amazon Application Recovery Controller zonal shift to recover from these failures and protect your customer experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Experience with application development and deployment

title: Building operational resilience in workloads using generative AI
description: Building operational resilience requires proactive identification and mitigation of risks. In this workshop, use AWS managed generative AI services in real-world scenarios to learn how to assess readiness, proactively improve your architecture, react quickly to events, troubleshoot issues, and implement effective observability practices. Also use AWS Countdown and the AWS Well-Architected Framework as the entry point reference frameworks to leverage generative AI services for operation. Through hands-on activities, learn strategies for debugging issues, detecting anomalies and incidents, and optimizing architectures to improve the resilience of your workloads. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with the AWS Well-Architected Framework.
3. Proficiency in using AWS Management Console or AWS CLI.
4. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities.
5. Familiarity with generative AI services and their applications.

title: Building optimized IT infrastructure and operations (sponsored by IBM)
description: Scaling AI requires having the right IT foundation—from intentionally designed architecture that is open and secure to optimized IT operations that use AI and automation to improve observability, remediation, cloud and network performance, and tech spend. In this session, hear from global leaders about how a more intentional and intelligent approach is helping them optimize their architecture, operations, and spend. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of IT architecture design principles
2. Knowledge of open and secure IT systems
3. Familiarity with AI and automation in IT operations
4. Expertise in cloud and network performance optimization
5. Experience in managing and optimizing technology spending

title: Building production-grade resilient architectures with Amazon EKS
description: Platform teams need to effectively manage thousands of clusters to meet the demands of growing organizations. In this session, learn how to manage and upgrade clusters at scale without compromising security, resiliency, performance, and cost. See how you can use open source tools like ACK, Argo CD, and Backstage to build and maintain Amazon EKS clusters at scale, as well as provide a single pane of glass as an inventory of Amazon EKS clusters across your entire AWS organization. Explore architecture techniques to ensure workload resiliency with enhanced observability, enabling rapid issue identification across Amazon EKS clusters.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Kubernetes and Amazon EKS
2. Understanding of infrastructure as code and GitOps principles
3. Familiarity with open-source tools like ACK, Argo CD, and Backstage
4. Experience in managing and upgrading clusters at scale
5. Awareness of security, resiliency, performance, and cost considerations in cluster management.

title: Building production-ready generative AI applications on Amazon Bedrock
description: Successful generative AI deployments demand more than just a proof of concept. This session explores the end-to-end journey of scaling generative AI applications with Amazon Bedrock, from model selection and cost optimization to performance monitoring and observability. Gain insights into managing model access, balancing trade-offs, and future-proofing your AI strategy. Discover best practices for post-production observability, ensuring seamless operations and continuous improvement. Leverage the full potential of generative AI in your enterprise with a comprehensive approach powered by Amazon Bedrock.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI and its applications
2. Familiarity with cloud-based AI services, such as Amazon Bedrock
3. Experience in model selection, cost optimization, and performance monitoring
4. Knowledge of model access management and trade-off balancing
5. Desire to implement a comprehensive AI strategy and leverage the full potential of generative AI

title: Building RAG applications with Elasticsearch and Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Elastic)
description: Learn how to employ Elastic’s integration of Amazon Bedrock with its Elasticsearch Open Inference API and Playground to enhance the flexibility for developers to build RAG applications using any large language model on Amazon Bedrock. In this session, review how to simplify the development of advanced search experiences by utilizing a vast library of models. Discover how developers can improve conversational search through advanced model testing and embedding capabilities directly within Elasticsearch environments. This presentation is brought to you by Elastic, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Elasticsearch
2. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock
3. Knowledge of large language models
4. Experience with developing search applications
5. Familiarity with Elastic's integration capabilities

title: Building rate-limited solutions on AWS
description: Does your scalable service overwhelm backends that can’t keep up? Do you need to integrate with rate-limited third-party APIs? Attend this chalk talk to learn some of the best ways to build rate limiting into your systems for improved reliability. After a quick overview of AWS rate limiting tools, dive into the details of three different implementations. Leave with practical strategies to prevent downstream bottlenecks from impacting your application’s performance.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with system design and architecture
3. Knowledge of API integration and rate limiting
4. Familiarity with performance optimization techniques

title: Building resilience against ransomware using AWS Backup
description: Organizations need a robust recovery plan to be resilient in the face of the challenges they face. The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) provides strong principles that help to minimize downtime and maintain business continuity. This session dives deep into the knowledge and strategies to build a recovery plan using AWS Backup and explores the concepts and role data vaults can play in that plan.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cybersecurity concepts
2. Familiarity with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework
3. Knowledge of AWS Backup and its features
4. Understanding of the importance of business continuity and disaster recovery
5. Awareness of the role of data vaults in recovery planning

title: Building resilient Amazon ECS applications with chaos engineering [REPEAT]
description: Achieving true resilience for applications running on Amazon ECS requires actively testing and validating your system's ability to withstand failures and unexpected events. In this chalk talk, explore how you can leverage the principles of chaos engineering and tools like AWS Fault Injection Service to inject controlled failures into your Amazon ECS tasks and services. Learn best practices for designing and running impactful chaos experiments that reveal hidden weaknesses and dependencies, and uncover strategies for using the insights from chaos testing to improve the overall availability, scalability, and recoverability of your Amazon ECS applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service)
2. Familiarity with chaos engineering principles
3. Knowledge of AWS Fault Injection Service
4. Experience in designing and running chaos experiments
5. Understanding of application availability, scalability, and recoverability

title: Building resilient Amazon ECS applications with chaos engineering [REPEAT]
description: Achieving true resilience for applications running on Amazon ECS requires actively testing and validating your system's ability to withstand failures and unexpected events. In this chalk talk, explore how you can leverage the principles of chaos engineering and tools like AWS Fault Injection Service to inject controlled failures into your Amazon ECS tasks and services. Learn best practices for designing and running impactful chaos experiments that reveal hidden weaknesses and dependencies, and uncover strategies for using the insights from chaos testing to improve the overall availability, scalability, and recoverability of your Amazon ECS applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS)
2. Knowledge of chaos engineering principles and practices
3. Familiarity with AWS Fault Injection Service
4. Experience in designing and running chaos experiments
5. Understanding of application availability, scalability, and recoverability

title: Building resilient applications and environments: Is less more? (sponsored by Veeam Software)
description: Even with the high availability and reliability of AWS, simply migrating or modernizing an application on AWS doesn’t ensure resilience. Infrastructure issues, misconfigurations, and security events can still affect uptime. Join this demo-filled session to learn what true data resilience means and how to build it. Discover how to go beyond basic backup by creating a resilient environment that enhances efficiency and security. Explore data backup, recovery, security, and cost optimization to keep your applications running smoothly. Join this session with Veeam Software, a global leader in data resilience, to learn how to enhance your AWS experience. This presentation is brought to you by Veeam Software, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS infrastructure and services
2. Basic knowledge of data backup and recovery strategies
3. Familiarity with cloud security and cost optimization principles

title: Building resilient applications on AWS with Capital One
description: Are you concerned about running mission-critical applications on AWS? Did you know that AWS hosts mission-critical applications for some of the largest and most-regulated businesses on earth? In this session, discover the patterns and principles of AWS resilience best practices. Then, hear Capital One showcase its next-generation design and deployment patterns that push the boundaries of resilient architectures and support its most critical business processes. Learn about the AWS services it uses, the tradeoffs it must consider, and the decision matrix that guides developers to the right pattern for the right use case.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS
2. Knowledge of mission-critical applications and their requirements
3. Familiarity with AWS services and resilience best practices
4. Interest in learning about Capital One's resilient architecture patterns

title: Building resilient architectures with observability
description: As cloud-based applications become increasingly complex and dynamic, ensuring resilience and reliability is a critical concern for organizations. In this workshop, explore how to use AWS services, including AWS Resilience Hub, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS Fault Injection Service, to build resilient and reliable cloud-based applications. Learn how to implement observability strategies that enable proactive monitoring, rapid incident response, and continuous improvement. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their functionalities
3. Experience in building and deploying cloud-based applications
4. Knowledge of observability and monitoring strategies
5. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities during the workshop

title: Building resilient connectivity for hybrid environments [REPEAT]
description: Customers often operate mission-critical applications with resources split between AWS and on-premises facilities. The availability of these applications depends on the resilience of your hybrid connectivity. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect your hybrid connectivity for high availability and disaster recovery using services like AWS Direct Connect, AWS Site-to-Site VPN, and AWS Transit Gateway. Explore both single and multi-Region network architectures. Also discover how to enhance observability and availability, utilizing active monitoring with Amazon CloudWatch Network Monitor, to help you manage and recover gracefully.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of hybrid cloud architecture.
2. Familiarity with AWS services like Direct Connect, Site-to-Site VPN, and Transit Gateway.
3. Knowledge of network design and high availability concepts.
4. Experience with network monitoring and observability tools like Amazon CloudWatch Network Monitor.
5. Awareness of disaster recovery strategies and best practices.

title: Building resilient connectivity for hybrid environments [REPEAT]
description: Customers often operate mission-critical applications with resources split between AWS and on-premises facilities. The availability of these applications depends on the resilience of your hybrid connectivity. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect your hybrid connectivity for high availability and disaster recovery using services like AWS Direct Connect, AWS Site-to-Site VPN, and AWS Transit Gateway. Explore both single and multi-Region network architectures. Also discover how to enhance observability and availability, utilizing active monitoring with Amazon CloudWatch Network Monitor, to help you manage and recover gracefully.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of hybrid cloud architecture
2. Knowledge of AWS networking services (Direct Connect, Site-to-Site VPN, Transit Gateway)
3. Familiarity with high availability and disaster recovery concepts
4. Experience with network monitoring and observability tools (e.g., Amazon CloudWatch Network Monitor)
5. Familiarity with multi-Region network architectures

title: Building resilient live video streaming with AWS Media Services
description: The viewership of livestreaming events has been increasing annually, and some sports events are now only available online. Fans watching any of these events have high expectations for perfect coverage on any screen. In this chalk talk, see examples of how to use AWS Media Services along with Amazon CloudFront and other AWS services to build highly available live video streaming workflows. Learn about running workflows across different AWS Regions to provide streams with seamless failover between encoding and packaging legs. Discuss how trade-offs for cost, operational complexity, latency, and scale affect workflow design and resulting resilience and reliability levels.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of live video streaming technologies and workflows.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS Media Services, Amazon CloudFront, and other relevant AWS services.
3. Knowledge of content delivery network (CDN) concepts and their role in live video streaming.
4. Experience with designing and implementing highly available and resilient systems.
5. Understanding of trade-offs between cost, operational complexity, latency, and scale in the context of live video streaming workflows.

title: Building resilient systems in a globally connected world [REPEAT]
description: Modern IT workloads are more complex than ever—even the simplest application may have hundreds of external dependencies. Recent events have shown how failure of even a single component can cause dramatic planetary-scale disruption, with impacts in the millions or even billions of dollars. In this interconnected world, reliability is more important than ever. Whether you’re an IT vendor or a customer, learn the key best practices from AWS Well-Architected for building and operating integrated systems that prevent critical errors and can tolerate and quickly recover from a broad variety of faults.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud-based applications
2. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS Well-Architected Framework
3. Knowledge of system architecture and design principles
4. Experience in building and operating complex, distributed systems
5. Awareness of common failure modes and resilience strategies

title: Building resilient systems in a globally connected world [REPEAT]
description: Modern IT workloads are more complex than ever—even the simplest application may have hundreds of external dependencies. Recent events have shown how failure of even a single component can cause dramatic planetary-scale disruption, with impacts in the millions or even billions of dollars. In this interconnected world, reliability is more important than ever. Whether you’re an IT vendor or a customer, learn the key best practices from AWS Well-Architected for building and operating integrated systems that prevent critical errors and can tolerate and quickly recover from a broad variety of faults.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and architectures
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities
3. Knowledge of software development and deployment practices
4. Awareness of common system failures and their potential impacts
5. Desire to build and operate reliable, fault-tolerant systems

title: Building safe enterprise AI with Securiti AI & Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Securiti)
description: Generative AI is set to transform the global economy, with projections of up to $15.7 trillion in impact by 2030. However, organizations face significant challenges in harnessing diverse data, ensuring proper controls, and managing AI operations at scale. Join this lightning talk to discover cutting-edge strategies for building safe enterprise AI using Securiti AI and Amazon Bedrock. This presentation is brought to you by Securiti, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Generative AI and its potential impact on the global economy.
2. Familiarity with the challenges faced by organizations in harnessing diverse data, ensuring proper controls, and managing AI operations at scale.
3. Interest in learning about cutting-edge strategies for building safe enterprise AI using Securiti AI and Amazon Bedrock.

title: Building scalable drug discovery applications
description: Learn how to accelerate scientific discovery by building, orchestrating, and visualizing computer-aided drug discovery workflows using AWS HealthOmics, state-of-the-art biological foundation models, and Jupyter. In this workshop, build multiple drug discovery workflows using Amazon SageMaker, NVIDIA BioNeMo, and HealthOmics, and then scale them to process thousands of predictions simultaneously. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and data science concepts
2. Familiarity with Jupyter Notebooks and Python programming
3. Experience with AWS services or willingness to learn
4. Interest in drug discovery and computational biology

title: Building secure network designs for generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: Cloud network design strategies need to evolve to meet the changing needs of the business with generative AI. Strong adherence to network design architecture best practices and proactive controls are the foundation of generative AI application security. These techniques allow businesses to build generative AI applications that are more resilient. In this chalk talk, learn how to build layered network security controls to protect, detect, and respond to issues faster and to accelerate your generative AI applications securely on AWS. Discover key considerations, best practices, and reference architectures to achieve your defense-in-depth network design objectives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud network design principles
2. Knowledge of network security best practices
3. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
4. Experience with AWS cloud services and architecture
5. Understanding of defense-in-depth security strategies

title: Building secure network designs for generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: Cloud network design strategies need to evolve to meet the changing needs of the business with generative AI. Strong adherence to network design architecture best practices and proactive controls are the foundation of generative AI application security. These techniques allow businesses to build generative AI applications that are more resilient. In this chalk talk, learn how to build layered network security controls to protect, detect, and respond to issues faster and to accelerate your generative AI applications securely on AWS. Discover key considerations, best practices, and reference architectures to achieve your defense-in-depth network design objectives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud network design principles
2. Knowledge of network security best practices
3. Familiarity with generative AI concepts and applications
4. Experience with AWS cloud services and architecture
5. Understanding of defense-in-depth security strategies

title: Building secure serverless applications [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, learn techniques to secure a serverless application built with AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon Aurora. Discover AWS services and features that you can use to improve the security of a serverless application in five domains: identity and access management, infrastructure, data, code, and logging and monitoring. Finally, explore new features including integrations with Amazon Inspector and Amazon GuardDuty. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with serverless architecture
3. Experience with AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon Aurora
4. Familiarity with identity and access management concepts
5. Basic programming skills

title: Building secure serverless applications [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, learn techniques to secure a serverless application built with AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon Aurora. Discover AWS services and features that you can use to improve the security of a serverless application in five domains: identity and access management, infrastructure, data, code, and logging and monitoring. Finally, explore new features including integrations with Amazon Inspector and Amazon GuardDuty. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services, such as Lambda, API Gateway, and Aurora.
2. Basic understanding of serverless architecture and its security considerations.
3. Proficiency in a programming language, such as Python or Node.js.
4. Ability to access an AWS account with the necessary permissions to create and manage resources.
5. Laptop with a compatible operating system and the ability to connect to the internet.

title: Building serverless applications using Terraform
description: In this workshop, explore how to streamline serverless application development using Terraform. Discover best practices for leveraging Terraform to achieve agility, consistency, and scalability. Dive into automation tips and integration strategies that enable seamless serverless development workflows. Leave with best practices that you can apply immediately. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with serverless architecture
2. Basic understanding of Terraform
3. Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

title: Building serverless distributed data processing workloads
description: Enterprises today face an ever-increasing need to process large-scale data to meet their business goals and unlock new value. Distributed data processing offers a cost-efficient way to speed up processing, but it also presents challenges for developers in managing the parallelism within serverful environments. In this workshop, learn how serverless technologies like AWS Step Functions and AWS Lambda can help you simplify management and scaling, offload undifferentiated tasks, and address the challenges of distributed data processing. Also, discover use cases, best practices, and resources that can help you accelerate your data processing journey. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with data processing concepts and challenges.
3. Willingness to learn and experiment with serverless technologies.
4. Access to a laptop for hands-on participation.

title: Building state machines with AWS Step Functions Workflow Studio
description: AWS Step Functions enables builders to orchestrate multiple AWS services to model complex workflows and state machines. Join this lightning talk for a demonstration of Workflow Studio, a low-code, visual editor for Step Functions that allows you to prototype and build workflows faster. Learn about the rich palette of integrations available in Workflow Studio and how to utilize the tool to build your own workflows.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with serverless computing concepts
3. Familiarity with workflow management and state machines
4. Familiarity with low-code/no-code development tools

title: Building the future of cloud operations at any scale
description: As technology evolves rapidly, business and IT leaders continue to ask: How do we operate at lower cost, improve efficiency, and enhance security and compliance posture while exceeding customer expectations? At AWS, we want to help every customer benefit from transforming their IT operations. Join this talk to learn how you can transform your IT operations to be more agile, resilient, efficient, and secure; make operations more intelligent to eliminate repetitive tasks; and get deeper insight for better decision-making. See a demo of the latest innovations, and explore impactful customer stories.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of IT operations
2. Interest in improving efficiency and security in IT operations
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
4. Desire to stay up-to-date with the latest innovations in IT operations

title: Building the open and interoperable internet of agents (sponsored by Cisco)
description: The agentic AI revolution promises to transform work on an internet-like scale. As AI agents automate diverse tasks, we face a critical juncture in building the underlying infrastructure. In this lightning talk, discover the requirements for an open, interoperable internet of agents, including a universal communication layer and open standards. Learn the importance of collaborative development, and explore why an open ecosystem is crucial to avoid walled gardens and democratize AI's transformative power. This presentation is brought to you by Cisco, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of AI and automation
2. Knowledge of internet infrastructure and interoperability
3. Familiarity with open standards and collaborative development
4. Awareness of the potential impact of AI on the workforce
5. Interest in the role of technology companies in shaping the future of AI

title: Building together: How AWS and Anthropic create amazing products (sponsored by Anthropic)
description: Discover how leading enterprises use AWS solutions that are built on top of Anthropic's Claude and deployed on Amazon Bedrock. This session explores real-world case studies that focus on the seamless integration of Claude's advanced AI capabilities with the robust cloud infrastructure of AWS and highlights the tangible benefits and transformative outcomes across various industries. Learn how this powerful collaboration helps businesses enhance decision-making, streamline operations, and create cutting-edge products and services. This presentation is brought to you by Anthropic, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS solutions
2. Familiarity with Anthropic's Claude AI platform
3. Knowledge of cloud computing and deployment
4. Interest in real-world case studies and industry applications

title: Building your AI stack with MongoDB, Anyscale, Cohere & Fireworks AI (sponsored by MongoDB)
description: In this session, hear from a panel of founders and engineering leaders from four preeminent companies in AI: MongoDB, Anyscale, Cohere, and Fireworks AI. Gain insight on how the field of AI has changed their businesses, important factors to consider when building LLM applications, and lessons learned in the past year building AI tools and technologies. Learn about the AI use cases they’re most excited about, and the challenges of taking LLM applications from prototype to production. Also learn their perspectives on what’s coming next in AI, what’s here to stay, and what’s going to change. Bring your questions. This presentation is brought to you by MongoDB, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Interest in the field of AI and its impact on businesses
2. Curiosity about the challenges and lessons learned in building LLM applications
3. Desire to learn about the latest AI use cases and future trends
4. Understanding of the role of MongoDB and AWS in the AI ecosystem

title: Building Zero Trust architectures with AWS practical guidance [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk dives deep on building Zero Trust network architectures using AWS services. As modern applications and workplaces have expanded beyond traditional boundaries, identity-based authorization, flexible identity-aware networks, and the removal of unneeded data access have become essential. Learn how to secure user-to-application, application-to-application, and other access scenarios through a Zero Trust lens. Learn about the key networking services, security components, and architecture patterns to implement Zero Trust principles. Explore the security mechanisms and AWS services you can leverage to secure access to critical data and applications end-to-end, from the entry point to the microservices level.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with network security principles and identity management.
3. Basic knowledge of modern application architectures, such as microservices.

title: Building Zero Trust architectures with AWS practical guidance [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk dives deep on building Zero Trust network architectures using AWS services. As modern applications and workplaces have expanded beyond traditional boundaries, identity-based authorization, flexible identity-aware networks, and the removal of unneeded data access have become essential. Learn how to secure user-to-application, application-to-application, and other access scenarios through a Zero Trust lens. Learn about the key networking services, security components, and architecture patterns to implement Zero Trust principles. Explore the security mechanisms and AWS services you can leverage to secure access to critical data and applications end-to-end, from the entry point to the microservices level.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Knowledge of network security principles and access control mechanisms.
3. Familiarity with identity and access management (IAM) concepts.
4. Basic understanding of modern application architectures, such as microservices.
5. Experience with AWS networking services, such as VPC, Direct Connect, and VPN.

title: Build large-scale transactional data lakes with open table formats
description: Transform your data landscape by building large-scale transactional data lakes using open table formats (OTFs) with AWS analytics services. The rise of generative AI and ML demands robust and scalable data infrastructure, and OTFs offer a cutting-edge solution for modern data architectures. Learn best practices for operating tables at scale, focusing on high performance, cost optimization, and operational excellence. This session also covers streaming data challenges, showcasing how OTFs enable seamless schema evolution and strong reliability for streaming workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS Analytics Services
2. Understanding of data lake concepts and architecture
3. Knowledge of open table formats (OTFs)
4. Experience with data streaming and schema management
5. Familiarity with modern data architecture principles

title: Build LLMs for low-resource languages with SageMaker HyperPod clusters
description: In this dev chat, dive into the process of training a large language model for low-resource languages, such as Cantonese, using Amazon SageMaker HyperPod and AWS Trainium. Explore the unique challenges and considerations involved in training language models for low-resource languages, and how AWS can streamline and optimize the training process. This dev chat discusses the key components of training such an LLM, including data preparation, model architecture, hyperparameter tuning, and evaluation techniques. It includes a demo of the trained LLM and showcases its potential applications and deployment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of natural language processing and language model training
