2. Familiarity with Amazon SageMaker and AWS Trainium
3. Understanding of the challenges and considerations in training language models for low-resource languages

title: Build modern applications with AWS NoSQL databases
description: Do you need to deliver applications with consistent, high performance and nearly unlimited throughput and storage? Learn to build modern applications using AWS purpose-built NoSQL databases. This bootcamp is for developers, architects, and database engineers who want to build applications that involve complex data characteristics and millisecond performance requirements from their databases. Learn about using AWS purpose-built databases to build a typical modern application with diverse access patterns and real-time scaling needs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and services
2. Basic understanding of database systems and data modeling
3. Experience in application development using various programming languages

title: Build modern architectures with event storming & domain-driven design
description: Calling all developers! Join this immersive workshop and learn about event storming and domain-driven design. Through collaborative exercises, you use multicolored sticky notes to identify events, actors, commands, aggregates, business rules, and external systems for real-world use cases. Then, you use these insights to define bounded contexts and architect microservices. Explore design patterns and deployment approaches to bring your domain-driven solutions to life. Leave with practical skills to tackle complex business problems using these powerful techniques. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of software development principles
2. Familiarity with object-oriented programming concepts
3. Willingness to actively participate in collaborative exercises

title: Build multimodal ASL avatars with bidirectional translation
description: Learn how multimodal large language models (LLMs) and 3D pose estimation algorithms can generate realistic human-like American Sign Language (ASL) avatars that can convey the emotions and expressions of sign language, improving accuracy and creating more authentic communication experiences. This session provides an introduction to bidirectional translation capabilities, enabling users to seamlessly translate ASL videos into spoken and written English, as well as spoken and written English into ASL videos. These features open up possibilities for builders seeking to create inclusive applications that cater to diverse audiences. Dive into the future of inclusive communication and see the power of generative AI in action.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of large language models (LLMs)
2. Knowledge of 3D pose estimation algorithms
3. Familiarity with American Sign Language (ASL)
4. Exposure to bidirectional translation concepts
5. Interest in inclusive communication and generative AI

title: Build multi-tenant data processing architectures
description: Building data processing architectures for multi-tenancy while ensuring low latency, governed access, data integrity, and data observability substantially increases the challenges and complexities of the architecture. Whether you are working on a transactional data lake, implementing a vector database, building an event streaming solution, or managing observability at scale, AWS analytics services make it simpler to design and build multi-tenant data solutions for your business needs. Join this chalk talk to learn about building multi-tenant data architectures with AWS services such as Amazon EMR, Amazon MSK, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon OpenSearch Service.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of data processing architectures
2. Knowledge of multi-tenancy concepts and challenges
3. Familiarity with AWS analytics services (Amazon EMR, Amazon MSK, Amazon Redshift, Amazon OpenSearch Service)
4. Experience in designing and implementing data solutions at scale
5. Understanding of data governance, data integrity, and observability requirements

title: Build near real-time LLM-powered features for monolithic applications
description: Ever needed to build new event-driven features for an existing black box or COTS application without access to the source code? In this builders’ session, learn how to set up a data streaming pipeline with AWS DMS and AWS OpenSearch Serverless to build new event-driven features for existing applications using change data capture. Using this event stream and Amazon Bedrock, build a new feature to generate embeddings in near real time and store them in a Retrieval Augmented Generation knowledge base. Then, leveraging Amazon Bedrock and AWS Lambda, build an AI-powered chatbot that can respond with insights about live events in the legacy application. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services, such as AWS DMS, AWS OpenSearch Serverless, Amazon Bedrock, and AWS Lambda.
2. Understanding of data streaming and change data capture concepts.
3. Basic knowledge of natural language processing and chatbot development.
4. Ability to work with code and set up development environments.
5. Access to a laptop for the hands-on session.

title: Build open table data lakes for real-time insights with Apache Iceberg [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, learn how to build a reliable and scalable streaming ingestion pipeline into Apache Iceberg–based data lakes on AWS to build a highly available, real-time data platform that can adapt to evolving data requirements. Through a series of guided exercises, learn how to use AWS streaming services to ingest data into Iceberg tables on Amazon S3 and use Amazon EMR to process the data. Implement Iceberg’s key capabilities, including atomic writes, schema evolution, and error handling for metadata management, to gracefully handle schema changes and data errors. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of data engineering concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing.
3. Experience with Apache Spark or other big data processing frameworks.
4. Ability to use a command-line interface and basic programming skills.
5. Bring a laptop to participate in the hands-on exercises.

title: Build open table data lakes for real-time insights with Apache Iceberg [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, learn how to build a reliable and scalable streaming ingestion pipeline into Apache Iceberg–based data lakes on AWS to build a highly available, real-time data platform that can adapt to evolving data requirements. Through a series of guided exercises, learn how to use AWS streaming services to ingest data into Iceberg tables on Amazon S3 and use Amazon EMR to process the data. Implement Iceberg’s key capabilities, including atomic writes, schema evolution, and error handling for metadata management, to gracefully handle schema changes and data errors. You must bring your laptop to participate.

Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data engineering concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Experience with Apache Spark or Apache Hadoop
4. Knowledge of data lake architecture and Iceberg table format

title: Build & optimize models on AWS Trainium using Neuron Kernel Interface
description: Neuron empowers AI scientists and researchers to invent new model architectures, build the next generation of foundation models on AWS Trainium, and push the boundaries of generative AI research and open source innovation. In this code talk, learn how to use Neuron Kernel Interface to build innovative compute kernels that outperform existing techniques and build highly optimized kernels to maximize performance for the most critical or differentiated parts of your models. You must bring a laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
2. Experience in building and training neural networks
3. Knowledge of AWS Trainium and its capabilities
4. Understanding of compute kernel optimization techniques
5. Ability to write and execute code on a laptop

title: Build protection and cost-optimize using Amazon EBS snapshots
description: Data protection and reducing long-term data retention costs are top priorities for most organizations. Join this workshop to learn how to protect Amazon EBS volumes with EBS snapshots. Walk through examples of scripting data protection workflows to achieve faster backup at lower costs using EBS direct APIs. Explore the EBS Snapshots Archive tier, which can save you up to 75% in snapshot storage costs. Learn ways to protect and optimize your EBS resources, including encryption best practices, access and data security management, and strategies for optimal cost savings. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Amazon EBS
2. Familiarity with data protection and backup strategies
3. Ability to use a laptop and basic scripting/programming skills

title: Build ransomware data recovery and response with AWS Backup
description: Ransomware and malware continue to disrupt business applications. This expert-level workshop applies AWS Backup locking mechanisms, logically air-gapped vaults, and restore testing to help strengthen cyber recovery posture. Explore configuring air-gapped, immutable vaults and automating recovery point testing to meet objectives. See how you can combine these features to build a comprehensive, recovery-focused data protection strategy that can help withstand evolving cyber threats. Through hands-on exercises, gain practical experience designing, deploying, and maintaining a resilient backup and recovery solution using AWS Backup. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Basic understanding of data backup and recovery strategies.
3. Experience in configuring and managing AWS services.
4. Ability to access an AWS account and perform hands-on exercises.
5. Laptop to participate in the hands-on exercises.

title: Build real-time applications with AWS Amplify & AWS AppSync WebSockets
description: Learn how to create applications that use real-time data to improve user engagement. In this workshop, build a multiplayer trivia application with live score updates and group chat functionality. Use AWS Amplify to connect an application frontend to a serverless backend built with AWS AppSync WebSockets. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
2. Familiarity with React or other frontend frameworks
3. Familiarity with AWS services (optional)

title: Build resilience using learnings from incident communication patterns (sponsored by PagerDuty)
description: Incidents are inevitable but offer growth opportunities. How your organization responds to and learns from incidents can make all the difference in building more resilient operations. Having worked on countless incidents firsthand and later founding Jeli, Nora Jones, Senior Director of Product at PagerDuty, shares experiences for empowering teams to confidently navigate incidents, embrace failures as learning opportunities, bridge the executive-engineering gap, and shift from reactive to proactive approaches. Learn how to equip your team with the knowledge and skills to turn incidents into opportunities for growth and resilience through critical but often underlooked aspects: communication and coordination. This presentation is brought to you by PagerDuty, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this presentation could include:

1. Understanding the importance of incident management and resilience in operations.
2. Familiarity with the challenges of communication and coordination during incidents.
3. Interest in learning from industry experts on turning incidents into growth opportunities.
4. Desire to bridge the gap between executives and engineering teams.
5. Willingness to explore proactive approaches to incident management.

title: Build resilient architectures with Amazon EBS
description: Among the components of a resilient system, storage is fundamental for any enterprise application. In this chalk talk, learn best practices for configuring Amazon EBS for resilience and high availability, including how to use observability metrics to gain granular visibility into the performance of your EBS volumes to proactively monitor volume health and improve application resiliency. Walk through how to use the Pause I/O action in AWS Fault Injection Service to simulate an unresponsive state of an Amazon EBS volume. Discover how Amazon EBS can help you meet even the most demanding service levels for mission-critical applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of enterprise application architecture and the role of storage.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) and its features.
3. Knowledge of observability metrics and their importance in monitoring system performance.
4. Awareness of AWS Fault Injection Service and its capabilities.
5. Experience with mission-critical application deployment and service level requirements.

title: Build resilient, high-performance apps with Amazon Aurora innovations
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to maximize value and performance using Amazon Aurora's latest innovations to build modern, resilient applications. Dive deep into best practices spanning application design, data distribution, resiliency objectives, and more that will scale your application from startup to global enterprise.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of relational databases
2. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
3. Experience in application development and deployment

title: Build responsible generative AI apps with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
description: In this workshop, dive into building responsible generative AI applications using Amazon Bedrock Guardrails. Develop a generative AI application from scratch, test its behavior, and discuss the potential risks and challenges associated with uncontrolled language models. Use guardrails to filter undesirable topics, block harmful content, avoid prompt injection attacks, and handle sensitive information such as PII. Finally, learn how to detect and avoid hallucinations in model responses that are not grounded in your data. See how you can create and apply custom tailored guardrails directly with FMs and fine-tuned FMs on Amazon Bedrock to implement responsible AI policies within your generative AI applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and natural language processing.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Amazon Bedrock.
3. Experience in software development and programming.
4. Laptop for hands-on activities.

title: Build scalable and cost-optimized apps with Amazon Aurora Serverless
description: Amazon Aurora Serverless represents a paradigm shift in database management, offering a serverless architecture that seamlessly scales compute and memory resources based on application demand. In this session, dive deep into the Amazon Aurora Serverless v2 architecture, new innovations, and best practices for building scalable and cost-optimized applications with this on-demand, auto scaling configuration for Aurora.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session may include:

1. Understanding of relational databases and their architecture.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and services.
3. Knowledge of AWS services, particularly Amazon Aurora.
4. Experience with database management and optimization.
5. Interest in serverless computing and its benefits.

title: Build scalable RAG applications using Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases
description: Amazon Bedrock offers a managed Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) capability, connecting foundation models to your data. This session explores the latest techniques to improve response accuracy and optimize costs in Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases. Use the advanced chunking, parsing, and hallucination reducing capabilities in Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases for improved accuracy. Learn how to build scalable RAG solutions, delivering contextual responses while only paying for what you use.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Understanding of Foundation Models
2. Knowledge of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock
4. Experience with Knowledge Base management
5. Awareness of advanced techniques for improving response accuracy and cost optimization

title: Build scalable, secure, global connectivity with AWS
description: Discover how organizations are adopting AWS Cloud WAN to build secure, global networks while seamlessly integrating advanced services like AWS Network Firewall for cross-Region traffic inspection and Amazon VPC Lattice for Zero Trust service-to-service connectivity. Explore best practices for extending connectivity beyond AWS boundaries using AWS Verified Access, AWS Client VPN, and AWS Direct Connect, enabling secure access for remote users and external services. Gain in-depth insights and strategies for implementing these advanced networking solutions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud networking concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities
3. Knowledge of network security principles and best practices
4. Experience with network connectivity solutions

description: Application architectures built with proven methodologies help organizations create performant, cost-efficient, and secure applications. In this chalk talk, get insights into how to leverage Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate best practices that are rooted in the AWS Well-Architected Framework across the security, reliability, performance efficiency, and operational excellence pillars, and learn how to apply these methodologies directly to your Amazon ECS workloads.

2. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS Well-Architected Framework

description: Application architectures built with proven methodologies help organizations create performant, cost-efficient, and secure applications. In this chalk talk, get insights into how to leverage Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate best practices that are rooted in the AWS Well-Architected Framework across the security, reliability, performance efficiency, and operational excellence pillars, and learn how to apply these methodologies directly to your Amazon ECS workloads.

title: Build serverless chatbots using Amazon ElastiCache & Aurora PostgreSQL
description: In this session, learn how to build a serverless-first chatbot application by leveraging Amazon Aurora as a vector store and Amazon ElastiCache Serverless for chat history storage. Discover how to harness these services to create contextually aware chatbots. Explore architectural patterns, implementation strategies, and real-world use cases. Along the way, gain insights into optimizing performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness for your chatbot solutions. Whether you're a developer, architect, or decision-maker, this session equips you with the knowledge to build cutting-edge, serverless-powered chatbot applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with AWS services (e.g., Amazon Aurora, Amazon ElastiCache)

title: Build serverless streaming data pipelines for real-time analytics
description: Streaming data is typically unbounded, is generated at scale, and frequently has immediate, ordered processing with minimal latency needs. As such, it presents a unique set of design and architectural challenges for developers. This session explores the architecture and best practices for a serverless approach to building streaming data applications with Amazon Kinesis, Amazon MSK Serverless, and Amazon Redshift Streaming Ingestion. Through well-architected solution architectures and demonstrations, participants gain insights into optimizing data throughput, ensuring data integrity, processing data at scale, and managing operational costs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Basic understanding of data streaming concepts.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.
3. Experience with data processing and data engineering.
4. Interest in serverless architectures and cost optimization.

title: Build server-side rendered (SSR) apps with AWS Amplify and Next.js [REPEAT]
description: Next.js continues to gain momentum as the preferred server-side rendering (SSR) React framework for frontend and full-stack web developers. Join this workshop to learn how to develop and deploy a Next.js application with the new AWS Amplify Gen 2 developer experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.

Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with JavaScript and Node.js

title: Build server-side rendered (SSR) apps with AWS Amplify and Next.js [REPEAT]
description: Next.js continues to gain momentum as the preferred server-side rendering (SSR) React framework for frontend and full-stack web developers. title: Build tailored, industry-specific rendering workflows on AWS
description: Whether you’re in media and entertainment, architecture, engineering, or beyond, this chalk talk equips you to tailor rendering workflows on AWS to your unique industry needs. Dive into building rendering environments that integrate digital content creation software, proprietary tools, and industry-leading graphics applications using open standards like Open Job Description and Conda. Optimize costs with best practices for Amazon EC2 Spot Instances for rendering workloads, and learn to use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) to secure your intellectual property. Maintain consistent software configurations across scalable AWS compute resources, and streamline job execution through the AWS Deadline Cloud managed infrastructure.

2. Knowledge of open standards like Open Job Description and Conda.
3. Understanding of AWS services, including EC2 and IAM.
4. Familiarity with rendering workflows and optimization techniques.
5. Exposure to scalable compute infrastructure and job execution management.

title: Build trust in your CI/CD pipeline: Codify container security at scale
description: In this session, learn how to automate container security and compliance at scale. Start with base images, pulling those in from trusted sources, and learn how to automate the application of security into your build processes to ensure container compliance. Explore how Amazon Q Developer, Amazon Inspector, and EC2 Image Builder complement each other, helping to automate the creation of secured container images and their eventual storage in Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR). Leave knowing how to support your builders and allow them to develop quickly without compromising on security.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of container technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
2. Knowledge of AWS services (e.g., Amazon ECR, Amazon Inspector, EC2 Image Builder)
3. Familiarity with security best practices and compliance requirements
4. Experience with automation tools and scripting (e.g., bash, Python)
5. Understanding of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) processes

title: Build your competitive advantage at each stage of the gen AI journey
description: Generative AI poses unique challenges and considerations for customers at each stage of the customer adoption journey. This lightning talk walks you through the insights we’ve collected from market research and our own user interactions to provide recommendations and examples of partner offerings that can help support customers and how you can leverage these to build your unique value proposition.

Prerequisites:

3. Familiarity with market research and user interaction insights

5. Ability to develop a unique value proposition based on the insights and partner offerings

title: Build your data strategy for generative AI with Amazon Redshift [REPEAT]
description: Data warehouses are pivotal in developing generative AI applications. By using the native integration between Amazon Redshift and large language models, organizations can unlock use cases like sentiment analysis and content summarization. The Amazon Q generative SQL capability in Amazon Redshift query editor v2 empowers business users to automatically generate SQL queries. Organizations can use valuable domain data from data warehouses for Retrieval Augmented Generation, foundation model fine-tuning, continuous pretraining, and model building from the beginning. This chalk talk explores how data warehouses harness the potential of generative AI so organizations can extract valuable insights and drive innovation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of data warehousing concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift and its features
3. Understanding of large language models and their applications
4. Awareness of Retrieval Augmented Generation and its use cases
5. Basic understanding of foundation model fine-tuning and continuous pretraining

description: Data warehouses are pivotal in developing generative AI applications. By using the native integration between Amazon Redshift and large language models, organizations can unlock use cases like sentiment analysis and content summarization. The Amazon Q generative SQL capability in Amazon Redshift query editor v2 empowers business users to automatically generate SQL queries. Organizations can use valuable domain data from data warehouses for Retrieval Augmented Generation, foundation model fine-tuning, continuous pretraining, and model building from the beginning. title: Bursting to Amazon EC2 for AI workloads with MinIO (sponsored by MinIO)
description: For organizations with large footprints on-premises or in the private cloud, there are significant benefits to bursting compute intensive workloads to Amazon EC2 for training AI models or performing advance analytics at scale. The architecture involves high-performance Amazon S3 compatible object storage alongside an application layer that is cloud-native. The benefits can be significant: economically, due to reduced need for constant high-capacity infrastructure; operationally, by accelerating development cycles; and from a security and control perspective. This approach increases the velocity of development by eliminating the need to create an entire machine learning compute layer internally and instead using Amazon EC2 and Amazon EKS. This presentation is brought to you by MinIO, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the presented architecture would be:

1. Existing on-premises or private cloud infrastructure
2. Requirement for compute-intensive workloads, such as training AI models or performing advanced analytics
3. Need for high-performance object storage compatible with Amazon S3
4. Desire to leverage cloud-native application architecture
5. Preference for accelerating development cycles and reducing the need for internal machine learning compute infrastructure

title: Byte to insight: Maximize value from your logs with Amazon CloudWatch
description: Businesses often struggle with too many logs and not enough actionable insights. In this session, explore the full log data lifecycle, from ingestion to insights, and uncover concrete strategies to extract maximum value using the latest Amazon CloudWatch Logs capabilities. Learn practical techniques to optimize log data for cost-effectiveness and business impact. This isn't the CloudWatch of yesteryear—it's a transformed, customer-centric observability platform that can revolutionize how you manage and use log data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with log data management and analysis.
3. Awareness of the challenges in extracting actionable insights from log data.

title: Capitalize efficiency and edge (sponsored by Okta)
description: Combine Amazon Q with Okta to empower your business to seamlessly and securely use generative AI. Full identity lifecycle management scales access to save time and costs so employees get what they need—when they need it—to do their best work. This presentation is brought to you by Okta, an AWS Partner.

4. Understanding of identity and access management

title: Capitalizing on the opportunity for migrations and modernization
description: This session navigates the strategies to build repeatable business engines. Explore how partners can strengthen their approach using cutting-edge generative AI technology to transform Microsoft and VMware workloads. See an approach for conducting effective cloud assessments and learn how to identify candidate workloads for modernization. Review migration and modernization pathways to AWS, and discover how to use Amazon Q to accelerate the refactoring of Java and .NET applications using generative AI. Discover how partners can get the most out of the Migration Acceleration Program (MAP) so they can deliver an exceptional experience for customers.

title: Cash me if you can [REPEAT]
description: Become a modern-day Sherlock Holmes in an immersive XR experience that challenges you to uncover money laundering schemes. Navigate a dynamic 3D globe to visualize suspicious financial flows, analyze transactions, and interact with a generative AI assistant for real-time insights. Trace the origins of illicit funds using Meta Quest 3, Amazon CloudFront, API Gateway, AWS Lambda, DynamoDB and Amazon RDS. Can you identify the hidden connections and solve the mystery?

description: Unlocking the full potential of generative AI depends on data quality, effective data sharing, and data governance. Learn how to use Amazon DataZone, a comprehensive solution that empowers organizations to catalog, govern, and securely share data assets for generative AI initiatives. Discover how to streamline data discovery, ensure compliance with data policies, and foster secure collaboration across teams, mitigating risks associated with generative AI models while enabling responsible innovation. title: Celebrating 10 years of pioneering serverless and containers
description: Ten years ago, AWS Lambda pioneered serverless computing. Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate further catalyzed the serverless revolution. With serverless, builders are able to focus on delivering customer value instead of spending time managing servers. Serverless continues to be an innovative approach to building applications. Join this session to explore how serverless has evolved to help organizations drive the highest performance, availability, and security at low costs. Learn from leaders charged with defining the next generation of serverless how serverless powers applications across Amazon and AWS.

title: Centralize audit data for hybrid and multicloud environments
description: As customers accelerate their migrations to the cloud and transform their businesses, some find themselves in situations where they have to manage IT operations in hybrid environments. Does this sound like you? This chalk talk walks you through how to enable AWS CloudTrail Lake, import historical CloudTrail logs, and aggregate your audit logs from partner integrations, custom solutions, and many AWS resources. It also discusses how to query this data for investigative analysis and security purposes.

1. Understanding of cloud migration and hybrid IT environments.
2. Familiarity with AWS CloudTrail and its capabilities.
3. Knowledge of importing and managing historical CloudTrail logs.
4. Experience with aggregating audit logs from various sources, including partner integrations and custom solutions.
5. Understanding of querying and analyzing audit data for investigative and security purposes.

title: Centralized network traffic inspection: Key insights & lessons learned
description: Centralized network traffic inspection using AWS Transit Gateway or AWS Cloud WAN and AWS Network Firewall or Gateway Load Balancer is a common architecture adopted by many customers. This architecture has many benefits both in terms of operations and cost efficiencies. In this chalk talk, explore the advantages of centralized inspection and learn valuable lessons from AWS experiences working with customers to plan and execute this architecture successfully.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Transit Gateway or AWS Cloud WAN
2. Knowledge of AWS Network Firewall or Gateway Load Balancer
3. Familiarity with network traffic inspection and centralized architectures
4. Experience with AWS services and their integration
5. Understanding of cost optimization and operational efficiency in cloud environments

title: Centralize multicloud management using AWS
description: Operating in a multicloud environment may introduce operational complexity. In this session, learn to streamline operations with AWS Systems Manager, which is designed to allow easier instance management across all environments. Also, gain insights into performance with Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon Managed Grafana, which deliver a unified dashboard of metrics and logs from virtually any data source. With these services, you can simplify day-to-day tasks, maintain control, and optimize resources—whether your workloads span across AWS, on premises, or multiple clouds. Centralize multicloud management so you can focus on what really matters—running your business.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Experience in managing cloud infrastructure
4. Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools
5. Familiarity with multicloud environments

title: Centric Brands: A journey using AWS analytics and Amazon services
description: Learn how a leading retailer, Centric Brands, created a direct-to-consumer business using AWS analytics services and Amazon’s composable ecommerce services such as Buy with Prime, Amazon Multi-Channel Fulfillment, and Reviews from Amazon. Hear how they used AWS to build core capabilities such as automated order management and financial reconciliation to eliminate manual effort and how this same model can be reused to enhance your ecommerce offerings.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of ecommerce and online retail
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Knowledge of order management and financial reconciliation processes

title: CEO Keynote with Matt Garman
description: Join AWS CEO Matt Garman to hear how AWS is innovating across every aspect of the world’s leading cloud. He explores how we are reinventing foundational building blocks as well as developing brand new experiences, all to empower customers and partners with what they need to build a better future.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its benefits
2. Interest in AWS and its services
3. Familiarity with the role of a cloud service provider

title: Chaos engineering: A proactive approach to system resilience
description: Do you know if your system will behave as intended when exposed to underlying failures? In this session, explore how chaos engineering enables organizations to proactively identify system resilience weaknesses, improve operational excellence, and enhance incident response capabilities. Through real-world scenarios executed with the AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS), this session demonstrates the benefits of chaos engineering in action. Gain insights from BMW Group’s transformative journey, learning key lessons on scaling chaos engineering across the organization, and how BMW Group conducts large-scale chaos experiments in production, uncovering issues and fostering a culture of greater resilience and continuous improvement.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of system architecture and design
2. Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and services
3. Familiarity with incident response and operational excellence
4. Exposure to chaos engineering principles and practices
5. Interest in improving system resilience and reliability

title: Chaos engineering workshop
description: This workshop introduces AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS) for running controlled resilience experiments to improve application performance, observability, and resilience. Use FIS to inject faults in a controlled and ad-hoc manner to better understand application behavior and improve resilience. Run experiments against a variety of services, including Amazon EKS, Amazon ECS, AWS Fargate, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon RDS, and more. Also run the AZ Availability: Power Interruption experiment with applied zonal shift. All experiments are accompanied by CloudWatch, X-Ray, and RUM to provide the right insights during the experiments and maximum learnings! You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts
2. Experience with cloud-based application development and deployment
3. Familiarity with observability tools like CloudWatch, X-Ray, and RUM

title: ChatSync API on non-streaming conversations with Amazon Q Business
description: Join this code talk to learn how to use the identity-aware Amazon Q Business ChatSync API. Learn how to configure an identity provider as a trusted token issuer and how your application can obtain an STS token to assume a role that calls the ChatSync API. See a demo of a server-side Python script that calls the ChatSync API when triggered by frontend application events such as page loads. Finally, learn how a frontend application can upload a PDF to a server-side Python script that uses the ChatSync API to generate a document summary.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of identity management and authentication concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon STS (Security Token Service)
3. Experience with server-side Python programming
4. Knowledge of frontend web development (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
5. Familiarity with Amazon Q Business ChatSync API

title: Choose the optimal compute environment for your AI/ML workloads
description: Ready to run your generative AI workloads on AWS? If you’re trying to decide between accelerators such as AWS Inferentia and AWS Trainium, GPUs from NVIDIA and AMD, processors such as AWS Graviton, or managed services such as Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, this chalk talk has got you covered. Come explore the different options you have available on AWS, unpack their advantages and trade-offs, and get help choosing the option that is best for your workload and budget.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning and generative AI concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and infrastructure
3. Knowledge of different hardware accelerators and their capabilities
4. Experience with cost optimization and budgeting for cloud-based workloads
5. Familiarity with managed AI/ML services on AWS

title: Choose the right AI service for your .NET use case
description: With AWS AI services, you can enrich your .NET applications with capabilities like natural language processing, translation, and image analysis. And with generative AI, you can add powerful capabilities like text summarization, content generation, and visual reasoning. In this demo-heavy coding session, explore when and how to use AWS AI services and generative AI services with AWS SDK for .NET. Learn how to build a sample intelligent document processing application with both AI and generative AI capabilities using a generative AI–powered assistant to help write the code.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with .NET development
2. Understanding of AWS services and cloud computing
3. Basic knowledge of natural language processing and image analysis
4. Familiarity with generative AI concepts
5. Hands-on experience with AWS SDK for .NET

title: Choosing the right AWS storage service
description: AWS offers a range of storage services designed for different use cases, including migrating applications, backing up data, integrating cloud storage with on-premises applications, building data lakes, and developing cloud-native applications. With multiple options available, it's crucial to carefully evaluate your needs to avoid service mismatches and unnecessary complexity. Our aim is to provide guidance in selecting the right AWS storage service to align with workloads and application requirements, providing the flexibility to scale as needed. This chalk talk gives participants a clear understanding of which AWS storage service to use for various scenarios and situations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Basic knowledge of data storage and management
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their use cases

title: Choosing the right serverless compute services [REPEAT]
description: Learn when to use AWS serverless compute services and how to integrate them into your application architectures. Both AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate scale up to meet demand when needed and can scale to zero, even with containers. Find out when Lambda is the best fit for event-driven workloads and when Fargate is the better choice for containerized serverless applications. Discover how services such as AWS Step Functions and Amazon EventBridge allow you to use Lambda and Fargate together in well-architected solutions. Find out when to use the right tool to build efficient, scalable, and cost-effective workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of cloud computing fundamentals.
2. Basic knowledge of AWS services and architectures.
3. Familiarity with serverless computing and container technologies.
4. Experience with application development and deployment.
5. Familiarity with event-driven and microservices-based architectures.

title: Choosing the right serverless compute services [REPEAT]
description: Learn when to use AWS serverless compute services and how to integrate them into your application architectures. Both AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate scale up to meet demand when needed and can scale to zero, even with containers. Find out when Lambda is the best fit for event-driven workloads and when Fargate is the better choice for containerized serverless applications. Discover how services such as AWS Step Functions and Amazon EventBridge allow you to use Lambda and Fargate together in well-architected solutions. Find out when to use the right tool to build efficient, scalable, and cost-effective workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given course:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their use cases.
3. Hands-on experience with AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate.
4. Knowledge of event-driven architectures and containerization.
5. Familiarity with AWS Step Functions and Amazon EventBridge.

title: Closing the machine-to-cloud gap to jump-start digital transformation
description: Today, the data pipeline between industrial machines (OT) and the cloud (IT) requires many systems to be integrated together to create a unified data foundation, leading to longer lead times to deploy digital transformation projects. In this session, hear how Rehrig Pacific Company jump-started data ingestion from industrial systems and machines using a securely managed industrial edge to cloud. Hear how manufacturers like Rehrig are quickly deriving business value from operational data that is organized and contextualized for use in factory and cloud applications, unlocking use cases such as asset monitoring, predictive maintenance, quality inspection, and energy management.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of industrial machine (OT) and cloud (IT) systems integration.
2. Understanding of data pipeline architecture and deployment challenges.
3. Familiarity with industrial edge computing and secure data ingestion.
4. Experience in deriving business value from operational data and unlocking use cases.
5. Awareness of manufacturing industry trends and digital transformation initiatives.

title: Cloud ERP-native AI: SAP’s business AI strategy (sponsored by SAP)
description: AI is today’s hot topic. Demystifying the hype and noise around AI into tangible steps you can take with your business software is no easy task. In this session, learn how SAP reengineered their own cloud ERP systems over the past decade to allow you to embed SAP Business AI across your cloud ERP portfolio, from pre-built, pre-trained embedded AI functionality to fully customized generative AI business agents. Discover how you can take your most complex business software and processes and derive real value through business AI. This presentation is brought to you by SAP, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud ERP systems
2. Familiarity with SAP Business AI
3. Interest in leveraging AI in business software and processes
4. Knowledge of SAP's partnership with AWS

title: Cloud game development toolkit [REPEAT]
description: The cloud game development toolkit is an open source repository that simplifies the deployment of build pipelines on AWS. It comes complete with best-practice Terraform modules for a variety of common industry tools like Jenkins and Perforce and can be extended or integrated into an existing environment easily. In this chalk talk, learn about the flexible design of the cloud game development toolkit that allows builders to pick and choose which tools they may need without using those that they already have solutions for.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services and infrastructure
2. Familiarity with Terraform and infrastructure as code
3. Understanding of common game development tools like Jenkins and Perforce
4. Experience in cloud-based game development

title: Cloud game development toolkit [REPEAT]
description: The cloud game development toolkit is an open source repository that simplifies the deployment of build pipelines on AWS. It comes complete with best-practice Terraform modules for a variety of common industry tools like Jenkins and Perforce and can be extended or integrated into an existing environment easily. In this chalk talk, learn about the flexible design of the cloud game development toolkit that allows builders to pick and choose which tools they may need without using those that they already have solutions for.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services and infrastructure
2. Familiarity with Terraform and infrastructure as code
3. Understanding of common game development tools (e.g., Jenkins, Perforce)
4. Experience with build pipelines and deployment processes

title: Cloud innovation for a cause: One organization’s all-in AWS journey
description: Nonprofits face a big challenge: increasing giving to drive more global impact. Bonterra, one of the world’s largest social good software companies, is going all in on AWS to help nonprofits get more for their missions. Join us as Bonterra shares their cloud journey—rapidly migrating from data centers to AWS, rearchitecting applications with cloud-native services, and sunsetting legacy tech debt. Hear how this decision—and adopting services like Amazon SES and Amazon Q—drive more impact across fundraising, grant management, and strategic philanthropy. The end result: a major step toward Bonterra’s mission to create $573 billion in new annual global impact by 2033.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of nonprofit organizations and their challenges
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud-native services
3. Familiarity with software development and application architecture
4. Interest in leveraging technology to drive social impact
5. Desire to learn about Bonterra's cloud journey and its impact on nonprofits

title: Cloud journey and technical debt tabletop
description: Join our new “technical debt & risk” tabletop about leaders tackling the challenges of a fictional organization. In this engaging experience, participants make high-stakes decisions, manage technical debt, and optimize risk strategies. Work together to improve system resilience and balance technical investments with risk management. This interactive simulation hones your skills and provides practical insights for managing technical debt and risk in your own organization. Experience strategic problem-solving and gain actionable tactics to drive success. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with technical debt and risk management concepts
2. Interest in strategic problem-solving and decision-making
3. Ability to work collaboratively in a team setting
4. Basic proficiency in using a laptop

title: Cloud journey tabletop experience [REPEAT]
description: Dive into an interactive cloud journey tabletop experience where visionary leaders converge to shape the fate of a fictional organization. Harnessing the power of collaborative decision-making, attendees embark on a transformative journey, unlocking invaluable insights typically accrued over years of real-world experience. In this immersive and competitive environment, teams vie to elevate automation, cultivate operational agility, fortify risk-aligned security frameworks, and amplify strategic influence. Join us to accelerate your understanding of cloud security dynamics, and emerge equipped with actionable strategies to propel your organization toward resilient and forward-thinking security practices.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Interest in cloud security and risk management
3. Desire to engage in collaborative decision-making
4. Willingness to explore fictional scenarios and apply real-world insights
5. Openness to learning from an immersive and competitive experience

title: Cloud journey tabletop experience [REPEAT]
description: Dive into an interactive cloud journey tabletop experience where visionary leaders converge to shape the fate of a fictional organization. Harnessing the power of collaborative decision-making, attendees embark on a transformative journey, unlocking invaluable insights typically accrued over years of real-world experience. In this immersive and competitive environment, teams vie to elevate automation, cultivate operational agility, fortify risk-aligned security frameworks, and amplify strategic influence. Join us to accelerate your understanding of cloud security dynamics, and emerge equipped with actionable strategies to propel your organization toward resilient and forward-thinking security practices.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and technologies
2. Familiarity with cloud security best practices
3. Experience in strategic decision-making and problem-solving
4. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
5. Interest in exploring innovative approaches to cloud security challenges

title: Cloud-native Java on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to build cloud-native Java applications based on best practices, and discover ways you can optimize for performance. In this builders’ session, gain hands-on experience building cloud-native Java applications with Amazon Corretto and Spring Boot. In addition, explore how to use Amazon Q Developer to simplify the creation of new Java functionality and increase development speed, and learn how to deploy Java applications on Amazon EKS. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Basic understanding of Java programming language.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts.
3. Experience with Docker and containerization.
4. Knowledge of Kubernetes or willingness to learn.
5. Laptop with a development environment set up.

title: Cloud-native Java on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to build cloud-native Java applications based on best practices, and discover ways you can optimize for performance. In this builders’ session, gain hands-on experience building cloud-native Java applications with Amazon Corretto and Spring Boot. In addition, explore how to use Amazon Q Developer to simplify the creation of new Java functionality and increase development speed, and learn how to deploy Java applications on Amazon EKS. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Java programming language.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and services.
3. Experience with containerization and container orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
4. Familiarity with Spring Boot framework.
5. Willingness to actively participate in hands-on exercises.

title: Cloud-native Java on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to build cloud-native Java applications based on best practices, and discover ways you can optimize for performance. In this builders’ session, gain hands-on experience building cloud-native Java applications with Amazon Corretto and Spring Boot. In addition, explore how to use Amazon Q Developer to simplify the creation of new Java functionality and increase development speed, and learn how to deploy Java applications on Amazon EKS. You must bring your laptop to participate.

1. Basic understanding of Java programming language
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Exposure to containerization and Kubernetes
4. Familiarity with Spring Boot framework

title: Cloud optimization at scale: Building efficient AWS architectures
description: As you grow your cloud adoption, you need to implement a robust governance strategy that seamlessly integrates technology, people, and processes. By designing sustainable, automated, and efficient architectures from the start, and by embracing a culture of continuous improvement, not only can you optimize your cloud usage but also drive innovation. This chalk talk offers actionable insights and practical tips on how to streamline your multi-account management, boost efficiency, and maintain control, while balancing cost, performance, and resiliency in your architectures. Explore how to transform your cloud operations using AWS Well-Architected best practices.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services
2. Experience in cloud architecture and design
3. Knowledge of AWS Well-Architected Framework
4. Familiarity with cloud governance and management strategies
5. Ability to implement automation and continuous improvement practices

title: CloudRiddle quest: AWS-themed scavenger hunt [REPEAT]
description: Dive into a thrilling, AWS-themed scavenger hunt across the Builders' Fair! AI-generated riddles and clues guide you through the hunt. This innovative treasure hunt uses advanced gen AI agents to dynamically create AWS-themed puzzles and clues, ensuring a unique experience for every participant. Leveraging Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Rekognition, and Amazon Lex this project showcases how AI can create engaging, educational content on the fly while teaching participants about AWS services in a fun, challenging way.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services
2. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
3. Experience with natural language processing and generation
4. Proficiency in using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Rekognition, and Amazon Lex

title: CloudRiddle quest: AWS-themed scavenger hunt [REPEAT]
description: Dive into a thrilling, AWS-themed scavenger hunt across the Builders' Fair! AI-generated riddles and clues guide you through the hunt. This innovative treasure hunt uses advanced gen AI agents to dynamically create AWS-themed puzzles and clues, ensuring a unique experience for every participant. Leveraging Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Rekognition, and Amazon Lex this project showcases how AI can create engaging, educational content on the fly while teaching participants about AWS services in a fun, challenging way.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Experience with AI and machine learning
3. Proficiency in natural language processing
4. Ability to leverage Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Rekognition, and Amazon Lex
5. Creativity and problem-solving skills

title: Cloud security in the age of generative AI (sponsored by Sysdig)
description: AI has sparked imagination and innovation but at the same time represents a new frontier of risk from threat actors. Organizations must find ways to both protect their AI implementations and use the power of AI to augment defense. In this lightning talk, Sysdig discusses how generative AI is changing the cloud security landscape. Explore how to enhance the security of your AI deployments that use solutions like Amazon Q and Amazon Bedrock, keep up with emerging AI governance and compliance regulations, and employ AI to boost the effectiveness of security teams in the face of evolving threats. This presentation is brought to you by Sysdig, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and security
2. Familiarity with AI and its applications
3. Knowledge of AWS services like Amazon Q and Amazon Bedrock
4. Awareness of emerging AI governance and compliance regulations
5. Interest in enhancing security through AI-powered solutions

title: Cloud security novice to expert in 10 steps: Actionable CNAPP approach (sponsored by Tenable)
description: What’s step one for protecting cloud-native applications: CSPM, CWPP, CIEM, DSPM, or CNAPP? Go beyond acronyms and learn how to improve your security quickly and simply by understanding security findings in context—workloads, infrastructure, identities, network, and sensitive data—and then prioritize risks that matter most. Join this session to learn how a unified platform empowers multiple stakeholders to unify identity-driven visibility, risk prioritization, and remediation across complex cloud and hybrid environments. This presentation is brought to you by Tenable, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud-native applications and their security challenges
2. Basic knowledge of cloud security concepts and terminology (CSPM, CWPP, CIEM, DSPM, CNAPP)
3. Interest in improving cloud security through a unified platform approach
4. Familiarity with cloud and hybrid environments

title: Cloud transformation in finance: Modernizing SAP and data with AWS
description: Discover how one of the world’s largest financial firms leveraged AWS to modernize their SAP Business Warehouse landscape, migrating to RISE with SAP on AWS and benefiting from the performance, reliability, and security of the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud. Learn more about this global financial leader’s strategy to unlock new insights from their data by utilizing the latest AI/ML capabilities from AWS in conjunction with SAP and non-SAP data. Get insights to accelerate your own enterprise transformation with SAP and AWS in this informative session.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with SAP Business Warehouse
2. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS
3. Knowledge of enterprise data management and analytics

title: Cloud transformation: Merck’s proven modernization factory model (sponsored by HCLTech)
description: As organizations devise their cloud transformation programs and overcome challenges, the right setup of the execution model is critical to establish success and scale. Merck’s modernization factory model has been delivering value at an accelerated pace, making the program consistently achieve milestones for each tranche of the journey. In this lightning talk, hear Merck’s proven methodology and framework for a mod factory setup for an enterprise-wide cloud transformation. Through the journey, adoption practices and maturity parameters were brought in to get modern and stay modern. This presentation is brought to you by HCLTech, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of cloud transformation programs and their challenges.
2. Knowledge of execution models and their importance in establishing success and scalability.
3. Familiarity with Merck's modernization factory model and its approach to cloud transformation.
4. Awareness of adoption practices and maturity parameters for staying modern.
5. Familiarity with HCLTech as an AWS Partner.

title: Coding for account customizations with AWS Control Tower
description: Explore how to apply baseline configurations and account customizations across your multi-account AWS environment at scale through this live coding and interactive discussion. In this code talk, dive deep into some real-world examples and explore how you can customize across 100s or even 1,000s of accounts securely. In addition, learn how Amazon Q enables infrastructure as code to help implement customization quickly.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this live coding and interactive discussion would likely include:

1. Familiarity with AWS multi-account environments
2. Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools and techniques
3. Understanding of AWS security best practices
4. Knowledge of AWS services like AWS Config, AWS Organizations, and AWS CloudFormation
5. Familiarity with scripting or programming languages used for IaC, such as Terraform or AWS CDK.

title: Coding for proactive controls with AWS CloudFormation
description: As organizations increasingly embrace cloud-native architectures and deploy applications at scale, robust security controls become paramount. In this code talk, experts discuss security best practices using AWS CloudFormation Hooks and AWS CloudFormation Guard. You learn how to write Guard DSL rules, which can be used for static template validation and integration with CloudFormation Hooks and as AWS Config custom rules.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud-native architectures
2. Familiarity with AWS CloudFormation
3. Knowledge of AWS security best practices
4. Familiarity with AWS Config
5. Familiarity with programming concepts and syntax

title: Coding for serverless observability
description: Serverless architectures, with their ephemeral and distributed nature, pose unique challenges to effective monitoring and observability. Join this code talk to learn best practices for collecting signals from your serverless applications. Dive deep into techniques to effectively instrument your applications to provide you with optimal observability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with serverless computing concepts
2. Understanding of application monitoring and observability
3. Basic knowledge of instrumentation techniques
4. Exposure to cloud-based serverless platforms (e.g., AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, Google Cloud Functions)
5. Familiarity with logging, metrics, and tracing in a distributed system environment

title: Coffee networking social
description: Come interact with our AI barista and network over topics we're excited to talk about. Whether you want to dive deep or learn and be curious, this is the place for you.
prerequisites:
1. Interest in conversing with an AI system
2. Curiosity about the topics the organizers are excited to discuss
3. Willingness to engage in both in-depth discussions and casual learning
4. Openness to networking and connecting with others
5. Availability to attend the event

title: Collaboratively build insightful apps without sharing raw data
description: Building modern applications increasingly requires that you complement your data with external raw data from your peers to provide more value to your end users. Access to this raw data isn’t always available due mainly to security reasons. This session demonstrates how AWS Clean Rooms helps you and your peers collaborate on your collective datasets without sharing or copying underlying data. Learn how to build an application that lets your technical community find events that align to topics they want to hear about and, as a result, make new like-minded friends.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of data privacy and security concerns
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of data collaboration and sharing challenges
4. Interest in building applications that facilitate community engagement
5. Basic understanding of application development

title: Common patterns for storing data for Amazon ECS workloads
description: This chalk talk dives into the common patterns used for storing data for workloads running on Amazon ECS. This includes securing data within the task, sharing data between tasks, and providing persistence to running workloads. Explore how storage services like Amazon EFS and Amazon EBS can be used alongside containerized workloads running on Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service)
2. Familiarity with containerization and Docker
3. Knowledge of AWS storage services (Amazon EFS and Amazon EBS)
4. Familiarity with AWS Fargate

title: Completing a large-scale migration and modernization
description: This session focuses on valuable lessons from the thousands of enterprises who have migrated and modernized their on-premises workloads with AWS. Dive into the technical lessons that have been learned and the mental models that have been used. Learn how to set up teams to modernize as they migrate and how to engage with AWS Professional Services and AWS Partners for success. Finally, get an update on what’s new in AWS migration and modernization tooling.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Experience with on-premises workload migration or modernization

title: Compute innovation for any application, anywhere
description: AWS offers the most comprehensive set of capabilities, continually innovating across our infrastructure and services so you can build, run, and scale applications in the cloud, on premises, and at the edge. Join Dave Brown, VP AWS Compute and Networking, to learn how AWS innovations are transforming the computing landscape. Dave highlights the latest instance, containers, and serverless technology innovations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AWS services and offerings
3. Interest in the latest advancements in cloud computing technology

title: Compute innovation with the AWS Nitro System
description: This chalk talk provides an overview of the AWS Nitro System and new compute innovations fueled by the Nitro System, including multi-host for smaller metal sizes, reduced area of impact, and higher performance, as well as how the Nitro System has helped with Flex instances. Dive deep into eighth-generation AWS Graviton-based instances and seventh-generation Intel/AMD instances.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS cloud computing services
2. Knowledge of virtualization and hardware-assisted virtualization
3. Familiarity with AWS Graviton processors and Intel/AMD instances
4. Basic understanding of cloud infrastructure and performance optimization

title: Configuration, compliance, and audit
description: This bootcamp is intended for AWS Partners. This hands-on bootcamp equips you with the ability to enable effective cloud compliance management. Learn how to centralize AWS Config data, create AWS CloudTrail Lake queries, deploy conformance packs, configure automatic remediation, and track infrastructure and application changes. Also explore how to enable AWS Config, create CloudTrail Lake event stores, and use advanced event selectors. Discover how to use AWS compliance capabilities so you can implement a robust cloud compliance strategy and accelerate customer opportunities within your organization. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. AWS Partner status
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts
3. Proficiency in cloud compliance management
4. Understanding of AWS Config and CloudTrail
5. Ability to work with cloud infrastructure and applications

title: Configuring Amazon S3 security settings and access controls
description: Amazon S3 provides security settings and granular access controls to suit virtually any workload. In this workshop, learn how you can manage access and define user and resource-based policies at scale to fit your needs with Amazon S3 access management tools. In addition, learn how you can monitor and audit who is accessing what data, including from where and when. Explore scenarios involving different security requirements, and walk through how you can apply different Amazon S3 tools and capabilities to meet those requirements. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud storage and data management
2. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
3. Ability to access and navigate the AWS Management Console

title: Connecting the dots: Get hands-on experience with distributed tracing [REPEAT]
description: Distributed tracing is a crucial observability technique for understanding complex, microservices-based applications on AWS. In this builders’ session, learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch to instrument your applications and collect tracing data, allowing you to identify performance bottlenecks, debug issues, and optimize your systems. Leave this session with the knowledge and skills to unlock the full potential of distributed tracing and enhance the observability of your AWS-based applications, driving better decision-making for your business. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of microservices architecture
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Experience with application development and deployment

description: Distributed tracing is a crucial observability technique for understanding complex, microservices-based applications on AWS. In this builders’ session, learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch to instrument your applications and collect tracing data, allowing you to identify performance bottlenecks, debug issues, and optimize your systems. Leave this session with the knowledge and skills to unlock the full potential of distributed tracing and enhance the observability of your AWS-based applications, driving better decision-making for your business. title: Conquer AI performance, cost, and scale with AWS AI chips
description: Generative AI promises to revolutionize industries, but its immense computational demands and escalating costs pose significant challenges. To overcome these hurdles, AWS designed and purpose-built AI chips including AWS Trainium2 and AWS Inferentia2. In this session, get a close look at the innovation across silicon, server, and datacenter and hear from AWS customers about how they built, deployed, and scaled foundation models across various products and services using AWS AI chips.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Generative AI
2. Understanding of computational demands and costs associated with Generative AI
3. Familiarity with AWS Trainium2 and AWS Inferentia2 AI chips
4. Interest in learning about AWS's innovation in silicon, server, and datacenter technology
5. Curiosity about how AWS customers have leveraged AWS AI chips to build, deploy, and scale foundation models.

title: Consolidated data protection insights with generative AI
description: To prevent data loss and data leakage, security leaders want to understand how their data is encrypted using AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) across all accounts, including legacy accounts and partner-managed accounts. You might wonder, “When was a KMS key last used?” or “Which resources does the key protect?” This code talk presents a modular, extendable, and readily usable solution using natural language queries with Amazon Q in QuickSight to get answers to such questions. This allows you to validate with more confidence that you can delete a key, identify unused resources, and find resources with data protection gaps.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given scenario would be:

1. Understanding of AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
2. Knowledge of data encryption and data protection
3. Familiarity with Amazon QuickSight and natural language queries
4. Experience in creating modular and extendable solutions
5. Ability to identify and address data protection gaps

title: Containers are not scary [REPEAT]
description: Fear containers no more, intrepid AWS builders! This session demystifies container basics using Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) so you can learn to effortlessly build, package, and deploy apps. But wait, there's more cloud magic! This talk will also reveal how to summon the powers of AWS generative AI services like Amazon Q Developer to turbocharge your workflow. No more manually spinning up containers – learn to make AI assistants automate those mundane tasks using AWS Lambda functions. By the end, become an AWS container extraordinaire wielding the power of AI to boost productivity.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with containerization concepts and technologies like Docker
3. Exposure to AWS Lambda and serverless computing
4. Interest in leveraging AI/ML services for workflow automation

title: Containers are not scary [REPEAT]
description: Fear containers no more, intrepid AWS builders! This session demystifies container basics using Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) so you can learn to effortlessly build, package, and deploy apps. But wait, there's more cloud magic! This talk will also reveal how to summon the powers of AWS generative AI services like Amazon Q Developer to turbocharge your workflow. No more manually spinning up containers – learn to make AI assistants automate those mundane tasks using AWS Lambda functions. By the end, become an AWS container extraordinaire wielding the power of AI to boost productivity.
