5. Ability to integrate AWS Marketplace APIs into your own web properties

title: Deliver performance at scale with Amazon S3
description: With Amazon S3, your applications can scale to millions of transactions per second (TPS) and achieve terabits per second of throughput. In this chalk talk, explore how Amazon S3 delivers predictable, high-throughput, and low-latency object storage for your most performance-critical workloads. Learn about Amazon S3 performance characteristics so you can tailor your storage performance to the needs of your applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of object storage concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
3. Knowledge of application performance requirements and scaling

title: Deliver reliable generative AI mobile apps: A testing architecture
description: In this chalk talk, discover how you can harness the power of AWS Device Farm to transform your mobile testing strategy. Adobe shares how they used Device Farm to build a standardized and scalable mobile testing framework for testing their generative AI–enabled apps. Learn how to: test across a range of iOS and Android devices without having or managing physical devices; reduce onboarding time for new applications in your testing pipeline; and gain insights into app functionality, performance, and resource usage.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services, particularly AWS Device Farm
2. Understanding of mobile application testing and quality assurance
3. Familiarity with Adobe's mobile app development and testing processes
4. Awareness of generative AI and its application in mobile apps
5. Experience in setting up and managing a mobile testing framework

title: Deliver ROI for your customers’ generative AI application
description: In this session, watch an introduction to the components of developing a comprehensive ROI analysis for your customer’s generative AI applications on AWS. Hear a discussion on the strategic, design, and operational considerations and the best practices that can make an impact on the ROI. This session also includes a walkthrough of specific examples leveraging the ROI tools available to AWS partners through the Generative AI Center of Excellence.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session may include:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with generative AI technologies and their applications.
3. Experience in financial analysis and ROI calculations.
4. Knowledge of AWS partner programs and resources.

title: Democratize generative AI data access without compromising on security [REPEAT]
description: Building a generative AI application requires a seamlessly integrated centralized service for data governance and access controls. Using Amazon DataZone, organizations can maintain robust data governance and security access controls to make their data securely available for generative AI projects across business teams. Join this chalk talk to learn how Amazon DataZone enables data asset discovery through comprehensive metadata descriptions, data quality metrics, and lineage reporting. This talk also covers automated infrastructure provisioning, end-to-end auditing, and access grants for managed Amazon Redshift assets.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of data governance and access controls
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services
3. Knowledge of generative AI applications and their data requirements
4. Familiarity with data asset discovery, metadata, and lineage reporting
5. Familiarity with automated infrastructure provisioning and end-to-end auditing

title: Democratize generative AI data access without compromising on security [REPEAT]

3. Knowledge of data asset discovery and metadata management
4. Exposure to data quality metrics and lineage reporting
5. Experience with automated infrastructure provisioning and end-to-end auditing

title: Democratizing access to higher education for 1.2 million students
description: This session demonstrates how the AWS platform was essential to supporting the Unified Selection System (SiSU), enabling 1.27 million students to apply for 460,000 vacancies at 127 public institutions digitally. Understand how the Brazilian Ministry of Education and AWS collaborated to help students gain admission to public higher education institutions in the country, increasing price/performance efficiency and resulting in zero availability issues or infrastructure incidents.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of the Brazilian higher education system
2. Knowledge of the Unified Selection System (SiSU)
3. Familiarity with AWS cloud platform and its services
4. Experience in digital application and admission processes
5. Collaboration between government agencies and cloud service providers

title: Democratizing live television broadcasting with cloud technology
description: Take a look behind the scenes at how AWS is combining industry-specific expertise and technology to lower the barrier of entry to running cloud-based media workflows. This chalk talk covers the evolution of live broadcast system deployment and management on AWS, from the initial steps of ClickOps system deployment to modern API-driven orchestration of cloud-based television production facilities. Learn what architectural patterns work best in the cloud and how the broad AWS Partner ecosystem can complement AWS services for a complete workflow.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Knowledge of media and broadcast workflows
3. Familiarity with API-driven architectures and orchestration

title: Demystify and democratize access to your data with a business catalog
description: Understanding your data in context means that all users can discover and comprehend the meaning of their data so they can use it confidently to drive business value. With a centralized data catalog, data can be found easily, data quality can be quantified and tracked with lineage, access permissions can be requested and provisioned, and data can be used to make business decisions. In this session, learn how Amazon DataZone, AWS Glue Data Catalog, and AWS Lake Formation help you build a catalog accessible to all of your data marketplace users.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of data management principles
2. Familiarity with data cataloging and data lineage concepts
3. Knowledge of data access and security management
4. Awareness of AWS data services (Amazon DataZone, AWS Glue Data Catalog, AWS Lake Formation)
5. Experience in data-driven decision-making processes

title: Demystifying Amazon ECS deployments for secure and automated releases [REPEAT]
description: When running containerized applications on Amazon ECS, operations teams need to ensure that new software releases are rolled out safely with the ability to try out new releases and to quickly restore a service to a last known stable state. Join this workshop to gain hands-on experience with Amazon ECS deployment strategies. Dive deep into the different approaches, and learn how they can be automated as part of a CI/CD pipeline. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Basic understanding of containerization and Docker.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS).
3. Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) principles.
4. Ability to use a command-line interface and basic programming skills.
5. Availability of a laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Demystifying Amazon ECS deployments for secure and automated releases [REPEAT]
description: When running containerized applications on Amazon ECS, operations teams need to ensure that new software releases are rolled out safely with the ability to try out new releases and to quickly restore a service to a last known stable state. Join this workshop to gain hands-on experience with Amazon ECS deployment strategies. Dive deep into the different approaches, and learn how they can be automated as part of a CI/CD pipeline. prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of containerization and Docker
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS)
3. Experience with CI/CD pipelines

title: Demystifying containers on AWS: What’s right for you?
description: This session dives into the details of running containers on AWS and the nuances that will affect which service you choose. Receive advice on when it is time to migrate to a different service, as well as the trade-offs between cost, complexity, and knowledge, in order to find the best combination for your use case. The session is hands-on and demo-driven to show how you can quickly test out the different options for yourself and decide which approach is best for you.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Basic understanding of containerization and Docker
3. Hands-on experience with AWS CLI or AWS Management Console

title: Demystifying LLM deployment and optimization with AWS Inferentia [REPEAT]
description: Large language models (LLMs) show remarkable impact in a wide range of applications, but they pose significant cost and deployment challenges at scale. In this workshop, explore best practices for efficient LLM deployment using AWS Inferentia2-based Amazon EC2 Inf2 instances to maximize performance and lower costs. Learn review techniques like continuous batching, paged attention, flash attention, and others, and walk through serving libraries such as Hugging Face TGI and vLLM. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of large language models (LLMs)
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon EC2 and AWS Inferentia2
3. Experience with machine learning deployment and optimization
4. Knowledge of serving libraries like Hugging Face TGI and vLLM

5. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: Demystifying LLMs with your AWS DeepRacer know-how [REPEAT]
description: Building on AWS DeepRacer foundations, learn fine-tuning and pre-training techniques that use AWS managed services like Amazon SageMaker Jumpstart and Amazon Bedrock. Discover how smaller, fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) can outperform bigger models in solving diverse tasks. Develop crucial fit-for-purpose AI-customization skills that are essential to prepare you for an AI-driven future of work and innovation. Explore dataset preparation, model tuning, hyperparameter optimization, and evaluation. Fostering team-building and democratizing machine learning, this workshop is designed for both technical and nontechnical audiences and is accessible to anyone who wants to improve their generative AI skills. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS DeepRacer and Amazon SageMaker.
3. Proficiency in a programming language, such as Python.
4. Willingness to collaborate and work in a team.
5. Curiosity about generative AI and a desire to improve your skills in this area.

title: Demystifying LLMs with your AWS DeepRacer know-how [REPEAT]
description: Building on AWS DeepRacer foundations, learn fine-tuning and pre-training techniques that use AWS managed services like Amazon SageMaker Jumpstart and Amazon Bedrock. Discover how smaller, fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) can outperform bigger models in solving diverse tasks. The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Familiarity with AWS DeepRacer
2. Basic understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts
3. Ability to use a laptop and basic software tools

title: Demystifying SaaS networking, connectivity, and routing strategies
description: SaaS applications are often required to support a variety of personas/tiers. Supporting these varied experiences requires a more distributed multi-tenant architecture model, where tenants/tiers may have dedicated resources. This chalk talk explores different architecture patterns, technologies, and strategies that are used to route requests to per-tenant/tier infrastructure. It covers a wider range of routing considerations, including domain and data-driven routing, and how connectivity options like Amazon Route 53, Amazon CloudFront, APIs, and AWS PrivateLink affect your routing strategy. The goal is to review the strengths and limitations of each option, helping you identify the strategy that best addresses your needs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of multi-tenant architecture and its challenges.
2. Knowledge of different routing technologies and strategies, such as Amazon Route 53, Amazon CloudFront, APIs, and AWS PrivateLink.
3. Familiarity with domain-driven and data-driven routing concepts.
4. Experience in designing and implementing distributed systems.
5. Understanding of the trade-offs and considerations involved in selecting the appropriate routing strategy for your SaaS application.

title: Dentsu and AWS: “Easy Reading” books for developmentally disabled
description: Dentsu Creative launched the pioneering AI tool “Easy Reading” to make reading more accessible for millions with intellectual disabilities. Developed using AWS, Easy Reading can translate any text into the internationally recognized Easy-to-Read format. Dentsu has partnered with Visit Portugal, an organization dedicated to literature, to allow people to “visit” the country through its literary classics. Using Easy Reading, Visit Portugal is providing free access to three renowned Portuguese works on easyreadingportugal.com. The program will be celebrated in Lisbon in April, with a campaign across Visit Portugal’s digital channels to promote the accessible reading platform.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given text would be:

1. Dentsu Creative's expertise in developing innovative AI-based solutions.
2. Collaboration with AWS for the technical development of the "Easy Reading" tool.
3. Partnership with Visit Portugal, an organization focused on literature and accessibility.
4. Commitment to making reading more accessible for individuals with intellectual disabilities.
5. Availability of renowned Portuguese literary works to be made accessible through the "Easy Reading" platform.

title: Deploy artificial intelligence architectures in AWS GovCloud (US)
description: Artificial intelligence, particularly generative AI, positions agencies, integrators, and partners to enhance the impact of their missions. This chalk talk explains best practices to deploy Amazon Bedrock Guardrails using models from Meta and Anthropic, as well as best practices for deploying Amazon SageMaker Studio with third-party models in AWS GovCloud (US). This talk also covers responsible innovation through experimentation, testing, and deploying while aligning with the White House Executive Order on Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Learn the AWS GovCloud (US) AI capabilities and how to deploy in an enterprise environment responsibly.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this chalk talk would likely include:

1. Understanding of Artificial Intelligence, particularly Generative AI
2. Knowledge of Amazon Bedrock Guardrails and third-party AI models
3. Familiarity with Amazon SageMaker Studio and AWS GovCloud (US)
4. Understanding of responsible innovation and the White House Executive Order on AI
5. Experience in deploying AI solutions in an enterprise environment

title: Deploy foundation models on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod for inference [REPEAT]
description: With Amazon EKS support in Amazon SageMaker HyperPod, users can deploy foundation models for inference on a performant and resilient cluster. They can leverage state-of-the-art model servers in SageMaker and an ecosystem of Kubernetes tools. For critical workloads, SageMaker HyperPod automatically replaces faulty nodes, ensuring uninterrupted end-user experience. Additionally, SageMaker HyperPod optimizes cluster utilization by efficiently sharing resources between inference and training workloads, reducing costs by maximizing capacity usage around the clock. In this chalk talk, learn how to deploy inference workloads on SageMaker HyperPod, and discover its operational efficiencies like maintaining up-to-date frameworks, libraries, and implementing rolling updates to minimize downtime.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Knowledge of Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service)
2. Understanding of Amazon SageMaker and its capabilities
3. Familiarity with Kubernetes and its ecosystem of tools
4. Experience with deploying and managing machine learning models for inference
5. Interest in optimizing infrastructure and reducing costs for critical machine learning workloads

title: Deploy foundation models on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod for inference [REPEAT]

They can leverage state-of-the-art model servers in SageMaker and an ecosystem of Kubernetes tools. 2. Understanding of Amazon SageMaker and its capabilities
3. Familiarity with Kubernetes and its ecosystem of tools
4. Experience with deploying and managing machine learning models for inference
5. Understanding of cluster management and resource optimization strategies

title: Deploying a CI/CD pipeline with a managed deployment using AWS CDK
description: Attend this lab to learn how to deploy an existing containerized application. Create a pipeline to build and test the application. Then, add a deployment stage to the pipeline to automatically deploy code updates to test and production environments.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of containerization and Docker.
2. Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
3. Knowledge of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) concepts.
4. Familiarity with a CI/CD tool (e.g., Jenkins, Azure DevOps, CircleCI).
5. Basic understanding of cloud infrastructure and deployment environments.

title: Deploying Amazon EKS clusters from the cloud to the edge [REPEAT]
description: Dive deep into the strategies to minimize latency and enhance performance of distributed applications leveraging Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) across Regions, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts. This chalk talk covers deploying an application based on a real-world scenario to an EKS cluster, demonstrating the seamless integration of Outposts and Local Zones, while maintaining a unified control plane. By exploring real-world use cases and best practices, gain practical insights into architecting resilient and scalable applications across distributed environments. This talk aligns to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, empowering you to optimize AWS deployments for consistency and security.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Amazon EKS
2. Understanding of distributed application architecture
3. Knowledge of AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones
4. Familiarity with the AWS Well-Architected Framework

title: Deploying Amazon EKS clusters from the cloud to the edge [REPEAT]
description: Dive deep into the strategies to minimize latency and enhance performance of distributed applications leveraging Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) across Regions, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts. This chalk talk covers deploying an application based on a real-world scenario to an EKS cluster, demonstrating the seamless integration of Outposts and Local Zones, while maintaining a unified control plane. By exploring real-world use cases and best practices, gain practical insights into architecting resilient and scalable applications across distributed environments. This talk aligns to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, empowering you to optimize AWS deployments for consistency and security.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Kubernetes and container orchestration.
2. Understanding of AWS services, such as Amazon EKS, AWS Local Zones, and AWS Outposts.
3. Knowledge of the AWS Well-Architected Framework.
4. Experience in designing and deploying distributed applications.
5. Familiarity with networking concepts and latency optimization techniques.

title: Deploying Amazon S3 in multiple Regions to support global applications
description: Amazon S3 Multi-Region Access Points provide a single global endpoint to access datasets that span multiple S3 buckets in different AWS Regions. This allows you to build multi-Region applications with the same simple architecture used in a single Region and then run those applications anywhere in the world. In this chalk talk, learn how you can scale your existing S3 data stack to multiple AWS Regions and clients across the globe.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service)
2. Knowledge of AWS Regions and their importance in multi-Region applications
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their integration
4. Experience in building and deploying multi-Region applications
5. Understanding of data management and distribution strategies across multiple Regions

title: Deploying an MES in the cloud or at the edge on AWS Outposts
description: Manufacturers today are looking at how the cloud can provide flexibility and resilience, as well as reduce cost for their production critical systems. Manufacturing execution system (MES) can be deployed in the cloud or for manufacturers who need low latency or have limited bandwidth on an AWS Outpost running at the edge. In this chalk talk, deep dive into the architectural patterns for deploying a MES system on AWS and on an AWS Outpost, including network topology and connectivity. This talk also walks through the reference architecture for running Siemens Opcenter Execution on AWS in general and on AWS Outposts in particular.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its benefits for manufacturing
2. Knowledge of Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES)
3. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
4. Awareness of AWS Outposts and their use cases
5. Familiarity with Siemens Opcenter Execution

title: Deploying automotive workloads on the AWS and China partitions
description: This chalk talk outlines how automotive companies can migrate cloud-native development platforms from the AWS partition to the AWS China partition, referencing the successful migration of BMW’s autonomous driving (AD) platform as an example. This talk outlines the technical and organizational challenges that can be expected, as well as the tools to simplify the process. Finally, learn how BMW keeps both the AWS AD and AWS China AD platforms in sync, enabling a cost-effective, long-term operation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of cloud-native development platforms
2. Understanding of AWS partitions (AWS and AWS China)
3. Familiarity with automotive industry and autonomous driving technologies
4. Experience in cloud infrastructure migration and synchronization

title: Deploying containerized applications with Amazon EBS
description: Enterprises running critical applications in Kubernetes use Amazon EBS for its high performance, low latency, and persistence, which ensures data can be re-attached to new containers. This chalk talk explores using the EBS Container Storage Interface (CSI) driver to provision and manage EBS volumes running on Amazon EKS or other Kubernetes managements without having to use APIs specific to AWS. Learn best practices to efficiently manage and scale containerized applications, such as simplifying volume migration and modification to optimize cost performance without downtime. Discover new features and configurations that improve performance, scalability, and monitorability in a Kubernetes environment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Kubernetes
2. Understanding of containerized applications
3. Knowledge of Amazon EBS and its features
4. Experience with AWS services and infrastructure
5. Familiarity with the Container Storage Interface (CSI) driver

title: Deploy LLMs at the edge with AWS IoT [REPEAT]
description: In this builders’ session, learn how to deploy offline LLMs and a web portal as AWS IoT Greengrass components. Discover how to synchronize contextual data from private sources or Amazon S3 to build local knowledge bases. Explore Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for more relevant, accurate, and customized responses, and learn how to integrate multimodal local agents for complex edge tasks. This approach unlocks LLM power at the edge, helping ensure data privacy, low latency, and tailored experiences by combining contextual knowledge with edge computing and multimodal agent capabilities. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS IoT Greengrass
2. Familiarity with machine learning and language models
3. Experience with edge computing and data synchronization
4. Knowledge of multimodal agents and their integration
5. Access to a laptop for hands-on participation

title: Deployment best practices for reliable rollouts using Amazon ECS
description: In today’s fast-paced software development landscape, development teams need to release updates faster, reduce time to market, and respond more quickly to changes in business requirements and technical dependencies. In this session, learn best practices for how you can ship software faster and with high confidence using Amazon ECS. Explore different approaches for different application types, and learn how they can be automated as part of a CI/CD pipeline.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of containerization and Docker
2. Familiarity with AWS services, especially Amazon ECS
3. Knowledge of CI/CD principles and practices
4. Experience with software development lifecycle and deployment processes

title: Deploy optimized inference pipelines on Amazon EKS
description: Running generative AI apps on Amazon EKS? Learn how to reduce GPU costs, increase application resilience, and future-proof architecture. This session discusses hardware options such as NVIDIA’s GPU and AWS Inferentia accelerators, how to benchmark them, and how to gradually migrate. It showcases an image diffusion application deployed on Amazon EKS, powered by Karpenter and scaled by KEDA. The inference application dynamically runs on diverse GPUs and accelerators, and loading the system with 10,000 requests per second on hundreds of accelerators illustrates the power of Kubernetes as an AI/ML inference engine and the cost availability benefits of accelerator diversity.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Familiarity with Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service)
2. Understanding of GPU-powered applications and hardware accelerators
3. Knowledge of Kubernetes and its ecosystem (e.g., Karpenter, KEDA)
4. Experience with AI/ML inference applications and deployment

title: Design an industrial data foundation for generative AI in manufacturing
description: This chalk talk dives deep into the architectural patterns that underpin an industrial data strategy. This foundation is critical to enabling the application of generative AI for use cases such as assisted diagnosis and troubleshooting, advanced quality defect detection, and automated information modeling and digital threads. In addition to sharing and whiteboarding architectural patterns for operational and enterprise data ingestion, data storage and transformation, and contextualization, the talk showcases generative AI manufacturing use cases with live demos and code samples.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of industrial data management
2. Familiarity with architectural patterns and data strategies
3. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications in manufacturing
4. Exposure to data ingestion, storage, transformation, and contextualization
5. Interest in exploring advanced manufacturing use cases

title: Design high-performance storage to accelerate ML training and HPC
description: Join this technical discussion about AWS storage services and their importance for machine learning (ML) and high-performance computing (HPC) workloads. Explore the architecture and performance characteristics of solutions such as Amazon EFS, Amazon S3, and Amazon FSx, providing insights into their suitability and optimization for diverse ML and HPC applications. Through detailed analysis and use case discussions, learn why storage matters for generative AI/ML and HPC, and how leveraging high-performance storage can enhance the efficiency and scalability of data-intensive workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS cloud services
2. Understanding of machine learning and high-performance computing concepts
3. Basic knowledge of data storage and file systems
4. Interest in exploring storage solutions for data-intensive workloads
5. Desire to learn about the architecture and performance characteristics of AWS storage services

title: Designing complex authorization systems with Cedar
description: Imagine delegating access to your data to multiple devices or individuals, who might do the same to you. Scary? Improbable? It’s real for industries like healthcare, where data access extends beyond humans to devices and third parties. Managing authorization becomes complex, making expression, evaluation, and governance tedious. This chalk talk explores how Cedar, an open source language, helps shape models allowing all-party access to sensitive data through impersonation or delegation, with limit of time, and consent to align with privacy-by-design principles. By exploring examples in this talk, developers and architects gain knowledge to build secure, compliant, and trusted authorization systems.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data access and authorization management
2. Familiarity with privacy-by-design principles
3. Knowledge of open source languages and their applications
4. Interest in building secure and compliant authorization systems
5. Desire to explore solutions for complex data access scenarios

title: Designing generative AI workloads for resilience
description: Resilience plays a pivotal role in the development of any workload, and generative AI workloads are no different. There are unique considerations when engineering generative AI workloads through a resilience lens. Understanding and prioritizing resilience is crucial for generative AI workloads to meet organizational availability and business continuity requirements. In this session, learn about the different stacks of a generative AI workload and what those considerations should be.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of generative AI concepts and workloads.
2. Knowledge of software engineering principles and practices.
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and distributed systems.
4. Awareness of business continuity and availability requirements.
5. Experience in designing and implementing resilient systems.

title: Designing SaaS architectures that support global growth and scale
description: SaaS organizations are often driven by growth. Scaling to meet this growth often requires teams to think about how their underlying architecture, operations, and application can support these growth models. Designing a multi-tenant environment that can scale into new geographies, be deployed into more regions, and/or address additional compliance requirements can be challenging. This chalk talk examines the architectural challenges that come with supporting various growth/reach models, highlighting techniques, patterns, and strategies that are used to prime your SaaS offering for broader reach/expansion. It covers the architectural, deployment, resilience, and operational considerations that come with tackling this growth profile.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and SaaS delivery models
2. Knowledge of scalable and distributed system design
3. Familiarity with multi-tenancy concepts and challenges
4. Experience with deployment strategies and infrastructure automation
5. Awareness of compliance and regulatory requirements in different regions

title: Designing your AWS network for growth and flexibility [REPEAT]
description: Your AWS network started with one virtual private cloud (VPC), and now it’s your job to be ready for what’s next. In this builders’ session, build and scale an AWS network starting with VPC peering and building up to a multi-Region network using AWS Transit Gateway and AWS Cloud WAN. Leave this session with the skills to scale your VPC network and solve networking problems more efficiently. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS VPC
2. Familiarity with VPC peering
3. Knowledge of AWS Transit Gateway
4. Familiarity with AWS Cloud WAN
5. Ability to use AWS Management Console or AWS CLI

title: Designing your AWS network for growth and flexibility [REPEAT]
description: Your AWS network started with one virtual private cloud (VPC), and now it’s your job to be ready for what’s next. title: Design modern data architectures with LLMs using Amazon SageMaker
description: In this new interactive training session powered by generative AI, address a simulated business scenario by developing a voice-enabled search system that recognizes and retrieves information from databases using natural language. Create an intuitive user experience and design a flexible, scalable solution using Amazon Bedrock, AWS Glue and Amazon SageMaker. A laptop is required for this session.

Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of natural language processing (NLP)
2. Familiarity with AWS services (Amazon Bedrock, AWS Glue, Amazon SageMaker)
3. Experience with software development and user experience design
4. Access to a laptop

title: Design patterns for multi-Region applications and data in AWS (sponsored by YugabyteDB)
description: AWS has the largest infrastructure footprint in the world, spanning countries and continents. This makes it possible to build multi-Region applications that serve user requests with low latency from nearly anywhere, tolerate all sorts of possible outages including major Region-level incidents, and comply with data regulatory requirements. Join us to learn about design patterns for building multi-Region applications on AWS with a focus on low latency and high availability. Explore common deployment patterns used by innovative digital native companies and global corporations, and learn about trade-offs with each pattern. This presentation is brought to you by YugabyteDB, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given presentation:

1. Understanding of AWS cloud infrastructure and services.
2. Knowledge of application architecture design and deployment patterns.
3. Familiarity with data regulatory requirements and compliance.
4. Interest in building highly available and low-latency applications.
5. Awareness of YugabyteDB and its partnership with AWS.

title: Design scalable database solutions with Aurora Limitless Database
description: With Amazon Aurora Limitless Database, you get the flexibility and familiarity of a relational database with the virtually limitless horizontal scale of a distributed database. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect a hyperscale solution featuring a managed sharded database. Dive deep into Aurora Limitless Database, and learn how to make design decisions such as picking the right shard key, choosing collocated and reference tables, and more. Hear directly from the experts in the field as they share lessons learned, best practices, and anti-patterns along the way to help you achieve virtually limitless scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Understanding of relational databases and their architecture.
2. Familiarity with distributed database concepts and horizontal scaling.
3. Knowledge of database design principles, such as sharding and partitioning.
4. Experience with AWS services, particularly Amazon Aurora.
5. Familiarity with database design decisions, including shard key selection, collocated tables, and reference tables.

title: Design secure and resilient relational database architectures on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Overwhelmed with all the security best practices and trying to understand what makes sense for you to implement to protect your data? Join this chalk talk to learn how to deploy a secure and resilient architecture using all the security features that effectively integrate with your databases running on Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS. Strengthen your enterprise’s security posture by discovering best practices and avoiding common pitfalls. Leave this talk equipped with all the available security features, knowing how to set them up and configure meaningful alerts to safeguard your data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of database security
2. Familiarity with Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS
3. Knowledge of cloud security best practices
4. Desire to strengthen the security posture of your enterprise

title: Design smart home solutions for resiliency and scalability on AWS IoT
description: Unlock the full potential of IoT in the smart home domain with AWS IoT. In this chalk talk, learn how to build robust and scalable smart home solutions with AWS IoT. Explore key considerations and best practices for designing resilient and scalable architectures that can handle large-scale deployments. From device connectivity and management to real-time interaction and control, discover the strategies and architectures that will empower you to create an IoT ecosystem that delights your consumers.

2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Hands-on experience with cloud computing and architecture design

title: Design well-architected networks on AWS
description: Elevate your AWS networking expertise by learning how to design well-architected networks on AWS. This session starts with the tradeoffs of multi-AZ and multi-Region architectures and how to build an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). Next, it explores design challenges when connecting multiple VPCs and on-premises datacenters, followed by a discussion on building a scalable DNS infrastructure on AWS. Finally, we will consider several common network architecture patterns on AWS, such as application ingress and egress. Leave equipped with the insights needed to create resilient, secure, and scalable network infrastructure on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
2. Understanding of networking fundamentals
3. Experience with VPC configuration and management

title: Destination zero: Insights and tactics for sustainable architectures
description: In this lightning talk, explore the principles of the AWS Well-Architected Framework sustainability pillar in practice. Learn about data sources to gain insights into the resource efficiency and environmental impact, including the AWS customer carbon footprint tool and proxy metrics from AWS Cost & Usage Reports. From AWS architectures to web applications to AI workloads, hear about the impact of shifting responsibilities when moving along the spectrum of self-managed to managed services. Take a deep dive on services and trade-offs and considerations for resource efficiency and how to keep architecture flexible as requirements change.

Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of the AWS Well-Architected Framework
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architectures
3. Knowledge of sustainability and environmental impact considerations in cloud computing
4. Experience with AWS Cost & Usage Reports and customer carbon footprint tools
5. Familiarity with the spectrum of self-managed to managed services in AWS

title: Detect, investigate & respond to security scenarios with generative AI [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, participate in an interactive tabletop exercise covering threat vectors like exposed AWS access keys, insecure security group ports, and unauthorized resource launches. Through engaging role-play, take on an incident response persona, strategizing and working together to defend an organization from security threats and dilemmas. Learn how to correlate data from sources including AWS CloudTrail, IAM Access Analyzer, AWS Config, and AWS Trusted Advisor using Amazon Q. Discover how to respond to incidents using AWS Systems Manager, AWS Lambda, and Amazon CloudWatch Events. Learn how AWS programs can help you prepare for the unexpected. You must bring your laptop to participate.

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts.
2. Familiarity with incident response and security best practices.
3. Ability to use a laptop and navigate AWS management console.

description: In this breakout session, learn how to tap into the demand signals from AWS customers to better understand which industry-leading solutions to build, market, and sell. Also learn how to leverage the Partner Solution framework to address the pain points of line of business buyers and deliver top industry use cases in a scalable and repeatable fashion. With specialized Guidance packages, AWS Partners can harness a set of tailored components to address the entire solution lifecycle, from ideation to customer success, and how to partner with AWS to go to market.

title: Developing generative AI applications on AWS
description: This bootcamp is for software developers interested in leveraging large language models without fine-tuning. It provides an overview of generative AI, planning a generative AI project, and getting started with Amazon Bedrock, and it describes the various use cases of foundation models and defines prompt engineering. Learn best practices for interacting with FMs, as well as the architecture patterns for building generative AI applications using Amazon Bedrock and LangChain. You must bring your laptop to participate.

Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts
3. Willingness to learn about large language models and their applications

title: DevOps approach for software-defined everything with AWS Marketplace
description: To create software-defined everything (SDx) products, device manufacturers need to improve software collaboration and integration quality. This requires an agile and cloud-friendly approach compared to legacy on-premises development kits and restrictive software licenses. AWS Marketplace is helping AWS users create a cloud-based CI/CD pipeline and development environment with virtualized hardware. This chalk talk shows how AWS Marketplace is enabling the software-defined transformation for vehicles, medical devices, and manufacturers. See how users are able to scale the onboarding of their software vendors into their product development workflows and become modern software organizations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Agile and cloud-friendly approach
2. Virtualized hardware
3. Cloud-based CI/CD pipeline and development environment
4. Scalable onboarding of software vendors
5. Transformation towards modern software organizations

title: Digital sovereignty: Overcome complexity and enable future-readiness
description: Organizations are facing increasing complexity in an evolving sovereignty landscape. Building a strong digital foundation can help simplify efforts to meet requirements today and prepare your organization for the future without slowing innovation. Join this session to learn how AWS sovereign cloud offerings, ranging from encryption services to the announced AWS European Sovereign Cloud, provide more control and choice to help meet your unique needs. Discover how customers are keeping critical workloads secure and protected when using new technologies on AWS including generative AI, and learn about new digital sovereignty solutions offered by AWS Partners.

Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and digital transformation
2. Familiarity with data privacy and security regulations

4. Desire to explore solutions for secure adoption of new technologies like generative AI

title: Discover how Hyundai drives user adoption in connected car services (sponsored by Intel)
description: Since entering the connected car service market in 2003, Hyundai Motor Group and subsidiary Hyundai AutoEver have provided enhanced human interaction with their vehicles through operating systems, customer applications, and infotainment. By leveraging custom Amazon EC2 instances using Intel Xeon processors and Intel Accelerators in their application development, they've achieved a 25% increase in performance. Join this session as Hyundai and AutoEver share their journey in launching the service, their challenges and insights on how the latest Intel and AWS technologies and AI drive customer adoption for new services, and how you can do this in your industry. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this presentation would be:

4. Interest in the application of AI and latest technologies in driving customer adoption for new services

title: Dive deep into Amazon Aurora query plan management
description: Do you deal with PostgreSQL query performance–related issues? In this code talk, explore advanced techniques for monitoring query plans in Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition and maintaining query plan stability using Aurora query plan management. This talk features live coding scenarios and interactive discussions to identify and address query plan regression. Gain deep insights into tools and methods to tweak PostgreSQL execution plans to ensure optimal query performance and stability in your databases. Learn practical insights and troubleshoot common issues in real time. This talk is designed for attendees who are familiar with PostgreSQL and basic query optimization concepts.

Prerequisites:

2. Basic understanding of query optimization
3. Experience with Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition

Gain an in-depth understanding of how DynamoDB capabilities including TTL, global tables, and MemDS have been implemented.

Learn how to create a unified internal developer platform for Amazon EKS clusters across environments using GitOps principles. Hone your skills in multi-cluster resource configuration, drift detection, and lifecycle management while ensuring compliance and security. Gain practical skills in implementing platform engineering for consistent resource states, enforcing policies across clusters, and centralizing logging, metrics, monitoring, and access control. title: Dive deep into the AWS Nitro System
description: The AWS Nitro System is a rich collection of building block technologies—including hardware offload and security components built by AWS—that are powering the recent and future generations of Amazon EC2 instances with an ever-broadening selection of compute, storage, memory, and networking options. In this session, dive deep into the AWS Nitro System, review its design and architecture, explore new innovations in the Nitro platform, and see how it has made the seemingly impossible possible.

title: Dive deep on Amazon S3
description: Amazon S3 provides developers and IT teams with cloud object storage that delivers industry-leading scalability, durability, security, and performance. Amazon S3 averages over 150 million requests per second across millions of hard drives to handle some of the world’s largest workloads. In this session, engineering leaders from the Amazon S3 team dive deep into the inner workings of Amazon S3. Learn the engineering principles behind operating storage systems at scale and how that benefits customers of all sizes.

Prerequisites:

description: As organizations rapidly adopt cloud computing, the need for effective governance has become paramount. description: Explore the world of AWS routing, from static and dynamic routing to protocols like BGP. In this session, discover how routing features are used in Amazon VPC, AWS Transit Gateway, AWS Direct Connect, AWS Site-to-Site VPN, and AWS Cloud WAN to create efficiency in network communication. Compare AWS routing to traditional on-premises methods and explore failure handling, while examining how to implement active/active, active/passive, and traffic inspection setups. Dragonfly Financial Technologies, a leading financial technology company, embarked on a two-year journey to migrate its entire data center infrastructure to the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud platform. title: Drilling down into performance for distributed training [REPEAT]
description: Performance optimization of distributed training jobs is complex due to the multiple levels of parallelism and the need to drill down in the accelerator, CPU, and network metrics at nanosecond granularity throughout the stack, from the communication libraries driving collective network operations to the ML framework. In this chalk talk, learn how to do that with NVIDIA Nsight (for GPUs) and AWS Neuron Monitor (for AWS Trainium and Inferentia) and analyze your training codes on multi-node clusters for Slurm and Kubernetes on AWS. Learn to generate reports, add your own traces within your code, and optimize your distributed training performance.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of distributed training and the various levels of parallelism involved.
2. Familiarity with performance monitoring tools like NVIDIA Nsight and AWS Neuron Monitor.
3. Experience with multi-node cluster management using Slurm and Kubernetes on AWS.
4. Understanding of ML frameworks and communication libraries used in distributed training.
5. Ability to analyze performance data and optimize distributed training code.

In this chalk talk, learn how to do that with NVIDIA Nsight (for GPUs) and AWS Neuron Monitor (for AWS Trainium and Inferentia) and analyze your training codes on multi-node clusters for Slurm and Kubernetes on AWS. Learn to generate reports, add your own traces within your code, and optimize your distributed training performance.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of distributed training concepts and parallelism
2. Familiarity with NVIDIA Nsight and AWS Neuron Monitor tools
3. Experience with Slurm and Kubernetes on AWS
4. Knowledge of performance optimization techniques for machine learning frameworks
5. Proficiency in analyzing and interpreting performance metrics at the nanosecond granularity

title: Drive business transformation with Amazon Q: Strategy to deployment
description: Embark on a transformative journey with Amazon Q. Explore the customer journey from initial AI strategy to successful enterprise deployment, uncovering winning strategies and lessons learned. Discover how to balance short-term ROI with long-term transformative objectives. Experience a “Day in the Life” demo showcasing how business leaders leverage Amazon Q to streamline workflows and push data-driven decisions.

The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of AI and its business applications.
2. Knowledge of customer journey mapping and enterprise-level deployment.
3. Familiarity with balancing short-term and long-term business objectives.
4. Interest in exploring data-driven decision-making processes.
5. Desire to learn from real-world case studies and practical demonstrations.

title: Drive customer loyalty with tailored experiences in Amazon Connect
description: Revolutionize your customer engagement across every channel and touchpoint. Join this session to learn how contact center leaders are utilizing AI to deliver proactive, personalized experiences and address customer needs before they turn into issues. Learn how Amazon Connect makes it easy to provide targeted, omnichannel customer experiences at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of customer engagement strategies
2. Familiarity with AI and its applications in customer service
3. Knowledge of omnichannel customer experience
4. Awareness of Amazon Connect as a contact center solution
5. Interest in delivering personalized and proactive customer experiences

title: Drive innovation and results with high performance computing on AWS
description: The convergence of high performance computing (HPC), cloud, and AI is allowing AWS customers to drive innovation at an unprecedented pace. This powerful combination lets organizations leverage virtually unlimited compute capacity, accelerated computing, high-performance storage, advanced networking, and orchestration services for seamlessly running complex simulations and AI/ML workloads at scale. In this session, explore how customers across healthcare and life sciences (HCLS) and manufacturing industries are harnessing the convergence of HPC, cloud, and AI on AWS to accelerate time to insights, optimize performance, and drive innovation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of high-performance computing (HPC)
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and its capabilities
3. Familiarity with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML)
4. Experience in the healthcare, life sciences, or manufacturing industries
5. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities

title: Drive innovation by implementing an industrial data strategy
description: To harness the value of data, manufacturers need more than a single database, data lake, or business intelligence service. They need to implement an end-to-end data strategy. AWS can help your organization implement an end-to-end strategy that makes data management easier at every step of the journey, from ingesting, storing, and querying data to analyzing, visualizing, and running ML models. Learn about the AWS Industrial Data Fabric, a well-architected framework that enables manufacturers to accelerate the ingestion of, contextualization of, as well as ability to act on industrial and enterprise data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of data management and analytics concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Knowledge of industrial data and manufacturing processes
4. Ability to identify and address data challenges in the manufacturing industry
5. Willingness to implement a comprehensive data strategy across the organization

title: Driving cloud innovation in a regulated financial services environment (sponsored by Dynatrace)
description: Staying resilient and efficient while navigating an ever-changing regulatory landscape can complicate cloud migration efforts for financial services organizations. Join this session for an in-depth exploration of cloud transformation through the lens of a leading German financial credit scoring service provider. Discover how the service provider integrated Dynatrace to enhance cloud performance, security, observability, and compliance. Learn how to ensure data integrity and privacy while driving innovation and operational excellence throughout your cloud transformation journey. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud migration challenges in the financial services industry
2. Knowledge of cloud transformation strategies and best practices
3. Familiarity with Dynatrace and its capabilities in cloud performance, security, observability, and compliance
4. Awareness of data integrity and privacy considerations in cloud transformation
5. Interest in driving innovation and operational excellence through cloud transformation

title: Driving cost optimization at scale (sponsored by Datadog)
description: Datadog runs complex infrastructure on AWS across multiple Regions with demanding resiliency requirements. At this scale, Datadog constantly makes difficult trade-offs: cost savings versus performance and resiliency. In 2023, Datadog set a goal to migrate 100% of their AWS workloads to Graviton. Arm processors demonstrated better cost to performance than the existing fleet for many workloads, and Graviton was available in sustainable quantities. This session shows you how in a year Datadog helped a small team successfully migrate a large-scale infrastructure to a new hardware platform, gained massive efficiencies, and added some key strategic capabilities. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would likely include:

1. Experience with AWS infrastructure and multi-region deployments
2. Understanding of cost optimization and performance trade-offs in complex environments
3. Familiarity with Arm-based Graviton processors and their benefits
4. Knowledge of infrastructure migration strategies and best practices

title: Driving eCommerce business intelligence with Amazon Bedrock
description: This hands-on workshop empowers participants with the knowledge and skills to leverage advanced AI platform Amazon Bedrock for generating valuable recommendations by integrating data from the Multi-Channel Fulfillment (SP-API) and Buy with Prime API into a data lake. Learn how to collect, process, and store e-commerce data using AWS services, and gain hands-on experience in creating personalized recommendations generated by Amazon Bedrock. Through real-world case studies and interactive discussions, participants acquire the practical skills necessary to transform raw data into actionable intelligence, enabling them to make informed business decisions and compete in the digital marketplace. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of e-commerce and data management
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Hands-on experience with programming and data processing

title: Driving operational excellence: F1’s AI-fueled race-day transformation
description: Discover how Formula 1 (F1) revolutionized storytelling and race-day operations through AWS powered innovation. Hear from F1 leadership on fostering a culture of innovation and using new mechanisms and governance models to accelerate product development. Explore F1’s generative AI solutions like Track Pulse, which identifies high-impact stories in real time with rich insights, and the AI-based assistant that streamlines issue resolution during races. Gain insights into F1’s transformation journey and best practices for enabling continual innovation and experimentation.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this topic would be:

1. Understanding of the Formula 1 (F1) racing industry
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with innovation and product development processes
4. Awareness of generative AI and its applications in sports and media
5. Interest in digital transformation and best practices for continuous innovation

title: Driving operational excellence with AWS Supply Chain
description: Join this chalk talk to learn how AWS Supply Chain Work Order Insights enables operational visibility for gas, petroleum, and manufacturing companies. The solution provides end-to-end tracking of work order material movement, accurately forecasting onsite delivery dates, proactively identifying risks that impact planned maintenance, and recommending mitigations. By shifting to a proactive approach, Work Order Insights helps reduce expedited shipping, minimize inventory buffers, and maximize asset uptime—driving operational excellence and cost savings in your operations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of supply chain management
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Interest in operational visibility and optimization

title: Driving profitable growth with innovative products
description: In this session, learn how product and technology officers at software companies continue to drive their innovation agenda, maintain differentiation, and avoid disruption. Technologies like generative AI have captured the imagination of the industry and are poised to bring in the next wave of advancements. However, software companies face challenges such as navigating the current macroeconomic climate and optimizing their capital allocation, profitability, and R&D priorities. Explore strategies for how product and technology officers can work together to build a strong foundation for business.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of software industry dynamics
2. Knowledge of emerging technologies like generative AI
3. Familiarity with product management and technology leadership roles
4. Awareness of macroeconomic factors affecting software companies
5. Familiarity with business strategy and capital allocation

title: Driving real outcomes with an evidence-based approach to cloud security (sponsored by SentinelOne)
description: Learn how SentinelOne customers have decreased alert overload, improved security posture, and helped developer and security teams align and work together to improve security. Explore how autonomous red-teaming cloud security issues helps you focus on what matters most and presents the evidence needed to speed cross-functional agreement among SecOps, AppSec, and developers. This session provides a real-world overview of how customers evolved their cloud security engineering and operations with an attacker's mindset and includes the range of people, process, and technology challenges and approaches. This presentation is brought to you by SentinelOne, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud security challenges
2. Familiarity with SecOps, AppSec, and developer roles
3. Interest in improving security posture and cross-functional alignment

title: Driving transformation for California’s workforce
description: California’s Employment Development Department (EDD) administers essential benefit programs such as unemployment insurance, disability insurance, and paid family leave. Serving one of the largest and most diverse populations in the country, EDD collects and disburses billions of dollars annually. This session dives deep on EDDNext, a comprehensive modernization effort to revamp benefit systems and transform the customer and employee experience. From improving self-service and language access with Amazon Connect to migrating a tax system to AWS that collects over $100 billion annually, learn how EDD is investing in a brighter future for millions of Californians.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of unemployment insurance, disability insurance, and paid family leave programs.
2. Understanding of large-scale government benefit administration and customer service.
3. Familiarity with cloud computing technologies, such as AWS.
4. Experience in system modernization and digital transformation projects.
5. Awareness of the challenges and opportunities in serving diverse populations.

title: Dr. Swami Sivasubramanian Keynote
description: Join Dr. Swami Sivasubramanian, VP of AI and Data at AWS, to discover how you can use a strong data foundation to create innovative and differentiated solutions for your customers. Hear from customer speakers with real-world examples of how they’ve used data to support a variety of use cases, including generative AI, to create unique customer experiences.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management and analytics
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Interest in exploring innovative use cases for data and AI
4. Desire to learn from industry experts and customer success stories
5. Openness to exploring new technologies and solutions

title: Dr. Werner Vogels Keynote
description: Join Dr. Werner Vogels, VP and CTO at Amazon.com, as he shares the critical lessons and strategies he has learned for managing increasingly complex systems. The keynote explores the core principles for embracing complexity, drawing on Amazon’s experiences building distributed systems at massive scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of distributed systems
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and scalability
3. Familiarity with Amazon's technology stack and services

title: Dual-stack global networks with AWS Cloud WAN and AWS Direct Connect
description: Get hands-on experience building a modern global network with AWS Cloud WAN and AWS Direct Connect. In this workshop, transform your network by replacing traditional data center interconnect circuits with AWS Direct Connect SiteLink. Also, dual-stack your hybrid network to prepare IPv6 connectivity for applications, and scale beyond limitations of IPv4 space. Finally, enhance your hybrid cloud network by implementing Amazon Route 53 Resolver endpoints with Route 53 Profiles to integrate your AWS and on-premises DNS infrastructure. Leave this workshop well-equipped to architect and deploy efficient hybrid network architectures. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of networking concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services, such as AWS Direct Connect and Amazon Route 53
3. Experience with cloud infrastructure deployment and management
4. Ability to access and use a laptop during the workshop

title: Duct tape will only go so far: Making legacy workloads cloud-native [REPEAT]
description: We all have workloads we’re not proud of: they’re old, often brittle, but they keep the mission running. Nonprofits have limited time and resources, so how do you even begin to upgrade or replace a legacy workload? In this builders’ session, get hands-on to move a legacy mission-based application into a modern cloud-native architecture. Modernize the routing and database layers of an existing monolithic application, and learn how to gradually shift traffic to your new stack. Leave this session knowing how to modernize your legacy workloads with confidence. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with cloud-native architecture
2. Basic understanding of routing and database concepts
3. Experience with application development and deployment
4. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: Duolingo gains resiliency for business-critical applications and data (sponsored by Clumio)
description: Duolingo, an online language learning platform, has 100M active learners that depend on it every month. Duolingo needed strong application resilience to continue delivering services in the event of major outages, accidental data loss, or cybersecurity incidents. Duolingo chose Clumio backup and recovery for hundreds of terabytes of Amazon DynamoDB data and petabytes of Amazon S3 data. Join this lightning talk to hear how, with Clumio, Duolingo gained a 70% reduction in backup costs, met recovery point objective (RPO) targets, and repurposed savings into innovation projects. This presentation is brought to you by Clumio, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this presentation would be:

1. Understanding of Duolingo's online language learning platform.
2. Knowledge of the importance of application resilience and data protection in the event of outages, data loss, or cybersecurity incidents.
3. Familiarity with Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon S3 as data storage solutions.
4. Understanding of backup and recovery solutions, such as Clumio, and their role in ensuring data protection and cost optimization.
5. Interest in learning how Duolingo leveraged Clumio to achieve their data protection and cost-saving goals.

title: Dynamic security at scale: Cedar policies for continuous authorization (sponsored by StrongDM)
description: Join the CTO of StrongDM for a live demo showcasing how Cedar policies and continuous authorization enable fine-grained control over your systems. With real-world experience as a Cedar adopter, StrongDM uses context signals across your enterprise to enforce policies that block suspicious or unsanctioned actions in real time. This lightning talk highlights how StrongDM’s Zero Trust-based approach ensures that risk assessments dynamically determine access and the appropriate level of friction for critical actions. Discover how Cedar's flexibility and precision help you build resilient security measures that adapt to evolving threats while maintaining an optimal user experience. This presentation is brought to you by StrongDM, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Zero Trust security principles
2. Familiarity with access control and authorization mechanisms
3. Interest in real-time risk assessment and dynamic access control
4. Desire to learn about StrongDM's Cedar policies and continuous authorization
5. Curiosity about building resilient security measures that adapt to evolving threats

title: Easily port .NET Framework applications to Linux with Amazon Q [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, gain hands-on experience porting a .NET Framework application to cross-platform .NET. Use Amazon Q Code Transformation for .NET, a modernization tool powered by generative AI that significantly reduces the time to migrate applications from Windows Server to Linux. Learn how migrating to Linux helps you avoid additional licensing fees and gain performance and security benefits. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with .NET Framework
2. Basic understanding of cross-platform .NET
3. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: eBPF superpowers for containers on AWS
description: eBPF is a kernel technology enabling high-performance and low overhead tooling for security, observability, and networking. It allows for safe kernel-level access that won’t crash your machines, and is ideal for instrumenting containerized workloads without the overhead and operational complexity of sidecars. Learn from Liz Rice, AWS Container Hero and author of O’Reilly books “Learning eBPF” and “Container Security”, why eBPF is such a game-changer! See demos of open source eBPF-based tools being used for real-world tasks, like observing workload performance, detecting or even blocking potentially malicious behaviors, and obtaining forensics about a security compromise.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of Linux kernel internals
2. Familiarity with system programming and low-level networking concepts
3. Knowledge of containerization and container security best practices
4. Exposure to observability and performance monitoring tools

title: EC2 Nitro networking under the hood
description: Gain valuable insights into the life of a packet on an EC2 instance and learn about key strategies for optimizing instance network performance for your workload. In this session, discover the cutting-edge technologies that are shaping the networking experience on an EC2 instance and unlock new levels of performance. Learn how AWS scales a single VPC to grow at unprecedented scale and explore innovations in Nitro to achieve optimal performance for different types of applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of networking concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS EC2 and VPC
3. Knowledge of performance optimization techniques

title: Edge-to-cloud robotic solutions for optimizing manufacturing processes
description: Within manufacturing, the integration of robotics has revolutionized operations. However, successful implementations require careful planning. Robotic simulation is a powerful tool to virtually test and validate robotic systems before physical deployments, minimizing risks and optimizing processes. This chalk talk presents architectural patterns and a demonstration of robotic simulation with AWS IoT Greengrass and AWS IoT Core, enabling edge-to-cloud connectivity for manufacturers. This approach facilitates a validation of robotic systems using real-world data from Open 3D Engine (O3DE) simulators and AWS IoT Core, enabling manufacturers to simulate the entire manufacturing process including robotic systems, conveyors, and other equipment before physical implementation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of robotics and manufacturing operations
2. Understanding of robotic simulation and its benefits
3. Familiarity with AWS IoT Greengrass and AWS IoT Core
4. Experience with Open 3D Engine (O3DE) simulators
5. Understanding of edge-to-cloud connectivity in manufacturing

title: Education revolutionized with generative AI
description: Imagine a world where learning is no longer a one-size-fits-all experience but a personalized journey tailored to each individual’s needs. Learn how to harness the power of generative AI and AWS services to revolutionize the education space. In this workshop, see how generative AI can aid with different learning styles, productivity, and accessibility for students. Get ready to be inspired by the art of the possible in leveraging technology to transform the way people learn. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of generative AI
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Proficiency in using a laptop

title: Effective Amazon Neptune data modeling strategies in the age of gen AI
description: The emergence of generative AI has also seen the rise of innovative new graph workloads like GraphRAG and natural language querying. In this chalk talk, learn how to deploy these new workload types on Amazon Neptune. Explore how these new workloads can change your approach to building graph data model and querying strategies.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of graph databases
2. Understanding of natural language processing
3. Familiarity with Amazon Neptune
4. Experience in data modeling and querying strategies

title: Effectively model costs for your serverless applications [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, gain insights into modeling the cost of serverless applications on AWS. Learn how traditional approaches based on CPU, memory, storage, and networking costs don’t directly apply. Discover how to holistically model costs for distributed serverless architectures by considering request loads, payload sizes, and service pricing. Walk through an example serverless application architecture, and leave with practical knowledge for accurately estimating costs tailored to modern, serverless application designs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and serverless architecture
2. Understanding of cost factors in traditional cloud computing
3. Exposure to distributed system design

title: Effective tagging strategies for multi-account application operations
description: Developing and implementing an effective tagging and resource management strategy is time consuming and complex, especially when you’re managing thousands of resources across multiple applications and AWS accounts. In this chalk talk, you learn how to discover untagged resources, organize resources into applications, and then manage those applications across your AWS Organizations. You then get an opportunity to ask AWS experts questions about how to manage resources and applications at scale.

title: Efficient cross-account VPC sharing for streamlined network management [REPEAT]
description: For organizations considering or migrating to AWS, designing the VPC network architecture is a foundational step to achieve efficient management, cost-effectiveness, and the best performance. In addition to AWS networking best practices, the use of VPC sharing allows small admin teams to centrally manage large-scale networks and free development teams from infrastructure setup tasks. In this builders’ session, learn how to build a multi-account shared VPC architecture, and discover how DNS, AD integration, and routing operate in the environment. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Basic understanding of AWS VPC
2. Familiarity with AWS networking concepts
3. Experience with AWS account management and administration

title: Efficient incremental processing with Apache Iceberg at Netflix
description: Incremental processing substantially reduces compute costs and execution time, leading to fewer failures and less manual intervention. However, enabling it on large-scale data workflows presents significant challenges around scalability, ease of adoption, and user experience. In this session, learn how Apache Iceberg and Netflix Maestro are being leveraged to build an incremental processing solution (IPS) that processes new or changed data, reducing costs and time while ensuring data accuracy and freshness. Combining Iceberg’s metadata capabilities with Maestro’s workflow orchestration allows for the efficient management of late-arriving data and backfills in various different scenarios beyond append-only mode.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Knowledge of Apache Iceberg
2. Understanding of Netflix Maestro
3. Familiarity with data workflows and incremental processing
4. Experience with scalability and user experience challenges in large-scale data processing
5. Interest in cost-effective and efficient data processing solutions

title: Efficiently manage petabytes of vehicle video with AWS IoT and AI
description: In this interactive chalk talk, explore using AWS IoT and AI vision models to categorize “incident” versus “no incident” videos captured by fleet vehicle dashboard cameras, stored in Amazon S3. Learn how to move “no incident” videos to cost-effective storage tiers and use “incident” videos to train edge AI models that power real-time driver guidance. See how to use services like Amazon Kinesis Video Streams, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon S3, and Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth to address the challenges faced by transportation and logistics companies in managing petabytes of video data cost-effectively.

4. Knowledge of transportation and logistics industry challenges

title: Effortless game launches: How League of Legends runs at scale on AWS
description: Discover how Riot Games, the studio behind League of Legends and VALORANT, revolutionized their game server infrastructure with AWS. Explore how they used AWS auto scaling to significantly cut their game server fleet costs while boosting their ability to rapidly respond to shifts in player demand, which helped them take creative risks in updating their games. Learn how they developed a flexible Game Provisioning Platform that can automatically spin up game servers tailored to the unique requirements of different Riot titles, allowing them to quickly roll out new game modes, test experimental ideas, and provide the best possible player experiences.

4. Understanding of scalability and cost optimization in game server management

description: Gain deep visibility into your workloads, without complex instrumentation. In this chalk talk, explore Amazon CloudWatch features that enable easy collection, aggregation, and visualization of metrics, logs, and traces. Discover how Amazon CloudWatch Container Insights and Amazon CloudWatch Lambda Insights provide summarized insights into your containers and serverless environments using metrics and logs. Learn how Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights collects metrics and traces from your applications, displaying key metrics like call volume, availability, latency, faults, and errors in seconds, with minimal setup from frontend to database.
