description: In this builders’ session, you learn how to use Amazon EKS to implement elastic scaling strategies for 5G core network functions, ensuring high availability and resilience. Explore cold standby Amazon EKS clusters for efficient disaster recovery across Availability Zones. Rapidly provision standby environments to handle failures or sudden traffic spikes. Implement gradual, intelligent scaling using Karpenter, provisioning worker nodes based on real-time resource utilization. Optimize costs while meeting dynamic workload demands. Hands-on labs guide you through configuring cold standby, setting up Karpenter, and simulating recovery scenarios. title: Elastic serverless: Stateless architecture for speed and scale (sponsored by Elastic)
description: See how Elastic's new cloud-native Search AI Lake architecture brings low-latency querying on vast object stores, complete with built-in vector database capabilities. Learn how to interactively search a practically unlimited amount of data with uncompromised speed and scale on Elastic Cloud Serverless, which removes all operational overhead so you can get started fast and seamlessly scale your workloads on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Elastic, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud-native architectures
2. Familiarity with object storage and vector databases
3. Experience with Elastic Cloud or AWS services

title: Elevate AP with AWS AI/ML: Modernize SAP processes using generative AI
description: This bootcamp is intended for AWS Partners. In this hands-on bootcamp, you are guided through an intelligent document processing scenario and shown how to automate a paper-to-post invoice management process by integrating SAP with AWS artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) services natively using the AWS SDK for SAP ABAP. You also learn how you can build smart audit assistants using the Amazon Bedrock generative AI service to gain audit insights from invoices. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience as an AWS Partner
2. Familiarity with AWS services and SDK for SAP ABAP
3. Basic understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning
4. Ability to work with invoices and document processing
5. Access to a laptop for the hands-on activities

title: Elevate contact center performance with AI-driven agent coaching
description: Attend this hands-on workshop and learn how Amazon Connect and generative AI can be applied to boost contact center agent development and training. Explore how to leverage data and insights from Amazon Connect to create tailored coaching programs with personalized guidance for each agent based on business-specific and behavioral scenarios. Then learn how to use generative AI to automate the coaching process through immersive training sessions, empowering agents to elevate their skills and improve customer engagement. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of contact center operations
2. Familiarity with Amazon Connect
3. Familiarity with generative AI concepts
4. Proficiency in using a laptop

title: Elevate customer engagement with AWS End User Messaging
description: In this real-world scenario, step into the shoes of a fictitious taco truck owner who wants to enhance customer engagement. This interactive workshop explores how to implement SMS notifications for order pickup and how to create a customer loyalty signup experience using AWS End User Messaging. Learn how to boost message reliability and how to utilize multiple messaging channels for a unified user experience. Gain actionable skills to improve end user communications with AWS End User Messaging, ultimately driving customer satisfaction and operational efficiency for your taco truck. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of SMS and customer engagement
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Ability to use a laptop for the interactive workshop

title: Elevate service response with video using Amazon Connect and gen AI
description: Attend this builders’ session to learn how to use video capabilities from Amazon Connect, integrated with generative AI for computer vision to implement an intelligent customer service response management solution. Experts guide you step-by-step through the process of integrating web video chat in Amazon Connect with AI-powered cameras for real-time event detection and analysis. You then act as contact center agents, receiving AI-powered recommendations from Amazon Q in Connect based on live video feeds (enabling immediate service responses and accurate personnel dispatch) and experiencing the power of visual guidance in customer service response management. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Connect
2. Basic understanding of computer vision and generative AI
3. Experience with web development and integration

title: Elevate smart home experiences with IoT-based AI/ML models at the edge
description: The next generation of smart home solutions is expected to harness the power of AI to a new level, delivering unprecedented convenience, hyper-personalization, and elevated intelligence. Modern AI assistants will learn user preferences, schedules, and habits, enabling proactive automation tailored to individual needs. In this session, learn how to train ML models optimized for smart home devices, set up CI/CD pipelines to efficiently distribute model updates, and implement mechanisms to automatically capture device data for retraining. Also, see how AWS customers are combining AI, IoT, and seamless interoperability to transform living spaces into truly adaptive environments.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of machine learning and AI
2. Understanding of IoT and smart home technologies
3. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and model deployment
4. Experience in data collection and model retraining
5. Awareness of AWS services and their integration capabilities

title: Elevate your cloud operations with an efficient governance strategy
description: As you grow and scale your cloud adoption, you need to build a robust governance strategy that seamlessly integrates technology, people, and processes. This chalk talk offers actionable insights on how to streamline your multi-account vending, build efficient and fault-tolerant workloads, and maintain control while effectively managing your AWS costs. Learn how to utilize AWS Trusted Advisor to make informed architectural decisions to ensure your workloads are cost-efficient, performant, secure, and resilient. Explore how services such as AWS Organizations and AWS Control Tower can transform your cloud operations using AWS Well-Architected best practices.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this chalk talk would be:

1. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Experience in managing multi-account environments.
3. Understanding of cloud governance and cost optimization strategies.
4. Knowledge of AWS Well-Architected Framework.
5. Desire to streamline cloud operations and improve overall cloud adoption.

title: Elevate your contact center performance with AI-powered analytics
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is unlocking deeper insights about contact center performance, including customer sentiment, agent performance, and workforce scheduling. Join this session to hear how contact center managers are leveraging AI-powered analytics in Amazon Connect to proactively identify and act on opportunities to improve customer service outcomes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of contact center operations
2. Familiarity with customer service and workforce management concepts
3. Knowledge of data analytics and performance metrics

title: Elevate your cost allocation strategy with AWS Cost Categories [REPEAT]
description: A key FinOps principle is that everyone takes ownership of cloud usage. Cost allocation is a process that enables this principle by identifying, categorizing, and assigning the costs of cloud computing resources to specific users, departments, projects, or any other relevant grouping within an organization. Join this builders' session for a hands-on experience using AWS Cost Categories to simplify cost allocation processes. Learn how to map costs with dimensions, create custom cost groupings, define split charge rules, distribute shared costs, and explore advanced implementations and best practices. Access to your AWS Organizations payer account is recommended. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and cost management.
2. Access to an AWS Organizations payer account.
3. Laptop for hands-on participation.

title: Elevate your cost allocation strategy with AWS Cost Categories [REPEAT]
description: A key FinOps principle is that everyone takes ownership of cloud usage. Cost allocation is a process that enables this principle by identifying, categorizing, and assigning the costs of cloud computing resources to specific users, departments, projects, or any other relevant grouping within an organization. Join this builders' session for a hands-on experience using AWS Cost Categories to simplify cost allocation processes. Learn how to map costs with dimensions, create custom cost groupings, define split charge rules, distribute shared costs, and explore advanced implementations and best practices. Access to your AWS Organizations payer account is recommended. You must bring your laptop to participate.

2. Access to an AWS Organizations payer account

title: Elevating community support with AI automation [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how AWS is elevating community support using intelligent agents that learn from our documents, images, and databases and take repetitive actions for us. During this development process, learn how several tasks can be automated with developer-friendly tools, even if you have no previous experience with AI/ML. A similar approach can be applied to multiple use cases.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with AI/ML concepts
3. Experience with developer tools and automation

title: Elevating community support with AI automation [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how AWS is elevating community support using intelligent agents that learn from our documents, images, and databases and take repetitive actions for us. During this development process, learn how several tasks can be automated with developer-friendly tools, even if you have no previous experience with AI/ML. A similar approach can be applied to multiple use cases.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AI/ML concepts (even if no previous experience)
3. Interest in automating repetitive tasks and improving community support

title: Elevating the developer experience with Backstage on AWS
description: In an era where developer productivity and collaboration are crucial, Backstage is a game-changer. Utilizing an open source framework, Backstage streamlines the developer experience by providing a unified interface for your cloud and on-premises infrastructure tools and services. Explore how Toyota leverages Backstage as a component of their platform engineering strategy and how you can transform your development workflows to create an exceptional developer experience. Also look at how to empower generative AI models through your developer portal to drive a broad set of capabilities.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud and on-premises infrastructure tools and services
2. Familiarity with open-source frameworks and developer productivity tools
3. Knowledge of platform engineering strategies and developer experience optimization
4. Exposure to generative AI models and their integration with developer portals

title: Elevating the traveler experience: Marriott’s digital transformation
description: With $40B+ digital revenue processing on AWS, Marriott's digital transformation enhanced guest experiences and property associates ease of usage, increasing engineering velocity 4 times and achieving $60M+ in savings through FinOps and AI. Learn how Marriott successfully migrated, modernized, and built cloud-native applications serving 200M+ Bonvoy guests and 9,000+ properties using Amazon Aurora and Amazon EKS, secured by modern SASE architecture and secure-by-design concepts. Discover their cloud migration strategies, modernization approach, cloud-native practices, and collaboration with AWS that drove this success. Gain access to Marriott's AWS Migration Hub journey template to follow best practices and replicate success in your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud migration strategies
2. Knowledge of modern application architecture and cloud-native practices
3. Familiarity with AWS services like Amazon Aurora and Amazon EKS
4. Experience in FinOps and AI implementation
5. Exposure to secure-by-design concepts and SASE architecture

title: Elevating your data security posture through scalable observability
description: As organizations mature in their cloud journeys—from a single application in an account to having multiple accounts across multiple Regions—understanding data security at scale helps them architect their environments. Delve into the art of balancing data security, observability, and cost as you scale with AWS data protection services. Gain insights into best practices for safeguarding data, implementing least privilege, monitoring, and decentralized management to enable developer agility while satisfying security and compliance controls. For seasoned cloud architects and security professionals, gain the knowledge and tools to optimize your approach to data protection in AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Understanding of data security concepts and best practices.
3. Experience in cloud architecture and design.
4. Knowledge of security and compliance requirements.
5. Familiarity with AWS data protection services and tools.

title: Eliminating AI adoption barriers: Moving from hype to empirical success (sponsored by Qlik)
description: This session showcases real-world customers following a blueprint for AI success developed by Qlik and Accenture. Learn about building real-time AI data pipelines from structured and unstructured sources and creating a trusted data foundation with continuous verification of AI data readiness and automated remediation. Also explore how to define a data architecture strategy that efficiently processes data at various layers—from object stores to open table formats to specific engines—thereby optimizing compute spend. Finally, explore how to create data products for a centralized, accessible, and standardized way of unlocking the value of enterprise data, and learn how to deliver reliable and explainable results from generative AI. This presentation is brought to you by Qlik, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data pipelines and data processing architectures
2. Knowledge of structured and unstructured data sources
3. Familiarity with data verification and remediation processes
4. Experience in defining data architecture strategies
5. Understanding of data products and generative AI

title: Embedded analytics: An architectural deep dive [REPEAT]
description: Dive into the architecture of embedding customized, interactive visuals, and dashboards into your applications with Amazon QuickSight and the generative BI capabilities of Amazon Q. Explore best practices for maintaining a consistent branded experience within your applications. Learn about architectural patterns and deployment options around authentication, authorization, and automation, and how to embed AI-powered data Q&A to help you build integrated experiences.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of business intelligence (BI) and data visualization concepts
2. Familiarity with web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
3. Basic knowledge of AWS services and cloud architecture
4. Familiarity with data management and analysis

title: Embedded analytics: An architectural deep dive [REPEAT]
description: Dive into the architecture of embedding customized, interactive visuals, and dashboards into your applications with Amazon QuickSight and the generative BI capabilities of Amazon Q. Explore best practices for maintaining a consistent branded experience within your applications. Learn about architectural patterns and deployment options around authentication, authorization, and automation, and how to embed AI-powered data Q&A to help you build integrated experiences.

5. Interest in building interactive and customized data-driven applications.

title: Embed seamless customer support with Amazon Connect [REPEAT]
description: Delivering exceptional customer service and support is challenging, as they demand attention across numerous touch points, like physical products, product documentation, and mobile customer support apps. This chalk talk explores specific strategies for elevating your customer experience with Amazon Connect. Learn how to create a cohesive, frictionless support experience using techniques like embedded channels, proactive outreach, and out-of-the-box information sharing that will delight your customers.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Basic understanding of customer service and support operations.
2. Familiarity with different customer touchpoints, such as physical products, product documentation, and mobile customer support apps.
3. Knowledge of Amazon Connect, a cloud-based contact center service.
4. Interest in exploring strategies for enhancing the customer experience.
5. Willingness to learn about techniques like embedded channels, proactive outreach, and out-of-the-box information sharing.

title: Embed seamless customer support with Amazon Connect [REPEAT]
description: Delivering exceptional customer service and support is challenging, as they demand attention across numerous touch points, like physical products, product documentation, and mobile customer support apps. This chalk talk explores specific strategies for elevating your customer experience with Amazon Connect. Learn how to create a cohesive, frictionless support experience using techniques like embedded channels, proactive outreach, and out-of-the-box information sharing that will delight your customers.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with Amazon Connect or similar contact center platforms
3. Knowledge of various customer touchpoints and communication channels
4. Ability to analyze and improve customer experience
5. Familiarity with techniques like embedded channels, proactive outreach, and information sharing

title: Emotionally intelligent leadership for an AI-powered future
description: As leaders create and navigate a future fueled by AI, they need to reimagine their leadership approaches, integrating their cognitive intelligence with their emotional intelligence to build adaptable, resilient, and innovative organizations. These leaders will have deep empathy for their customers and foster a culture of creativity and psychological safety among their employees. They will be data-driven but also authentically human. This session helps executives understand the EPIC attributes that empower future-ready leaders—empathy, purpose, inspiration, and connection—so they can drive successful outcomes for their businesses, their customers, and their people in the new human + AI era.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of the role of AI in shaping the future business landscape
2. Familiarity with the concept of emotional intelligence and its importance in leadership
3. Awareness of the need for adaptability, resilience, and innovation in organizations
4. Knowledge of the importance of customer empathy and fostering a culture of creativity and psychological safety
5. Appreciation for the balance between data-driven decision-making and authentic human leadership

title: Emotionally intelligent security leadership to drive business impact
description: Elevate your leadership and learn to align security needs with strategic business outcomes, spearhead impactful transformations, and cultivate a sustainable security culture. Get an inside look how AWS and its customers lead security with empathy, translate security purpose into results, inspire innovation, and foster connections to improve positive escalation culture. Uncover proven strategies to overcome people challenges, empower security champions, and achieve scalable security success. Become empowered to lead with precision, acquire the art of connecting security objectives to meaningful business impact, and steer your organization toward a future where security is a catalyst for success and resilience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience in security management or leadership roles
2. Understanding of business strategy and alignment with security objectives
3. Familiarity with cloud security practices, particularly in the AWS ecosystem
4. Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with cross-functional teams
5. Desire to develop empathetic leadership skills and foster a positive security culture

title: Empower and elevate: Best practices for empowering seller communities
description: In today's competitive marketplace, business success often hinges on the effectiveness of its seller communities. This session provides information for actionable strategies and practical training techniques to empower sellers, enhance their capabilities, and drive performance. Attendees leave equipped with the tools and knowledge necessary to build and sustain high-performing sellers on AWS solutions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of sales and marketing principles
2. Familiarity with AWS solutions and services
3. Experience in managing or training sales teams

title: Empower compute-heavy workloads with burst-to-cloud storage [REPEAT]
description: Do you have spiky or unpredictable workloads with high performance requirements? Are your on-premises compute resources inadequate when tasked to accelerate and scale applications at a moment’s notice? Join this session to discuss how leveraging hybrid cloud strategies with Amazon file storage makes it faster and easier for you to process file data, regardless of where the data is stored. Learn how capabilities like cloud busting, scalable performance and high-speed file caching enable flexibility for workloads like distributed ML training, media rendering and transcoding, electronic design automation (EDA), and big data analytics.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. High-performance computing requirements
2. Inadequate on-premises compute resources
3. Need for accelerating and scaling applications quickly
4. Workloads that involve file data processing
5. Desire for flexibility in workloads like distributed ML training, media rendering, EDA, and big data analytics

title: Empower compute-heavy workloads with burst-to-cloud storage [REPEAT]
description: Do you have spiky or unpredictable workloads with high performance requirements? Are your on-premises compute resources inadequate when tasked to accelerate and scale applications at a moment’s notice? Join this session to discuss how leveraging hybrid cloud strategies with Amazon file storage makes it faster and easier for you to process file data, regardless of where the data is stored. Learn how capabilities like cloud busting, scalable performance and high-speed file caching enable flexibility for workloads like distributed ML training, media rendering and transcoding, electronic design automation (EDA), and big data analytics.

title: Empower executives: Self-service dashboards with Generative BI
description: In today’s data-driven business landscape, executives and decision-makers need real-time access to actionable insights. However, traditional business intelligence (BI) tools often require technical expertise and can be time-consuming to navigate. This hands-on workshop shows you how to empower your executives to get insights on their own. Leverage the latest Generative BI capabilities in Amazon QuickSight to build a powerful executive dashboard in minutes using natural language. Learn how Amazon Q makes it easier for business users to understand data with executive summaries, context-aware Q&A, and data stories that help drive decisions from insights. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this workshop:

1. Basic understanding of business intelligence and data analysis.
2. Familiarity with data visualization tools or dashboards.
3. Access to a laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Empowering AWS developers with telecom network capabilities
description: AWS is collaborating with telcos globally to offer developers access to programmable networks through APIs providing trusted network data like device location, SIM status, identity verification, and on-demand network quality control. AWS developers can combine these APIs with cloud and software components to build network-aware applications. Learn how AWS simplifies the discovery, subscription, and usage of network APIs from multiple telcos showcasing new applications across verticals on AWS. Hear how this initiative creates a new go-to-market channel for telcos, allowing them to monetize network assets by reaching the AWS global developer community, fostering innovation while unlocking new revenue streams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services and APIs
2. Understanding of network infrastructure and APIs
3. Experience in building network-aware applications
4. Familiarity with the telco industry and their offerings
5. Ability to leverage AWS cloud services and components

title: Empowering PMs & data scientists: A self-service experimentation guide (sponsored by LaunchDarkly)
description: Experimentation—using specific metrics to evaluate the impact of features you roll out—is essential to making data-driven technology decisions. But first, organizations must overcome the technical challenge of building a scalable experimentation program. In this session, discover the steps needed to create a scalable experimentation program—from connecting your data sources to designing effective experiments and analyzing results to identify winning variations. Additionally, learn how to further empower your product and data teams by letting them run advanced experimentation analysis from within your data warehouse. This presentation is brought to you by LaunchDarkly, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the session would be:

1. Understanding of data-driven decision making
2. Familiarity with experimentation and A/B testing
3. Knowledge of data sources and data warehousing
4. Familiarity with product and data team responsibilities

title: Empowering stateful workloads on Amazon EKS with AWS storage services
description: Attend this session to learn proven methods for unlocking scalability, flexibility, and resiliency. Explore the integration of AWS storage services with Amazon EKS to effectively run stateful applications. Discover best practices for allowing thousands of pods to access shared data volumes concurrently. This session demonstrates simple ways to deploy stateful workloads on EKS while optimizing performance. Attendees leave this demo-packed session with actionable insights and resources to start mastering stateful applications on Amazon EKS right away.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Amazon EKS
2. Familiarity with AWS storage services
3. Knowledge of containerization and Kubernetes

title: Empowering the next-generation industrial operator with generative AI
description: Georgia-Pacific (GP) is one of the largest manufacturers of pulp and paper, dispensers, packaging, and wood and gypsum building products. Like many manufacturers, GP faces workforce attrition challenges as senior workers retire and apprentice operators need to upskill quickly. Hear how GP’s Amazon Bedrock–enabled industrial operator assistant provides a natural language interface for machine diagnostic troubleshooting based on unstructured data (SOP docs, machine manuals, etc.) and structured real-time machine data to retrieve and summarize relevant content in minutes. This reduces mean time to resolution by empowering apprentice workers to troubleshoot independently with real-time, contextualized machine data.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given scenario would be:

1. Knowledge of pulp and paper manufacturing processes.
2. Understanding of workforce challenges in the manufacturing industry, particularly related to senior worker retirement and apprentice upskilling.
3. Familiarity with industrial automation and machine diagnostic systems.
4. Awareness of natural language processing and its application in industrial settings.
5. Knowledge of unstructured and structured data integration for troubleshooting and decision-making.

title: Empowering the supercomputing community with Amazon Braket
description: The Pawsey Supercomputing Centre in Perth, Australia, is home to the largest supercomputer in the Southern Hemisphere and is spearheading the integration of quantum capabilities with traditional HPC workloads. In this chalk talk, see their architecture for running a national hub for quantum computing leveraging Amazon Braket and HPC resources. We demonstrate how to configure Braket to manage users, projects, budgets, and different devices to support a national research and education effort, all in one place.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of quantum computing and its integration with traditional HPC workloads.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Braket and its capabilities.
3. Knowledge of managing users, projects, budgets, and different devices for a national research and education effort.

title: Empowering women in AI: Celebrating women leading the gen AI frontier
description: Join the AWS Startups team for an afternoon empowering and celebrating women in AI. This session features a panel of seasoned AI startup founders and investors, alongside a tactical demo of Amazon Bedrock, and wraps up with the reveal of the Women of Gen AI Portrait Project, spotlighting leaders in the space. The goal of this session is to foster a community of women building and investing in AI, demonstrating how AWS can empower and elevate your success.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Interest in AI and entrepreneurship
2. Desire to learn from experienced AI startup founders and investors
3. Willingness to participate in a community-building event

title: Empower your business with defense-in-depth architecture for gen AI
description: Generative AI promises transformative innovation, and as SMBs increasingly adopt generative AI applications, safeguarding these technologies with practical, cost-effective strategies is crucial. In this builders’ session, learn how to enhance your security posture by using defense in depth, and see an architecture with layered defenses across trust boundaries. Learn strategies to innovate while increasing resilience, build on the secure AWS infrastructure, and integrate AI/ML-specific security. Explore solutions like guardrails, observability, and responsible AI practices to ensure the safety and integrity of AI-powered solutions, harnessing generative AI while mitigating risks. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI and its applications
2. Basic knowledge of cybersecurity concepts and practices
3. Familiarity with AWS infrastructure and services
4. Interest in integrating AI/ML-specific security measures
5. Ability to actively participate in the session by bringing a laptop

title: Enable fine-grained access control for your APIs [REPEAT]
description: Implement fine-grained, context-aware access control for your APIs in this hands-on builders’ session. Explore how to define granular, policy-based access controls using roles and attributes with the expressive, open source Cedar policy language. Integrate with Amazon Cognito user pools via the Amazon Cognito authorizer to enforce these fine-grained permissions in your APIs. Learn practical skills for enhancing API security through attribute-based access policies tailored to your application's unique requirements. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon Cognito and API Gateway.
2. Understanding of access control concepts, such as roles, attributes, and policy-based permissions.
3. Ability to write and execute code in a programming language (e.g., Python, Node.js).
4. Laptop with a development environment set up.
5. Familiarity with the Cedar policy language.

title: Enable fine-grained access control for your APIs [REPEAT]
description: Implement fine-grained, context-aware access control for your APIs in this hands-on builders’ session. Explore how to define granular, policy-based access controls using roles and attributes with the expressive, open source Cedar policy language. Integrate with Amazon Cognito user pools via the Amazon Cognito authorizer to enforce these fine-grained permissions in your APIs. Learn practical skills for enhancing API security through attribute-based access policies tailored to your application's unique requirements. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this hands-on session would likely include:

1. Familiarity with API development and security concepts.
2. Basic understanding of AWS services, particularly Amazon Cognito.
3. Experience with policy-based access control or a willingness to learn.
4. Proficiency in a programming language, as you'll be implementing the access control policies.
5. Availability of a laptop to participate in the hands-on exercises.

title: Enabling the future: Nuclear fusion on Elastic Fabric Adapter
description: Fusion energy is a potential source of clean energy that could contribute to the global transition to a net-zero economy. It has been a topic of research for the last 50+ years, and now cloud technologies are helping to accelerate its pace of development. In this session, hear from AWS energy experts on the role of cloud technologies in fusion. Also learn how Realta Fusion has leveraged Amazon EC2 HPC instances and Elastic Fabric Adapter to demonstrate, for the first time, that plasma physics stability simulations are possible using the highest-fidelity plasma models available.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of fusion energy and its potential as a clean energy source.
2. Knowledge of the history and ongoing research in fusion energy development.
3. Familiarity with cloud technologies and their applications in various industries.
4. Awareness of the role of high-performance computing (HPC) in fusion energy research.
5. Understanding of plasma physics and simulation techniques.

title: End-to-end acceleration of vehicle software development [REPEAT]
description: The vehicle software development lifecycle is more than just writing lines of code. Months are spent in requirements engineering, code development and unit testing, and software validation. In this chalk talk, experts dive into each of these areas, showcasing how AWS can help accelerate the process with generative AI for interactive requirements development, code generation, and test-case generation. Learn how this, coupled with virtual validation targets on AWS, can enable up to 80% of the software development process to take place in the cloud, achieving a shift left in development and validation by somewhere between 6 and 18 months.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of software development lifecycle
2. Knowledge of AWS services and capabilities
3. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications in software development
4. Experience in requirements engineering, code development, and software validation
5. Awareness of the benefits of cloud-based software development and validation

Learn how this, coupled with virtual validation targets on AWS, can enable up to 80% of the software development process to take place in the cloud, achieving a shift left in development and validation by somewhere between 6 and 18 months.

title: End-to-end biological foundation model workflows for drug discovery [REPEAT]
description: In this session, learn how to orchestrate multiple state-of-the-art (SOTA) biological foundation models (FMs) together to create a seamless drug discovery workflow using AWS HealthOmics. Explore how to combine multiple FMs, and get hands-on experience automating a canonical drug discovery pathway.

Prerequisites:

2. Knowledge of AWS HealthOmics platform
3. Familiarity with drug discovery workflows

title: End-to-end biological foundation model workflows for drug discovery [REPEAT]

title: Enhance citizen services and operations with conversational AI
description: Conversational AI agents can streamline citizen services and improve government operations. Deploying these technologies in the public sector requires careful consideration of ethical, security, and regulatory concerns. In this chalk talk, explore approaches for building AI agents with robust guardrails and safeguards that ensure they operate in alignment with public sector values and mandates. Learn how to add safeguards that reduce the risk of off-purpose usage.

description: In this chalk talk intended for developers, learn how to seamlessly integrate AI-powered security services into your daily software development lifecycle (SDLC) to enhance code security. See how to normalize and consolidate security findings to gain unified visibility into application security. Finally, learn how you can utilize generative AI to analyze security findings and streamline remediation through a code security management UI.

Explore the architecture of a guided self-service chat experience with step-by-step guides, streamlined authentication flows, and third-party application integration. Learn how to apply generative AI to summarize your customers’ self-service experiences and present those summaries to agents, helping them deliver seamless customer experiences.

title: Enhancing security and operational excellence with AWS observability
description: Achieving operational excellence really comes down to understanding what’s going on in your systems, including security events. This session explores how observability can help you detect and investigate security and operational events as early and quickly as possible. Learn techniques for setting up intelligent monitoring and alerting to detect issues—before they escalate. Explore strategies for conducting efficient root cause analysis and automating remediation actions to minimize operational disruptions. Whether you’re focused on application development, infrastructure operations, or security, this session equips you with practical approaches to strong observability with AWS.

title: Enhancing shop floor efficiency with AI-driven resolutions (sponsored by Cognizant)
description: Shop floor machine operators can now report problems with machines to a bot that responds with solutions based on past technician fixes for similar issues. In this session, learn how this has sped up resolution by 10 to 20 times on average and could save $100,000 to $200,000 per year in each use case. Also learn how this enhances quality and adherence to regulations in the process outcome. This presentation is brought to you by Cognizant, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Availability of historical data on machine issues and technician fixes
2. Integration of a chatbot or conversational AI system to interact with shop floor operators
3. Ability to analyze past data and provide relevant solutions based on similar issues

5. Alignment with quality and regulatory requirements in the manufacturing process

title: Enhancing the United Airline experience for today’s digital consumer (sponsored by DXC Technology)
description: Changing consumer demand means airlines, like many industries, need to figure out how to meet the increasing consumer expectation of having instant access to information with a seamless experience and the highest data security. In this session, learn how United Airlines and DXC Technology have worked together with a digital-first approach to maintain an industry leading mobile app that increasingly bridges the digital and physical passenger experience. In addition, explore DXC Technology’s approach to unlocking the potential of predictability and greater operational effectiveness while solving for the security, compliance, and increasingly important data governance spaces in the AI era. This presentation is brought to you by DXC Technology, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session may include:

1. Understanding of the airline industry and its challenges.
2. Knowledge of digital transformation and the importance of mobile apps in the passenger experience.

4. Interest in exploring the partnership between United Airlines and DXC Technology.
5. Curiosity about DXC Technology's approach to unlocking the potential of predictability and operational effectiveness.

title: Ensuring data defensibility in the cloud era (sponsored by Rubrik)
description: As the volume and value of cloud data surges, defending it is an ever-increasing challenge. In 2022, 94% of cloud tenants were targeted every month, and 62% were successfully compromised. A focus on preventing incidents is no longer sufficient—data must be defensible, even after a compromise. This session explores how to expand your cybersecurity strategy, helping you control risk, recover quickly and safely in the event of an incident, and ensure your data and business stand resilient against cyberattacks. This presentation is brought to you by Rubrik, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and data storage
2. Awareness of cybersecurity threats and challenges
3. Knowledge of incident response and data recovery strategies
4. Familiarity with Rubrik and its partnership with AWS

title: Ensuring ethical use of AI models through consistent observability (sponsored by Datadog)
description: AI-based chatbots are transforming how we use and build applications. As a tech innovator, the Washington Post built an LLM-powered chatbot trained on custom data including documentation, internal processes, and runbooks using Amazon Bedrock. But LLMs can also come with challenges, such as identifying hallucinations at scale, protecting against abuse from prompt injection, and ensuring against inadvertent disclosure of data. In this session, Joe Croney, CTO of the Washington Post’s Arc XP Business, shares how they built the chatbot and how they use LLM observability to ensure it not only meets customer needs but is used ethically and responsibly. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AI-based chatbots and their applications
2. Understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their capabilities
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock or similar LLM deployment platforms
4. Experience in building custom data-driven applications
5. Awareness of the challenges and ethical considerations surrounding LLM-powered chatbots

Drawing from training delivered to over 40,000 professionals at Amazon and Twilio.org's crisis response work, we'll explore how to harness Amazon leadership principles like deliver results, earn trust, and bias for action to achieve remarkable self-confidence and to combat imposter syndrome. Get practical techniques and a detailed workbook, and a long-term plan to stay accountable, learn from failure, and create a fulfilling tech career as your true self.

2. Desire to learn from Amazon leadership principles

5. Experience in the fast-paced tech industry

description: With a growing number of data sources for tracking the environmental impact of your organization, it becomes challenging to discover, assess the validity of, and extract values from these assets across multiple teams. Join this lightning talk to learn how a sustainability data fabric, as well as generative AI–based insights, enables environmental, social, and governance (ESG) data collection, management, and reporting. Discover how, with more reliable data, your organization can solve challenges such as more accurately calculating your estimated carbon emissions, assessing climate risk, or understanding your biodiversity impact.

description: In today's fast-paced cloud computing landscape, organizations face numerous challenges in maintaining a secure, efficient, and cost-effective cloud infrastructure. AWS Trusted Advisor is a powerful tool that helps mitigate risks and optimize resource utilization, ensuring compliance with Well-Architected best practices and industry standards. This builders’ session dives deep into the capabilities of Trusted Advisor, exploring its various checks and recommendations tailored to different aspects of cloud management. Learn how to effectively utilize Trusted Advisor's features, such as automatic checks, customizable alerts, and actionable recommendations, to proactively identify and address potential risks within your AWS environments.

description: In this workshop, explore how you can evaluate your RAG components in Amazon Bedrock. These frameworks often offer various tools, utilities, and metrics to assess the performance of RAG systems across different aspects, such as retrieval accuracy, generation quality, and factual consistency. By using open source frameworks, generative AI developers can rigorously evaluate RAG models, identify strengths and weaknesses, and make informed decisions about model selection and deployment. title: Exchange structured and unstructured data seamlessly using data grants
description: In this lightning talk, learn how you can leverage data grants in AWS Data Exchange to easily and securely share data across AWS accounts and organizations. This session demonstrates how to create a data grant and extend it to another AWS account. Learn how to accept the data grant and work with the data using other AWS services.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this lightning talk would be:

1. Understanding of AWS Data Exchange
2. Familiarity with AWS account management
3. Basic knowledge of data sharing and access control
4. Familiarity with using other AWS services

title: Experience leading-edge AI for your next-gen applications (sponsored by Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.)
description: Qualcomm relentlessly innovates to deliver intelligent computing everywhere, helping organizations tackle their most important challenges. Qualcomm’s proven solutions are transforming major industries, and their Snapdragon platform powers extraordinary consumer experiences. In the lightning talk, learn about the latest Qualcomm innovations across AI, automotive, IoT, and cloud computing that can help organizations achieve endless possibilities and accelerate their hybrid cloud journeys. This presentation is brought to you by Qualcomm Technologies, Inc., an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Qualcomm's technology and innovations
2. Knowledge of Qualcomm's role in transforming major industries
3. Familiarity with Qualcomm's Snapdragon platform and its capabilities
4. Interest in Qualcomm's latest innovations in AI, automotive, IoT, and cloud computing
5. Awareness of Qualcomm's partnership with AWS

title: Explore generative AI use cases with LangChain and Amazon Bedrock
description: This Amazon Bedrock session teaches you how to use generative AI models for tasks like writing summaries, answering questions, and building chatbots. The session is based on real-world use cases and provides you with hands-on experience using API calls, software tools, and open source libraries. Discover how to use generative AI to improve your efficiency and build your own AI-powered applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning and AI concepts.
2. Familiarity with programming languages (e.g., Python) and APIs.
3. Experience with natural language processing (NLP) or text-based applications.
4. Awareness of open-source libraries and tools for AI/ML development.
5. Curiosity and willingness to explore generative AI models and their applications.

title: Explore generative business intelligence features in Amazon QuickSight
description: In this lab, leverage the new generative BI capabilities of Amazon QuickSight to analyze sample loan portfolio data and create a comprehensive dashboard that provides valuable insights to support further decision-making processes. Also create new visuals and generate calculations and summaries using Amazon QuickSight Q&A and storytelling features. Workstations are provided for you; no laptop required.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this lab would be:

1. Basic understanding of data analysis and visualization.
2. Familiarity with Amazon QuickSight or similar business intelligence (BI) tools.
3. Access to sample loan portfolio data.

title: Explore SAP BTP and AI use cases for extending your SAP applications (sponsored by SAP)
description: Learn how SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) can help you innovate, accelerate, and extend your SAP applications. Explore its application development, automation, integration, data and analytics, and AI use cases. Also hear real-world success stories on how businesses are leveraging SAP BTP. This presentation is brought to you by SAP, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of SAP applications
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and platform-as-a-service (PaaS) concepts
3. Interest in exploring innovative solutions for business applications

title: Explore the many ways to train foundation models on AWS
description: Training large-scale foundation models presents unique challenges. This session unravels the complexities of building and scaling these models. From selecting the optimal compute resources—including GPUs, AWS Trainium, and AWS Inferentia—to optimizing data pipelines with Amazon S3, Amazon FSx for Lustre, or NVMe and maximizing network performance with an Elastic Fabric Adapter. It also covers how Amazon SageMaker HyperPod can help you save up to 40% on training costs. Receive practical guidance for overcoming challenges and achieving peak performance in your foundation model training, and hear how customers leverage AWS AI chips to train their foundation models for a multi-agent personal AI.
prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning concepts
2. Familiarity with large-scale model training and deployment
3. Understanding of cloud computing resources and services
4. Proficiency in data engineering and pipeline optimization
5. Awareness of AWS AI-specific hardware and services

title: Explore what’s new in data governance with AWS analytics
description: Join this session to explore the latest innovations and features in AWS analytics that are revolutionizing data governance. Expert presenters guide you through the exciting developments in services like Amazon DataZone, AWS Lake Formation, and AWS Glue that are empowering organizations to establish robust data governance frameworks while maintaining stringent compliance standards.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of data management and governance concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon S3, AWS Glue, and AWS Lake Formation.
3. Knowledge of data security and compliance requirements.

title: Exploring hybrid quantum-classical computation with Amazon Braket
description: Hybrid algorithms, combining quantum and classical compute resources, are widely believed to be promising candidates for the first demonstrations of useful applications of quantum computers. Linear systems of equations, which play an important role in science and technology, are one such area where hybrid algorithms have been explored. In this workshop, learn how to use Amazon Braket Hybrid Jobs to implement the Variational Quantum Linear Solver algorithm to solve linear systems of equations on real quantum computers. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of quantum computing
2. Familiarity with linear algebra and systems of equations
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python)
4. Access to a laptop for the workshop

title: Exploring performance analysis with AWS Graviton instances
description: Many developers are working at a higher and higher level, which is fantastic from a productivity standpoint. However, when it comes to performance, it is often necessary to be closer to the metal to understand the dynamics of applications, study their behavior, and understand and fix their bottlenecks. In this code talk, AWS experts open a shell on an Amazon EC2 instance and dig into the system to see which tools and resources you can use, including the Amazon Aperf tool. Learn as they write some mini-applications to study their performance behavior and troubleshoot how to improve them.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given code talk:

1. Basic understanding of system performance and optimization.
2. Familiarity with Amazon EC2 instances and their management.
3. Knowledge of common performance analysis tools and techniques.
4. Familiarity with writing and troubleshooting applications.
5. Interest in understanding and improving application performance.

title: Expo
description: Visit the Expo to discover hundreds of AWS Partners offering software, data, and services that run on AWS. When entering the Expo, embark on a browsing experience and visit six unique AWS pavilions. Each pavilion is filled with AWS teams that focus on AI/ML, community, data, developers, industries, generative AI, or partners. Each pavilion also contains a content theater where you can hear from AWS experts and partners. Come by to explore all that the Expo has to offer.

Prerequisites:
1. General understanding of AWS services and ecosystem
2. Interest in exploring AWS partner offerings and solutions
3. Willingness to engage with AWS experts and attend presentations

description: Connect with AWS Partners, network with peers, talk to experts, and see the latest interactive demos. Beverage service is provided throughout the Expo. The Expo Happy Hour is brought to you by AMD an AWS Partner.

title: Extend generative AI capabilities with serverless containers and RAG
description: In this builders’ session, explore how to extend generative AI workloads using the capabilities of Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). Through real-world examples of RAG-powered workloads, delve into the considerations and best practices for building generative AI applications with serverless containers. Then, gain hands-on experience building one by yourself. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate
2. Understanding of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
3. Hands-on experience with generative AI applications
4. Ability to work with serverless containers
5. Laptop for hands-on activities

title: Extract insights from satellite imagery at scale with WherobotsAI (sponsored by Wherobots)
description: Inferring objects and detecting change in satellite imagery was once reserved for companies with the talent, money, and time to build, manage, and run sophisticated, self-managed machine learning (ML) inference solutions against satellite data. In this lightning talk, learn how WherobotsAI Raster Inference makes it possible for data platform and science teams to utilize satellite imagery to analyze our planet with AI faster, more reliably, and with zero carbon footprint using SQL and Python. Raster Inference is a fully managed, high-performance, carbon neutral planetary-scale computer vision solution that makes AI and ML on satellite imagery accessible to most developers and data scientists. This presentation is brought to you by Wherobots, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the lightning talk would be:

1. Knowledge of satellite imagery analysis
2. Familiarity with machine learning and computer vision techniques
3. Experience with SQL and Python programming
4. Interest in sustainable and accessible AI/ML solutions

title: Extract insights with multi-modal agents using Amazon Bedrock
description: In this new interactive training session powered by generative AI, address a simulated business scenario by building an application to help users extract information from various data types. Build a multi-modal agent using an Amazon Bedrock foundation model and LangChain. Learn how to use managed AI/ML services to transform different type of data formats and generate insights. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning and natural language processing.
2. Familiarity with Python programming language.
3. Experience with data manipulation and analysis.
4. Knowledge of cloud-based AI/ML services.
5. Ability to work with various data formats.

title: Failing without flailing: Lessons we learned at AWS the hard way
description: At AWS, we’ve learned that building resilient services requires more than just designing for high availability. In this session AWS operational leaders are back for more insights on how to mitigate impact when, not if, the unexpected happens. Hear a few short stories collected from 18 years of operational excellence, with practical advice on preparing for and mitigating failure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Knowledge of high availability and fault tolerance principles
4. Experience in incident management and disaster recovery planning
5. Interest in learning from real-world operational experiences

title: Fast and secure AI context with open source hybrid vector search (sponsored by Aiven)
description: Vector similarity is fundamental for organizations looking to develop secure, cost-effective, and scalable AI solutions. Yet the inexact and complex nature of proximity search represents a risk for use cases, including regulated or sensitive data where precision in the retrieval is an absolute necessity. Hybrid search, available in several open source databases, is a powerful way to accelerate and refine the outcomes of standard vector search by balancing advanced text/field and similarity techniques. If you are considering AI for your business, this lightning talk provides an overview of the options available in open source for creating safe, accurate, and performant applications. This presentation is brought to you by Aiven, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of vector similarity
2. Familiarity with proximity search and its limitations
3. Knowledge of hybrid search techniques and their applications
4. Interest in developing secure, cost-effective, and scalable AI solutions
5. Consideration of AI for business applications

title: Faster, cheaper, better: Optimizing inference for production AI (sponsored by Baseten)
description: Optimizing ML model inference isn't just about the model—it’s about every layer of the stack. In this lightning talk, explore Baseten’s approach to optimizing latency, throughput, and cost, ensuring that your production AI products perform at their best. Learn about hardware-level optimizations like integrating NVIDIA TensorRT, using dynamic batching, and deploying with multi-instance GPUs. This presentation is brought to you by Baseten, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning models and their deployment.
2. Knowledge of hardware-level optimizations, such as NVIDIA TensorRT.
3. Familiarity with techniques like dynamic batching and multi-instance GPU deployment.
4. Interest in optimizing latency, throughput, and cost for production AI products.
5. Awareness of Baseten and their approach to optimizing the entire stack.

title: Fast evolving GraphQL schema with federation
description: This session explores cutting-edge techniques for GraphQL schema management and projections utilizing AWS AppSync, AWS Fargate, and AWS AI/ML services. Gain insights into overcoming limitations through innovative schema projection strategies. The session dives into how AWS AI/ML services can transform schema versioning and management, providing automated testing and generation of sample datasets to reduce development efforts. Learn about creating a mock environment for merchants based on projected schemas, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of their development processes. This session enables participants to implement robust schema management solutions and stay competitive in an evolving landscape.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with GraphQL
2. Experience with AWS services (AppSync, Fargate, AI/ML)
3. Understanding of schema management and versioning
4. Familiarity with software development lifecycle and testing practices

title: Fast web delivery: Expert insights into Amazon CloudFront [REPEAT]
description: Interested in delivering fast web experiences that keep users coming back? With the latest advancements in web protocols and Amazon CloudFront capabilities, there’s lots to consider when delivering web applications online. Bring your toughest questions around delivery topics like caching, dynamic content acceleration, or data transfer optimization. The CloudFront experts kick off the discussion with single domain architecture and API delivery topics and then dive deep into your specific challenges to provide tailored solutions for your unique web application workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with web protocols and web application delivery
2. Understanding of Amazon CloudFront and its capabilities
3. Experience with caching, dynamic content acceleration, and data transfer optimization

title: Fast web delivery: Expert insights into Amazon CloudFront [REPEAT]
description: Interested in delivering fast web experiences that keep users coming back? With the latest advancements in web protocols and Amazon CloudFront capabilities, there’s lots to consider when delivering web applications online. Bring your toughest questions around delivery topics like caching, dynamic content acceleration, or data transfer optimization. The CloudFront experts kick off the discussion with single domain architecture and API delivery topics and then dive deep into your specific challenges to provide tailored solutions for your unique web application workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Familiarity with Amazon CloudFront and its capabilities
3. Knowledge of web application delivery topics, such as caching, dynamic content acceleration, and data transfer optimization

title: Feed your AI strategy with data products (sponsored by Starburst)
description: The success of any AI strategy hinges on the quality, accessibility, and relevance of the data that powers it. Data products play a crucial role in this context by transforming raw data into valuable, trusted, and purpose-built data assets that fuel AI-driven innovation and decision-making. By integrating data products into your AI initiatives, you can accelerate AI development, enhance decision-making, foster innovation, and ensure data quality. In this lightning talk, learn how Starburst data products can enhance AI strategies across the enterprise to increase productivity, unlock new opportunities, drive competitive advantage, and lead in the era of intelligent business. This presentation is brought to you by Starburst, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the success of the AI strategy:

1. Quality of data
2. Accessibility of data
3. Relevance of data
4. Transformation of raw data into valuable, trusted, and purpose-built data assets
5. Integration of data products into AI initiatives

title: Ferrari and Bloomberg transform end-user computing with AWS
description: Interested in building an end-user computing solution that maximizes security of company and customer data, optimizes IT agility, and helps control cost? In this session, Ferrari and Bloomberg discuss how they leveraged AWS End User Computing services to address their digital workplace challenges and deliver an exceptional end-user experience. This session also explores advancements to the AWS portfolio of virtual desktop and application streaming services that give IT organizations more flexibility to choose the optimal service for their unique use cases and workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of end-user computing solutions
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with virtual desktop and application streaming technologies
4. Interest in optimizing IT agility and cost control
5. Desire to enhance security of company and customer data

title: Fidelity Investments and real-time vector search for Amazon MemoryDB
description: With vector search for Amazon MemoryDB, enterprises no longer need to compromise on relevancy and speed, offering the fastest vector search solution on AWS at the highest levels of recall. Join Fidelity Investments and learn how they benchmarked and evaluated vector search for Amazon MemoryDB, sharing their key performance indicators in recall, queries per second, load duration, and latency measurements. See a deep-dive demo of a persistent, configurable vector storage in MemoryDB for hybrid search and semantic caching within Fidelity’s network that aligns with Fidelity’s multicloud portability requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of vector search
2. Understanding of Amazon MemoryDB
3. Familiarity with Fidelity Investments' use case
4. Awareness of performance metrics (recall, queries per second, load duration, latency)
5. Familiarity with hybrid search and semantic caching

title: Fidelity Investments: Building for mission-critical resilience
description: Ensuring uninterrupted operations is critical to maintaining customer confidence and remaining compliant with regulatory requirements. This session explores the transformation of Fidelity Investments’ trade processing platform on AWS and the critical role resiliency plays in preserving operational integrity. Discover Fidelity Investments’ approach to building and validating a robust trade flow application with AWS Fault Injection Service, Amazon EC2, and Amazon EKS. Learn how Fidelity Investments practices chaos experiments using real-world scenarios and drives adoption of chaos engineering to 50% of all applications with its “chaos buffet,” a suite of tools that helps simulate impacting events in non-production environments.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with trade processing and financial services industry.
3. Knowledge of application architecture and resiliency concepts.
4. Experience with chaos engineering and fault injection techniques.
5. Interest in learning about Fidelity Investments' approach to building a robust trade flow application.

title: Fidelity Investments: Operating Tier 0 trading databases on AWS
description: Learn how Fidelity Investments operates Tier 0 brokerage databases on AWS and ensures highly available systems for its users. The session covers some of the challenges of operating low latency, multi-Region databases on AWS and highlights Fidelity's proactive mechanisms via AWS Incident Detection and Response. Incident Detection and Response offers customers proactive engagement and incident management to reduce the potential for failure and to accelerate recovery of critical workloads from disruption.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and infrastructure
2. Understanding of database concepts and architecture
3. Knowledge of high availability and disaster recovery strategies
4. Experience with incident management and response processes
5. Familiarity with Fidelity Investments or similar financial services industry.

title: Finding the right approach: Bridging traditional ML with generative AI [REPEAT]
description: This hands-on workshop explores the synergy between traditional ML approaches and the emerging realm of generative AI. Drawing parallels from reinforcement learning concepts used with AWS DeepRacer, this workshop dives into the criteria for selecting appropriate solutions, whether traditional ML or generative AI. Explore the different tools and services available, ranging from low-code/no-code offerings like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q to code-based solutions like Amazon SageMaker JumpStart. Leave this workshop with a comprehensive understanding of when to use generative AI capabilities, how to integrate generative AI seamlessly with traditional ML methodologies, and what tools are available through AWS. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and tools
3. Proficiency in programming (Python or similar)
4. Laptop for hands-on participation

Explore the different tools and services available, ranging from low-code/no-code offerings like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q to code-based solutions like Amazon SageMaker JumpStart. 3. Ability to work with a laptop and programming environments

title: Find the malicious shipmate! [REPEAT]
description: Embark on Malicious Shipmate, a game of collaboration and deception! You and your crew members must work together to complete critical tasks. But beware: One is an AI impostor. Navigate through 10 rooms with unique challenges like Amazon S3 bucket replication and flushing Amazon CloudFront caches. Strategize carefully, strive to identify the traitor, cast votes in meetings, and eliminate potential threats. Be cautious, because the impostor can fake tasks, leaving you unsure of who to trust.
prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts, specifically Amazon S3 and Amazon CloudFront.
2. Understanding of collaborative gameplay and deception mechanics.
3. Interest in strategic decision-making and problem-solving.

title: Find the perfect file storage to optimize your workload's performance [REPEAT]
description: The right file storage can make or break an application’s performance and scalability. Choosing a solution that fits the demand of the workload is critical to optimizing availability and cost efficiency. Join this talk to learn how to match your use case with the best storage, whether you're scaling demanding applications, handling high I/O requirements, or managing complex workloads. Learn to navigate the decision process, comparing the Amazon EFS and the Amazon FSx family of file services to extend or migrate without adding complexity or cost. Bring your questions to gain real-time insights and actionable solutions for your cloud journey.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and file storage solutions
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its file storage services
3. Experience in managing and optimizing application performance and scalability
4. Knowledge of workload requirements and the decision-making process for selecting the appropriate file storage solution
5. Desire to learn about the Amazon EFS and Amazon FSx file services and how they can be leveraged for cloud migrations and workload optimization

Choosing a solution that fits the demand of the workload is critical to optimizing availability and cost efficiency. Join this talk to learn how to match your use case with the best storage, whether you're scaling demanding applications, handling high I/O requirements, or managing complex workloads. title: Fine-tune and deploy an LLM using Amazon SageMaker and AWS AI chips
description: As deep learning models have grown in size and complexity, there is a need for specialized ML accelerators to address the increasing training and inference demands of these models, while also delivering high performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. In this workshop, use AWS purpose-built ML accelerators, AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia, to fine-tune and then run inference using an LLM based on the Llama architecture. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with deep learning and machine learning concepts.
2. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing.
3. Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
4. Access to a laptop with the necessary software and tools installed.

title: Fine-tune and deploy Llama 3.1 models on AWS Trainium and Inferentia
description: AWS Neuron SDK allows you to train, fine-tune, and deploy foundation models on AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia when building generative AI applications. This chalk talk provides an overview of Neuron SDK and the various capabilities that maximize performance and deliver ease-of-use when training and deploying Llama 3.1 models on AWS AI chips. Dive deep into Neuron Distributed libraries and discover debugging, profiling, and observability tools that can help you optimize performance of your AI workloads on AWS AI chips.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and infrastructure
2. Understanding of machine learning concepts and deep learning models
3. Experience with natural language processing (NLP) and generative AI applications
4. Knowledge of AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia AI chips
5. Familiarity with distributed computing and optimization techniques

title: Fine-tune Hugging Face LLMs using Amazon SageMaker and AWS Trainium [REPEAT]
description: Large language models (LLMs) are pretrained on vast amounts of data and perform well across a variety of general-purpose tasks and benchmarks without further specialized training. In practice, however, it is common to improve the performance of a pretrained LLM by fine-tuning the model using a smaller task-specific or domain-specific dataset. In this builders’ session, learn how to use Amazon SageMaker to fine-tune a pretrained Hugging Face LLM using AWS Trainium, and then leverage the fine-tuned model for inference. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and terminology
2. Basic understanding of natural language processing (NLP)
3. Experience with Python programming
4. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon SageMaker
5. Access to a laptop for the hands-on session

title: Fine-tune Hugging Face LLMs using Amazon SageMaker and AWS Trainium [REPEAT]
description: Large language models (LLMs) are pretrained on vast amounts of data and perform well across a variety of general-purpose tasks and benchmarks without further specialized training. In practice, however, it is common to improve the performance of a pretrained LLM by fine-tuning the model using a smaller task-specific or domain-specific dataset. In this builders’ session, learn how to use Amazon SageMaker to fine-tune a pretrained Hugging Face LLM using AWS Trainium, and then leverage the fine-tuned model for inference. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts
2. Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) and large language models
3. Experience with Python programming
4. Basic knowledge of AWS services and Hugging Face
5. Laptop with necessary software installed

title: Fine-tune Hugging Face LLMs using Amazon SageMaker and AWS Trainium [REPEAT]
description: Large language models (LLMs) are pretrained on vast amounts of data and perform well across a variety of general-purpose tasks and benchmarks without further specialized training. In practice, however, it is common to improve the performance of a pretrained LLM by fine-tuning the model using a smaller task-specific or domain-specific dataset. In this builders’ session, learn how to use Amazon SageMaker to fine-tune a pretrained Hugging Face LLM using AWS Trainium, and then leverage the fine-tuned model for inference. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning and natural language processing.
2. Familiarity with Hugging Face transformers and Amazon SageMaker.
3. Knowledge of AWS Trainium and its capabilities.
4. Access to a laptop for hands-on participation.

title: Fine-tune Llama 3 models cost-effectively on Amazon SageMaker [REPEAT]
description: In this builders’ session, get step-by-step implementation experience fine-tuning Llama 3 8B using the QLoRA strategy. Learn how you can fine-tune Llama 3 models at scale using the memory-efficient PyTorch Fully Sharded Data Parallel (FSDP2) library with access to built-in debugging and GPU utilization metrics. Use a custom deep learning container with Amazon SageMaker to run these large-scale training jobs on the Amazon EC2 G5 instance. Discover how you can bring your own choice of libraries, like torchtune, on Amazon SageMaker’s managed infrastructure of GPU resources. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with machine learning and natural language processing concepts.
2. Experience with Python programming and PyTorch library.
3. Understanding of large language models and fine-tuning techniques.
4. Access to a laptop with a compatible operating system.
5. Basic knowledge of Amazon SageMaker and cloud computing.
