title: Generative AI-powered search with Amazon OpenSearch Service [REPEAT]
description: Embark on a journey with Amazon OpenSearch Service to create a generative AI-powered search and chatbot application. In this code talk, journey through a step-by-step process from writing and deploying code to implementing the basics of OpenSearch Service, indexing your data, running vector search queries, and building a fully functional generative AI search application. Join this session to gain practical experience and knowledge in applying OpenSearch Service to your own AI-driven projects.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the code talk:

1. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services.
2. Basic understanding of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning concepts.
3. Experience with programming languages, such as Python or JavaScript.
4. Knowledge of web development and building web applications.
5. Familiarity with OpenSearch or Elasticsearch.

title: Generative AI-powered search with Amazon OpenSearch Service [REPEAT]
description: Embark on a journey with Amazon OpenSearch Service to create a generative AI-powered search and chatbot application. In this code talk, journey through a step-by-step process from writing and deploying code to implementing the basics of OpenSearch Service, indexing your data, running vector search queries, and building a fully functional generative AI search application. Join this session to gain practical experience and knowledge in applying OpenSearch Service to your own AI-driven projects.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of search engine concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing.
3. Knowledge of natural language processing and generative AI models.
4. Experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript).
5. Familiarity with web application development.

title: Generative AI product development with Amazon Bedrock [REPEAT]
description: Be empowered to effortlessly ideate and generate new product concepts using this intuitive, sketch-driven demo. By providing hand-drawn simple sketches, learn to harness the power of generative AI to transform your creative ideas into tangible product designs and multichannel marketing content.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given task would be:

1. Basic understanding of product design and development.
2. Familiarity with digital sketching or drawing tools.
3. Exposure to generative AI technologies and their applications.
4. Willingness to experiment and explore new creative approaches.
5. Openness to learning and adapting to the provided intuitive, sketch-driven demo.

title: Generative AI product development with Amazon Bedrock [REPEAT]
description: Be empowered to effortlessly ideate and generate new product concepts using this intuitive, sketch-driven demo. By providing hand-drawn simple sketches, learn to harness the power of generative AI to transform your creative ideas into tangible product designs and multichannel marketing content.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of product design and development
2. Familiarity with sketching and visual ideation techniques
3. Willingness to experiment with generative AI tools

title: Generative AI scene detection and intelligent media workflows
description: Unlock the power of AI/ML and generative AI using Media2Cloud guidance on AWS to streamline media workflows through intelligent automation. Learn how to decrease the manual work involved in monetizing your content and improve its accessibility for a larger audience. This hands-on workshop explores using AI services on AWS like Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Bedrock to analyze video, detect scene changes, and determine context to find the ideal times for ad placement. Then, use content analysis to create intelligent video summaries, and learn how to create automatic captioning and translations. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with media workflows and content management.
3. Hands-on experience with video processing or media production.
4. Willingness to learn and experiment with AI/ML and generative AI technologies.
5. Laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Generative AI: Transforming LATAM Airlines' call center CX from POC to MVP
description: LATAM Airlines transformed their call center using generative AI via Amazon Bedrock, moving from reactive to proactive customer service. This session explores their journey from proof of concept to MVP, highlighting improved intent categorization for automated handling or agent escalation. Key insights include AI training requirements, architectures, and achieving 85% response accuracy. Learn about integrating Genesys Cloud with AWS services and LATAM’s progression from handling 70,000 calls in the Peruvian market POC to an anticipated 1.5 million monthly calls with their MVP solution. Discover how generative AI is revolutionizing call center operations and enhancing customer experience.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the session would likely include:

1. Knowledge of call center operations and customer service.
2. Understanding of generative AI and its applications in customer service.
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and Genesys Cloud.
4. Experience in integrating cloud-based services and architectures.
5. Interest in the transformation of call center operations using advanced technologies.

title: Generative AI unleashed: An insider’s perspective on Amazon’s approach
description: This session provides AWS Partners and chief technologists a look at how Amazon is using generative AI to continually innovate and develop solutions that drive value for our partners and customers. We share key lessons on the challenges and best practices for building robust, reliable generative AI systems at scale, including insights on data quality, model training, security, and user interaction design. The session will also discuss how Amazon balances innovation with responsible development, ensuring generative AI solutions are developed and deployed ethically and with the end user’s best interests in mind.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the AWS Partner Network.
2. Knowledge of generative AI technologies and their applications.
3. Familiarity with the challenges and best practices in building large-scale, reliable generative AI systems.
4. Awareness of data quality, model training, security, and user interaction design considerations in the context of generative AI.
5. Interest in responsible development and ethical deployment of generative AI solutions.

title: Generative AI with Data on Amazon EKS (DoEKS)
description: Some of the most innovative AWS customers are using Amazon EKS to train, fine-tune, and serve cutting-edge generative AI models. In this workshop, learn how to serve fine-tuned models with vLLM and Ray Serve for a high-performance solution and be cost effective with Karpenter for right-sized accelerated compute. Through real-world, hands-on examples, learn some key patterns that can help you implement LLMOps for scaling inference workloads, integrating RAG frameworks, and optimizing performance within the Kubernetes ecosystem. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with Kubernetes and containerization
3. Knowledge of machine learning and AI concepts
4. Laptop for hands-on exercises

title: Gesture-controlled car [REPEAT]
description: Step on the gas and take control! This project powered by AWS IoT Greengrass lets you drive a car with hand gestures. Compete with others on the leaderboard and experience the fusion of IoT and gaming. Who will be the champion?
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of IoT (Internet of Things) concepts
2. Knowledge of AWS IoT Greengrass
3. Familiarity with hand gesture recognition technology
4. Proficiency in game development
5. Experience in integrating IoT and gaming systems

title: Gesture-controlled car [REPEAT]
description: Step on the gas and take control! This project powered by AWS IoT Greengrass lets you drive a car with hand gestures. Compete with others on the leaderboard and experience the fusion of IoT and gaming. Who will be the champion?
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of IoT and cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AWS IoT Greengrass
3. Understanding of gesture-based control systems
4. Experience in game development or integration

title: Get better at building AWS CDK constructs
description: In this workshop, dive deep into how to design AWS CDK constructs, which are reusable and shareable cloud components that can help you meet your organization’s security, compliance, and governance requirements. Learn how to build, test, and share constructs representing a single AWS resource, and discover how to create higher-level abstractions that include built-in defaults and allow you to provision multiple AWS resources. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS Cloud services and architecture
2. Basic understanding of software development and programming concepts
3. Experience with AWS CloudFormation or other Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools
4. Knowledge of AWS security, compliance, and governance best practices
5. Proficiency in a programming language, such as TypeScript or Python

title: Get cloud and application security right, from the first line of code (sponsored by Wiz)
description: As software supply chains, applications, and cloud environments grow more complex, integrated security across the entire development lifecycle is essential. The days of treating code, pipelines, and cloud in isolation are over—security should now be unified across every stage of development. Join this session with Wiz and their customers to learn why application security can no longer be separated from cloud security. Discover how a code-to-cloud approach empowers your developers to move at the speed of the cloud without compromising security. Learn practical strategies and real-world examples to secure your AWS environment effectively. This presentation is brought to you by Wiz, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of software development lifecycle
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS
3. Knowledge of application security and cloud security

title: Get hands-on with Amazon Connect to empower agents with customer data
description: Join this hands-on workshop to learn how to use Amazon Connect to deliver real-time, actionable customer insights and data to your contact center agents, enabling personalized customer service experiences. You learn how to sync customer data from disparate sources, match identifiers using generative AI, and surface unified profiles. Explore how to combine data like contact history, sentiment, orders, and application interactions from Amazon Connect and other sources to create a unified customer view. Step-by-step, you implement solutions that empower self-service, equip agents with actionable customer insights, and deliver tailored experiences, improving customer satisfaction and lowering resolution times. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of customer service and contact center operations.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
3. Experience with data integration and management.
4. Proficiency in programming or scripting languages.
5. Willingness to actively participate in hands-on exercises.

title: Get hands-on with fraud prevention using AWS WAF [REPEAT]
description: Traffic from malicious bots can lead to negative user experiences, financial losses, and operational bottlenecks ranging from add-to-cart attacks that disrupt your web applications to distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks that increase your infrastructure costs. In this workshop, explore how AWS uses a combination of techniques to identify and mitigate different types of bots and fraudulent activities. Gain valuable insights into how AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront work together to safeguard and deliver your applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of web applications and their architecture
2. Familiarity with AWS services, such as AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront
3. Ability to use a laptop and participate in the workshop activities

title: Get hands-on with fraud prevention using AWS WAF [REPEAT]
description: Traffic from malicious bots can lead to negative user experiences, financial losses, and operational bottlenecks ranging from add-to-cart attacks that disrupt your web applications to distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks that increase your infrastructure costs. In this workshop, explore how AWS uses a combination of techniques to identify and mitigate different types of bots and fraudulent activities. Gain valuable insights into how AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront work together to safeguard and deliver your applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of web applications and their architecture
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront

title: Get started with the latest Amazon Aurora innovations
description: In this session, Marc Brooker, AWS VP and Distinguished Engineer, guides you through the fundamentals of Amazon Aurora’s latest innovations. Learn how Aurora can work within your architecture, understand key considerations and trade-offs, explore what an application architecture could look like, and more.
prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of relational databases
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of database architecture and design principles
4. Interest in exploring the latest innovations in Amazon Aurora

title: Get tailored code insights with Amazon Q Developer and private repos
description: Unlock the full potential of Amazon Q Developer with customized code recommendations tailored to your organization’s code base. In this code talk, learn how to securely connect Amazon Q to your private repositories, enabling it to generate highly relevant code suggestions based on your internal coding practices. Discover how to create and utilize customizations, and witness firsthand the transformative impact on code comprehension and development efficiency by comparing suggestions with and without customization. Elevate your coding experience with this powerful feature.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Q Developer
2. Access to private repositories
3. Understanding of code customization and integration
4. Desire to improve code comprehension and development efficiency

title: Getting better image analysis with generative AI
description: Using generative AI comes with challenges, like building prompts with enough information so the AI understands what to do but doesn’t become inflexible, and making sure you’re feeding it the most current data. This is particularly true for image analysis. In this lightening talk, our generative AI experts share tips and tricks that make it easy for you to build prompts that get relevant, high-quality results so you can complete your image analysis missions faster.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of generative AI and its capabilities.
2. Knowledge of prompt engineering techniques.
3. Familiarity with image analysis tasks and challenges.
4. Awareness of the importance of using up-to-date data.
5. Interest in learning from experts in the field of generative AI.

title: Getting started building serverless SaaS architectures
description: Are you planning to build a new software as a service (SaaS) application using serverless on AWS? Do you want to modernize an existing SaaS application to serverless and want to know more about multi-tenancy? In this session, explore the fundamentals of serverless at AWS. Learn about AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and event-driven integration services, discover how to build your first serverless application, and learn how to handle multi-tenant architectures for SaaS applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their use cases
3. Familiarity with software development and deployment processes

title: Getting started with AWS generative AI for SAP
description: Looking to reimagine your SAP business processes with generative AI, but don't know where to begin? Join us as we share some of the most promising areas to apply generative AI in your SAP landscape, discuss how you can leverage Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q, share proven architectures for integrating generative AI into SAP workflows, and explore new options for accessing Amazon Bedrock models within SAP’s generative AI hub. Bring your questions and get the insights you need to get started with generative AI in your SAP environment.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Knowledge of SAP business processes
2. Familiarity with generative AI concepts
3. Understanding of Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q
4. Experience with integrating AI/ML solutions into enterprise workflows
5. Familiarity with SAP's generative AI hub

title: Getting started with serverless patterns [REPEAT]
description: Serverless applications are built using services in a variety of common architecture patterns. Although customer scenarios are unique, these patterns emerge again and again. In this workshop, learn how to recognize and apply those patterns and best practices by building nearly production-ready code for a serverless application. Create microservices, run unit and integration tests, configure a CI/CD pipeline, and set up observability. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and serverless architecture.
2. Familiarity with programming languages and frameworks (e.g., JavaScript, Python, or C#).
3. Experience with AWS services or other cloud platforms.
4. Ability to work with command-line tools and version control systems (e.g., Git).
5. Willingness to participate actively in the workshop and bring a laptop.

title: Getting started with serverless patterns [REPEAT]
description: Serverless applications are built using services in a variety of common architecture patterns. Although customer scenarios are unique, these patterns emerge again and again. In this workshop, learn how to recognize and apply those patterns and best practices by building nearly production-ready code for a serverless application. Create microservices, run unit and integration tests, configure a CI/CD pipeline, and set up observability. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
2. Basic understanding of serverless architecture
3. Experience with programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python)
4. Familiarity with AWS services or other cloud platforms
5. Ability to set up a development environment on your laptop

title: Gilead Sciences: Executing a large-scale VMware transformation on AWS
description: Discover how Gilead Sciences accelerated their global digital transformation through collaboration with AWS Professional Services. Get inspired by their migration of over 2,000 servers from VMware on-premises to AWS native services, retiring 1,400+ systems. Hear directly from Gilead leaders who spearheaded this initiative on their migration approach, the AWS tools and services they leveraged, and the best practices for selecting and migrating workloads to AWS. Being on AWS has enabled Gilead to accelerate modernization and innovation. Gain insights into how Gilead does more with their data and integrates emerging technologies like AI to accomplish their business goals.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud migration strategies
2. Familiarity with AWS services and tools
3. Knowledge of digital transformation and modernization initiatives
4. Awareness of the pharmaceutical industry and its technology challenges
5. Interest in learning from real-world case studies and best practices

title: Gilead Sciences: Operational excellence for cloud, data, and AI/ML
description: Learn how Gilead is building a state-of-the-art operational excellence model focused on cloud, data, AI/ML, generative AI, and enterprise architecture to enable the business to achieve priorities such as developing 10+ transformative therapies by 2030 and ending the HIV epidemic. This enables business users seamless access to cloud capabilities and data platforms. An operational excellence framework—including cloud operating model, organizational change, cross-functional application support and modernization—will enable business users to innovate and develop products with speed and intelligence. With AWS solutions, operational enhancements, and efficiencies, Gilead will continue to raise the bar in the pharmaceutical industry.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its benefits
2. Knowledge of data management and analytics
3. Familiarity with AI/ML and generative AI technologies
4. Experience in enterprise architecture and application modernization
5. Expertise in operational excellence frameworks and organizational change management

title: GitHub Enterprise: Create a complete developer experience (sponsored by GitHub)
description: In this session, discover exciting new features planned for GitHub Enterprise, for both self-hosted and cloud environments. Explore how GitHub can accelerate productivity across end-to-end DevOps platforms. Gain insights on how to get started with GitHub’s enterprise offerings, and learn how to adopt them within your organization. See a demo and learn how to log in with Enterprise Managed Users (EMU), navigate projects, contribute code with GitHub Codespaces and GitHub Copilot, and enforce repository rules with GitHub Actions and code scanning. This presentation is brought to you by GitHub, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with GitHub
2. Understanding of DevOps practices
3. Interest in enterprise-level software development tools
4. Desire to learn about GitHub's enterprise offerings
5. Basic knowledge of cloud computing and software deployment

title: Go codeless and replatform Windows applications on Amazon EKS
description: Moody’s runs dozens of .NET applications on Amazon EC2 for Windows Server. As part of its modernization strategy, Moody’s replatformed its critical legacy applications to Amazon EKS with Windows support, achieving cost reduction, better performance, and more flexibility for its developers. In this session, Moody’s shares key takeaways and best practices from its successful replatform, including how it overcame challenges and maximized its platform engineering investments. Leave this session with concrete examples and techniques to replatform your own .NET Framework applications on Amazon EKS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this session:

1. Knowledge of .NET applications
2. Familiarity with Amazon EC2 and Amazon EKS
3. Understanding of containerization and Kubernetes
4. Experience with .NET Framework applications

title: Go from idea to AI-powered app in minutes with AWS Amplify [REPEAT]
description: AWS Amplify recently launched a second-generation developer experience featuring full-stack TypeScript capabilities for building production-ready applications on AWS. Generation two is built on top of AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK), making it possible to add any of the more than 200 AWS services to your Amplify application, including Amazon Bedrock for generative AI use cases. Join this chalk talk to discuss strategies for extending the Amplify full-stack TypeScript capabilities to create the next generation of innovative application experiences using AWS CDK and Amazon Bedrock.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS Amplify
2. Understanding of TypeScript
3. Knowledge of AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK)
4. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock for generative AI use cases

title: Go from idea to AI-powered app in minutes with AWS Amplify [REPEAT]
description: AWS Amplify recently launched a second-generation developer experience featuring full-stack TypeScript capabilities for building production-ready applications on AWS. Generation two is built on top of AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK), making it possible to add any of the more than 200 AWS services to your Amplify application, including Amazon Bedrock for generative AI use cases. Join this chalk talk to discuss strategies for extending the Amplify full-stack TypeScript capabilities to create the next generation of innovative application experiences using AWS CDK and Amazon Bedrock.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS Amplify
2. Understanding of TypeScript
3. Knowledge of AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK)
4. Awareness of Amazon Bedrock for generative AI use cases

title: Go from idea to app in hours using AWS Amplify and Amazon Q Developer [REPEAT]
description: Bring your full-stack app from idea to reality faster with AWS Amplify and Amazon Q Developer. In this workshop, use AWS Amplify to build and deploy a full-stack app, and see how Amazon Q Developer speeds up the entire software development lifecycle. Leave this workshop knowing how to build and launch a cloud-connected app. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of web development
2. Familiarity with JavaScript and React (or similar front-end framework)
3. Willingness to learn new cloud-based technologies

title: Go from idea to app in hours using AWS Amplify and Amazon Q Developer [REPEAT]
description: Bring your full-stack app from idea to reality faster with AWS Amplify and Amazon Q Developer. In this workshop, use AWS Amplify to build and deploy a full-stack app, and see how Amazon Q Developer speeds up the entire software development lifecycle. Leave this workshop knowing how to build and launch a cloud-connected app. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Familiarity with web development concepts and technologies.
2. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
3. Ability to use a code editor and command-line interface.
4. Laptop with a stable internet connection.

title: Governance and security with infrastructure as code
description: In this session, learn how to use AWS CloudFormation and the AWS CDK to deploy cloud applications in regulated environments while enforcing security controls. Find out how to catch issues early with cdk-nag, validate your pipelines with cfn-guard, and protect your accounts from unintended changes with CloudFormation Hooks.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaC) and CloudFormation
3. Knowledge of AWS CDK (Cloud Development Kit)
4. Experience with security best practices and compliance requirements

title: Grab innovates with generative AI and secure data collaboration
description: Grab, a leading super app in Southeast Asia, launched Grab Ads in 2018. In this session, learn how Grab uses AWS Clean Rooms to power its advertising business via secure data collaboration with partners to enrich its understanding of customers and deliver more relevant experiences. Discover how Grab uses generative AI services on AWS to empower its business functions across marketing and advertising. Hear from Grab about its migration to AWS and best practices for innovating with advertising workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of digital advertising and customer data management
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with secure data collaboration and data privacy
4. Awareness of generative AI and its applications in marketing and advertising
5. Experience with cloud migration and innovation in advertising workloads

title: Grindr’s AI-first approach with AWS: Enable inclusive user connection
description: Learn how Grindr partnered with AWS to become an AI-first company and launch AI-powered features such as their “AI Wingman” copilot chatbot, Roam for meeting users prior to travel, Personalized Dating Profile Recommendations for users, and more features that enabled Grindr to become the Digital Gayborhood in Your Pocket. Grindr's gayborhood empowers millions of other users to digitally access resources and information for the global LGTBQIA+ community, all in the app. By expanding Grindr to serve as the digital Gayborhood, Grindr is bringing a crucial form of community, rich in information and connection, to users on their phone.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Grindr's business model and target audience
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with AI and chatbot technologies
4. Awareness of the LGBTQIA+ community and their digital needs

title: Grupo Boticário’s AI-accessibility journey for inclusive e-commerce
description: Grupo Boticário, a prominent Brazilian beauty company, embarked on a transformative journey to enhance the accessibility of their e-commerce platform through the power of artificial intelligence. Using Amazon Bedrock and the Anthropic Claude 3 Sonnet model, they automated the generation of rich, descriptive alternative text for product images, revolutionizing the experience for visually impaired users and improving search engine indexing. This session delves into Grupo Boticário’s innovative approach, the challenges they overcame, and the measurable impact on inclusion and accessibility within their digital ecosystem, serving as a blueprint for organizations aspiring to create truly inclusive online experiences.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of e-commerce platform development
2. Understanding of artificial intelligence and its applications
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and Anthropic Claude 3 Sonnet model
4. Experience in accessibility and inclusivity considerations for digital platforms
5. Expertise in search engine optimization and indexing

title: Guardrails for financial services LLMs with Amazon Bedrock & SageMaker [REPEAT]
description: Financial institutions need to exercise caution when it comes to incorporating large language models (LLMs) in customer-facing products due to the risk of hallucinations. It’s also important to implement robust safeguards against the inadvertent sharing of sensitive data. In this chalk talk, learn strategies to refine datasets, maintain high-quality inputs, and customize LLM outputs to meet the precise requirements of the financial services industry. Walk through how you can use Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker to fine-tune LLMs, and gain practical insights that can help you unlock the power of generative AI while maintaining business-critical controls and compliance.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their potential risks, particularly in the context of financial services.
2. Knowledge of data handling and privacy considerations in the financial industry.
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker for fine-tuning and customizing LLMs.
4. Interest in leveraging the power of generative AI while maintaining robust controls and compliance.
5. Desire to learn strategies for refining datasets, maintaining high-quality inputs, and customizing LLM outputs for the financial services industry.

title: Guardrails for financial services LLMs with Amazon Bedrock & SageMaker [REPEAT]
description: Financial institutions need to exercise caution when it comes to incorporating large language models (LLMs) in customer-facing products due to the risk of hallucinations. It’s also important to implement robust safeguards against the inadvertent sharing of sensitive data. In this chalk talk, learn strategies to refine datasets, maintain high-quality inputs, and customize LLM outputs to meet the precise requirements of the financial services industry. Walk through how you can use Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker to fine-tune LLMs, and gain practical insights that can help you unlock the power of generative AI while maintaining business-critical controls and compliance.

Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their potential risks, such as hallucinations.
2. Knowledge of data privacy and security considerations in the financial services industry.
3. Familiarity with dataset refinement and input quality maintenance techniques.
4. Awareness of customization strategies for LLM outputs to meet financial industry requirements.
5. Experience or interest in using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker for LLM fine-tuning.

title: Guidance to build & grow with AWS Marketplace, programs & incentives
description: Through AWS Partner Experience Transformation, AWS has launched new programs, incentives, and tools to drive partner growth. Join this session to learn more about the AWS Partner Profitability Framework and how this supports your organization’s growth journey. This session covers how AWS helps partners build the right solutions to meet customer demand, increase your discoverability, match you with the right customers, and co-sell with you to win bigger and faster.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Partner Network (APN)
2. Knowledge of AWS partner programs and offerings
3. Familiarity with customer demand and sales strategies
4. Willingness to explore new tools and incentives for partner growth
5. Interest in improving profitability and expanding your customer base

title: Handle millions of observability events with Apache Flink & Prometheus
description: Prometheus is a de facto standard for monitoring and alerting, ingesting metrics from applications and infrastructure. The ability to efficiently store high volumes of dimensional time series also makes Prometheus a perfect fit for other operational analytics use cases, like observing fleets of IoT devices. Apache Flink can be used as a preprocessor for time series to reduce cardinality and frequency before writing into Prometheus. This session covers some of the potential use cases and how to leverage the new Apache Flink connector, an AWS contribution to the Apache Flink project, to send data to Prometheus at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given text:

1. Knowledge of Prometheus and its capabilities as a monitoring and alerting tool.
2. Understanding of time series data and its importance in operational analytics.
3. Familiarity with Apache Flink and its use as a preprocessor for time series data.
4. Awareness of the AWS contribution to the Apache Flink project, specifically the Prometheus connector.
5. Experience with large-scale data processing and ingestion.

title: Handle scaling with AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: In this interactive builders’ session on AWS Lambda scaling, learn how serverless workloads can handle massive spikes. Explore best practices to generate high throughput using load testing tools, and analyze scaling behavior with Amazon CloudWatch metrics. Discover real-world use cases, covering potential pitfalls like cold starts, concurrency limits, and upstream/downstream bottlenecks. Leave with a tested approach to verify application scaling, even at high throughput levels. Gain confidence that your applications can truly scale on demand by pushing serverless to its limits. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Lambda
2. Familiarity with load testing tools
3. Knowledge of Amazon CloudWatch metrics

title: Hands-on experience with Amazon CloudWatch [REPEAT]
description: Your enterprise’s agility, customer satisfaction, and business growth depend on setting up great observability. In order to help you build high-performing and reliable applications, AWS provides a variety of turnkey AWS native observability services and solutions. In this workshop, learn how to monitor AWS services with Amazon CloudWatch, get hands-on experience with the most common use cases, and learn about and implement the newest features available. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Basic understanding of application monitoring and observability.
3. Access to an AWS account with appropriate permissions.
4. A laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Hands-on with Amazon Q in QuickSight: A step-by-step workshop [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, explore the Generative BI capabilities of Amazon Q in QuickSight. Experience authoring visuals and refining them using natural language. Learn how business users can leverage natural language to generate data stories to create highly customizable narratives or slide decks from data. Discover how natural language Q&A with Amazon Q helps users gain insights beyond what is presented on dashboards while executive summaries provide an at-a-glance view of data, surfacing trends and explanations. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of business intelligence and data visualization concepts.
2. Familiarity with Amazon QuickSight or similar business intelligence tools.
3. Comfortable with using a laptop and navigating the web.

description: In this workshop, explore the Generative BI capabilities of Amazon Q in QuickSight. Experience authoring visuals and refining them using natural language. Learn how business users can leverage natural language to generate data stories to create highly customizable narratives or slide decks from data. Discover how natural language Q&A with Amazon Q helps users gain insights beyond what is presented on dashboards while executive summaries provide an at-a-glance view of data, surfacing trends and explanations. 3. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: Harness Amazon Q Business power with Microsoft workload data sources
description: Microsoft workloads—such as SharePoint and File Server—are rich datasets for Amazon Q Business. In this session, learn how to extract the maximum value from these datasets by enabling Amazon Q Business to unleash generative AI power and by implementing data guardrails at the same time. See how Amazon Q Business integrates with SharePoint and Amazon FSx, indexes data, and enforces data guardrails based on Active Directory identities.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint and File Server
2. Understanding of Amazon Q Business and its capabilities
3. Familiarity with data integration and indexing processes
4. Awareness of data governance and security best practices
5. Experience with Active Directory and user identity management

title: Harness application scale & data-enriched accuracy with Amazon Bedrock
description: Discover the full potential of contextual response with Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, a fully managed Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution. This offering empowers you to obtain contextual and accurate responses tailored to your unique needs. With Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, you gain flexibility and scalability, enabling you to customize and design your RAG applications with ease by providing a suite of capabilities designed to enhance accuracy and streamline undifferentiated heavy lifting tasks. Harness the power of knowledge bases and elevate your applications with contextual intelligence.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for "Discover the full potential of contextual response with Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, a fully managed Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) solution":

1. Understanding of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) concept.
2. Familiarity with knowledge base management and integration.
3. Experience in developing AI-powered applications.
4. Requirement for customizable and scalable contextual response capabilities.
5. Need to streamline undifferentiated heavy lifting tasks in application development.

title: Harness Boomi AI & AWS for effortless data integration & automation (sponsored by Boomi)
description: Discover how Boomi uses AI to revolutionize data integration and workflow automation. This presentation showcases Boomi's AI Agent capabilities that helps developers create integrations through natural language interactions. Learn about Boomi's RAG Agent Accelerator for AWS that utilizes Amazon Bedrock to securely communicate with a private copy of any LLM supported by AWS. See a demo of how this solution integrates with Amazon Kendra or Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, enhances query accuracy, and maintains data privacy. Explore how Boomi empowers organizations to orchestrate AI models and tools, optimizing decision-making processes and workflows across diverse business environments. This presentation is brought to you by Boomi, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this presentation would be:

1. Understanding of data integration and workflow automation
2. Familiarity with AI and natural language processing
3. Knowledge of AWS services like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Kendra
4. Awareness of Boomi's AI Agent capabilities and RAG Agent Accelerator

title: Harnessing Apache ActiveMQ: ActiveMQ 6.x features and roadmap
description: Join this session to discover the transformative capabilities of Apache ActiveMQ 6.x for robust messaging applications. Experience simplified APIs and enhanced features from JMS 2.0 and Jakarta 3.1 implementation, improved message handling, and delivery delay. See an overview of Apache ActiveMQ 6.x capabilities and gain insights into the open source roadmap, with a highlight on future enhancements for performance, scalability, and usability. Participants gain the knowledge to leverage these advancements for more efficient and reliable messaging solutions in their business.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of messaging systems and concepts.
2. Familiarity with Java and Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) development.
3. Exposure to message-oriented middleware or message queuing technologies.

title: Harnessing AWS for natural disaster early warning at scale
description: Learn how EarthScope optimizes natural disaster detection and response. Discover how EarthScope migrated the GNSS component of ShakeAlert, the US earthquake early warning system, from on premises to AWS to create a highly available, low-latency pipeline that processes real-time GNSS data to complement seismological networks. Also learn how ShakeAlert harnessed managed services and leveraged a serverless architecture to deliver near real-time, stream-processed products to government agencies and automated systems before damaging earthquakes reach people and critical infrastructure. Explore the benefits of cloud-native modernization and unlock the potential of advanced disaster preparedness in this insightful session.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of natural disaster detection and response systems.
2. Familiarity with GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) technology.
3. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud-native architectures.
4. Awareness of the ShakeAlert earthquake early warning system.
5. Interest in the application of technology in disaster preparedness and mitigation.

title: Harnessing generative AI for impact: Mapping pathways out of poverty
description: Discover how FINCA, a non-profit organization dedicated to alleviating poverty, is harnessing the power of AWS and generative AI to revolutionize its research processes. FINCA's groundbreaking open source platform, AuRA, leverages AI to accelerate the creation of theories of change, enabling researchers to quickly identify relevant evidence, curate data libraries, and generate impactful pathways. Join this session to learn how AuRA's collaborative approach, combining AI capabilities with subject matter expertise, is driving operational efficiency, extracting insights from data, and scaling social impact across sectors. Explore the transformative potential of generative AI in tackling complex global challenges.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of non-profit organizations and their role in alleviating poverty.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, specifically AWS.
3. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications in research and data analysis.
4. Awareness of open-source platforms and their potential for collaborative problem-solving.
5. Interest in exploring the intersection of technology, social impact, and global challenges.

title: Harnessing generative AI to create & understand architecture diagrams
description: This builders’ session explores using generative AI to create and comprehend architecture diagrams, a critical aspect of software design and communication. Diagrams are often image data, custom formats of drawing programs, or text-based representations from diagram-as-code tools. Techniques are used from two different layers of the generative AI stack, Amazon Q Developer and foundational models on Amazon Bedrock. Chat-based workflows first understand and analyze existing diagrams, and then ask follow-up questions about best practices. New diagrams are created using diagram-as-code formats. Leave with practical strategies for harnessing generative AI in your software architecture workflows. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of software architecture and design
2. Familiarity with diagram-as-code tools
3. Familiarity with generative AI concepts and technologies

title: Harnessing the power of Agentic AI Architecture
description: Dive into the advanced Agentic AI Architecture, designed to enable AI agents with autonomous decision-making in dynamic environments. This framework incorporates cutting-edge technologies to optimize agent performance. In this insightful workshop, built utilizing Amazon Bedrock, knowledge bases, and serverless technologies, the US SMB Demo Squad team members explore the architecture’s key components and features and the lessons learned during its creation. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
2. Understanding of software architecture and design principles
3. Experience with cloud computing and serverless technologies

title: Harnessing the power of small language models in financial services
description: Financial institutions are using large language models (LLMs) to improve employee productivity and transform the customer experience. But LLMs are not always the right choice for every application. This chalk talk explores how small language models (SLMs) can offer you the speed and precision you need to solve specific problems without compromising on power and utility. Explore task-specific and task-agnostic SLM architectures, data strategies, and techniques for domain adaptation, fine-tuning, and pre-training using Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker. Discover post-training optimizations that highlight effective strategies for reducing model size while enhancing the performance of generative AI applications.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their applications in financial institutions.
2. Familiarity with the concept of small language models (SLMs) and their potential advantages.
3. Knowledge of Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker for SLM development and deployment.
4. Awareness of techniques for domain adaptation, fine-tuning, and pre-training of SLMs.
5. Interest in post-training optimizations for generative AI applications.

title: Harness your file data value with Amazon Bedrock and generative AI [REPEAT]
description: As customers seek to unlock the full potential of their unstructured enterprise file data, many are turning to generative AI for deeper insights. In this session, learn how to swiftly and securely integrate your company’s on-premises file data as a Knowledge Base for Amazon Bedrock using Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. Explore how to implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) workflows to enrich generative AI with contextual information from your private data sources, ensuring more relevant, accurate, and customized responses. Discover how to efficiently manage and store this data in your vector database to optimize AI-driven insights.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of unstructured enterprise file data
2. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
3. Knowledge of Amazon Bedrock and Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP
4. Familiarity with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) workflows
5. Understanding of vector databases and their role in AI-driven insights

title: Harness your file data value with Amazon Bedrock and generative AI [REPEAT]
description: As customers seek to unlock the full potential of their unstructured enterprise file data, many are turning to generative AI for deeper insights. In this session, learn how to swiftly and securely integrate your company’s on-premises file data as a Knowledge Base for Amazon Bedrock using Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP. Explore how to implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) workflows to enrich generative AI with contextual information from your private data sources, ensuring more relevant, accurate, and customized responses. Discover how to efficiently manage and store this data in your vector database to optimize AI-driven insights.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of unstructured enterprise file data
2. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP
4. Familiarity with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) workflows
5. Experience with vector database management and optimization for AI-driven insights.

title: HBCUv: Reimagine online higher education experience & data management (sponsored by Deloitte)
description: HBCUv is a new educational platform built with AWS that combines multi-institutional registration, a centralized learning management system, comprehensive analytical models, and a student engagement platform for multiple UNCF institutions. Learn how HBCUv is reimagining the legacy, community, and culture of HBCUs into a virtual experience that is accessible, equitable, and connected, by bringing the on-campus experience to a virtual environment. New data models that capture engagement, registration, and learning insights can help institutions provide better support and pave the way for a shared services model in the future. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the "HBCUv" presentation:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Knowledge of educational technology and learning management systems.
3. Familiarity with the challenges and opportunities faced by Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs).
4. Awareness of data analytics and its application in the education sector.
5. Interest in exploring innovative solutions for improving accessibility, equity, and community engagement in higher education.

title: HelloFresh: AWS for scalable data mesh and generative AI success
description: HelloFresh’s explosive growth—200% yearly data expansion while scaling to eight brands across 18 countries—isn’t just a typical data mesh story. It’s a journey of hard-earned lessons in navigating a cultural transformation to fully harness the power of data. In this session, discover how HelloFresh, with AWS Cloud solutions, built an innovative, cost-effective data ecosystem. Explore how they overcame initial failures and challenges through cross-functional collaboration, training, and enablement. Gain practical insights into scaling data platforms, early-stage planning, and building the foundations for delivering personalized, scalable food solutions globally. Learn the lessons they wish they had known from the start.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:
1. Understanding of data mesh architecture
2. Knowledge of cloud-based data solutions, preferably AWS
3. Interest in cultural transformation and cross-functional collaboration for data-driven initiatives
4. Familiarity with the food delivery industry and the challenges of scaling personalized solutions globally

title: Heroku next-generation platform for cloud-native workloads (sponsored by Salesforce)
description: Learn about the Heroku developer platform and Salesforce’s plans to iterate and expand it to a next-generation platform, powered by Kubernetes, that embraces cloud-native standards and cutting-edge Postgres offerings. This presentation is brought to you by Salesforce, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing platforms
2. Familiarity with Kubernetes and container technologies
3. Knowledge of Postgres database and its features
4. Awareness of Salesforce's product offerings and cloud ecosystem

title: Higher productivity for AWS CloudFormation with Pkl and Rain
description: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with AWS CloudFormation provides a productive and safe way to manage infrastructure. The new Pkl declarative language and the CloudFormation Pkl library can bring further productivity gains through better type-safety, reusability with functions and data types, and great IDE support. When used with the Rain CLI, infrastructure can be defined with Pkl and easily tested/deployed. This chalk talk includes an introduction to writing CloudFormation templates with Pkl and using Rain to deploy them.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS CloudFormation
2. Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaC) concepts
3. Familiarity with programming languages and their syntax

title: High performance computing is a capacity challenge. We have solutions.
description: High performance computing (HPC) involves techniques that leverage speed and scale to let R&D teams solve problems in human scales of time. This chalk talk works through the tools, services, and techniques available to you in the cloud to ensure you're able to tap the right compute—at the right scale—when you need it. Discuss specialist HPC instances, interconnects, capacity blocks, and reservation tools so you can get predictable outcomes every time.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with high-performance computing (HPC) and its applications.
3. Knowledge of cloud-based HPC services and instances.
4. Understanding of interconnects, capacity blocks, and reservation tools in the cloud.
5. Awareness of techniques and tools used to leverage speed and scale in HPC.

title: High performance computing: Reinvented to help you think truly big
description: As more customers bring their high performance computing (HPC) workloads to AWS, we’re engineering new solutions to make sure running at cloud scale is a success factor for those customers, not a challenge. In this session, experts walk you straight past some of the undifferentiated heavy lifting you no longer need to do to spin up thousands (or millions) of cores to solve a hard problem. In collaboration with a guest customer, learn what HPC looks like when it’s reinvented like this and how much easier it is to think really, truly big.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of High-Performance Computing (HPC) workloads
2. Familiarity with AWS cloud services and infrastructure
3. Experience in scaling computing resources to thousands or millions of cores
4. Knowledge of cloud-based solutions for HPC challenges
5. Collaboration with customers in the HPC domain

title: High performance distributed model training with Amazon SageMaker
description: Foundation models continue to grow in size with billions or even trillions of parameters, and they often won’t fit into a single accelerator device such as a GPU. Amazon SageMaker distributed training capabilities help you apply advanced parallelization techniques, communication optimizations, and efficient checkpointing strategies to distribute your training workload across hundreds or thousands of GPUs, reducing model training time and cost by up to 20%. Join this session for a deep dive into the infrastructure used to run distributed training at scale. Learn how to integrate Amazon SageMaker training capabilities to reduce the total cost of foundation model development.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon SageMaker and its capabilities
3. Understanding of distributed training techniques and parallelization strategies
4. Experience with large-scale model training and optimization

title: High-performance generative AI on Amazon EKS
description: Generative AI models have opened up new possibilities in computing, but deploying them effectively can be challenging. Many are turning to open source tools on Kubernetes for solutions. Join this session to explore how Amazon EKS can address the infrastructure needs of generative AI, including GPU acceleration, scalability, and low-latency responses. Learn practical insights, see case studies of successful implementations, and discover best practices for using Amazon EKS to control costs while optimizing performance.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Kubernetes
2. Understanding of GPU-accelerated computing
3. Familiarity with generative AI models
4. Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment
5. Awareness of cost optimization and performance optimization strategies

title: High-performance LLM inference scaling on Amazon EKS
description: Unlock the full potential of large language model (LLM) inference on Amazon EKS using leading open source frameworks. Learn to construct highly scalable, GPU-accelerated clusters with Amazon EKS–optimized AMIs and NVIDIA CUDA runtimes. This chalk talk compares state-of-the-art open source inference engines with leading LLM frameworks. Explore performance metrics, auto scaling capabilities, NVIDIA GPU inference execution, and seamless integration with AWS services for maximum efficiency and scalability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service)
2. Understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their applications
3. Experience with open-source machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
4. Knowledge of container technologies (e.g., Docker) and orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes)
5. Familiarity with NVIDIA CUDA and GPU-accelerated computing

title: High-performance storage for AI/ML, analytics, and HPC workloads
description: AWS storage services can act as a powerful, cost-effective foundation for any high-performance workload, from genomics analysis to media rendering and real-time analytics. In this session, explore storage options that are suitable for numerous architectures, data types, and organizational requirements and that can accelerate your most performance-critical applications to speed up time to insights and time to market. From data ingestion to processing and storage, learn advanced techniques and best practices for achieving peak performance at scale for your most demanding workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Experience with high-performance workloads or applications
4. Knowledge of data storage and processing requirements
5. Familiarity with performance optimization techniques

title: High-scale performance optimization of serving multiple FMs [REPEAT]
description: This hands-on workshop empowers you to revolutionize your personalization use cases by mastering the art of fine-tuning models using Parameter Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT). Dive into open source techniques like S-LoRA, LoRAX, and Punica to streamline the training and hosting of high-performance, scalable LoRA adapters. Unleash the power of Amazon SageMaker optimization techniques and uncover the optimal deployment strategies, including inference components and multi-model endpoints. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning concepts
2. Basic understanding of natural language processing (NLP)
3. Experience with Python programming
4. Familiarity with Amazon SageMaker

title: High-scale performance optimization of serving multiple FMs [REPEAT]
description: This hands-on workshop empowers you to revolutionize your personalization use cases by mastering the art of fine-tuning models using Parameter Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT). Dive into open source techniques like S-LoRA, LoRAX, and Punica to streamline the training and hosting of high-performance, scalable LoRA adapters. Unleash the power of Amazon SageMaker optimization techniques and uncover the optimal deployment strategies, including inference components and multi-model endpoints. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with Python programming language.
3. Experience with natural language processing or computer vision tasks.
4. Familiarity with AWS SageMaker or other cloud-based machine learning platforms.

title: HIPAA-compliant IVD SaaS: Werfen's global AWS solution journey
description: Explore Werfen's AWS journey in developing their digital factory platform, enhancing customer experience and patient care in healthcare. Learn how Werfen created a HIPAA-compliant AWS landing zone, designed a hybrid cloud application, and deployed a multi-tenant platform using SaaS-first principles. Discover the technology stack behind their medical imaging application and the tradeoffs considered for high scalability, operational excellence, security, resiliency, and data residency. This session illuminates Werfen's path to building a global cloud solution on AWS, offering insights into architecting secure, scalable platforms for the medical devices sector.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Knowledge of healthcare industry regulations and compliance requirements, particularly HIPAA.
3. Familiarity with hybrid cloud architectures and SaaS-based platforms.
4. Experience in designing and deploying secure, scalable, and resilient cloud-based applications.
5. Interest in the medical devices sector and the challenges of building global cloud solutions.

title: Honda’s EV charging experience with Amazon Bedrock and AWS IoT Core
description: Join this session to learn how Honda worked with AWS to redefine the in-vehicle EV charging experience. By combining data from its connected vehicle platform, external data sources, and layering in generative AI, Honda delivers a personalized, connected, and intelligent charging solution that caters to the evolving needs of EV owners. At the core of this experience is Honda’s use of Amazon Bedrock, providing drivers with personalized charging recommendations and route guidance by factoring in battery health data, driving patterns, and available charging stations.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of connected vehicle technology
2. Knowledge of electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure
3. Familiarity with data integration and analysis
4. Awareness of generative AI and its applications
5. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock platform

title: Host multiplayer games on Amazon GameLift with containers and anywhere [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn about the features, architectural patterns, and best practices of Amazon GameLift, a fully managed global game server hosting solution. Explore the differences between hosting options, including recently launched containers support as well as traditional virtual machine hosting. Also learn how the new Amazon GameLift Agent can be leveraged to run game servers anywhere in the world and to host development environments for fast iteration. Finally, learn about the complete architecture for integrating your game client and game backend with Amazon GameLift.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of game server hosting and deployment
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and services
3. Knowledge of container technologies and their usage in game development
4. Experience with game client-server architecture

title: Host multiplayer games on Amazon GameLift with containers and anywhere [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn about the features, architectural patterns, and best practices of Amazon GameLift, a fully managed global game server hosting solution. Explore the differences between hosting options, including recently launched containers support as well as traditional virtual machine hosting. Also learn how the new Amazon GameLift Agent can be leveraged to run game servers anywhere in the world and to host development environments for fast iteration. Finally, learn about the complete architecture for integrating your game client and game backend with Amazon GameLift.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of game server hosting
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with container technologies (optional)

title: Hours to minutes: The gen AI evolution in Convera's customer experience (sponsored by Rackspace Technology)
description: Convera is a leading B2B fintech in global payments, transacting in more than 140 currencies in over 200 countries. In a fast-paced industry where customer experience is key, the response time and effective resolution in support escalations are critical. In this insightful session, learn how Convera is using gen AI to streamline over 230,000 monthly support requests. Explore how Convera and Rackspace created a groundbreaking solution that blends advanced generative AI technologies such as Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Comprehend, and Claude 3 to orchestrate complex email classification and revolutionize operational workflows, cutting response time from hours to minutes. This presentation is brought to you by Rackspace Technology, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of fintech and global payments industry
2. Understanding of customer experience and support escalations in a fast-paced industry
3. Familiarity with generative AI technologies, such as Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Comprehend, and Claude 3
4. Understanding of email classification and operational workflow automation
5. Awareness of Rackspace Technology and its partnership with AWS

title: How Abrigo transformed its business with AWS: Lessons learned
description: In this session, discover how Abrigo (a leading fintech company for over 2,400 community financial institutions) used the AWS global services to successfully migrate to AWS and modernize their infrastructure, achieving significant operational efficiencies and cost savings. Explore the challenges faced by Abrigo and the strategic solutions deployed, getting actionable insights for organizations embarking on their cloud transformation journeys. Join this session to learn key strategies for seamless migration, automation, and infrastructure modernization, backed by real-world results and best practices.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with infrastructure migration and modernization
3. Interest in fintech industry and cloud transformation strategies
4. Desire to learn from real-world case studies and best practices

title: How AI and ML are changing information retrieval (sponsored by OpenSearch)
description: When we work with information systems, we capture information in text and find information with text queries. Advances in AI have made it possible to move from word-to-word matching to something like meaning-to-meaning matching. Learn how search and OpenSearch unlock the meaning in your information. This session is foundational, covering why we search and how we search to retrieve the best results. Learn about the core search algorithm, BM25 scoring, dense and sparse vectors, LLMs, embedding generation, the neural and kNN plugins, and exact and approximate scoring. This presentation is brought to you by OpenSearch, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Basic understanding of information systems and data management.
2. Familiarity with text-based information retrieval and search algorithms.
3. Knowledge of machine learning and natural language processing concepts.
4. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.

title: How Air Canada is innovating customer service across lines of business
description: Providing exceptional self-guided customer service is crucial for customer satisfaction and operational efficiency, such as improved experiences and reduced wait times. In this session, Air Canada shares their journey enabling differentiated, context-aware self-service with Amazon Connect across business units like Air Canada Cargo. Discover how Amazon Connect can help you design and deliver intelligent self-service capabilities, maintain context across channels, and provide personalized assistance all without specialized expertise.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of customer service principles
2. Familiarity with contact center technologies
3. Knowledge of Amazon Connect
4. Awareness of business unit integration
5. Desire to improve customer experience and operational efficiency

title: How Amazon.com powers customer-obsessed service with Amazon Connect
description: At Amazon.com, being customer-obsessed is key to earning trust though every customer service interaction. In this session, learn how Amazon customer service, the largest worldwide customer for Amazon Connect, scales to billions of customer interactions per year using Amazon Connect to deliver convenient, personalized customer experiences. Hear how Amazon is investing in generative AI to augment customer service interactions that address complex customer support needs in a comprehensive manner worldwide.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of customer service principles and best practices
2. Familiarity with cloud-based contact center solutions
3. Knowledge of Amazon Connect and its capabilities
4. Awareness of the role of generative AI in customer service
5. Interest in scaling customer service operations to handle high volumes of interactions

title: How Amazon.com uses AWS Regions to improve customer experience
description: Learn how and why Amazon.com is expanding to more AWS Regions and building services so they can be easily deployed and moved to different regions. In this session discover the benefits of using multiple AWS Regions and Amazon.com’s learnings and best practices for building and managing regionally flexible services. Learn about approaches for decoupling services from specific regions, managing application latency and dependencies, and architecting to leverage the benefits of region diversity, customer proximity, and cost optimization that can be gained from a region flexible deployment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Regions and Availability Zones
2. Knowledge of AWS services and their regional availability
3. Familiarity with distributed system architecture
4. Experience with service-oriented or microservices-based application design
5. Understanding of cloud-native application development and deployment practices

title: How Amazon threat intelligence helps protect your infrastructure
description: Explore AWS threat intelligence capabilities and learn how they power managed firewall rules and security findings in security services such as AWS WAF, AWS Network Firewall, and Amazon Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall. Learn about the threat intelligence AWS uses to protect AWS infrastructure, build new security features, and empower customers to enhance their application protection on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS security services (AWS WAF, AWS Network Firewall, Amazon Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall)
2. Understanding of network security concepts and firewall configurations
3. Knowledge of threat intelligence and its role in cybersecurity
4. Experience with AWS infrastructure and application deployment

title: How an analytics engineer uses AWS in a financial company
description: In this dev talk, hear about the importance of the analytics engineer role in Banco Itaú, the largest financial company in South America. Take a deep dive on how AWS offers a series of tools and services that can be used by analytics engineer teams to build data and analytics pipelines in order to get insights from financial data.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data analytics and data engineering concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and tools
3. Knowledge of financial data and analytics
4. Experience in building data pipelines and data processing
5. Understanding of the role of analytics engineers in financial organizations

title: How AWS can help meet your digital sovereignty requirements [REPEAT]
description: Customers in regulated industries such as PS, healthcare, FSI, and telecom have shared how they face digital sovereignty concerns in their cloud journeys. In this chalk talk, discover how AWS is sovereign by design, and explore the range of AWS capabilities that can help you meet your digital sovereignty needs. In addition, learn how the AWS European Sovereign Cloud is being built to provide further choice to meet these needs. Join this talk to explore how AWS can help you accelerate your cloud journey while meeting your requirements.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this chalk talk could be:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and its adoption in regulated industries.
2. Familiarity with digital sovereignty and its importance in cloud deployments.
3. Knowledge of AWS services and capabilities.
4. Awareness of the AWS European Sovereign Cloud initiative.
5. Interest in accelerating cloud adoption while addressing digital sovereignty requirements.

title: How AWS can help meet your digital sovereignty requirements [REPEAT]
description: Customers in regulated industries such as PS, healthcare, FSI, and telecom have shared how they face digital sovereignty concerns in their cloud journeys. In this chalk talk, discover how AWS is sovereign by design, and explore the range of AWS capabilities that can help you meet your digital sovereignty needs. In addition, learn how the AWS European Sovereign Cloud is being built to provide further choice to meet these needs. Join this talk to explore how AWS can help you accelerate your cloud journey while meeting your requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its adoption in regulated industries.
2. Familiarity with digital sovereignty and its importance in cloud deployments.
3. Knowledge of AWS services and capabilities.
4. Interest in exploring AWS solutions for meeting digital sovereignty requirements.
5. Desire to accelerate cloud adoption while addressing regulatory and compliance needs.

title: How AWS is helping to reduce the carbon footprint of AI workloads
description: In this lightning talk, learn how AWS is innovating to improve the sustainability of its infrastructure and how that helps its customers reduce the carbon footprint of their workloads by as much as 99%. From optimizing its data center design to investing in purpose-built chips to implementing new cooling technologies, AWS is working on ways to increase the energy efficiency of its facilities to better serve our customers’ sustainability needs and the scaled use of AI.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the lightning talk:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with sustainability and environmental impact in the context of technology infrastructure.
3. Interest in learning about innovative approaches to improving the energy efficiency of data centers.
4. Desire to understand how AWS is addressing the sustainability needs of its customers.
5. Curiosity about the role of AI in enhancing the sustainability of cloud infrastructure.

title: How bpx streamlines cloud migration with AWS and Dynatrace (sponsored by Dynatrace)
description: In this session, bpx, a prominent oil and gas producer, transformed its cloud operations by transitioning to OneCloud using Dynatrace and AWS, overcoming challenges such as limited observability and long timescales for troubleshooting. Learn how bpx utilized Dynatrace dashboards and notebooks for proactive monitoring, significantly reducing troubleshooting durations and providing a consolidated view of performance metrics. Explore actionable strategies for using AWS and Dynatrace to ensure a seamless cloud transition, driving operational efficiency and innovation in your own organizations. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud operations and cloud migration
2. Familiarity with Dynatrace and AWS
3. Experience with performance monitoring and troubleshooting in a cloud environment

title: How Cambia supercharged their Amazon EKS based platform (sponsored by Datadog)
description: Containers are the standard for packaging and deploying modern, cloud-native applications, and a rich ecosystem has grown around them. Community projects like Kubernetes, Argo CD, and others empower organizations to operate more scalable, reliable systems. As a technology leader in the healthcare industry, Cambia Health Solutions has used containers for a long time, but they recently migrated from Amazon ECS to Amazon EKS in order to take advantage of the expansive Kubernetes ecosystem. Learn more about their migration and the tools they’ve used to increase their development velocity, improve reliability, and harness more power from their AWS compute resources. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of containers and their benefits
2. Familiarity with Kubernetes and its ecosystem
3. Knowledge of cloud computing platforms, particularly AWS

title: How can one person build an enterprise-grade data lake? [Korean]
description: This session is delivered in Korean. Learn how to build a secure financial data lake quickly and easily. Samsung Life Insurance built a small-scale analysis data warehouse on AWS and is gradually expanding to a company-wide data lake. It uses AWS serverless analytics services such as AWS Glue, Amazon QuickSight and Amazon MWAA for rapid deployment, implementing them in-house rather than outsourcing. It also uses AWS Security Hub and AWS Lake Formation to secure data lake governance and comply with personal information protection laws in the Korean finance industry.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Korean language
2. Understanding of data lake architecture and its components
3. Familiarity with AWS services, such as AWS Glue, Amazon QuickSight, Amazon MWAA, AWS Security Hub, and AWS Lake Formation
4. Experience in data governance and compliance with personal information protection laws
5. Familiarity with the Korean finance industry and its regulations.
