title: How climate tech startups build on AWS to address climate change [REPEAT]
description: The world is racing to get to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 to mitigate global warming. Speed is critical; generative AI and cutting-edge advanced cloud computing are important tools to accelerate the build and deployment of climate solutions. In this lightning talk, learn how AWS helps climate technology startups quickly and affordably build technology that is solving big problems related to climate change. It features AWS resources for climate technology startups and offers examples of AWS services that are critical for climate technology startups looking to contribute to climate mitigation efforts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of climate change and the need for net-zero carbon emissions.
2. Knowledge of generative AI and advanced cloud computing technologies.
3. Interest in climate technology startups and their role in climate mitigation efforts.
4. Familiarity with AWS services and resources for climate technology startups.
5. Desire to learn about how AWS can help accelerate the development and deployment of climate solutions.

title: How climate tech startups build on AWS to address climate change [REPEAT]
description: The world is racing to get to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 to mitigate global warming. Speed is critical; generative AI and cutting-edge advanced cloud computing are important tools to accelerate the build and deployment of climate solutions. In this lightning talk, learn how AWS helps climate technology startups quickly and affordably build technology that is solving big problems related to climate change. It features AWS resources for climate technology startups and offers examples of AWS services that are critical for climate technology startups looking to contribute to climate mitigation efforts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of climate change and the need for net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.
2. Knowledge of generative AI and advanced cloud computing technologies.
3. Interest in climate technology startups and their role in addressing climate change.

title: How Coupang Pay boosts developer productivity with generative AI [Korean]
description: This lightning talk is delivered in Korean. Coupang Pay, an e-commerce payment company in Korea, uses generative AI on AWS to boost organization productivity. Facing rapid service improvements and high security, they launched two initiatives: auto code generation for developers and a wiki-based chatbot for non-developers in Amazon Bedrock. Learn about the challenges they overcame and the measurable impact on developer velocity, organizational agility for non-developers, and AI-assisted development at scale with AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Korean language
2. Understanding of e-commerce payment systems
3. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
4. Experience with AWS services, particularly Amazon Bedrock
5. Interest in organizational productivity and agility using AI-powered solutions

title: How customers optimize network and EBS workloads on Amazon EC2
description: The EC2 network optimized instances portfolio offers customers one of the highest, most consistent, network performances in the cloud for workloads such as security and network virtual appliances. EC2 network optimized instances also offer the highest Elastic Block Storage (EBS) performance in EC2 for workloads such as SQL/NoSQL databases, in-memory databases, and more. Join AND learn how customers are leveraging these instances types to get the best workload performance and optimize cost on EC2.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services
2. Knowledge of network performance and virtual appliances
3. Familiarity with SQL/NoSQL databases and in-memory databases
4. Interest in optimizing workload performance and cost on EC2

title: How developers can self-remediate AWS Security Hub findings
description: When AWS Security Hub findings go unhandled, your AWS environments may be at risk. To address this, our organization developed a mechanism that helps AWS account holders respond to Security Hub findings swiftly and efficiently. In this dev chat, learn the three key principles of this approach: actionable notifications to ensure notifications prompt immediate actions, clear responsibility that assigns notifications to specific on-call personnel to foster ownership, and risk management that tailors responses to fit the unique risk profiles of organizations and teams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Security Hub and its functionality
2. Knowledge of incident response and risk management principles
3. Familiarity with AWS account management and access control
4. Experience in developing custom solutions or integrations within the AWS ecosystem
5. Awareness of organizational security policies and best practices

title: How Drata closed more deals after adding over 30 product integrations (sponsored by Merge)
description: Drata faced a challenge when starting to build their product: Integrating with their customers' various HRIS and ticketing solutions was critical to streamline the compliance process. However, building and managing each one was a massive, resource-draining task that would take months. Hear directly from the CTO and cofounder of Drata on how they solved this problem with Merge. Learn how Drata saved engineering resources and accelerated deal closures with Merge’s Unified API to easily add HRIS, ticketing, and SCIM directory integrations. This presentation is brought to you by Merge, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of HRIS (Human Resource Information System) and ticketing solutions.
2. Familiarity with the compliance process and the challenges of integrating with various systems.
3. Knowledge of the Merge Unified API and its capabilities in streamlining integration tasks.
4. Awareness of the benefits of leveraging an AWS Partner solution like Merge.
5. Interest in learning how Drata, a company, solved their integration challenges using Merge.

title: How Duolingo's culture of experimentation drives innovation
description: Amazon's unique approach to innovation is driven by culture, mechanisms, and our Day 1 mindset. Like Amazon, Duolingo's culture is what creates unique customer experiences and drives innovation. The world's most popular education app runs hundreds of A/B tests every day to improve the experience for its millions of learners. Whether it's testing the motivating power of delightful animations or trying out new exercise types, Duolingo has built a culture that prioritizes experimentation across the company. Learn more about its testing mechanisms and tools, as well as the impact these tests have had on developing differentiated customer experiences.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of Amazon's approach to innovation and its "Day 1" mindset.
2. Knowledge of Duolingo's culture and its focus on creating unique customer experiences.
3. Familiarity with A/B testing and its role in driving innovation at Duolingo.
4. Awareness of the various testing mechanisms and tools used by Duolingo.
5. Appreciation for the impact of Duolingo's testing on developing differentiated customer experiences.

title: How event-driven architectures can go wrong and how to fix them [REPEAT]
description: Event-driven architectures enable speed and agility for distributed cloud applications; however, this also means there’s the risk of shipping bad ideas fast without governance. Fortunately, the same agility allows for quick fixes. Attend this chalk talk to learn common event-driven pitfalls, including YOLO events, god events, observability soup, event loops, exposing monoliths, state corruption, and surprise bills. Explore strategies and techniques teams can implement to avoid these pitfalls and reap the full benefits of event-driven architectures.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of event-driven architectures
2. Familiarity with distributed cloud applications
3. Knowledge of common event-driven pitfalls
4. Awareness of strategies and techniques to mitigate event-driven architecture challenges
5. Interest in learning about best practices for event-driven architectures

title: How event-driven architectures can go wrong and how to fix them [REPEAT]
description: Event-driven architectures enable speed and agility for distributed cloud applications; however, this also means there’s the risk of shipping bad ideas fast without governance. Fortunately, the same agility allows for quick fixes. Attend this chalk talk to learn common event-driven pitfalls, including YOLO events, god events, observability soup, event loops, exposing monoliths, state corruption, and surprise bills. Explore strategies and techniques teams can implement to avoid these pitfalls and reap the full benefits of event-driven architectures.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the event-driven architectures chalk talk:

1. Understanding of event-driven architecture concepts.
2. Familiarity with distributed cloud applications.
3. Awareness of the potential risks and challenges associated with event-driven architectures.
4. Interest in learning strategies and techniques to mitigate common event-driven pitfalls.
5. Desire to explore the benefits and trade-offs of event-driven architectures.

title: How Ford unlocked real-time insights using Apache Iceberg on AWS
description: In the era of connected vehicles, it’s crucial for automakers to use real-time, data-driven insights to enhance customer experiences and drive operational efficiencies. This session explores Ford’s collaboration with AWS to develop the Event Store, a key component of Ford’s Transportation Mobility Cloud (TMC). This platform processes 4 TB of real-time data daily from over 20 million vehicles, allowing insights around OTA updates, vehicle command and control, and telemetry. Ford’s strategic adoption of AWS services facilitated a petabyte-scale data lake using Apache Iceberg, improving data management and analysis and reducing SLAs by 50% while meeting low-latency requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of connected vehicle technology
2. Understanding of real-time data processing and analytics
3. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms and services
4. Exposure to big data management and storage solutions
5. Experience in automotive industry or transportation domain

title: How Frontdoor, Inc. boosts agent productivity with Amazon Connect
description: Contact center agents are a critical part of customer service delivery. Hear from AWS and Frontdoor, Inc.—the largest provider of home warranties in the US—about how you can empower agents and increase productivity with a unified, generative AI–powered workspace in Amazon Connect that provides agents the critical capabilities they need to deliver personalized service to your customers. Walk away with new ideas about how to improve agent handling of complex customer inquiries, and make every agent your best agent, starting their first day.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of contact center operations and customer service delivery
2. Familiarity with Amazon Connect or interest in cloud-based contact center solutions
3. Interest in leveraging generative AI to enhance agent productivity and customer experience

title: How generative AI can boost developer productivity & player experience
description: In this chalk talk, learn how generative AI can boost developer productivity, enhance player experiences, and expand replayability by transforming content into dynamic, personalized in-game experiences. Discover how Amazon Q Developer empowers your team to focus on challenges, and explore how Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases and Amazon Bedrock Agents can build a conversational Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture to improve gameplay and engagement. This talk is ideal for game developers, designers, and AI enthusiasts looking to use generative AI for unforgettable gaming experiences.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of game development principles
2. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
3. Interest in exploring the integration of generative AI in game development

title: How generative AI can transform service delivery
description: This lightning talk covers various generative AI technologies and techniques that can be used by public sector agencies to enhance citizen experiences. Making highly accessible, localized, quality information available to your citizens 24/7 has never been more within reach. This talk briefly explores topics such as curating knowledge stores, building retrieval systems, and adding natural language interfaces to your public services. All of this is easier than ever with the help of AWS solutions and services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AI and machine learning concepts
2. Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) and conversational interfaces
3. Knowledge of public sector services and citizen engagement
4. Awareness of cloud computing and AWS services

title: How generative AI is transforming legal tech with AWS
description: NetDocuments leads in cloud-based document management for the legal sector. Their platform enables global document storage, sharing, and collaboration. Learn how ND advances document management with innovative solutions and semantic search, processing millions of documents daily. The legal industry, including law firms and corporate legal departments, often grapples with large, complex documents. As generative AI evolves, new productivity-enhancing applications emerge: searching vast document repositories, summarizing files, powering Q&A systems, and drafting documents. This session explores how generative AI can transform legal work, boost efficiency, and streamline document-heavy workflows, revolutionizing the profession.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of cloud-based document management systems.
2. Knowledge of the legal industry's document management challenges.
3. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications in the legal field.
4. Awareness of the potential impact of generative AI on legal workflows and productivity.
5. Interest in exploring innovative solutions for document-heavy tasks in the legal profession.

title: How Gousto reduces food waste and increases workforce productivity
description: In this session, hear how Gousto, a British meal kit retailer, built a scalable Industrial Data Fabric (IDF) to gain real-time and historical operations visibility. Gousto relies on equipment vendors to provide much of their data, which can add complexity, cost, and time delays. To resolve these challenges, AWS and an AWS Partner helped build a modern IDF using AWS IoT SiteWise, AWS IoT Core, and Amazon Monitron. Hear about the business benefits of their unified namespace architecture and how the customer uses advanced analytics, ML, and generative AI on top of their industrial data foundation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Industrial Data Fabric (IDF) concepts
2. Knowledge of AWS IoT SiteWise, AWS IoT Core, and Amazon Monitron
3. Experience with advanced analytics, machine learning, and generative AI

title: How Hard Rock Digital built a multi-region sportsbook with CockroachDB (sponsored by Cockroach Labs)
description: In this session, the Hard Rock Digital team shares their journey launching the Hard Rock Sportsbook, a multi-region sports betting application that complies with strict regulatory requirements. Learn about the challenges they faced building a highly available, compliant, and performant application that scales across multiple regions and handles high transaction volumes, and how they addressed those challenges with CockroachDB. Also learn how the team runs CockroachDB on AWS to auto scale during high-demand championship sporting events while optimizing infrastructure costs. Explore their reference architecture to see how they are utilizing Amazon EC2 and AWS Outposts in conjunction with CockroachDB. This presentation is brought to you by Cockroach Labs, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of sports betting industry and regulatory requirements
2. Knowledge of building highly available and scalable applications
3. Familiarity with CockroachDB and its features
4. Experience with AWS services, such as EC2 and Outposts
5. Interest in learning about real-world use cases of CockroachDB

title: How ICE implemented a developer-focused DevSecOps workflow (sponsored by Snyk)
description: Building applications on AWS offers flexibility and scale, but security often becomes more complex to manage using traditional AppSec methodologies. With increased use of open source, containers, infrastructure as code, and now gen AI solutions, the software risk environment has shifted rapidly, increasing friction between engineering and security. As a result, ICE implemented DevSecOps philosophies that help security to fit neatly into the SDLC. Join the Senior Director of Information Security at ICE and the Field CTO at Snyk to hear the value of implementing a workflow that empowers developers to build securely from the first line of code. This presentation is brought to you by Snyk, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS and its services
2. Familiarity with DevSecOps principles
3. Knowledge of open-source software, containers, and infrastructure as code
4. Awareness of the challenges in managing security in a rapidly evolving software risk environment

title: How ICEYE uses satellite data & generative AI to speed flood response
description: Over the past two years, climate change increased flood risks by 23% with an estimated 1.81 billion people now facing flood risk and consequences like disease, clean water scarcity, and food insecurity. Response organizations need precise, real-time updates to save lives and reduce the impact of flooding on communities. Discover how ICEYE and AWS combine satellite-acquired geospatial imagery and generative AI to help first responders access precise insights and take action faster. Find out how ICEYE uses Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock foundation models to capture and automate disaster location and impact data for response teams.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given text would be:

1. Knowledge of climate change and its impact on flood risks.
2. Understanding of the importance of real-time updates for disaster response organizations.
3. Familiarity with satellite-acquired geospatial imagery and generative AI technologies.
4. Awareness of Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock foundation models.
5. Appreciation for the need to capture and automate disaster location and impact data for response teams.

title: How Merck improves drug design with biological foundation models
description: In this session, learn how Merck is modernizing its drug discovery process with the integration of biological foundation models. Merck shares firsthand experience into how the company has modernized its generative biology inference stack using AWS HealthOmics, which helps them scale and unlock new insights.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of drug discovery process
2. Knowledge of biological foundation models
3. Familiarity with AWS HealthOmics
4. Awareness of Merck's drug discovery initiatives
5. Interest in modernizing generative biology inference stack

title: How Mindbody migrated 60,000 SQL Server databases to AWS
description: Mindbody’s complex monolithic application, built with Windows Server and over 60,000 SQL Server databases, underwent a multi-phased migration journey from its data centers to AWS Local Zones and Regions. During its migration testing, Mindbody needed to use the elasticity and capacity of the AWS Cloud, but they experienced application latency issues. In this session, technical leaders from Mindbody and AWS share Mindbody’s migration journey: the challenges; architecture designs; technical, licensing, and cost considerations; lessons learned; and successful outcomes. Learn how Mindbody’s journey created new opportunities, improved application reliability, reduced costs, and unleashed innovation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Understanding of Windows Server and SQL Server technologies.
2. Knowledge of cloud migration strategies and challenges.
3. Familiarity with AWS services, including Local Zones and Regions.
4. Experience with application performance optimization and latency management.
5. Interest in learning from a real-world migration case study.

title: How Moderna Is building a healthier supply chain
description: Moderna, a pioneering biotechnology company and leader in mRNA medicine, has undergone a significant supply chain transformation over the past year. Through strong technology partnerships, Moderna’s supply chain and digital teams have worked cross-functionally to enhance vaccine replenishment strategies and optimize distribution processes. These advancements have also improved in-stock rates and minimized waste from expired products. This session looks into how AWS collaborated with Moderna to drive this critical transformation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Expertise in biotechnology and mRNA medicine
2. Experience in supply chain management and digital transformation
3. Collaboration with technology partners, such as AWS
4. Cross-functional teamwork between supply chain and digital teams
5. Focus on enhancing vaccine replenishment strategies and optimizing distribution processes

title: How NAB uses Amazon Q Developer for increased productivity
description: Significantly accelerate development by customizing Amazon Q Developer to generate even more relevant inline code recommendations and chat responses (in preview) by making it aware of your internal libraries, APIs, best practices, and architectural patterns. In this lightning talk, you learn how National Australia Bank (NAB) is using Amazon Q Developer to help their development teams ship faster, and innovate more for their customers, by using customizations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Q Developer
2. Understanding of internal libraries, APIs, best practices, and architectural patterns
3. Experience in customizing and integrating AI-powered tools for development teams
4. Knowledge of National Australia Bank's (NAB) development processes and challenges

title: How Natera safeguards AWS data with data security posture management (sponsored by BigID)
description: Given the growth in data volume, velocity, variety, and vulnerabilities, data security is critical for organizations handling sensitive information. For Natera, a leader in genetic testing and diagnostics, safeguarding vast amounts of sensitive data in the cloud is not just a requirement—it’s an essential task. As the company transitioned more of its operations to AWS, Natera leveraged a robust data security posture management (DSPM) solution from BigID to help identify and protect sensitive data while maintaining compliance with several data privacy and regulatory requirements, such as HIPAA. In this lightning talk, join Natera and BigID to discover practical strategies that can help strengthen security posture and reduce risk. This presentation is brought to you by BigID, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given scenario would be:

1. Understanding the importance of data security in the context of increasing data volume, velocity, variety, and vulnerabilities.
2. Knowledge of the challenges faced by organizations, like Natera, in safeguarding sensitive data in the cloud.
3. Familiarity with data security posture management (DSPM) solutions and their role in identifying and protecting sensitive data.
4. Awareness of regulatory requirements, such as HIPAA, that organizations need to comply with when handling sensitive data.
5. Interest in learning practical strategies to strengthen security posture and reduce risk.

title: How Netflix autopilots migration from Amazon RDS to Aurora at scale
description: At Netflix, we wanted to migrate from Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL to address limitations in scalability, availability, and crash recovery of single-node databases. To support this migration, we developed a self-service system that allows customers to effortlessly migrate RDS instances to Aurora clusters. This chalk talk outlines our automated migration tool, which we built internally using AWS Database Migration Service (DMS), and explores the challenges faced in migrating Netflix’s diverse fleet of customer-managed RDS instances.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL
2. Understanding of the limitations in scalability, availability, and crash recovery of single-node databases
3. Familiarity with Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL
4. Knowledge of AWS Database Migration Service (DMS)
5. Experience in developing self-service systems for database migrations

title: How Netflix benchmarks FMs and LLMs across hardware chipsets
description: Netflix deploys various foundation models on standard CPUs and specialized accelerated computing chips from providers like NVIDIA, AWS, AMD, and Intel. Optimizing instance selection based on price and performance is crucial for rightsizing workloads, achieving cost efficiencies, and accurately forecasting infrastructure needs. In this session, hear Netflix’s approach to automating FM performance benchmarking using FMBench, an open source tool developed by AWS. Learn how FMBench simplifies deployment of FMs to Amazon EC2 and FMBench's reporting capabilities, which capture key performance and accuracy metrics, enabling data-driven decisions based on latency, throughput, and cost requirements.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session would be:

1. Knowledge of foundation models (FMs) and their deployment on various computing platforms.
2. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and instance selection for optimizing cost and performance.
3. Familiarity with automated benchmarking tools, such as FMBench, and their capabilities.
4. Experience in deploying and evaluating the performance of FMs on Amazon EC2.
5. Interest in data-driven decision-making based on latency, throughput, and cost metrics.

title: How Netflix handles sudden load spikes in the cloud
description: Netflix operates at full active across four AWS Regions, serving their global traffic by intelligently steering users and managing costs via thousands of auto scaling compute server groups. At various times, traffic surges hit their service that could exceed capacity. In this session, walk through how Netflix solves these problems by pairing predictive automated pre-scaling with fast reactive auto scaling in combination with advanced resilience techniques like prioritized load shedding, cross-Region traffic shifting, targeted capacity injection by service criticality, and more. Discover how to maintain a low level of spend while being ready for sudden load spikes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS Regions and their purpose.
2. Knowledge of auto scaling and its application in managing compute resources.
3. Familiarity with predictive analytics and its use in capacity planning.
4. Understanding of resilience techniques, such as load shedding, traffic shifting, and capacity injection.
5. Experience with cost optimization strategies in cloud environments.

title: How not to fail at AI: Bring AI to life with DataStax AI PaaS on AWS (sponsored by DataStax)
description: Have your AI initiatives stalled because of tool confusion or uncertainty? You’re not alone. Generative AI applications can be an expensive failure. Organizations using DataStax AI PaaS and Amazon Bedrock are quickly delivering real business value securely with their AI applications. In this session, hear from DataStax customers on their AI journeys, their trials and failures, and how they finally brought all the necessary teams together to deploy successfully with DataStax and AWS. Learn how they used DataStax AI PaaS, the real results they are achieving, and how they maintain relevance with future technology. This presentation is brought to you by DataStax, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Familiarity with AI initiatives and the challenges faced in their implementation.
2. Interest in understanding how organizations have successfully deployed AI applications using DataStax AI PaaS and Amazon Bedrock.
3. Desire to learn from the experiences and lessons shared by DataStax customers.
4. Curiosity about the real-world results and benefits achieved through the use of DataStax and AWS technologies.
5. Willingness to explore how to maintain relevance with future technology advancements.

title: How Nykaa automates product descriptions using generative AI
description: Inaccurate or incomplete online product descriptions can lower a retailer’s conversion rates and impact revenue. Join this session to learn how Nykaa, India’s largest online beauty and personal care retailer, is using machine learning and generative AI to identify product attributes from images and generate standard product descriptions, improving accuracy, productivity, and click-through rates.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning and generative AI
2. Knowledge of product description generation
3. Familiarity with the e-commerce industry and online retail challenges
4. Awareness of Nykaa's business model and operations
5. Interest in improving product description accuracy and conversion rates

title: How Pearson elevates CX with Amazon Connect & Salesforce Service Cloud
description: Are you tired of disjointed agent and customer experiences due to siloed CRM and contact center applications? In this session, learn how Pearson Clinical Assessments is using Amazon Connect and Salesforce Service Cloud Voice to empower agents with a unified, AI-powered workspace that consolidates interactions across voice, chat, and other digital channels for an effortless customer experience. Learn how advanced AI capabilities can boost agent productivity with real-time insights, intelligent recommendations, and automated workflows. Join this session to discover the future of customer-centric operations, where CRM and contact center are harmonized for seamless and efficient omnichannel engagement, driving business growth and success.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) and contact center applications
2. Knowledge of cloud-based contact center solutions like Amazon Connect
3. Familiarity with Salesforce Service Cloud and its capabilities
4. Awareness of AI-powered technologies and their applications in customer service
5. Interest in improving customer experience and agent productivity through integrated solutions

title: How Principal Financial improved productivity with Amazon Q Business
description: Delivering an exceptional customer experience is crucial for businesses to succeed in today’s competitive landscape. In this session, Principal Financial shares its transformative journey leveraging the powerful capabilities of Amazon Q Business. Learn how Amazon Q Business was implemented across the Customer Support team and dive into the key challenges faced, such as legacy system integrations and training. This session also highlights best practices for seamlessly blending human and AI interactions to provide personalized, efficient customer service at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of customer experience management
2. Knowledge of Amazon Q Business capabilities
3. Experience with legacy system integrations
4. Familiarity with blending human and AI interactions for customer service
5. Awareness of best practices for scalable, personalized customer service

title: How Rivada Networks manages satellites via software networking on AWS
description: Active satellites are forecasted to grow from 8,377 to about 58,000 by 2030. Inter-satellite networks enable more reliable, accessible terrestrial networks and lay the foundation for space networks. However, simulating network connectivity across many orbital and ground objects requires a lot of time and computational resources. In this session, learn how AWS enables Rivada Networks to simulate, visualize, and orchestrate space-to-ground networks using digital twins of their constellation and user terminals. Discover how, using AWS, Rivada can shorten the constellation configuration time across their network from hours to seconds and leverage a variety of enterprise-grade networking protocols.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of satellite technology and space-based networks.
2. Knowledge of network simulation and visualization techniques.
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities in the space and networking domains.
4. Awareness of the challenges in configuring and managing large-scale satellite constellations.
5. Interest in exploring how cloud-based solutions can streamline the development and deployment of space-to-ground networks.

title: How Rivian accelerated ADAS development on AWS
description: This session covers how Rivian built an end-to-end pipeline for developing, simulating, and releasing new advanced driver-assistance system (ADAS) features using AWS cloud services and partner solutions. It explores Rivian's approach, from data ingestion to perception model training, simulation, and edge deployment, highlighting the AWS services it leveraged. Gain insights into best practices and learn about the AWS services that Rivian employed to help accelerate and scale new ADAS feature development, while optimizing data ingest, compute, storage, and simulation costs.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (ADAS)
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Experience in data engineering and machine learning
4. Familiarity with software development and deployment processes
5. Interest in the automotive industry and its technological advancements

title: How Rocket Mortgage elevates client experiences with secure AI
description: Generative AI promises industry revolutions, but secure adoption is crucial. Discover how Rocket Mortgage leveraged AWS’s generative AI services while navigating security requirements. Learn how they elevated client service, personalized client experiences, and boosted productivity, all while implementing stringent data protection and trust-building measures. Gain insights into Rocket Mortgage’s strategies and best practices for unlocking generative AI’s potential and how generative AI helps them achieve their mission to “Help Everyone Home,” while prioritizing robust security. Accelerate your own AI initiatives, securely, by learning from this trailblazer’s approach.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI and its potential industry applications
2. Knowledge of AWS's generative AI services and their capabilities
3. Familiarity with data protection and security best practices
4. Interest in learning from Rocket Mortgage's experience in implementing generative AI
5. Desire to accelerate your own AI initiatives while prioritizing security

title: How SMBs can scale with platform engineering
description: Small and medium businesses (SMBs) can become more productive and efficient by practicing platform engineering, a discipline that focuses on building and maintaining the internal developer platform and tools. This chalk talk discusses what platform engineering is and how to build a platform in AWS. Speakers will dispel some of the myths and explore how platform engineering can be applied to reduce cognitive load on developers, increase their productivity, and ensure that the organization’s development processes are secure, scalable, and aligned with best practices.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of software development and deployment processes
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools
4. Awareness of the challenges faced by small and medium-sized businesses in managing their IT infrastructure
5. Interest in improving developer productivity and organizational efficiency

title: How startups can create disruptive innovations with gen AI on AWS [Korean]
description: This session is delivered in Korean. Startups have diverse requirements for a variety of generative AI workloads, from providing their own foundation models for enterprise customers to creating content for end users. In this session, learn how startups can build disruptive innovations using generative AI on AWS. Discover how Upstage’s Solar model is 100% pretrained with Amazon SageMaker and uses AWS Marketplace so global customers can build their own fine-tuned models easily. Find out how Miridih’s MiriCanvas provides AI-powered creative design features like AI presentation generation using prompt chaining on Amazon Bedrock and LangGraph and recommending similar design templates from over 40 million vector data using Amazon OpenSearch Service.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of generative AI
2. Understanding of startup requirements and use cases for generative AI
3. Familiarity with AWS services like SageMaker, Marketplace, Bedrock, LangGraph, and OpenSearch Service

title: How Star Wars: Hunters got to the next level with Amazon GameLift
description: Like playing multiplayer arena battle games in a galaxy far, far away? Discover how Zynga utilized Amazon GameLift to meet aggressive release deadlines, support a global game deployment, and plan the team’s first console game launch. Built on the Unreal Engine, Star Wars: Hunters launched worldwide on June 4, 2024, in 12 AWS Regions. Dive into multiplayer game challenges, including development pipelines and infrastructure management. Learn how to leverage fully managed Amazon GameLift for global presence, auto scaling, and matchmaking, Amazon Aurora for player and game data stores, and Amazon ElastiCache for leaderboards while minimizing costs and maximizing game value.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with multiplayer game development
2. Familiarity with Unreal Engine
3. Knowledge of cloud-based infrastructure and services
4. Understanding of game data management and player engagement
5. Interest in the Star Wars universe and game development

title: How Stripe achieves five and a half 9s of availability
description: Stripe, which processes trillions of dollars in transactions annually across the world, must ensure its systems remain available, fault-tolerant, and resilient in the face of surges in traffic and unexpected failures. This session shares how Stripe architects and operates highly available systems at global scale on AWS. Explore the architectural patterns, monitoring systems, and incident response workflows that enable Stripe to achieve 99.9995% uptime—the gold standard set by emergency response hotlines. Gain practical insights into building resilient distributed systems and elevating the availability of your applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of distributed system architecture
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with monitoring and incident response processes
4. Experience in building highly available and fault-tolerant applications
5. Understanding of the principles of resilient system design

title: How Supercell’s newest game launched with tens of millions of players
description: With over 200 million monthly active users, Supercell’s mission is to create great games that as many people as possible play for years and that are remembered forever. In this session, discover how Supercell achieved a successful global launch for its latest game, Squad Busters, with over 40 million pre-launch registrations. Discover how Supercell powers its backend infrastructure by using AWS services like Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling, AWS Graviton, Amazon Aurora I/O-Optimized storage, AWS Countdown, and Amazon CloudFront. Delve into the services and strategy that enable them to handle massive user influxes, while ensuring a seamless worldwide player experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Knowledge of Supercell's game development and publishing strategies.
2. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and AWS services like Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling, AWS Graviton, Amazon Aurora, AWS Countdown, and Amazon CloudFront.
3. Familiarity with handling large-scale user influxes and ensuring a seamless global player experience.

title: How the NBA used Zero Trust & Prosimo to unify multicloud connectivity (sponsored by Prosimo)
description: Explore how the NBA transformed its cloud infrastructure by unifying multiple clouds through Prosimo’s One Enterprise Cloud Network. With a focus on data sovereignty, end-to-end segmentation, and unified policy enforcement, the NBA eliminated backhaul traffic, optimized cloud-to-cloud communication, and enhanced visibility, detecting issues before impacting performance. In this lightning talk, NBA technology leaders share their journey, covering automated cloud asset discovery and bi-directional connectivity; seamless integration of IaaS applications and PaaS endpoints; adaptive service insertion and end-to-end segmentation with one unified policy; and end-to-end network flow tracing and performance monitoring using IaC. Learn how the NBA optimized multicloud operations for high-performance applications. This presentation is brought to you by Prosimo, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and its components.
2. Knowledge of multi-cloud environments and the challenges associated with them.
3. Familiarity with cloud networking concepts, such as connectivity, segmentation, and policy enforcement.
4. Awareness of cloud-based application deployment and integration.
5. Understanding of infrastructure as code (IaC) and its role in cloud operations.

title: How TII, Reply, Accenture, and MAG bring AI everywhere (sponsored by Intel)
description: Intel provides customers with a broad product portfolio and a path to rapidly implementing AI projects with AWS in the cloud and at the edge. Hear from industry partners Accenture and Reply on how they utilize Intel technologies to harness the power of AI. In addition, Manchester Airport Group shares how Intel and AWS enabled successful and rapid deployment of edge AI capabilities in production. Lastly, dive into a case study from the Technology Innovation Institute (TII) on Falcon, their family of state-of-the-art language models, and learn how they are working to democratize and optimize the usage of Falcon for Intel CPUs. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the presentation would be:

1. Knowledge of Intel's product portfolio
2. Understanding of AI and its implementation in the cloud and at the edge
3. Familiarity with AWS and its integration with Intel technologies
4. Awareness of Accenture and Reply's utilization of Intel technologies for AI
5. Knowledge of Manchester Airport Group's deployment of edge AI capabilities

title: How to accelerate migration and modernization through resilience
description: In this lightning talk, hear about how intentionally integrating resilience into the migration process before, during, and after the cloud migration will drive revenue and customer success. By taking advantage of validated AWS Partner Solutions and AWS purpose-built resilience services, our users realize the benefits of the cloud’s flexibility, scalability, and cost-efficiency while being safe in the knowledge that their applications are designed and operated in a secure, resilient manner and with improved recovery objectives in place.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud migration processes
2. Knowledge of AWS Partner Solutions and AWS resilience services
3. Familiarity with application design and operations in a cloud environment
4. Awareness of security and resilience considerations in cloud migrations
5. Desire to improve recovery objectives and customer success

title: How to achieve water goals with AWS technology
description: Water is a precious resource, and organizations around the globe are stepping up to do their part in protecting it. In this session, learn about AWS efforts to conserve and reuse water across its onsite operations and in communities where it operates as part of its Water+ commitment. Also learn how AWS customer Generation Park, a McCord Development project, is leveraging the Garnet Framework and AWS Partners to build an IoT water monitoring solution to reduce water wastage and set a foundation for future smart city projects.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of water conservation and sustainability
2. Knowledge of AWS services and offerings
3. Familiarity with IoT and smart city technologies
4. Understanding of water monitoring and management solutions

title: How to analyze Amazon CloudFront logs using generative AI [REPEAT]
description: Gain critical insights for optimizing the performance of your web application with Amazon CloudFront logs using Amazon Bedrock. In this builders’ session, learn why analyzing and monitoring logs is essential for detecting anomalies, enhancing reliability, and improving site performance. Whether you’re an SRE focused on fine-tuning performance or a CTO ensuring a robust infrastructure, discover how AI-powered log analysis empowers proactive decision-making. Find out how to harness the power of Amazon CloudFront data for actionable intelligence and to drive your application’s success. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Familiarity with Amazon CloudFront
2. Understanding of web application performance optimization
3. Basic knowledge of log analysis and monitoring

title: How to build a real-time gen AI app with AWS, Confluent & Anthropic (sponsored by Confluent)
description: Today’s enterprise data architectures limit AI’s potential for fast, informed decision-making. In this session, join experts from Confluent, AWS, and Anthropic to discover how to integrate Confluent’s scalable data streaming platform with Amazon Bedrock, a fully managed generative AI AWS service, to build innovative solutions. Learn how to integrate real-time context at query time with continuous processing and ingestion into vector databases, which is critical for RAG-enabled gen AI applications. Explore patterns for ingesting, processing, and serving data streams at scale, leveraging Confluent’s data streaming platform and Anthropic’s advanced LLMs for trustworthy, real-time data streams and secure, scalable AI solutions. This presentation is brought to you by Confluent, an AWS Partner.

4. Experience with ingesting, processing, and serving data streams at scale
5. Understanding of Anthropic's advanced language models and their role in trustworthy, real-time data streams and secure, scalable AI solutions

title: How to build resilient applications on Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: As mission-critical applications increasingly run on Amazon EKS clusters, meeting service level objectives (SLOs) is paramount. This chalk talk delves into strategies and best practices to enhance the resiliency of your workloads, minimize the impact of failures, and ensure high availability and continuity of service delivery. Explore various strategies, including multi-cluster connectivity, disaster recovery, and failover mechanisms. In addition, learn about AWS-managed observability services and how to achieve operational excellence through observability best practices. Attend this talk to gain practical insights to mitigate risks, minimize downtime, and ensure continuous availability of your containerized workloads on Amazon EKS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of containerization and Kubernetes
2. Familiarity with Amazon EKS
3. Knowledge of service level objectives (SLOs) and their importance
4. Awareness of the need for resilient and highly available applications

This chalk talk delves into strategies and best practices to enhance the resiliency of your workloads, minimize the impact of failures, and ensure high availability and continuity of service delivery. Explore various strategies, including multi-cluster connectivity, disaster recovery, and failover mechanisms. title: How to build scalable platforms with Amazon EKS
description: A wide range of companies, from the most innovative startups to the world’s leading enterprises, are running their internal platforms on Amazon EKS, helping them to accelerate developer velocity and increase the pace of innovation. In this session, learn about best practices that AWS has developed over years of helping thousands of customers build and scale their internal platforms on Amazon EKS.

title: How to choose between AWS CloudFormation, Terraform, and AWS CDK
description: Both HashiCorp Terraform and AWS CloudFormation have attracted large numbers of fans from the moment they were launched, with AWS CDK gaining more traction as well. However, highly opinionated users have often only used one, sometimes two of these tools, and their experiences are not up to date with the latest features and possibilities. In this session, explore high-paced, live coding examples with all three, and then dive deep into some specific scenarios. At the end, leave with the ability to make informed decisions and select the best tool for the job.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud infrastructure concepts
2. Basic knowledge of AWS services
3. Familiarity with programming languages and scripting

title: How to design your HPC cluster in the cloud for sustainability [REPEAT]
description: As organizations strive to reduce their carbon footprint and promote environmental sustainability, optimizing high performance computing (HPC) workloads in the cloud has become a critical priority. In this hands-on builders’ session, learn how to design and deploy HPC clusters on AWS that deliver both performance and sustainability. Work through the process of architecting an HPC cluster using the latest AWS services, with a strong focus on the AWS Well-Architected Framework sustainability pillar. Leave this session equipped to design and deploy sustainable HPC clusters on AWS that deliver both high performance and environmental responsibility. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this hands-on builders' session would be:

1. Familiarity with high performance computing (HPC) concepts.
2. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
3. Proficiency in using a laptop and accessing cloud-based resources.
4. Interest in designing and deploying sustainable HPC solutions.
5. Willingness to actively participate in the hands-on activities.

title: How to enable near real-time data analytics with a zero-ETL approach
description: This workshop explores an AWS zero-ETL solution for real-time data analytics, focusing on key components like data ingestion, processing frameworks, and delivery mechanisms. Utilizing Amazon Redshift, Amazon Kinesis Data Streams, and AWS Lake Formation, this workshop demonstrates how organizations can bypass traditional ETL bottlenecks. Discover how this approach enables near real-time analytics, a comprehensive customer view, and faster personalization. Learn how to streamline data integration, improve governance, and enhance data utilization across applications. Explore how you can use AWS services to achieve faster insights, better data management, and more efficient analytics processes, ultimately leading to improved decision-making and customer experiences. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data analytics and data processing
2. Familiarity with AWS services, such as Amazon Redshift, Amazon Kinesis Data Streams, and AWS Lake Formation
3. Ability to access and use a laptop during the workshop

title: How to ensure code accountability & trust in the age of generative AI (sponsored by Sonar)
description: As generative AI transforms software development, enterprises need to rethink how they build code trust. Traditionally, developers are accountable for code authorship and testing, but AI-generated code introduces new challenges. Without approved processes, using large language models (LLMs) to generate code can expose organizations to IP leakage, security risks, and lower code quality. This lightning talk explores how businesses can integrate AI safely into their software development lifecycle. Hear strategies for LLM approval, tracking, and performance monitoring. Learn how tools like Sonar can ensure transparency, maintain high quality standards, and build trust in AI-driven development workflows. This presentation is brought to you by Sonar, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of software development lifecycle
2. Awareness of the challenges posed by AI-generated code
3. Interest in integrating AI safely into software development
4. Familiarity with tools like Sonar for code transparency and quality assurance
5. Desire to build trust in AI-driven development workflows

title: How to get dynamic with secrets management (sponsored by HashiCorp)
description: It can be hard to let go of what you know. But, if a majority of your secrets and credentials are static and long-lived, it’s probably time for a change. In this session, learn the latest and greatest secrets management capabilities of HashiCorp Vault with AWS and apply them to real-world use cases to help you reduce the risk of application downtime and breach. Also learn how HCP Vault Radar can help you inspect your distributed environments for security risks, remediate them, and then enforce settings and policies to increase security moving forward. This presentation is brought to you by HashiCorp, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of secrets management concepts
2. Familiarity with HashiCorp Vault
3. Knowledge of AWS services
4. Experience with application security and risk management
5. Interest in distributed environment security

title: How to integrate Amazon VPC Lattice into your existing environment
description: Amazon VPC Lattice offers powerful features to enhance network security, simplify routing, and streamline load balancing for your backend applications. However, changing your network design can be a daunting and time-consuming task. In this engaging chalk talk, explore architectural best practices, strategies, and proven techniques to seamlessly integrate VPC Lattice into your existing environment, enhancing your security posture and simplifying connectivity.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
2. Knowledge of network security concepts
3. Familiarity with load balancing and routing
4. Experience with backend application deployment

title: How to maintain and automate compliance on AWS
description: Learn how AWS services can help simplify and automate compliance with various regulations and standards. This session starts by defining compliance and discussing the benefits of automation. Then, learn how to automate the collection of compliance data using AWS Artifact and AWS Audit Manager and how to create automated security and compliance checks with AWS Config and AWS Security Hub. Finally, learn how set up automated remediation workflows using AWS Systems Manager Automation documents. By the end of the session, cloud security engineers and cloud architects will know how to establish a comprehensive, automated compliance workflow on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Understanding of compliance regulations and standards.
3. Basic knowledge of security and automation in the cloud.

title: How to manage and prepare for large-scale and high-traffic events [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to provide a smooth customer journey during peak times by implementing a scalable, cloud-based virtual waiting room that leverages AWS services to reduce resource strain. Attendees use the Virtual Waiting Room and Distributed Load Testing AWS Solutions to gain actionable insights, understand capacity limits, and implement best practices for effective deployment in their own environments. Learn how to test the load capabilities of your application, better understand limits, and provide a seamless customer experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with web application development and deployment.
3. Experience with load testing and performance optimization.

title: How to mitigate Zonal and Regional impairments
description: Building an application to recover from common failure modes aligned to AWS fault isolation boundaries can help you meet your availability goals. In this chalk talk, learn how you can use Amazon Application Recovery Controller to recover your applications from impairments within an AWS Availability Zone and an AWS Region. You leave with an understanding of how ARC works and with key takeaways to incorporate into your architecture.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of AWS Availability Zones and Regions.
2. Familiarity with common application failure modes and fault isolation boundaries.
3. Basic knowledge of application architecture and design principles.
4. Understanding of the concept of application availability and recovery.
5. Familiarity with AWS services and tools for application management and resilience.

title: How to navigate your SQL Server migration journey with AWS
description: In this chalk talk, discover the spectrum of migration strategies for SQL Server on AWS. Whether you have a single database or thousands, learn the difference between using AWS Migration Hub, AWS Application Migration Service, and AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS). Learn about native SQL Server methods, including replication, Always On availability groups, and log shipping. Gain insights from real-world migrations and best practices tailored for diverse migration needs. Come prepared with your questions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of SQL Server database management.
2. Familiarity with AWS cloud services.
3. Basic knowledge of database migration strategies.

title: How to optimize AWS storage for generative AI and ML workloads [REPEAT]
description: Scaling deep learning programs into production often comes with its challenges, and you can’t have high-quality data modeling if your storage isn’t optimized for performance scalability. Getting this wrong can lead to unexpected cost and performance issues. In this interactive chalk talk, get answers to your questions related to selecting and optimizing storage for AI and ML workloads so you can build better, innovate faster, and deploy at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with deep learning concepts
2. Understanding of data storage and performance optimization
3. Experience with AI/ML workload deployment
4. Knowledge of cost and performance considerations in production environments
5. Desire to build scalable and efficient AI/ML solutions

title: How to optimize latency and throughput
description: The availability of processors with and without hyperthreading makes performance evaluation a tricky game. In this code talk, study a web application and evaluate its performance in various scenarios, and discover how to optimize throughput and latency along the way.

Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of web application architecture.
2. Familiarity with performance evaluation techniques.
3. Knowledge of processor architectures, including hyperthreading.
4. Proficiency in code analysis and optimization.
5. Experience with tools and techniques for measuring and improving application performance.

title: How to protect your clients from authorized push payment (APP) fraud (sponsored by Vonage, Part of Ericsson)
description: Impersonation scams are a rising problem—consumers struggle to distinguish if calls are legitimate while financial institutions face risks from unauthorized transactions. In this lightning talk, learn about Vonage solutions available in the AWS Marketplace that showcase how integrating Vonage Communications and Network APIs with AWS advanced AI services enhances fraud detection, improves customer experience, and reduces friction. Join this talk to learn how these tools can strengthen your defense against fraud while ensuring a secure customer journey. This presentation is brought to you by Vonage (Part of Ericsson), an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this lightning talk would be:

1. Understanding of impersonation scams and their impact on consumers and financial institutions.
2. Familiarity with Vonage solutions available in the AWS Marketplace.
3. Knowledge of integrating Vonage Communications and Network APIs with AWS advanced AI services.
4. Interest in enhancing fraud detection, improving customer experience, and reducing friction.
5. Desire to strengthen defense against fraud and ensure a secure customer journey.

title: How to re:Invent
description: New to AWS re:Invent? Come to this informational session to learn about navigating content, getting around campus, accessibility options, the Expo Hall, activities, and much more. There will be time for Q&A to help you get the most out of your week. Also, use this time to network with other first-time attendees.

Prerequisites:

2. Desire to learn about navigating the event and getting the most out of the experience
3. Willingness to network with other first-time attendees

title: How US Foods successfully built and scaled a generative AI sales tool
description: Join this session to learn how US Foods, a leading foodservice distributor, built an automated order guide to enable sales productivity using Amazon Bedrock. The VP of Machine Learning Engineering shares how he and his team identified the right use case, quickly built and tested feasibility with a lightweight proof of concept, quantified business impact to secure executive buy-in, and moved to production.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning and its applications in business.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock or similar machine learning platforms.
3. Knowledge of the foodservice distribution industry and its challenges.

title: How Vanguard rebuilt its mission-critical trading application on AWS
description: Learn how Vanguard rebuilt its retail investor trading platform on AWS to achieve higher resiliency, improve performance, and lower costs by scaling to meet demand. Vanguard adopted AWS Fargate for Amazon ECS to run this mission-critical platform, which uses cloud-native services like Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition and Amazon DynamoDB to store and replicate data across Regions, achieving 99.99% availability over the past two years. New features that Vanguard needed months or longer to develop on its legacy mainframe monolith now take only weeks or even days, enabling the company to continuously improve the customer experience and compete effectively.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud-native services.
2. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its various services, such as Amazon ECS, Amazon Aurora, and Amazon DynamoDB.
3. Familiarity with containerization and the use of AWS Fargate.
4. Understanding of the challenges and benefits of migrating from a legacy monolithic architecture to a cloud-native, microservices-based architecture.
5. Knowledge of software development lifecycle and continuous delivery practices.

title: HPC simplified: Explore the fully managed parallel computing service
description: From genomics to weather simulations, AWS Parallel Computing Service (AWS PCS) revolutionizes cloud-based HPC. This managed service simplifies scaling diverse workloads, offering enhanced reproducibility and rapid experimentation. Easily modify entire clusters to support emerging requirements or opportunities. In this hands-on workshop, learn to build custom PCS environments, manage compute resources, and implement useful cluster architectures. Gain practical experience in cluster design, job scheduling, and performance optimization as you build and exercise an elastic HPC cluster. Familiarity with Slurm, HPC workloads, and cluster architectures is beneficial. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Familiarity with Slurm
2. Experience with HPC workloads
3. Knowledge of cluster architectures
4. Ability to bring a laptop to participate

title: Hydrate and Help (sponsored by GitLab)
description: This year, AWS is partnering with Fill it Forward to support charity: water at the Hydrate and Help water walk. Millions of people around the world are without access to clean and safe drinking water and must walk every day to collect water. Get involved, raise awareness, and experience a simulation of this walk that so many make every single day for their water supply. Plus grab a water bottle from SWAG. Each time you refill your bottle and scan the QR code, you’re giving back while reducing waste from single-use cups and bottles. Sponsored by GitLab.

2. Support for charity: water
3. Hydrate and Help water walk event
4. Lack of access to clean and safe drinking water for millions globally
5. Opportunity to raise awareness and experience a water collection simulation

title: IaC and AI: Tales from the trenches
description: Join this dev chat for a deep dive into the real-world chaos of integrating infrastructure as code (IaC) powered by artificial intelligence (AI). This dev chat focuses on the behind-the-scenes challenges and unexpected failures facing engineers and devs alike. From disastrous misconfigurations and lurking security vulnerabilities to IaC anti-pattern nightmares and baffling automation glitches, hear firsthand accounts of what went wrong. Discover the hard-earned lessons and ingenious solutions that emerged from these trials. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how to navigate and conquer these obstacles.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
2. Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and its applications in infrastructure management
3. Experience in software engineering or DevOps

title: Identify a prioritization strategy for security response & remediation [REPEAT]
description: Join this chalk talk to discuss managing security across multiple accounts, Regions, and resources. Automated security responses are increasingly becoming key to helping organizations protect their systems more efficiently, improve their security posture, and reduce the time taken to investigate and respond to threats. Learn about a framework for automating your response and remediation to security findings for your accounts. With AWS Security Hub as the foundation, explore the decision-making process around which findings could be auto-remediated, the implications of an auto-remediation approach, and how to ensure a quick and thorough response.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the chalk talk:

1. Understanding of AWS Security Hub
2. Familiarity with security concepts and best practices
3. Experience with AWS account management and resource deployment
4. Basic knowledge of AWS automation and scripting
5. Interest in improving security posture and incident response

title: Identify a prioritization strategy for security response & remediation [REPEAT]

Automated security responses are increasingly becoming key to helping organizations protect their systems more efficiently, improve their security posture, and reduce the time taken to investigate and respond to threats. Learn about a framework for automating your response and remediation to security findings for your accounts. With AWS Security Hub as the foundation, explore the decision-making process around which findings could be auto-remediated, the implications of an auto-remediation approach, and how to ensure a quick and thorough response.

title: Identify & manage orphaned Amazon Aurora & Amazon RDS snapshots at scale [REPEAT]
description: If you maintain a fleet of database instances provisioned across AWS accounts in multiple Regions, gaining visibility into orphaned database snapshots can be a daunting task. In this hands-on session, learn how to create a solution to locate and manage database snapshots whose primary database instances have been deleted. Using some of the serverless capabilities that AWS offers, you can manage orphaned snapshots and automate their archival or deletion based on your use case and business requirements. This practical approach will empower you to implement efficient snapshot lifecycle policies, ultimately reducing costs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the hands-on session:

1. Knowledge of AWS services and concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS account management and multi-region deployments
3. Basic understanding of database management and snapshot lifecycle

Using some of the serverless capabilities that AWS offers, you can manage orphaned snapshots and automate their archival or deletion based on your use case and business requirements. 3. Proficiency in serverless computing and automation

Using some of the serverless capabilities that AWS offers, you can manage orphaned snapshots and automate their archival or deletion based on your use case and business requirements. 2. Familiarity with database management and snapshot lifecycle policies.
3. Hands-on experience with AWS serverless technologies, such as AWS Lambda and Amazon CloudWatch.
4. Ability to write and deploy simple AWS Lambda functions.
5. Access to an AWS account with the necessary permissions to create and manage resources.

title: I didn't know AWS AppSync could do that!
description: AWS AppSync is a managed service for developers to connect their apps to cloud data, events, and AI models. No longer just a GraphQL API service, with AWS AppSync you can leverage serverless WebSockets to create real-time event APIs, build AI gateways to simplify and secure application access to Amazon Bedrock, and more. Join this session to learn about all the exciting new AWS AppSync features released this year.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with GraphQL
2. Understanding of serverless architectures
3. Knowledge of AWS services like Amazon Bedrock
4. Experience with real-time event-driven applications
5. Familiarity with API development and management

title: I didn’t know AWS WAF did this
description: Securing web applications in today’s ever-evolving threat landscape is crucial. As threats evolve, so must security controls and countermeasures. In this chalk talk, dive into how AWS WAF seamlessly integrates with other AWS services, making it possible for you to construct a resilient, multi-layered defense strategy. Learn about uncommon use cases and how to address even the most unconventional threats.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with web application security concepts
2. Understanding of AWS services and their integration capabilities
3. Knowledge of common web application threats and security best practices
4. Experience with configuring and managing AWS WAF

title: IDP fast track: Racing to deploy with CNOE for enterprise DevOps
description: Rev up your enterprise DevOps strategy in this internal developer platform (IDP) fast-track workshop, powered by the Cloud Native Operational Excellence (CNOE) initiative. Accelerate deployment of an IDP using the CNOE stack, build resilient CI/CD pipelines, and achieve heightened observability through golden paths. Whether you're starting from scratch or scaling up, join us for practical insights and hands-on experience to drive your enterprise DevOps forward at high speed. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of DevOps principles and practices.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and cloud-native technologies.
3. Experience with software development and deployment processes.
4. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities.

title: Ignite your tools and workflows with Amazon Q Apps and APIs
description: Join this chalk talk to explore the API capabilities available in Amazon Q Apps, including app creation, data source integration, user management, and administrative controls, demonstrating how Amazon Q Apps can streamline tasks and boost organizational efficiency. By using the comprehensive Amazon Q Business API suite, organizations can seamlessly integrate Amazon Q Apps into their existing workflows and tools of choice, empowering users to, for example, generate apps from natural language descriptions or conversations from other enterprise solutions. With robust security and governance controls inherited from Amazon Q Business, plus the power of APIs, sensitive data remains protected while promoting collaboration and productivity company-wide.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon Q Business and its capabilities
2. Familiarity with API integration and application development
3. Knowledge of data source integration and user management
4. Awareness of security and governance controls in enterprise solutions

title: Igniting public sector innovation for a better tomorrow
description: The public sector landscape is rapidly shifting, presenting organizations with complex hurdles that demand unprecedented and transformative approaches. Join Dave Levy, Vice President of Worldwide Public Sector at AWS, where he explores how cutting-edge AI and ML solutions are revolutionizing the space. Gain insights from real-world examples and uncover the boundless potential to drive change and forge a brighter future for citizens, constituents, students, service members, patients, and beyond.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of public sector organizations and their challenges
2. Knowledge of emerging technologies like AI and ML
3. Interest in exploring innovative solutions for the public sector

title: Igniting SMB new customer engagement, growth, and retention
description: Small and medium businesses (SMBs) are the backbone of the global economy accounting for over 98% of all businesses. Join this lightning talk to learn the latest market trends and AWS best practices for engaging, growing, and retaining SMB customers at scale across the build, market, sell, and grow journey. Receive actionable strategies and real-world use cases on how to guide your customers through their cloud journeys, and leave with clarity on how to package AWS tools to grow this customer base from foundation through innovation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of the SMB market and its significance
2. Knowledge of AWS services and solutions
3. Familiarity with cloud adoption and migration strategies
4. Experience in customer engagement and retention

title: I'm not a doctor but I play one with AI [REPEAT]
description: Experience an interactive game that challenges players to diagnose medical conditions based on medical images and interaction with a AI-driven physician. The game is designed to educate and engage players in the process of medical diagnosis while showcasing the capabilities of AWS AI/ML services like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with medical imaging and diagnostic processes.
2. Knowledge of AI/ML concepts and their application in healthcare.
3. Proficiency in game development or experience working with game engines.
4. Understanding of AWS AI/ML services like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker.
5. Ability to integrate AI/ML models into an interactive game environment.

title: I'm not a doctor but I play one with AI [REPEAT]
description: Experience an interactive game that challenges players to diagnose medical conditions based on medical images and interaction with a AI-driven physician. The game is designed to educate and engage players in the process of medical diagnosis while showcasing the capabilities of AWS AI/ML services like Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker.
prerequisites:
