title: Inclusive algorithms: Women’s key role in ethical AI development (sponsored by Deloitte)
description: In this lightning talk, explore the importance of gender diversity in the data and analytics field and why women in data are critical to building inclusive AI models that can be less prone to error and create better results. Learn the importance of having a diverse workforce to design and develop AI technologies, concrete examples of the potential risk of bias in AI, and actionable insights on how to create an inclusive environment that opens the door for women in data. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding the importance of gender diversity in the data and analytics field
2. Knowledge of the potential risks of bias in AI models
3. Familiarity with the benefits of having a diverse workforce in the design and development of AI technologies
4. Awareness of strategies to create an inclusive environment for women in the data and analytics field

title: Inclusive wellness: Leveraging Amazon One Medical for LGBTQIA+ care
description: One Medical and AWS are partnering to pilot a free, three-month One Medical membership for a diverse, 500-person cohort of Glamazon employees. The goal is to measure LGBTQIA+ customer experiences across all four U.S. regions and develop recommendations to improve One Medical's platform and attract LGBTQIA+ customers at scale in 2025. With over 1 in 5 Gen Zers identifying as LGBTQIA+ and 82% of allies more likely to buy from LGBTQIA+-inclusive brands, this pilot taps into a significant market opportunity. Representatives from AWS and One Medical will discuss inclusive healthcare delivery at scale and share learnings from the pilot.
prerequisites:
1. Diverse, 500-person cohort of Glamazon employees
2. Measure LGBTQIA+ customer experiences across all four U.S. regions
3. Develop recommendations to improve One Medical's platform
4. Attract LGBTQIA+ customers at scale in 2025
5. Significant market opportunity with over 1 in 5 Gen Zers identifying as LGBTQIA+ and 82% of allies more likely to buy from LGBTQIA+-inclusive brands

title: Incorporating generative AI in the CI/CD pipeline
description: In this chalk talk, discover how generative AI can revolutionize your continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipeline. Learn how AI models can analyze code changes and generate recommendations for safe deployments. Explore automated orchestration capabilities that trigger deployments, monitor metrics, and adapt strategies. Gain insights into using AI for continual monitoring and self-improving release cycles, streamlining your software delivery while minimizing risks and manual efforts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of CI/CD principles and workflows
2. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
3. Experience with software development and deployment processes

title: Increase profitability of your co-sell partnership with AWS
description: Optimize and maximize your co-sell motion through enhanced discoverability and co-sell productivity tools. Join this session to hear co-selling best practices, review options for automating co-sell through CRM integration, and learn about updated collaboration features for business planning and contacting AWS Sales teams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of co-selling and its importance in the sales process.
2. Familiarity with CRM systems and their integration capabilities.
3. Knowledge of collaboration tools and their features for business planning and communication.

title: Increase your database agility with Amazon FSx [REPEAT]
description: Migrating databases like SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and SAP HANA to the cloud is a critical part of your journey. In this workshop, explore self-managed databases on Amazon EC2 with Amazon FSx, and get hands-on with SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MySQL. Discover how the advanced snapshot, cloning, backup, and replication features of Amazon FSx can reduce your RPO/RTO from hours to seconds. Then, go beyond operations and see a demonstration of how to accelerate development and refresh cycles using zero-space cloning to instantly provide developers with their own copies of the database. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of database management systems (DBMS) like SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and SAP HANA.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
3. Hands-on experience with database administration or development.
4. Ability to connect to and interact with cloud-based databases.
5. Laptop for hands-on participation.

title: Increase your database agility with Amazon FSx [REPEAT]
description: Migrating databases like SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and SAP HANA to the cloud is a critical part of your journey. In this workshop, explore self-managed databases on Amazon EC2 with Amazon FSx, and get hands-on with SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MySQL. Discover how the advanced snapshot, cloning, backup, and replication features of Amazon FSx can reduce your RPO/RTO from hours to seconds. Then, go beyond operations and see a demonstration of how to accelerate development and refresh cycles using zero-space cloning to instantly provide developers with their own copies of the database. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of database management systems (DBMS) like SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MySQL.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and services.
3. Experience with Linux or Windows operating systems.
4. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities.

title: Increasing productivity in energy trading with generative AI [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how TotalEnergies used generative AI to streamline energy trading activities. Discover how an AI assistant enabled access to trades through natural language, enhancing trader productivity. Additionally, explore an LLM-powered reconciliation system deployed on Amazon Bedrock that improved transaction integrity. Gain insights into the journey—from ideation to production implementation—with these transformative applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of energy trading and related processes
2. Knowledge of natural language processing and conversational AI
3. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs) and their applications
4. Experience with cloud-based AI services like Amazon Bedrock
5. Interest in exploring real-world AI deployments in the energy sector

title: Increasing productivity in energy trading with generative AI [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, learn how TotalEnergies used generative AI to streamline energy trading activities. Discover how an AI assistant enabled access to trades through natural language, enhancing trader productivity. Additionally, explore an LLM-powered reconciliation system deployed on Amazon Bedrock that improved transaction integrity. Gain insights into the journey—from ideation to production implementation—with these transformative applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of energy trading activities
2. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
3. Knowledge of natural language processing and conversational AI
4. Awareness of large language models (LLMs) and their use cases
5. Experience with cloud-based infrastructure and services (e.g., Amazon Bedrock)

title: Indexless observability: How to decrease your observability costs (sponsored by Coralogix)
description: While the cost of observability is often discussed, the main driver of cost—indexing—is rarely explored. In this session, explore the role of indexing in observability and learn how far you can go by being a little more savvy about how you process your data. This presentation is brought to you by Coralogix, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of observability
2. Knowledge of indexing and its role in observability
3. Familiarity with data processing techniques

title: Industrialization of AI in advanced computing [Mandarin Chinese]
description: This session is delivered in Mandarin Chinese. In this session, explore how AI is revolutionizing advanced computing for enterprise. Speakers share successes and observations of generative AI-powered high-performance computing (HPC) simulations for automotive and manufacturing sectors, which accelerate and drive innovation for design and manufacturing. As IoT evolves, the focus shifts from connectivity and data collection to building AI models using IoT data in healthcare. Finally, learn how the mix of generative AI and traditional advanced compute workloads shapes the compute infrastructure, including the role of purpose-built chips such as AWS Trainium and Inferentia in deploying generative AI models at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Proficiency in Mandarin Chinese
2. Understanding of AI and its applications in enterprise computing
3. Knowledge of generative AI and its use in HPC simulations
4. Familiarity with IoT and its role in healthcare
5. Awareness of purpose-built chips for deploying generative AI models

title: Infrastructure as Kubernetes APIs
description: While developers can independently build Kubernetes applications, configuring cloud infrastructure dependencies remain a bottleneck, often consuming weeks. The goal of encapsulating cloud infrastructure in APIs has been challenging, traditionally requiring engineers skilled in programming and cloud infrastructure. For API-driven approaches to gain widespread adoption, creating these APIs must be simple and accessible without coding expertise. This session explores the trend of Infrastructure as Kubernetes APIs, the need for new tools, real-world customer use cases, and how to get started. It also demos how to build a modern platform using open source tools like ArgoCD, AWS Controllers for Kubernetes (ACK), and Gatekeeper.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Kubernetes
2. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and its dependencies
3. Familiarity with programming and cloud infrastructure skills
4. Exposure to API-driven approaches and the need for simplicity and accessibility
5. Interest in modern platform development using open-source tools like ArgoCD, AWS Controllers for Kubernetes (ACK), and Gatekeeper.

title: Infrastructure at the speed of AI (sponsored by HashiCorp)
description: This session covers HashiCorp’s role in building out infrastructure for AI and ML workloads on AWS. Explore how to secure that infrastructure and the data used as part of those models. Learn to implement a self-service, vending machine–style approach for AI, including integrating tools like Amazon SageMaker and AWS Lambda. Discover how to simplify and scale AI operations, manage costs and risks, and use Terraform Cloud for security and governance. Learn best practices for deploying and scaling AI infrastructure while ensuring robust security and efficient management on day 2. This presentation is brought to you by HashiCorp, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud infrastructure and services
2. Familiarity with AWS services and tools
3. Exposure to machine learning and AI concepts
4. Knowledge of infrastructure as code and Terraform

title: Ingest streaming data into Apache Iceberg tables with AWS streaming
description: Leveraging Apache Iceberg for real-time streaming events involves creating a robust transactional data lake that supports frequent data updates with minimal overhead. In this session dive deep into different ways of ingesting and updating real-time and near real-time events to Apache Iceberg tables using streaming options on AWS such as Amazon MSF (Managed Services for Apache Flink), Amazon Data Firehose, and Apache Spark Structured Streaming. Hear about the tradeoffs of these approaches, performance considerations, and best practices for streaming data updates and data deletes in Iceberg tables.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of Apache Iceberg
2. Understanding of real-time streaming and data ingestion
3. Familiarity with AWS services like Amazon MSK, Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, and Apache Spark Structured Streaming
4. Experience with data lake architecture and data engineering concepts

title: Innovating data governance with AWS
description: Discover cutting-edge data governance strategies with AWS in this exciting customer panel. Learn how leading organizations transform their data management practices to accelerate data-driven decisions while ensuring security and compliance. Hear firsthand from AWS customers about their innovative approaches to automating data integration and quality, curating data to prevent proliferation, and using centralized catalogs to boost data literacy. Explore how these pioneers are tackling emerging trends like generative AI and applying precise permissions for confident data sharing. Don’t miss this chance to gain actionable insights and see real-world examples of successful data governance in action.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data management principles
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud-based data solutions
3. Interest in exploring innovative approaches to data governance
4. Desire to learn from real-world case studies and industry leaders
5. Curiosity about emerging trends in data management and governance

title: Innovation showdown: A first-mover debate on emerging tech adoption (sponsored by Deloitte)
description: In the spirit of public debates, this engaging session pits the innovative prowess of two Tennessee CIOs against each other in a friendly first-mover debate. The multi-round discussion showcases the unique technological advancements, data-driven initiatives, and user-centric improvements implemented by both agencies. The CIOs discuss their journeys through strategic change management and their visions for the future. This session promises to offer compelling insight into the minds of state CIOs and their approaches to driving public service innovation. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of strategic change management
2. Understanding of data-driven initiatives and user-centric improvements
3. Familiarity with the role and responsibilities of state CIOs
4. Interest in public service innovation
5. Awareness of the partnership between Deloitte and AWS

title: Innovations in AWS analytics: Data processing
description: Join this session for an in-depth look at new capabilities to optimize data processing with AWS analytics services. Learn more about using Amazon EMR for scalable big data processing, AWS Glue for seamless data integration, Amazon Athena for powerful querying, and Amazon MWAA for supporting complex workflows. Whether you’re looking to improve performance, reduce costs, or streamline your data pipeline, this session provides valuable insights into the latest functionality and tools needed to enhance your data processing capabilities.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data processing and analytics
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Interest in improving data processing capabilities

title: Innovations in AWS analytics: Data warehousing and SQL analytics
description: Join this session to learn about the newest innovations in data warehousing and SQL analytics with AWS analytics services. Amazon Redshift is the AI-powered, cloud-based data warehousing solution used by tens of thousands of AWS customers to modernize data analytics workloads and generate business insights with the best price performance. Learn more about the latest capabilities launched for Amazon Redshift to further drive quick decision-making with lower costs for your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data warehousing concepts
2. Familiarity with SQL and data analytics
3. Experience with AWS cloud services

title: Innovations in AWS analytics: Zero-ETL and data integrations
description: Join this session to learn how AWS analytics services can help you achieve your data integration goals with exceptional price performance. Explore new capabilities, like zero-ETL integrations, that allow your users to access all their data; easily prepare it for analytics, machine learning, and generative AI workloads; build and maintain scalable and resilient data pipelines; and enhance decision-making quality.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data integration and analytics
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Interest in exploring new data integration capabilities
4. Desire to improve decision-making through data-driven insights
5. Willingness to learn about scalable and resilient data pipelines

title: Innovations in AWS detection and response
description: Join this session to learn about the latest advancements and recent AWS launches in detection and response. This session focuses on practical use cases, such as threat detection, workload and data protection, automated and continual vulnerability management, centralized monitoring, continuous cloud security posture management, unified security data management, investigations and response, and generative AI. Gain a deeper understanding of how you can seamlessly integrate AWS detection and response services to help protect your workloads at scale, enhance your security posture, and streamline security operations across your entire AWS environment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Knowledge of security best practices and cloud security principles.
3. Familiarity with security tools and techniques for threat detection and response.

title: Innovation Talk: Financial services
description: Learn how financial institutions are working with AWS to push past traditional technical boundaries to move their businesses—and the broader industry—in new directions. Discover how new capabilities are helping financial services companies personalize customer experience at scale, improve business decision-making, and efficiently meet the capital needs of consumers and businesses. Explore how financial institutions are deriving greater value from their data and applying generative AI to improve productivity and engage more directly with their customers. And learn directly from industry leaders how they built and are running the systems and applications that power the industry on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of financial services industry
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS
3. Knowledge of data management and analytics
4. Awareness of emerging technologies like generative AI
5. Interest in exploring innovative solutions in the financial sector

title: Inside the SaaS Builder Toolkit: A hands-on deep dive [REPEAT]
description: SaaS Builder Toolkit (SBT) is a library of developer tools that can be combined, configured, and extended with the goal of accelerating your ability to create, modernize, or enhance the multi-tenant footprint of a SaaS solution. This workshop examines SBT, using it to build out the core moving parts of a working SaaS environment. Learn how builders can configure the various parts of a SaaS architecture including a deep dive into the control plane, integration with the application plane, and the spin-up of a working application. In this developer-centric journey, explore the end-to-end elements of SBT. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the "SaaS Builder Toolkit (SBT) is a library of developer tools that can be combined, configured, and extended with the goal of accelerating your ability to create, modernize, or enhance the multi-tenant footprint of a SaaS solution" workshop:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and SaaS architecture.
2. Familiarity with software development concepts and tools.
3. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities.
4. Familiarity with cloud-based development platforms or tools.
5. Interest in building or enhancing SaaS solutions.

title: Inside the SaaS Builder Toolkit: A hands-on deep dive [REPEAT]
description: SaaS Builder Toolkit (SBT) is a library of developer tools that can be combined, configured, and extended with the goal of accelerating your ability to create, modernize, or enhance the multi-tenant footprint of a SaaS solution. This workshop examines SBT, using it to build out the core moving parts of a working SaaS environment. Learn how builders can configure the various parts of a SaaS architecture including a deep dive into the control plane, integration with the application plane, and the spin-up of a working application. In this developer-centric journey, explore the end-to-end elements of SBT. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and architectures.
2. Experience in software development, preferably with web-based applications.
3. Basic understanding of multi-tenant SaaS (Software as a Service) architecture.
4. Ability to work with a laptop and have the necessary software installed.

title: Inside Tripadvisor’s real-time personalization with ScyllaDB and AWS (sponsored by ScyllaDB)
description: What kind of traveler are you? Tripadvisor tries to assess this as soon as you engage with the site and offer you increasingly relevant information with every click—within a matter of milliseconds. This personalization is powered by advanced ML models acting on data that’s stored on ScyllaDB running on AWS. In this lightning talk, Dean Poulin, Tripadvisor Data Engineering Lead, provides a look at how they power this personalization and shares a taste of the technical challenges involved in delivering real-time personalization at Tripadvisor’s massive (and rapidly growing) scale. This presentation is brought to you by ScyllaDB, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of machine learning models
2. Knowledge of real-time data processing
3. Familiarity with database technologies, particularly ScyllaDB and AWS
4. Experience in building personalization systems
5. Awareness of the challenges involved in delivering real-time personalization at scale

title: Inspect and secure your application with generative AI
description: Explore how to use generative AI to improve the security of your applications. Learn how AI-powered tools can help rapidly identify and then recommend remediations for security threats. Learn about how Amazon Inspector detects software and code vulnerabilities in your applications, and discover how to scan for issues and remediate them using generative AI in your IDE.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of software security principles and common vulnerabilities.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.
3. Experience with software development and programming languages.
4. Knowledge of machine learning and AI concepts.
5. Familiarity with integrated development environments (IDEs).

title: Integrate Amazon Bedrock foundation models into a serverless app
description: In this lab, build a serverless AI application that connects a frontend application to Amazon Bedrock. Learn to generate LLM outputs from the frontend data, produce responses, and implement system prompts to solve a business problem. The workflow involves Amazon S3, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS Lambda, integrating with Amazon Bedrock. Workstations are provided for you; no laptop required.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services (S3, API Gateway, Lambda)
2. Basic understanding of serverless architecture
3. Familiarity with frontend development (e.g., React, Angular)
4. Knowledge of natural language processing and language models
5. Familiarity with Bedrock or similar large language models

title: Integrate serverless applications with AWS storage services
description: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You can integrate it with Amazon EFS and Amazon S3 for data persistence, enabling increased application availability beyond one Region for business continuity and disaster recovery. In this workshop, learn to build your serverless AI applications with persistent data in Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS. Additionally, explore how to deploy a stateful web application onto a multi-AZ Amazon EKS cluster to demonstrate regional availability and perform failover and failback for multi-Region disaster recovery. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with serverless computing and AWS Lambda
3. Knowledge of Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS
4. Experience with containerization and Amazon EKS
5. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: Integrating applications with Amazon EventBridge Pipes
description: Streamline event-driven integrations with Amazon EventBridge Pipes. Join this session for a live demo of how AWS customers leverage EventBridge Pipes to integrate services like Amazon Kinesis and Amazon SQS. Learn how EventBridge Pipes enables in-line enrichment, transformation, and filtering to reduce the need for custom integration code. Walk away with ideas to more efficiently build event-driven applications with EventBridge Pipes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of event-driven architecture
2. Familiarity with AWS services like Amazon Kinesis and Amazon SQS
3. Knowledge of data transformation and filtering concepts

title: Integrating generative AI effectively into sustainability strategies
description: Generative AI can materially support sustainability programs by simplifying the process of analyzing environmental data to simulating new designs to evaluating product lifecycles in a fraction of the time. This session covers the fundamentals of generative AI in sustainability programs, including how to ensure alignment with broader organizational objectives. Learn how Amazon Bedrock helps AWS customer Mercado Diferente reduce 35 tons of organic food waste per month.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Generative AI
2. Knowledge of sustainability programs and environmental data analysis
3. Familiarity with product lifecycle evaluation
4. Awareness of organizational objectives and alignment

title: Intel and AWS: Democratizing generative AI together
description: Intel and AWS ProServe collaborate to democratize access to generative AI. Intel offers affordable high-performance large language models (LLMs) and AWS ProServe builds the Intel Superportal for cloud-based testing. This enhances AWS AI services with better performance and cost-efficiency. Intel also introduces its open source OPEA platform onto the cloud, empowering a wider audience to learn, build, and innovate with generative AI.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Collaboration between Intel and AWS ProServe.
2. Availability of affordable high-performance large language models (LLMs) from Intel.
3. Establishment of the Intel Superportal for cloud-based testing on AWS.
4. Integration of Intel's LLMs into AWS AI services to enhance performance and cost-efficiency.
5. Introduction of Intel's open-source OPEA platform onto the cloud.

title: Intelligent automation: End-to-end AIOps with AWS native services
description: Artificial intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps) has become essential. This session explores how customers can leverage AWS native services to achieve comprehensive AIOps capabilities, from observability and incident management to predictive analytics and automated remediation. See how AWS services empower IT teams to proactively monitor, detect anomalies, and rapidly resolve issues. Real-world customer examples showcase the integration of services for cohesive AIOps and how AWS Partners guide customers on their AIOps journey, leveraging expertise and solution accelerators to implement end-to-end AIOps workflows. Join to learn how to harness AWS services and partners to achieve intelligent automation and elevate IT operations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with IT operations and incident management
3. Basic knowledge of observability, anomaly detection, and predictive analytics
4. Interest in leveraging AI/ML for IT operations
5. Desire to improve IT efficiency and proactive issue resolution

title: Intelligent continuous compliance: Redefining cloud security for the modern era (sponsored by Wipro)
description: Wipro Cloud Compliance Shield, powered by AWS, is a generative AI–driven solution for compliance and risk management. Wipro Cloud Compliance Shield enhances visibility into the compliance and security posture to proactively identify, assess, and mitigate various security, compliance, and operational risks associated with cloud technologies in real time. The Wipro solution ensures regulatory obligations are automatically updated and reduces compliance risk. By implementing the robust risk governance practices, organizations can ensure secure use of cloud while protecting their sensitive data and maintaining operational integrity. This presentation is brought to you by Wipro, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for "Wipro Cloud Compliance Shield, powered by AWS, is a generative AI–driven solution for compliance and risk management" would be:

1. Understanding of cloud technologies and their associated risks.
2. Knowledge of regulatory compliance requirements.
3. Familiarity with risk governance practices.
4. Awareness of data protection and operational integrity.
5. Experience with AWS and Wipro partnership.

title: Intelligently automating cloud operations [REPEAT]
description: Join this workshop to learn how to use AWS Health, AWS Trusted Advisor, and AWS generative AI and machine learning services to intelligently automate cloud operations. Also learn how to use Amazon EventBridge and AWS Lambda to create automations that organizations can use to optimize their cloud infrastructure, improve efficiency, and reduce operational costs. This workshop is designed for cloud administrators, DevOps engineers, site reliability engineers, and IT professionals who are responsible for managing and optimizing cloud operations. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS management console or CLI.
3. Experience in cloud operations, DevOps, or IT management.

title: Intelligently automating cloud operations [REPEAT]
description: Join this workshop to learn how to use AWS Health, AWS Trusted Advisor, and AWS generative AI and machine learning services to intelligently automate cloud operations. Also learn how to use Amazon EventBridge and AWS Lambda to create automations that organizations can use to optimize their cloud infrastructure, improve efficiency, and reduce operational costs. This workshop is designed for cloud administrators, DevOps engineers, site reliability engineers, and IT professionals who are responsible for managing and optimizing cloud operations. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Basic understanding of cloud operations and infrastructure management.
3. Experience with DevOps or site reliability engineering practices.
4. Proficiency in using a laptop and basic programming skills.

title: Interview intelligence: Criteria’s innovative use of AWS and gen AI
description: Join us for an discussion on how Criteria Corp is transforming the interviewing process using Amazon Bedrock and AWS-native data architecture with generative AI at scale. This lightning talk will explore the democratization of hiring through generative AI, highlighting its game-changing impact on the industry. Delve into the use of native serverless services in Criteria’s innovative solutions and learn actionable insights for how small to medium-sized businesses can leverage these advancements. Attendees gain a deeper understanding of using science-based tools and methodologies to achieve optimal hiring outcomes and development opportunities, enabling them to build the best teams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of hiring and recruitment processes
2. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and AWS-native data architecture
3. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications
4. Awareness of serverless services and their benefits
5. Interest in science-based hiring tools and methodologies

title: Introduction to AWS and SAP Joint Reference Architecture for gen AI
description: This lightning talk shares guidance for customers to leverage both AWS and SAP generative AI services in order to build the next generation of intelligent SAP applications for manufacturing, supply chain, and automotive industries. Learn how SAP is building with Amazon Bedrock and how customers are leveraging Amazon Bedrock from within SAP AI Core. Gain insights to build your intelligent SAP application with AWS services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS services, particularly Amazon Bedrock.
2. Knowledge of SAP AI Core and its capabilities.
3. Familiarity with the manufacturing, supply chain, and automotive industries.
4. Experience in building intelligent applications using generative AI services.
5. Understanding of the integration between AWS and SAP technologies.

title: Introduction to AWS storage: Building a data foundation in the cloud
description: Unlock the potential of your data with AWS storage. This session introduces you to the comprehensive range of storage and migration services offered by AWS, with a focus on common workloads that enterprises move to the cloud. Explore how these services seamlessly integrate with other AWS offerings, enabling you to build a robust, scalable, and cost-effective data foundation in the cloud. Learn best practices for data management, security, and durability, empowering you to unleash the power of your data and drive innovation within your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with data storage and management principles.
3. Awareness of common enterprise workloads and data migration challenges.

title: Introduction to MLOps engineering on AWS
description: Could your machine learning (ML) workflows use some DevOps agility? In this session, explore how to bring DevOps-style practices into building, training, and deploying ML models. Also learn how to address the challenges associated with handoffs between data engineers, data scientists, software developers, and operations through the use of tools, automation, processes, and teamwork.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the session could include:

1. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and workflows.
2. Experience with software development and deployment processes.
3. Understanding of the challenges in cross-functional collaboration between data engineers, data scientists, software developers, and operations.
4. Familiarity with DevOps principles and practices.
5. Interest in improving the efficiency and agility of ML model development and deployment.

title: Introduction to prompt engineering
description: In this session, you learn how to create and optimize prompts for a variety of generative AI models. First, this session covers the basics of foundation models (FMs), including a subset of FMs called large language models (LLMs). Then, the session covers the fundamental concepts of prompt engineering, such as the different elements of a prompt and some general best practices for using prompts effectively. Finally, the session provides information about basic prompt techniques, including zero-shot, few-shot, and chain-of-thought prompting.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with natural language processing and language models.
3. Familiarity with the concept of prompts and their role in generative AI models.

title: Investing in data quality: Nasdaq’s journey to data reliability (sponsored by Monte Carlo)
description: As one of the world’s largest stock exchanges, Nasdaq knows that high-quality data isn’t just a nice-to-have—it’s mission critical. That means choosing technology partners that can deliver on performance, scale, and reliability is just as important. That’s why, after implementing Amazon Redshift, the Nasdaq team turned their focus to data quality with data observability. In this talk, join Michael Weiss, AVP of Product Management at Nasdaq, to learn about the evolution of data at Nasdaq, how they collaborate with AWS and Monte Carlo to meet the needs of their modern data challenges, and best practices and tips for how to implement a data quality program at virtually any scale. This presentation is brought to you by Monte Carlo, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Amazon Redshift
2. Understanding of data observability
3. Familiarity with modern data challenges
4. Experience in implementing data quality programs
5. Awareness of AWS partnerships

title: IoT architecture cost optimization & explainability via Generative BI
description: Cost optimization is crucial for scaling IoT workloads on AWS. This chalk talk explores design patterns and AWS tools that you can use to continuously optimize workloads, maximizing resource usage while limiting infrastructure costs. Discover how to use Generative BI for cost reconciliation by automating dashboard and narrative creation. Gain insights into building cost-effective architectures that can maximize your cloud investment’s value. Learn how to create optimal IoT architectures while enhancing cost transparency, control, and forecasting.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with IoT (Internet of Things) and its applications.
3. Knowledge of cost optimization strategies and cloud cost management.
4. Exposure to data visualization and business intelligence tools.
5. Familiarity with architectural design patterns and principles.

title: Is Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) all you need?
description: How can you improve the accuracy of generative AI responses—by leveraging Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning techniques, or using a combination of both? This hand-on workshop explores two RAG approaches. First, learn how to implement RAG using Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases with quick and easy setup. Then, take a deep dive into Amazon SageMaker to fine-tune a model on AWS Trainium, deploy it on AWS Inferentia, and use Amazon OpenSearch Service to build out a RAG workflow. Learn when to employ each method based on your specific use case, domain-specific data, and tenancy requirements. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and generative AI models.
2. Basic understanding of AWS services like Amazon SageMaker, Amazon OpenSearch Service, and AWS Trainium/Inferentia.
3. Ability to use a programming language like Python and work with Jupyter Notebooks.
4. Bring a laptop to participate in the hands-on exercises.

title: Is your AWS GovCloud (US) architecture resilient? [REPEAT]
description: When designing your AWS GovCloud (US) architectures, you follow best practices and known design patterns. However, in the event of an outage, is your mission-critical architecture going to hold up like you think? Find out with AWS Resilience Hub and AWS Fault Injection Service. In this builders’ session, explore architectures that superficially appear well-architected and expose risks and deficiencies. Learn how to use AWS tools to uncover the components that will fail during an outage and discover how to rearchitect to fix these gaps. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this builders' session would be:

1. Familiarity with AWS GovCloud (US) architecture design.
2. Understanding of well-architected frameworks and design patterns.
3. Ability to use a laptop during the session.

title: Is your AWS GovCloud (US) architecture resilient? [REPEAT]
description: When designing your AWS GovCloud (US) architectures, you follow best practices and known design patterns. However, in the event of an outage, is your mission-critical architecture going to hold up like you think? Find out with AWS Resilience Hub and AWS Fault Injection Service. In this builders’ session, explore architectures that superficially appear well-architected and expose risks and deficiencies. Learn how to use AWS tools to uncover the components that will fail during an outage and discover how to rearchitect to fix these gaps. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given builders' session:

1. Knowledge of AWS GovCloud (US) architecture design principles and best practices.
2. Familiarity with AWS Resilience Hub and AWS Fault Injection Service.
3. Ability to analyze and assess the resilience of mission-critical architectures.
4. Willingness to participate actively and bring a laptop to the session.

title: Is your serverless application ready for production?
description: Building secure, reliable, and performant applications while balancing cost and operations can be challenging. Getting this right by aligning to the AWS Well-Architected Framework can greatly increase your chance of success. In this chalk talk, specific best practice guidance is applied to a serverless reference architecture.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud architecture.
2. Understanding of serverless computing and its benefits.
3. Basic knowledge of the AWS Well-Architected Framework.

title: It all starts with DNS: Getting the best results from Amazon Route 53
description: In this chalk talk, explore the key features of Amazon Route 53, the latest innovations, and the real-world use cases. Whether you’re focused on managing DNS records at scale, integrating with on-premises infrastructure, optimizing traffic flow through advanced routing policies, or enhancing the security of your DNS traffic, this talk provides you with the insights needed to get the most from Amazon Route 53.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Domain Name System (DNS)
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Experience with managing and configuring DNS records
4. Interest in learning about advanced routing policies and DNS security

title: Itaú and Intel: Innovating for cloud optimization and performance (sponsored by Intel)
description: Itaú’s cloud transformation has been critical in meeting their FinOps objectives. In this session, learn how Itaú’s internal lab—Intel Cloud Center of Expertise, a cutting-edge setup for testing and optimizing companywide solutions using Intel's latest Xeon processors, Intel Accelerator Engines, and software—has helped heighten their customer services and experiences. Explore their learnings in cloud performance, optimization, and use of AI in supporting Itaú's cloud journey, and discover how you can replicate their success to reach your objectives in any industry. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its benefits
2. Knowledge of FinOps principles and objectives
3. Familiarity with Intel's Xeon processors, Intel Accelerator Engines, and related software
4. Interest in leveraging AI and cloud optimization to enhance customer services and experiences
5. Desire to replicate Itaú's success in cloud transformation across different industries

title: IT transformation for nonprofits: Maximize impact with modernization
description: Nonprofits operate under budgetary and resource constraints that significantly hamper their ability to fulfill their mission. One such hurdle is aligning IT infrastructure with strategic goals and operational needs. IT transformation can deliver higher economic value, agility, and rapid innovation. In this chalk talk, business leaders and technologists learn modernization pathways, tools, and technologies to build a business case for prioritizing IT modernization. Presenters whiteboard use cases to move to cloud native architectures, containers, managed databases, modern DevOps, and open source. Attendees leave having learned repeatable patterns and practices for rapid modernization to lead to positive mission outcomes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of nonprofit operations and challenges
2. Knowledge of IT infrastructure and its alignment with strategic goals
3. Familiarity with cloud-native architectures, containers, managed databases, DevOps, and open-source technologies
4. Ability to develop a business case for IT modernization
5. Willingness to learn and apply repeatable patterns and practices for rapid modernization

title: Iveco Group and AWS: A story of continuous innovation
description: The session showcases how Iveco Group builds on AWS to drive innovation, collaboration, and digital transformation in virtual engineering, knowledge management, and generative AI-powered automation. Learn how Iveco is building a self-service development platform on AWS to enable faster development cycles and reduce hardware dependencies. The company’s Virtual Engineering Workbench fosters collaboration among developers, testers, and integrators by providing virtualized environments for digital cockpit development and automated testing. Additionally, the company’s Knowledge Management solution enhances productivity by streamlining access to technical information, and generative AI automates tasks like generating product data sheets from mechanical drawings.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with virtual engineering and digital transformation
3. Knowledge of knowledge management and generative AI
4. Experience in software development and automation
5. Familiarity with the automotive industry and Iveco Group's products and services

title: Jabil's inclusive talent transformation: A data-driven workforce
description: Global manufacturer Jabil faced challenges with frontline talent management, including high attrition, inefficient hiring, and lack of upskilling. To address, Jabil partnered with AWS to develop an end-to-end talent transformation. This included leveraging AWS services to build a robust data and technology infrastructure, redesigning processes, and driving cultural transformation focused on inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E). With a holistic approach to ID&E, Jabil aimed to create a more inclusive work environment to foster greater employee engagement, productivity, and retention. In this lightning talk, Jabil and AWS discuss building inclusive solutions at scale and share learnings from their talent transformation journey.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given scenario:

1. Experience in talent management and workforce development.
2. Knowledge of cloud-based solutions and AWS services.
3. Understanding of organizational culture and change management.
4. Expertise in data analytics and technology infrastructure.
5. Commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) initiatives.

title: Jefferies transformation story: Adopting gen AI for corporate functions (sponsored by HCLTech)
description: Discover how Jefferies implemented a decentralized data governance framework and integrated generative AI to streamline data access, enhance operational efficiency, and eliminate manual tasks. Gain insights from Jefferies' journey, covering stakeholder alignment, pilot projects, and real-world use cases. Learn about their challenges, the solutions they implemented, and how near real-time data pipelines and anomaly detection improved their data platform. Explore essential strategies for risk management, robust data governance, and using generative AI to drive operational excellence, unlock business value, and ensure efficient, scalable and cost-effective operations. This presentation is brought to you by HCLTech, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data governance frameworks
2. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications
3. Knowledge of data access and operational efficiency challenges
4. Awareness of real-time data pipelines and anomaly detection
5. Interest in risk management and operational excellence strategies

title: Journey from concept to customer: Rapid prototyping on AWS for SMBs
description: Unleash the power of rapid prototyping on AWS. This session dives deep into how you can visually design concepts for your customers’ needs and build them on AWS. Discover how you can leverage generative AI services to rapidly prototype your ideas and bring them to life. Witness a live demo that showcases how to build a tangible solution from scratch, demonstrating how to go from concept to completion seamlessly.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with visual design tools or experience in prototyping.
3. Basic knowledge of generative AI and its applications.
4. Familiarity with the software development lifecycle and rapid prototyping methodologies.
5. Curiosity and willingness to explore new technologies and approaches.

title: JPMorgan Chase: Real-time fraud screening at massive scale
description: JPMorgan Chase (JPMC) processes tens of thousands of payments per second across the globe. But with fraud threats continuously evolving to become more complex and detrimental, real-time screening at massive scale becomes essential. Learn how JPMC built a fraud screening platform using Amazon EKS, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon MSK that performs thousands of fraud checks per second within hundreds of milliseconds. Explore the AI/ML models that underpin the decisioning engine and reduce manual reviews, increasing accuracy and fraud mitigation by over 75%. Dive into the architectural decisions and trade-offs that inform this mission-critical solution built natively on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Understanding of fraud detection and prevention techniques
3. Familiarity with microservices architecture and containerization
4. Experience with machine learning and AI models
5. Background in financial services and payment processing

title: Jumpstart innovation with a generative AI sandbox for government
description: State and local governments (SLG) are increasingly exploring the power of generative artificial intelligence (gen AI) to drive innovation and solve complex challenges. In this chalk talk, learn the process of deploying a secure and scalable gen AI sandbox on AWS. Discover how to use Amazon Bedrock, and dive into the core elements of deploying and operating a gen AI sandbox along with some of the challenges faced along the way. Whether you are starting your gen AI journey or have workloads already in production, join us to learn from AWS experts and fellow SLG attendees.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts.
3. Interest in exploring the potential of generative AI for state and local government use cases.

title: Just walk out: Streamlining autonomous checkout for retail with RFID
description: In this session, get an in-depth look at how RFID-powered autonomous checkout works and the tangible benefits it can deliver for your business. Learn how the latest RFID advancements enable a frictionless, lightning-fast self-checkout experience for customers; reduce labor costs and shrink; and streamline inventory management. Whether you're looking to enhance the shopper experience, boost profitability, or optimize operations, this session provides you with both a practical understanding of how autonomous checkout can transform your retail operations, as well as a roadmap for implementation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this session:
1. Basic understanding of RFID technology
2. Knowledge of current retail challenges and pain points
3. Interest in improving customer experience and operational efficiency

title: KakaoStyle's fashion app innovation with generative AI [Korean]
description: This session is delivered in Korean. Learn how KakaoStyle, an e-commerce fashion service in Korea, improved its image review inspection system and marketing assets using Amazon Bedrock and Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 3.5. Autogenerated promotional banner images and marketing copy were delivered with equal or higher quality at least 80% faster than in the previous workflow, and generative AI–based content moderating was automated with high accuracy and coverage at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of the Korean language
2. Understanding of e-commerce and fashion industry in Korea
3. Familiarity with Amazon Bedrock and Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 3.5
4. Experience with generative AI and content moderation
5. Interest in learning about the improvements made by KakaoStyle

title: Karpenter: Amazon EKS best practices and cloud cost optimization [REPEAT]
description: Get hands-on experience with Karpenter on Amazon EKS. Karpenter is an application-centric node provisioner that simplifies infrastructure management by provisioning rightsized Amazon EC2 instances for your workload while considering any scheduling constraints. As your workload evolves, Karpenter’s consolidation feature helps continuously optimize your compute onto the fewest, most cost-efficient instances. In this workshop, learn how to set up Amazon EKS with Karpenter, gain an understanding of how Karpenter scales based on application requirements, set up continuous optimization of a workload using Karpenter consolidation, explore AWS spare capacity (Amazon EC2 Spot Instances) with Karpenter, and learn other best practices. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Familiarity with Amazon EKS
2. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
3. Knowledge of AWS services and concepts

title: Karpenter: Amazon EKS best practices and cloud cost optimization [REPEAT]
description: Get hands-on experience with Karpenter on Amazon EKS. Karpenter is an application-centric node provisioner that simplifies infrastructure management by provisioning rightsized Amazon EC2 instances for your workload while considering any scheduling constraints. As your workload evolves, Karpenter’s consolidation feature helps continuously optimize your compute onto the fewest, most cost-efficient instances. In this workshop, learn how to set up Amazon EKS with Karpenter, gain an understanding of how Karpenter scales based on application requirements, set up continuous optimization of a workload using Karpenter consolidation, explore AWS spare capacity (Amazon EC2 Spot Instances) with Karpenter, and learn other best practices. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the "Get hands-on experience with Karpenter on Amazon EKS" workshop:

1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes and container orchestration.
2. Experience with Amazon EKS or other Kubernetes platforms.
3. Familiarity with Amazon EC2 and AWS services.
4. Ability to access an AWS account with appropriate permissions.
5. A laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Keeping it small: Agentic workflows with SLMs on AWS Inferentia [REPEAT]
description: While large language models (LLMs) offer versatility, smaller language models (SLMs) provide resource efficiency, speed, and simplicity. This builders’ session explores task simplification and decomposition techniques to harness multiple specialized SLMs, surpassing a single large model’s accuracy at a fraction of the cost. Learn how to build a generative AI application by deploying SLMs from Amazon SageMaker JumpStart on AWS Inferentia. Understand model trade-offs and a mental model for selecting the right approach. Leave with a deep understanding of designing generative AI applications by orchestrating SLMs through agentic workflows for cost savings, accuracy, and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given builders' session:

1. Basic understanding of large language models (LLMs) and smaller language models (SLMs).
2. Familiarity with task simplification and decomposition techniques.
3. Experience with Amazon SageMaker JumpStart and AWS Inferentia.
4. Ability to design and implement generative AI applications.
5. Laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Keeping it small: Agentic workflows with SLMs on AWS Inferentia [REPEAT]
description: While large language models (LLMs) offer versatility, smaller language models (SLMs) provide resource efficiency, speed, and simplicity. This builders’ session explores task simplification and decomposition techniques to harness multiple specialized SLMs, surpassing a single large model’s accuracy at a fraction of the cost. Learn how to build a generative AI application by deploying SLMs from Amazon SageMaker JumpStart on AWS Inferentia. Understand model trade-offs and a mental model for selecting the right approach. Leave with a deep understanding of designing generative AI applications by orchestrating SLMs through agentic workflows for cost savings, accuracy, and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the builders' session:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning and language models.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, such as Amazon SageMaker and AWS Inferentia.
3. Proficiency in programming and software development.
4. Laptop for hands-on participation.

title: Keeping it small: Agentic workflows with SLMs on AWS Inferentia [REPEAT]
description: While large language models (LLMs) offer versatility, smaller language models (SLMs) provide resource efficiency, speed, and simplicity. This builders’ session explores task simplification and decomposition techniques to harness multiple specialized SLMs, surpassing a single large model’s accuracy at a fraction of the cost. Learn how to build a generative AI application by deploying SLMs from Amazon SageMaker JumpStart on AWS Inferentia. Understand model trade-offs and a mental model for selecting the right approach. Leave with a deep understanding of designing generative AI applications by orchestrating SLMs through agentic workflows for cost savings, accuracy, and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this builders' session:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning and language models.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon SageMaker and AWS Inferentia.
3. Experience with software development and deployment.
4. Willingness to actively participate and bring a laptop.

title: Kellanova’s cloud-powered transformation: Driving growth with AWS & AI
description: When the global snacking powerhouse Kellanova, formerly known as Kellogg Company, announced the separation of its North American cereal business, WK Kellogg, both companies relied on cloud technologies to power everything from manufacturing to supply chain to pricing. After the split, their CIOs knew they needed to continue to build a dynamic environment on AWS to optimize their SAP workloads, enhance revenue growth management and trade promotion management, and increase sales. In this session, learn the instrumental role AWS played in their journey and how the companies are using the power of the cloud and AI to unlock new opportunities.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of cloud technologies and their application in manufacturing, supply chain, and pricing
2. Understanding of SAP workloads and their optimization
3. Familiarity with revenue growth management and trade promotion management
4. Experience in sales and leveraging AI to unlock new opportunities

title: Klarna: Accelerating credit decisioning with real-time data processing
description: Klarna, a leader in instant credit and buy now, pay later services, must make fast and accurate decisions to provide a frictionless customer experience. This session shares how Klarna scales credit decisioning in real time using Amazon DynamoDB and AWS Glue. Learn how Klarna aggregates customer data points and condenses them into features such as past orders and outstanding debt to feed machine learning models that inform purchase approvals. See how Klarna’s data pipelines enable the company to rapidly ingest, process, and analyze vast amounts of customer data to securely power instant yet intelligent credit decisions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of credit decisioning and buy now, pay later services.
2. Knowledge of Amazon DynamoDB and AWS Glue.
3. Familiarity with data aggregation, feature engineering, and machine learning models.
4. Experience with data pipelines and real-time data processing.
5. Awareness of data security and privacy considerations in the financial industry.

title: Knockout AI: Your generative AI coach [REPEAT]
description: Unleash your full potential with an innovative, AI-powered coaching experience that can motivate and guide you in real time! Prepare to be captivated as a generative AI trainer enhances your boxing workout by delivering personalized advice through a lifelike voice as you hit a pressure-sensitive punching bag. This demo showcases the future of personalized training, where advanced AI models seamlessly integrate into our physical surroundings to offer a truly immersive and tailored experience.
prerequisites:
1. Pressure-sensitive punching bag
2. Lifelike voice interface
3. Advanced AI models
4. Personalized training algorithms
5. Immersive and interactive experience

title: Knockout AI: Your generative AI coach [REPEAT]
description: Unleash your full potential with an innovative, AI-powered coaching experience that can motivate and guide you in real time! Prepare to be captivated as a generative AI trainer enhances your boxing workout by delivering personalized advice through a lifelike voice as you hit a pressure-sensitive punching bag. This demo showcases the future of personalized training, where advanced AI models seamlessly integrate into our physical surroundings to offer a truly immersive and tailored experience.
prerequisites:
1. Pressure-sensitive punching bag
2. Generative AI model capable of providing personalized advice
3. Lifelike voice interface
4. Integration of advanced AI models into physical surroundings
5. Ability to deliver a truly immersive and tailored training experience

title: KONE safeguards AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
description: Amazon Bedrock Guardrails enables organizations to deliver consistently safe and moderated user experiences through generative AI applications, regardless of the underlying foundation models (FM). Join the session to deep dive into how guardrails provide additional customizable safeguards on top of the native protections of FMs, delivering industry-leading safety protection. Finally, hear from KONE's CEO on how they use Amazon Bedrock Guardrails to provide safe and accurate real-time AI support to 30,000 technicians that execute 80,000 field customer visits per day. Get their tips on adoption of responsible AI principles that deliver value while achieving productivity gains.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the session would be:

1. Understanding of generative AI applications
2. Knowledge of foundation models and their native protections
3. Familiarity with responsible AI principles
4. Interest in delivering safe and moderated user experiences
5. Desire to learn about KONE's use case and adoption of Amazon Bedrock Guardrails

title: KONE’s digital transformation: Achieving excellence with PwC and AWS (sponsored by PwC)
description: KONE has selected AWS as their strategic platform for hosting data integrations across enterprise applications, marking a significant technological advancement. PwC has played a pivotal role by delivering 220 technical AWS integrations, supporting KONE’s comprehensive SAP transformation program. In this lightning talk, learn the strategic approach to designing, building, and testing AWS integrations for seamless data flow. See how production cutover support ensures a smooth transition and uninterrupted operations. Discover the benefits of using an extended team for AWS development to meet high delivery standards and enhance capabilities. Don’t miss this chance to discover how PwC and AWS are driving KONE’s technology transformation and future growth. This presentation is brought to you by PwC, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this presentation would likely include:

1. Understanding of AWS cloud platform and its services.
2. Experience in designing and building data integrations across enterprise applications.
3. Knowledge of SAP transformation programs and their requirements.
4. Familiarity with production cutover support and ensuring smooth transitions.
5. Expertise in extended team management for AWS development projects.

title: Kubernetes connectivity: From service meshes to the future
description: In the rapidly evolving open source landscape, navigating complex connectivity patterns while maintaining non-functional requirements can be challenging. This is one of the reasons why the industry has embraced service mesh technologies to centralize and minimize those complexities. However, with numerous service mesh options and projects like Kubernetes Gateway API and Ambient Mesh emerging, choosing the right solution can be overwhelming. In this chalk talk, learn how to navigate this landscape and select the most suitable solution to achieve your specific business objectives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of service-oriented architecture and microservices
2. Familiarity with Kubernetes and container orchestration
3. Knowledge of non-functional requirements (e.g., security, reliability, performance)
4. Awareness of service mesh technologies and their capabilities
5. Familiarity with emerging projects like Kubernetes Gateway API and Ambient Mesh

title: Kubernetes meets Serverless: Deploy EDAs with Kubernetes APIs
description: Many organizations are running their workloads on both AWS serverless services and Kubernetes. While organizations and their platform teams want to give developers the ability to move fast with their preferred technology, they may face the challenges of supporting two different platforms for deploying applications to Amazon EKS and serverless services and dealing with inefficient processes and disjointed tools. In this session, learn how to deploy serverless, event-driven architectures through Kubernetes APIs using tools such as ACK, how to extend your existing Kubernetes platform to deploy composable serverless architectures, and how to give developers easy access to their preferred technology choice.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS serverless services
2. Understanding of Kubernetes and its deployment
3. Familiarity with tools like ACK (AWS Controllers for Kubernetes)
4. Experience in building event-driven architectures
5. Desire to streamline deployment processes and provide developers with flexibility

title: Lactation room
description: The lactation room provides parents with a private, secure space to express breastmilk for their nursing child. The room is equipped with lockers, a refrigerator, a microwave, disposable cold packs and wipes, and a comfortable space to pump. Reservations for the duration of the conference can be made at the check-in desk outside the room.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Private and secure space
2. Equipped with necessary amenities (lockers, refrigerator, microwave, etc.)
3. Comfortable space for pumping
4. Reservation system for the duration of the conference
5. Availability of the room at the check-in desk

title: Landing zone setup process from zero to hero [REPEAT]
description: This advanced chalk talk addresses the challenge of maintaining governance, security, and compliance as AWS footprints grow. It focuses on maximizing AWS Control Tower’s potential through advanced implementation strategies. Learn to configure guardrails, automate account provisioning, and utilize features like custom landing zones. The talk covers integrating AWS Control Tower with AWS Organizations and AWS Config to create a centralized governance framework. Gain expertise in optimizing AWS Control Tower for your organization, enabling efficient, secure cloud operations at scale. This advanced knowledge is crucial for organizations looking to streamline management and enhance security across their expanding AWS infrastructure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS Control Tower
2. Understanding of AWS Organizations and AWS Config
3. Experience in cloud governance and security best practices

title: Landing zone setup process from zero to hero [REPEAT]
description: This advanced chalk talk addresses the challenge of maintaining governance, security, and compliance as AWS footprints grow. It focuses on maximizing AWS Control Tower’s potential through advanced implementation strategies. Learn to configure guardrails, automate account provisioning, and utilize features like custom landing zones. The talk covers integrating AWS Control Tower with AWS Organizations and AWS Config to create a centralized governance framework. Gain expertise in optimizing AWS Control Tower for your organization, enabling efficient, secure cloud operations at scale. This advanced knowledge is crucial for organizations looking to streamline management and enhance security across their expanding AWS infrastructure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS Cloud architecture and services
2. Familiarity with AWS Organizations and AWS Config
3. Experience in cloud governance and security best practices
4. Knowledge of AWS Control Tower and its features

title: Latency optimization: From theory to practice
description: In this session, hear how to efficiently run latency sensitive workloads in AWS. Customers learn how to choose proper AWS services in order to optimize and measure latency indicators. Take a deep dive into different communication protocols and networking optimizations from client applications to corresponding computing environments with a help of generative AI, and summarize this knowledge in simple and practical mental models. Knowledge learned here can be used to improve user experiences and increase returns on investments in digital products.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with performance optimization and latency-sensitive workloads.
3. Knowledge of networking concepts and communication protocols.

title: Launch a secure WordPress site on Amazon Lightsail in minutes
description: Join this session to learn how to set up a secure and highly available WordPress website on Amazon Lightsail – an easy-to-use virtual private server (VPS). Discover what Amazon Lightsail is, the resources available to create a website, and how to set one up in minutes, all at a predictable monthly cost. After this session, participants will know how to set up their own best-practice WordPress website leveraging global AWS infrastructure and Lightsail's easy-to-use instance launch experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of WordPress
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and virtual private servers (VPS)
3. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)

title: Lazy loading container images with Seekable OCI (SOCI)
description: Seekable OCI (SOCI) is an open source AWS technology that enables containers to launch faster by lazily loading the container image. In this workshop, get hands-on with SOCI. Learn how to create SOCI indexes for existing container images and how index generation can be automated in the cloud. Then, practice deploying workloads to Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate, considering how launch times are reduced by lazily loading container images. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of container technology (e.g., Docker)
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate
3. Basic knowledge of command-line interface (CLI) and scripting

title: Leading in the age of AI: How Copilot empowers digital transformation (sponsored by GitHub)
description: In this session, explore GitHub Copilot. Learn how to increase developer productivity with GitHub’s native AI pair programmer. Discover how to employ AI to accelerate software development. Explore how to foster a culture of innovation with AI. Finally, learn what updates are coming up next for Copilot. This presentation is brought to you by GitHub, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with software development
2. Basic understanding of AI and machine learning
3. Experience with version control systems like Git

title: Learn and be curious: Methods for building a learning developer team [Japanese]
description: This session is delivered in Japanese. What are the most important things for modern application development? Productivity? Developer experience? While both of those are important, learning is also a key factor. Software development is creative work, and developers should continuously find something new in their work. In this session, learn how to transform your developer team into “learning team” with the help of AWS services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Japanese language
2. Interest in modern application development practices
3. Understanding of developer productivity and experience
4. Appreciation for the importance of continuous learning in software development

title: Learn how an SMB customer boosted automated scheduling with gen AI
description: Healthcare technology company MDFit successfully implemented an AI-powered chatbot on Amazon Lex and Amazon Bedrock to streamline appointment scheduling for end users. By leveraging natural language processing for intuitive scheduling conversations, the bot improved customer experience and operational efficiency by reducing the time and effort needed to book appointments.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques
2. Familiarity with Amazon Lex and Amazon Bedrock services
3. Understanding of appointment scheduling processes and customer experience optimization

title: Learn how Ingram Micro can accelerate your AWS Marketplace business (sponsored by Ingram Micro)
description: As the AWS 2023 Global Distributor Partner of the Year, Ingram Micro delivers exceptional global reach and a vast partner ecosystem providing an unparalleled customer experience through technical assessments, architecture and design consultation, proof of concept, migration strategy, professional services, security and optimization services, billing and cost efficiency, customer insights, and renewal management. Learn how Ingram Micro’s Xvantage digital experience platform can scale your AWS business to grow faster and be more profitable with AWS Marketplace private offers. This presentation is brought to you by Ingram Micro, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Marketplace and private offers
2. Familiarity with Ingram Micro's Xvantage digital experience platform
3. Knowledge of technical assessments, architecture and design consultation, proof of concept, migration strategy, professional services, security and optimization services, billing and cost efficiency, customer insights, and renewal management.

title: Learning from Amazon: AI/ML + generative AI
description: This chalk talk outlines the approach Amazon.com takes to apply AI/ML across core operations and new business launches. Sharing specific examples from Amazon.com’s consumer/retail and other businesses, the talk explains how AI/ML, and generative AI in particular, helps Amazon.com deliver the best customer experience possible while improving efficiency and lowering cost. Learn the lessons the Amazon.com teams have learned across the cultural, process, and technology aspects of building and scaling ML capabilities across the organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AI/ML concepts
2. Knowledge of Amazon.com's business operations and customer experience
3. Familiarity with the application of AI/ML in various industries
4. Interest in learning about the cultural, process, and technological aspects of building and scaling ML capabilities

title: Learning new skills with Amazon Q Developer [REPEAT]
description: Experience the power of Amazon Q Developer, your AI-powered assistant for software development. In this session, explore how Amazon Q Developer can streamline your daily workflow on AWS. Stuck in the console? Open the Amazon Q Developer panel for instant assistance. Can't find your way through the documentation? Amazon Q Developer guides you effortlessly. Need help crafting CLI commands? Amazon Q Developer has you covered. Want assistance right in Slack or Microsoft Teams? Amazon Q Developer is by your side, helping you work smarter, faster, and more efficiently across your favorite tools. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS
2. Basic understanding of software development
3. Access to a laptop

2. Basic understanding of software development and workflows
3. Access to a laptop or computer
