3. Familiarity with command-line tools or Slack/Microsoft Teams integration

title: Learnings from BMW's global software development platform on AWS
description: The BMW Group has established a global, award-winning software development platform within its automotive organization named the BMW Software Factory. After transitioning to AWS, BMW has scaled it to run over 165,000 CI/CD builds daily, with up to 5,500 instances dynamically provisioned in parallel. With 12,000+ developers, it became essential to focus on the resilience and efficient utilization of FinOps. In this session, learn about the fundamental architecture and design choices that enabled this resilient platform, and dive into the FinOps strategies BMW employed to drive cost optimizations, improve developer productivity, and accelerate its time to market.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience in software development and deployment
2. Knowledge of cloud computing platforms, particularly AWS
3. Understanding of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) processes
4. Familiarity with FinOps (Financial Operations) principles and practices
5. Exposure to large-scale software development and deployment challenges

title: Learnings from developers adopting AWS Graviton at scale [REPEAT]
description: AWS Graviton processors are custom designed to enable the best price performance for a wide variety of workloads on AWS including application servers, microservices, open source–based databases and in-memory caches, gaming, high performance computing, and machine learning. In this chalk talk, engage directly with AWS specialists that help customers on a daily basis with their adoption journey—from workload selection to running at scale in production. Explore AWS Graviton use cases, best practices, performance, and customer success stories.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Basic knowledge of processor architectures and performance optimization
3. Familiarity with common workloads and use cases in the cloud
4. Interest in exploring cost-effective and high-performance computing solutions

title: Learnings from developers adopting AWS Graviton at scale [REPEAT]

Explore AWS Graviton use cases, best practices, performance, and customer success stories.

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and offerings
3. Knowledge of application architecture and workload optimization
4. Interest in exploring alternative processor options for cloud-based workloads
5. Desire to learn about customer success stories and best practices

title: Learn multi-tier application architectures on Amazon ECS
description: In this workshop, gain practical experience in deploying, scaling, and observing a complex multi-tier application on Amazon ECS. Explore common best practices on how to operate and manage containerized applications that can be translated into any environment. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Docker and containerization concepts
2. Basic understanding of Amazon Web Services (AWS)
3. Proficiency in using a command-line interface (CLI)
4. Ability to install and configure necessary software on your laptop

title: Learn the latest generative AI updates and use cases [Japanese]
description: This session is delivered in Japanese. With the evolution of generative AI technology, more users have implemented generative AI services on AWS into their businesses. In this session, explore the latest generative AI use cases, technology updates, and customer stories, and learn how you can implement generative AI in your organization. In addition, hear two customers from Japan share their experiences utilizing generative AI services on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI technology
2. Knowledge of AWS services and their capabilities
3. Familiarity with Japanese language

title: Learn to create a robust, easy-to-scale architecture with cells
description: Join this session to understand strategies to enhance system availability and maximize the resource efficiency of your workloads. Learn from Slack, a communications platform delivering billions of messages every week, how they use AWS to optimize their cloud infrastructure to be resilient to fault boundaries. Gain insights into how cellular architecture on AWS was leveraged to mitigate risks in the face of potential Availability Zone and regional disruptions at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and architecture
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their use cases
3. Knowledge of system availability and fault tolerance principles
4. Exposure to scalable and resilient application design

title: Learn to deploy and self-manage blockchain nodes on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Join this builders’ session on empowering blockchain innovation to learn how to deploy blockchain nodes effectively using AWS technology. Led by AWS solutions architects, the session highlights the AWS Blockchain Node Runners initiative, an open source project that simplifies the complexities of blockchain deployment on AWS. Gain insights into the development processes, and explore deployment strategies. This session is ideal for both blockchain enthusiasts and professionals seeking to enhance their deployment capabilities on AWS with a variety of blockchain protocols, such as Ethereum, Solana, Polygon, and more. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of blockchain technology
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on participation

title: Lessons learned from DDoS mitigation: Insights from AWS SRT escalations
description: AWS stops millions of DDoS attacks per year and mitigates thousands on a daily basis. In this chalk talk, dive into past DDoS events and find out how the AWS Shield Response Team (SRT) helped to mitigate security escalations. Gain insights into this type of intrusion and how you can apply mitigation strategies to make your application more DDoS-resilient.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of DDoS attacks and their impact
2. Knowledge of AWS services and their capabilities
3. Familiarity with security best practices and mitigation strategies

title: Level up your data game: Strategic data prep for gen AI success (sponsored by Cloudtech)
description: In this lightning talk, explore essential strategies and actionable insights for transforming your data into a powerful asset ready for AI integration. Whether you’re just starting out or refining existing practices, discover innovative techniques to enhance your data quality, streamline your preparation processes, and implement robust governance frameworks that lay the proper groundwork for AI excellence. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how to unlock the full potential of your data and propel your organization toward unparalleled innovation and efficiency. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudtech, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data management
2. Familiarity with data quality and governance concepts
3. Interest in leveraging data for AI integration
4. Desire to improve organizational efficiency and innovation

title: Level up your serverless applications with Powertools for AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: The official Powertools for AWS Lambda workshop is back with new features! Learn why Powertools for AWS Lambda can be the developer toolkit of choice for serverless workloads. In this workshop, make an existing application more observable, resilient to retries, and handle API requests like a pro—all while cutting boilerplate in half. Choose your own adventure with Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, .NET, or Java, and bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Lambda
2. Familiarity with your chosen programming language (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, .NET, or Java)
3. Laptop with the necessary development environment set up

title: Level up your serverless applications with Powertools for AWS Lambda [REPEAT]
description: The official Powertools for AWS Lambda workshop is back with new features! Learn why Powertools for AWS Lambda can be the developer toolkit of choice for serverless workloads. In this workshop, make an existing application more observable, resilient to retries, and handle API requests like a pro—all while cutting boilerplate in half. Choose your own adventure with Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, .NET, or Java, and bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Lambda
2. Programming experience in at least one of the following languages: Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, .NET, or Java
3. Familiarity with serverless architectures and concepts

title: Leverage Anthropic's Claude models for AI's evolving landscape (sponsored by Anthropic)
description: In this session, discover how you can use Anthropic's Claude models to create innovative solutions. This session offers insights into the AI landscape, its impact on software development, and practical guidance on integrating AI technologies into your workflows. Learn how you can harness the power of AI to stay at the forefront of your industry, whether you’re optimizing existing applications or developing new AI-driven products. This presentation is brought to you by Anthropic, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with software development practices and workflows.
3. Interest in exploring the applications of AI in various industries.
4. Willingness to learn about Anthropic's Claude models and their capabilities.
5. Curiosity to understand the impact of AI on the software development landscape.

title: Leverage ISVs and AWS generative AI to optimize your SAP RISE journey
description: SAP and AWS announced the publication of RISE journey maps, accessible for all AWS customers from AWS Migration Hub, and highlighted our ISVs that have proven services to facilitate the assessment, migration, modernization, and maintenance of RISE deployments on AWS. In this chalk talk, dive deep on the migration scenarios for on-premises, legacy SAP customers and learn how you can leverage Amazon Bedrock, Anthropic Claude, and Amazon Titan FMs in your business process transformation in-line with the guidance published with SAP’s Joint Reference Architecture (JRA).
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of SAP and AWS partnership
2. Knowledge of RISE journey maps and AWS Migration Hub
3. Familiarity with AWS services like Amazon Bedrock, Anthropic Claude, and Amazon Titan FMs
4. Awareness of SAP's Joint Reference Architecture (JRA)
5. Experience with on-premises, legacy SAP systems and business process transformation

title: Leveraging AWS Certifications to pivot your career into AI/ML
description: This session explores how obtaining AWS Certifications can help individuals transition their careers into the Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) fields. Even for those not directly pursuing roles in AI/ML, acquiring knowledge and skills in these domains through AWS Certifications can future-proof their careers, given the increasing importance of AI and ML across various industries. Explore specific AWS Certifications relevant to AI/ML, how they enhance cloud computing and data management skills, and the value of using certifications if you don't have work experience to stay relevant in the evolving job market.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with programming languages and data analysis
3. Interest in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
4. Willingness to learn and acquire new skills
5. Desire to future-proof your career

title: Leveraging human-AI collaboration to reinvent knowledge management
description: Organizations are struggling to manage the rapid growth of data and information as traditional knowledge management approaches become unsustainable. Generative AI presents an opportunity to augment human intelligence in this domain. AWS has built knowledge communities to scale cloud knowledge and address the limitations of traditional approaches. This involves creating robust, adaptive, and innovative knowledge management systems that integrate human expertise with AI capabilities. These systems can help organizations adapt to the exponential growth of information and knowledge, leveraging the complementary strengths of humans and AI to tackle the challenges of modern knowledge management.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of knowledge management challenges in the digital age.
2. Familiarity with the capabilities and potential of Generative AI.
3. Awareness of AWS's approach to building knowledge communities.
4. Expertise in developing adaptive and innovative knowledge management systems.
5. Ability to integrate human expertise with AI capabilities.

title: Leveraging intelligent CloudOps to achieve service-level objectives
description: As your workloads and infrastructure grow, monitoring thousands of metrics, millions of logs, and numerous errors can become overwhelming—even for dedicated experts. Artificial intelligence (Al) and machine learning (ML) can help you simplify cloud operations at scale. In this chalk talk, explore setting up an intelligent operations platform, combining observability and event-driven automation. Learn how to analyze observability data to understand issues and identify root causes using Amazon CloudWatch. Finally, see how to implement event-driven architectures to trigger automated actions, enabling proactive resolution and reducing manual effort.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and operations
2. Familiarity with observability tools and concepts
3. Basic knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning
4. Experience with event-driven architectures
5. Familiarity with Amazon CloudWatch

title: Licensing commercial software on AWS
description: AWS provides a variety of migration pathways for your enterprise workloads, but navigating all the licensing options can be confusing. In this session, learn about licensing options for your Microsoft software, including end of support; complementary AWS Optimization and Licensing Assessment (AWS OLA) for your Microsoft, VMware, and Oracle workloads; and how to deal with the high cost of commercial hypervisors like VMware. Prepare for the future and get out of the business of license compliance by replacing your software-licensed products and applications with open source alternatives and technology built specifically for the cloud.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of enterprise workload migration strategies
2. Knowledge of Microsoft software licensing options
3. Familiarity with AWS Optimization and Licensing Assessment (AWS OLA)
4. Awareness of the costs associated with commercial hypervisors like VMware
5. Interest in exploring open-source alternatives and cloud-native technologies

title: Lift-and-shift your database: Scalable, performant, and cost-efficient
description: If you're managing SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or SAP HANA on-premises, migrating to the cloud is easier and more cost-effective than most think. Join this talk to discuss how Amazon EBS and Amazon FSx can enhance database agility, focusing on self-managed databases on Amazon EC2. Engage with experts as they dive into best practices, real-world use cases, and the technical nuances for high-performance, scalable database storage. Bring your questions and challenges to this dynamic session designed to provide actionable insights and practical solutions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience in managing on-premises SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or SAP HANA databases.
2. Interest in migrating to the cloud.
3. Familiarity with Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, and Amazon FSx.
4. Desire to learn best practices and real-world use cases for database storage in the cloud.
5. Willingness to engage with experts and ask questions.

title: Lilith Games: Gen AI, from humble beginnings to grand accomplishments [Mandarin Chinese]
description: This lightning talk is delivered in Mandarin Chinese. Join this talk to explore the generative AI journey of Lilith Games, a leading game company in China. Learn how Lilith utilizes Amazon Bedrock and Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 3.5 to optimize intelligent operations, improve game management, reduce manual labor by 50%, and enhance game development efficiency by 20%. Additionally, explore how they connect high-efficiency tools across internal departments to ultimately accelerate game innovation, improve player retention, and increase overall game revenue.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Fluency in Mandarin Chinese
2. Interest in the generative AI journey of Lilith Games
3. Understanding of Amazon Bedrock and Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 3.5
4. Curiosity about how Lilith Games utilizes AI to optimize operations and enhance game development
5. Desire to learn about connecting high-efficiency tools across departments to drive game innovation and revenue.

title: LLMOps unleashed: Crafting AI pipelines that actually work
description: Dive into the world of LLMOps in this interactive session and explore how to leverage AWS services like Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker, and many more to build, deploy, and manage large language model solutions at scale. Through real-world examples and hands-on problem-solving, learn practical strategies to optimize your AI workflows, automate deployments, and overcome common challenges. Join this chalk talk and transform your approach to LLMOps and unlock the full potential of your AI initiatives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services
2. Basic understanding of machine learning and AI concepts
3. Experience with large language models or a strong interest in the field

title: Lockheed Martin's path to digital transformation through innovation
description: Large enterprises going through digital transformations face common challenges including legacy processes, compressed timelines, scalability, silos (data and people), and friction points. AWS Experience-Based Acceleration (EBA), a transformation methodology adopted by hundreds of companies, helps overcome these challenges and bridge the gap between business goals and technology solutions. In this session, learn directly from Lockheed Martin how it used EBA to unlock innovation and drive its large-scale digital transformation delivering automation, agility, and business value. Find out how it built end-to-end solutions with EBA’s practical guidance to scale repeatable success patterns as its new cloud-fluent way of working.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of digital transformation challenges in large enterprises
2. Knowledge of AWS Experience-Based Acceleration (EBA) methodology
3. Familiarity with Lockheed Martin's digital transformation journey
4. Interest in scaling repeatable success patterns in cloud-based solutions
5. Desire to learn practical guidance for driving digital transformation initiatives

title: LogicMonitor’s hybrid AIOps enables AI modernization at any AWS stage (sponsored by LogicMonitor)
description: How does hybrid observability support the key stages of a cloud migration? If you're still mid-migration, are you able to sample gen AI tools with your hybrid infrastructure? Monitoring over 1 trillion events daily, LogicMonitor supports enterprises throughout every step of AWS migration and modernization. Learn how LogicMonitor’s SaaS platform on AWS helps the planning and execution of migrations, and explore how critical post-migration visualization eases the transition to the cloud. Discover AI-powered recommendations to optimize your AWS compute and storage resources. LogicMonitor’s support also helps users confidently test gen AI tools such as Amazon Bedrock. This presentation is brought to you by LogicMonitor, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of cloud migration process and its key stages.
2. Knowledge of hybrid observability and its role in supporting cloud migration.
3. Familiarity with AWS migration and modernization services.
4. Awareness of SaaS-based monitoring platforms and their capabilities.
5. Familiarity with AI-powered tools and their integration with hybrid infrastructure.

title: Low-code MFT automation: Supercharge your enterprise file movement
description: Learn how modernizing managed file transfer (MFT) to a cloud-native, event-driven architecture can transform your MFT business practice from simple B2B file exchanges into an intelligent data pipeline. By combining AWS Transfer Family SFTP endpoints and connectors with Amazon EventBridge and serverless architectures, you can automate the integration of B2B data into ETL pipelines or prepare data for inclusion of data sources for generative AI.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with managed file transfer (MFT) and its role in data integration.
3. Knowledge of event-driven architectures and serverless computing.
4. Experience with data pipelines, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data preparation for AI models.

title: Low-cost logging and observability with Amazon OpenSearch Service
description: In this workshop, discover how to build a cost-efficient enterprise logging and observability solution for large amounts of data with Amazon OpenSearch Service. Learn how to use storage tiering, OR1 instance types, zero-ETL, and query acceleration techniques to drive cost efficiencies and performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
2. Basic understanding of data management and storage
3. Familiarity with logging and observability concepts

title: Mainframe modernization: Pathways and AWS capabilities
description: Large mainframe estates often contain a diverse mix of legacy applications with varying requirements and objectives, necessitating the need for multiple toolsets, modernization patterns, and deployment options—an approach that makes modernization complex and challenging. This session explores the different mainframe modernization pathways and comprehensive AWS capabilities that help teams tailor their modernization approach to specific business needs without complexity. Learn about patterns including automated refactoring, replatforming, and augmentation, along with accelerators for application testing, data replication, file transfer, and DevOps. Hear from Allianz and Visma about their successful mainframe migration and their continued modernization efforts on AWS post-migration.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with mainframe systems and legacy applications
2. Understanding of different modernization patterns and deployment options
3. Familiarity with AWS capabilities for mainframe modernization
4. Knowledge of application testing, data replication, file transfer, and DevOps tools and processes
5. Exposure to successful mainframe migration and modernization projects on AWS

title: Mainframe modernization powered by generative AI on AWS
description: This builders’ session offers a comprehensive exploration of mainframe modernization and hands-on experience using generative AI services on AWS. Learn how to use AWS Partner solution AveriSource and integrate with Amazon Bedrock for both discovery and code analysis to gain valuable insights into existing mainframe application codebase and data structure. Also, discover how to use Amazon Bedrock to create test data, enhancing the testing process for modernization projects. Finally, explore Amazon Q capabilities in fine-tuning and refining the generated code from AveriSource, ensuring it meets specific requirements and standards. You must bring your laptop to participate. This builders’ session is intended for AWS Partners.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts
2. Understanding of mainframe systems and application modernization
3. Basic programming skills
4. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: Make applications highly resilient with AWS Fault Injection Service [REPEAT]
description: Application resilience is critical to the highly regulated financial services industry, and AWS tools and best practices can help you meet required levels of resilience and reliability. During this gamified builders’ session, compete with peers to evolve a simple, non-resilient banking application into a highly resilient architecture. This application uses technologies common in the financial services industry, including Java, containers, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka. Learn how to improve your application so that it can successfully pass the different tests AWS Fault Injection Service generates, such as a database failover, a container reboot, or an Availability Zone loss.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with Java, containers, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka.
3. Familiarity with application architecture and design principles.
4. Familiarity with AWS Fault Injection Service or similar testing tools.
5. Interest in building resilient and highly available applications for the financial services industry.

title: Make applications highly resilient with AWS Fault Injection Service [REPEAT]
description: Application resilience is critical to the highly regulated financial services industry, and AWS tools and best practices can help you meet required levels of resilience and reliability. During this gamified builders’ session, compete with peers to evolve a simple, non-resilient banking application into a highly resilient architecture. This application uses technologies common in the financial services industry, including Java, containers, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka. Learn how to improve your application so that it can successfully pass the different tests AWS Fault Injection Service generates, such as a database failover, a container reboot, or an Availability Zone loss.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with Java, containers, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka.
3. Knowledge of application architecture and design principles.
4. Familiarity with AWS Fault Injection Service or similar tools for testing application resilience.

title: Make applications highly resilient with AWS Fault Injection Service [REPEAT]
description: Application resilience is critical to the highly regulated financial services industry, and AWS tools and best practices can help you meet required levels of resilience and reliability. During this gamified builders’ session, compete with peers to evolve a simple, non-resilient banking application into a highly resilient architecture. This application uses technologies common in the financial services industry, including Java, containers, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka. Learn how to improve your application so that it can successfully pass the different tests AWS Fault Injection Service generates, such as a database failover, a container reboot, or an Availability Zone loss.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
2. Basic understanding of Java, containers, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka
3. Familiarity with application resilience and reliability concepts
4. Experience with AWS Fault Injection Service or similar testing tools

title: Make faster progress on AWS operational tasks with Amazon Q Developer
description: Amazon Q Developer is an expert on AWS and is available in the AWS Management Console to help developers and IT pros optimize their AWS Cloud environments, such as diagnose and resolve errors, provide guidance on architectural best practices, analyze billing information and trends, and use natural language in chat to manage resources in their AWS account. Learn how you can shift from a reactive review of issues to proactive remediation and guidance on error diagnosis, network troubleshooting, architecture best practices, and resource/cost analysis for proactive AWS account management. Streamline operations, save time and costs, and fuel innovation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Extensive knowledge of AWS services and architecture
2. Proficiency in AWS management and operations
3. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
4. Ability to provide guidance on best practices and optimization
5. Familiarity with natural language processing for resource management

title: Making data conversational: How an SMB unlocked AI insights
description: Radio Dimensione Suono, a leading Italian radio station, accumulated a vast trove of operational data over its nearly 50-year history, including scanned documents, manuals, and even radio signal coverage maps. However, it struggled to tap into this wealth of unstructured information scattered across sources. Learn how this fast-moving SMB leveraged AWS generative AI to break down silos and enable natural language queries of their diverse data formats. Discover how democratizing data through conversational AI can empower SMBs to optimize operations, enhance customer experience, and drive agile, informed decision-making – without advanced technical skills or meticulous documentation practices.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given scenario would be:

1. Diverse data formats (e.g., scanned documents, manuals, radio signal coverage maps)
2. Unstructured data scattered across multiple sources
3. Lack of advanced technical skills or meticulous documentation practices
4. Desire to democratize data and enable natural language queries
5. Need to optimize operations, enhance customer experience, and drive informed decision-making

title: Making dollars and sense out of FinOps
description: In today's cloud-centric landscape, understanding and controlling cloud costs is crucial. It’s important for leaders to understand how financial processes and strategies translate into clear and actionable insights in both the short and long term. FinOps, the practice of managing cloud costs, offers organizations a powerful methodology to optimize financial management and drive business value. In this session, representatives from the Enterprise Strategy team at AWS discuss key FinOps concepts and methodologies, as well as real-world examples of how organizations achieve cost savings while delivering business value. Receive practical guidance to implement FinOps.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing
2. Knowledge of financial management concepts
3. Familiarity with cost optimization strategies
4. Awareness of the FinOps framework and its principles
5. Interest in improving cloud cost management and driving business value

title: Making great products with generative AI
description: Generative AI is transforming how independent software vendors (ISVs) think about their businesses. In this session, see how a wide range of ISVs use generative AI technologies to improve their operations and enhance their products. Get a sense of where most ISVs are today on the adoption curve, explore the considerations of adopting generative AI in your business, and learn about AWS programs to support your generative AI journey.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of generative AI technologies
2. Familiarity with the software industry and the challenges faced by independent software vendors (ISVs)
3. Knowledge of AWS and its offerings related to generative AI

title: Making HPC and other R&D workloads accessible beyond the AWS console
description: Research and Engineering Studio on AWS (RES) lets IT teams deliver an easy-to-consume interface to R&D teams like scientists and engineers, without the fuss of knowing all the DevOps necessary. This is handy when trying to deliver graphical desktops in the cloud, but it’s a supercharge for their productivity when training models or running complex simulations on clusters is involved. Learn how RES works on the inside to make that experience great for your end users.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools
3. Experience in scientific computing or machine learning

title: Making your Amazon Aurora cluster more resilient [REPEAT]
description: Amazon Aurora is a cloud-native relational database with unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale. Hundreds of thousands of organizations trust Aurora for their workloads today. In this chalk talk, learn about features such as Aurora Global Database and Amazon RDS Proxy, and discover best practices to achieve high availability for your Aurora clusters. The talk includes a whiteboarding session on high availability and disaster recovery solutions to help you maximize your application’s resilience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of relational databases
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services
4. Experience with database administration and high availability strategies
5. Familiarity with disaster recovery planning

title: Making your Amazon Aurora cluster more resilient [REPEAT]
description: Amazon Aurora is a cloud-native relational database with unparalleled high performance and availability at global scale. Hundreds of thousands of organizations trust Aurora for their workloads today. In this chalk talk, learn about features such as Aurora Global Database and Amazon RDS Proxy, and discover best practices to achieve high availability for your Aurora clusters. The talk includes a whiteboarding session on high availability and disaster recovery solutions to help you maximize your application’s resilience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of relational databases
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services

title: Managing Amazon EC2 capacity and availability
description: Amazon EC2 offers a variety of capacity usage and reservation models, so you can choose the right combination for your workload and budget. These include capacity reservations, On-Demand Instances, Amazon EC2 Capacity Blocks for ML, and more. Join this session to learn how to combine these models in a way that’s best for your business. Leave with knowledge on how to manage your capacity to improve utilization and availability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon EC2 and its pricing models
2. Knowledge of workload requirements and budget constraints
3. Familiarity with capacity planning and resource optimization

title: Managing and optimizing EC2 on-demand capacity reservations at scale
description: Amazon EC2 On-Demand Capacity Reservations (ODCRs) provide you with capacity assurance for your critical workloads. To use ODCRs efficiently at scale, it is essential to proactively monitor and optimize your reservation usage. This chalk talk reviews how you can maximize the benefits of ODCRs, individually and across multiple AWS accounts, by adopting effective capacity management strategies. Learn how to select the right ODCR configurations, monitor capacity utilization, and employ capacity pooling strategies to efficiently manage your Capacity Reservations across your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Amazon EC2 and its pricing models.
2. Knowledge of AWS account management and cross-account collaboration.
3. Familiarity with capacity planning and resource optimization concepts.
4. Experience with AWS monitoring and analytics tools.
5. Awareness of AWS best practices for cost optimization and resource management.

title: Managing AWS Lambda runtimes at scale
description: Attend this chalk talk to learn how to safely manage AWS Lambda runtimes as your organization's serverless footprint grows. Explore strategies to make functions safe for automated patching, to implement runtime governance controls, and to identify and prioritize functions with deprecated runtimes. Through whiteboard examples and code samples, discover techniques like runtime reporting, version pinning, and dependency bundling. Leave equipped with practical skills for navigating runtime management issues to maximize application availability and reduce operational overhead.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS Lambda
2. Understanding of serverless architecture
3. Basic knowledge of software development and deployment

title: Managing compliance and costs to achieve visibility and optimization
description: Discover a simple method to jointly manage cloud compliance and costs. After a lift and shift migration that enabled the Swiss insurer to shut down its data center, Helvetia has started their journey in the cloud with a focus on modernization and optimization. But how do you optimize costs without impacting compliance? This lightning talk will demonstrate how to bring visibility to, prioritize, and balance FinOps and compliance initiatives.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud migration and lift-and-shift strategies
2. Knowledge of cloud compliance requirements and regulations
3. Familiarity with FinOps (Financial Operations) principles and cost optimization
4. Experience in balancing cost optimization and compliance in a cloud environment
5. Ability to demonstrate practical solutions for cloud visibility, prioritization, and optimization.

title: Managing cyber vulnerability in connected healthcare devices (sponsored by Claroty)
description: Digital transformation in healthcare has driven some of the most significant advancements in medical outcomes. However, the rapid increase in the number and variety of connected devices has outpaced the ability of healthcare environments to manage and secure them. This expansion has increased the attack surface of these critical ecosystems, making them more vulnerable to cybercrime. In this lightning talk, Corewell Health and Claroty discuss their approach to improving endpoint visibility and risk management across the Corewell Health system. Explore the challenges, considerations, and solutions that hospitals worldwide implement to mitigate emerging risks. This presentation is brought to you by Claroty, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this lightning talk would be:

1. Understanding of digital transformation in healthcare
2. Knowledge of the challenges posed by the increasing number and variety of connected devices in healthcare environments
3. Familiarity with cybersecurity risks and their impact on critical healthcare ecosystems
4. Awareness of the need for improved endpoint visibility and risk management in healthcare organizations
5. Interest in the solutions and approaches implemented by Corewell Health and Claroty to address these challenges

title: Managing infrastructure via APIs with AWS Controllers for Kubernetes
description: AWS Controllers for Kubernetes (ACK) is an open source project that lets you directly manage AWS services from Kubernetes APIs. This lightning talk first provides an overview of ACK’s capabilities for provisioning and operating cloud resources like databases, storage, and networking using familiar Kubernetes APIs and GitOps workflows. Then, hear how leading enterprises are building self-service platforms on ACK to empower developers to declaratively define and deploy AWS infrastructure alongside their containerized applications. Learn best practices for using ACK to boost developer productivity while ensuring production readiness of your cloud infrastructure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Kubernetes knowledge
2. AWS services understanding
3. Familiarity with GitOps workflows
4. Experience with cloud infrastructure management
5. Interest in developer productivity and production readiness

title: Managing state in serverless applications [REPEAT]
description: Learn effective state management strategies for serverless computing with AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate in this chalk talk. Understand the challenges of traditional state management approaches when applied to ephemeral, event-driven serverless applications—and their impact on design and scalability. Discover how to use managed AWS services like Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EFS to handle stateful data in serverless environments. Gain best practices and design patterns for managing state seamlessly in your serverless applications. Leave equipped with practical techniques for overcoming state management hurdles in serverless architectures.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this chalk talk would be:

1. Familiarity with AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate.
2. Understanding of serverless computing concepts and challenges.
3. Basic knowledge of state management in traditional application architectures.
4. Familiarity with AWS managed services like Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EFS.
5. Interest in learning best practices and design patterns for state management in serverless applications.

title: Managing state in serverless applications [REPEAT]
description: Learn effective state management strategies for serverless computing with AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate in this chalk talk. Understand the challenges of traditional state management approaches when applied to ephemeral, event-driven serverless applications—and their impact on design and scalability. Discover how to use managed AWS services like Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EFS to handle stateful data in serverless environments. Gain best practices and design patterns for managing state seamlessly in your serverless applications. Leave equipped with practical techniques for overcoming state management hurdles in serverless architectures.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS Lambda and Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate
2. Understanding of serverless computing and event-driven architectures
3. Basic knowledge of state management concepts
4. Familiarity with AWS services like Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EFS

title: Managing value-chain product carbon emissions data with generative AI
description: Manufacturers face increasing demand from customers and public authorities to accurately model, calculate, and report on their product-based carbon emissions. A credible assessment requires internal data management capabilities and the efficient exchange of high-trust information with suppliers. For larger manufacturers this may involve scaling to thousands of suppliers and/or products. Learn how connectivity, trust, and information exchange come together in the value chain, and about the mechanisms behind the modeling and calculation of product-based carbon emissions — and how it all can be accelerated using generative AI services on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of supply chain management and data exchange within the value chain.
2. Knowledge of carbon emissions modeling and calculation methodologies.
3. Familiarity with cloud-based technologies and generative AI services.
4. Experience in managing large-scale supplier and product data.
5. Commitment to sustainability and environmental reporting.

title: Mapbox's in-vehicle AI assistant: Customized models for safer driving
description: Getting assistance while driving is difficult. Drivers should keep their eyes on the road and not be distracted by phones or UIs. To address this challenge, Mapbox is developing an in-vehicle AI assistant offering real-time, intelligent conversational support to drivers. Working with model customization specialists from the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center and using fine-tuning features in Amazon Bedrock, Mapbox is customizing Amazon Titan Text Premier to enable multilingual interactions, seamless device transitions, and access to live data sources. Hear from Mapbox about its journey, lessons learned, and its approaches to customize foundation models using its private training data.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given scenario would be:

1. Knowledge of in-vehicle AI assistants
2. Familiarity with model customization techniques
3. Understanding of fine-tuning features in Amazon Bedrock
4. Experience in working with foundation models and customizing them
5. Expertise in multilingual interactions and seamless device transitions

title: Master AWS costs with Amazon Q Developer
description: This dev chat compares manual cost optimization techniques with the new Amazon Q Developer capability for managing AWS Cloud infrastructure costs. See a real-world case study where human experts perform a cost-optimization process and contrast the results with Amazon Q Developer’s suggestions for the same network. Learn how this AI-powered tool provides real-time, natural language answers to AWS cost-related questions, potentially revolutionizing cloud cost management. Gain insights into maximizing cloud value and leveraging AI for more efficient and cost-effective AWS infrastructure management.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Cloud infrastructure
2. Knowledge of cloud cost management strategies
3. Familiarity with AWS cost optimization techniques

title: Mastering automated, zero-downtime deployments [REPEAT]
description: Unlock the power of seamless, risk-free deployments with this insightful chalk talk. Discover how to leverage AWS services like AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS AppConfig to automate safe, hands-off deployments to Amazon EC2, Amazon ECS, and AWS Lambda across multiple accounts and Regions at scale. Explore zero-downtime deployment strategies and learn best practices for reducing risk when deploying to AWS. Whether you’re a seasoned DevOps professional or just starting your cloud journey, this talk equips you with the tools and techniques to streamline your deployment processes, ensuring reliability and minimizing disruptions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
2. Experience in software development and deployment processes
3. Understanding of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) principles
4. Familiarity with AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS AppConfig
5. Knowledge of deployment strategies and best practices for AWS environments

title: Mastering automated, zero-downtime deployments [REPEAT]
description: Unlock the power of seamless, risk-free deployments with this insightful chalk talk. Discover how to leverage AWS services like AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS AppConfig to automate safe, hands-off deployments to Amazon EC2, Amazon ECS, and AWS Lambda across multiple accounts and Regions at scale. Explore zero-downtime deployment strategies and learn best practices for reducing risk when deploying to AWS. Whether you’re a seasoned DevOps professional or just starting your cloud journey, this talk equips you with the tools and techniques to streamline your deployment processes, ensuring reliability and minimizing disruptions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
2. Understanding of software deployment processes
3. Basic knowledge of DevOps practices

title: Mastering data and AI governance with Databricks Unity Catalog (sponsored by Databricks)
description: In today's rapidly evolving AI landscape, fragmented data and AI governance can be a major roadblock to innovation and compliance. Join this demo-filled session to discover how to unify your data and AI governance with Databricks Unity Catalog by creating an enterprise catalog for structured and unstructured data, files, ML models, and AI tools while automatically tracking column-level lineage for both data and ML models. Also learn how Databricks Unity Catalog helps you monitor data and ML pipeline quality, access data from any compute engine or tool of your choice with open APIs, and share data and ML models across clouds, regions, and platforms with open source Delta Sharing. This presentation is brought to you by Databricks, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data governance and AI governance
2. Knowledge of data and machine learning model management
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and data storage technologies
4. Awareness of data and AI tools integration
5. Interest in enterprise-level data and AI solutions

title: Mastering resilience at every layer of the cake
description: Most workloads on AWS resemble a finely crafted cake, with delight at every layer. In this session, master resilience at each layer of deliciousness: from platform to infrastructure and applications, using services like AWS Resilience Hub, AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS), Amazon Route53 ARC, Amazon Elastic Disaster Recovery (DRS), AWS Backup, and more. Leave with a mental model for how resilience works throughout these layers, with ready-to-use reference architectures and prescriptive guidance. This session keeps things fun and lively along the way, with lots of demos!
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts
2. Understanding of application architecture and resilience
3. Experience with infrastructure management and automation

title: Maximize application performance with Valkey [REPEAT]
description: Using Valkey with your application tends to give quick performance wins using only a few strategically placed GETs and SETs. However, understanding all of Valkey’s data types and commands unlocks even more use cases and performance boosts. This builders’ session gives you an overview of the entire Valkey landscape of data types and their related commands, linking them to real-world use cases with hands-on exercises. Previous Valkey or Redis experience is helpful, but this session starts at the basics and moves quickly to touch on more advanced topics. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data structures and databases
2. Familiarity with Redis or similar in-memory data stores
3. Ability to write and execute basic code on your laptop

title: Maximize application performance with Valkey [REPEAT]
description: Using Valkey with your application tends to give quick performance wins using only a few strategically placed GETs and SETs. However, understanding all of Valkey’s data types and commands unlocks even more use cases and performance boosts. This builders’ session gives you an overview of the entire Valkey landscape of data types and their related commands, linking them to real-world use cases with hands-on exercises. Previous Valkey or Redis experience is helpful, but this session starts at the basics and moves quickly to touch on more advanced topics. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data structures and databases
2. Familiarity with programming concepts and syntax
3. Willingness to participate in hands-on exercises

title: Maximize business impact with Amazon Q Apps: The Volkswagen AI journey
description: Discover how Volkswagen harnesses generative AI for optimized job matching and career growth with Amazon Q. Learn from the AWS Product Management team about the benefits of Amazon Q Business and the latest innovations in Amazon Q Apps. Then, explore how Volkswagen used these tools to streamline a job role mapping project, saving thousands of hours. Mario Duarte, Senior Director at Volkswagen Group of America, details the journey toward their first Q App that helps Volkswagen’s Human Resources build a learning ecosystem that boosts employee development. Leave the session inspired to bring Q Apps to supercharge your teams’ productivity engines.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of generative AI
2. Familiarity with Amazon Q Business and Amazon Q Apps
3. Interest in job role mapping and employee development
4. Desire to learn about Volkswagen's use case and implementation

title: Maximize competitiveness of financial service apps with the cloud (sponsored by Intel)
description: The financial services industry faces significant challenges, primarily due to legacy technical debt and a prevailing reluctance to modernize. Critical systems are at risk of becoming obsolete unless hardware and software is assessed and transformed. DXC Luxoft with Intel and AWS have created a common enablement services platform, Luxoft Beyond, to accelerate and streamline the modernization of legacy applications into the cloud with the best cost performance. This session discusses DXC Luxoft’s transition of their own EarlyResolution platform onto custom Intel-powered Amazon EC2 instances and highlights the benefits you can realize for your organization. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of the financial services industry and its challenges
2. Understanding of legacy technical debt and the need for modernization
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and cloud migration strategies
4. Awareness of DXC Luxoft, Intel, and AWS as key players in the industry
5. Interest in accelerating the modernization of legacy applications

title: Maximize cost efficiency with a shift-left approach to FinOps (sponsored by IBM Cloudability)
description: With cloud spend increasing to new heights and with an uncertain economic climate, it’s never been more important to be efficient with cloud usage and engineering time. In this session, explore strategies focused on getting actionable data in front of engineers as early as possible, ideally preventing efficiency issues taking root in the first place. Discover how AWS customers get results by automating optimization actions and integrating proactive cost insights into developer workflows. Learn how these efforts can lead organizations not only to exceptional cost efficiency, but also free up engineers for other tasks. This presentation is brought to you by IBM Cloudability, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud infrastructure
2. Familiarity with cloud cost optimization and efficiency
3. Knowledge of AWS services and tools
4. Experience with developer workflows and integration
5. Interest in automating optimization actions and proactive cost insights

title: Maximize customer engagement and ROI with retail media networks
description: This chalk talk dives deep into the world of retail media networks, exploring how retailers can leverage these powerful channels to drive results. Participants gain a comprehensive understanding of how to architect a retail media network using AWS services for activation, intelligence orchestration, analytics and data collaboration, storage processing integration, and collection ingestion. Leave with actionable strategies to enhance customer engagement and drive measurable ROI.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of digital marketing and e-commerce
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Experience in data analytics and business intelligence

title: Maximize data value: Amazon S3 & AWS file storage for modern workloads
description: In today’s data-driven world, businesses grapple with massive data volumes, diverse workloads, and the need to extract maximum value from their data. This session showcases how Amazon S3 and AWS file storage offerings can be used to address these challenges. Discover how to harness object and file storage to power AI/ML, HPC, content management, and cloud-native applications. Learn strategies for seamless data movement, high-performance storage, and cost optimization. Explore key features and real-world use cases that will help you optimize your cloud storage and drive innovation across your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud storage concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of data management and processing requirements

title: Maximize efficiency and reduce costs with Amazon OpenSearch Service
description: Optimize your Amazon OpenSearch Service deployments for enhanced user experience and cost efficiency. This session covers key cost drivers, including operational management, licensing, networking, and data distribution. Learn to choose the best storage options, such as hot, UltraWarm, and cold storage and integration with Amazon S3. Discover how to optimize infrastructure with AWS Graviton processors or OpenSearch Service OR1 instances. Also, explore On-Demand pricing, Reserved Instance savings, and how Amazon OpenSearch Serverless with automatic scaling can ensure you pay only for the resources you use.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Amazon OpenSearch Service
2. Knowledge of AWS cost optimization strategies
3. Familiarity with AWS storage options and data distribution
4. Experience with AWS Graviton processors or OpenSearch Service instances
5. Understanding of AWS pricing models and serverless computing

title: Maximize gen AI application uptime, reliability, and cost efficiency (sponsored by New Relic)
description: As AI adoption surges, so do the challenges—performance bottlenecks, reliability issues, and cost overruns. In this lightning talk, New Relic showcases a real-world generative AI application and demonstrates how AI monitoring provides unparalleled visibility across your entire AI stack. Learn how to proactively monitor AI performance, gain insights into model usage and behavior, trace AI responses to root cause errors, optimize model selection for optimal performance and cost efficiency, and ensure data security and compliance. Wherever you are in your AI journey, this lightning talk equips you with the tools and knowledge needed to succeed in the evolving AI landscape. This presentation is brought to you by New Relic, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AI and its adoption in real-world applications
2. Familiarity with performance, reliability, and cost challenges in AI deployment
3. Interest in learning about AI monitoring and visibility tools
4. Desire to optimize AI model selection and performance
5. Concern for data security and compliance in AI systems

title: Maximize mission impact with no-code ML & generative AI solutions
description: Join this hands-on builders’ session, tailored for nonprofits, to explore no-code machine learning (ML) and generative AI. Ideal for analysts and business leaders, the session covers practical AI solutions for nonprofit needs like donor engagement and program impact measurement. Learn to use Retrieval Augmented Generation for document Q&A and to build chatbots to improve service delivery. Integrate predictive analytics into workflows for financial health monitoring and behavior prediction to anticipate donor trends or program outcomes. Finally, use Amazon SageMaker automated ML to effortlessly build and deploy models that transform data-driven decision-making. Discover how these AI tools can revolutionize your organization’s data-driven strategies. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with data analysis and business intelligence
2. Interest in exploring AI and machine learning solutions
3. Basic computer skills and ability to use a laptop
4. Desire to improve data-driven decision-making in a nonprofit organization

title: Maximize the efficiency of your AWS Marketplace sales operations
description: In this session, AWS Partners can learn how to leverage new customer insights to inform sales plays, prioritize high-potential customer engagements, and shorten time to revenue. Learn about the latest coselling features available to AWS Partners that enable better collaboration on deals and lead to better customer experiences. Don’t miss this opportunity to make the most of new data points and opportunities to streamline your sales operations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Partner program
2. Basic knowledge of customer insights and data analysis
3. Familiarity with sales and lead generation strategies
4. Interest in improving sales operations and collaboration with AWS

title: Maximize the potential of your AWS Marketplace listings
description: Every year, millions of unique visitors come to AWS Marketplace searching for products, but not all of them end up converting to sales. Learn about best practices that sellers can perform to optimize their AWS Marketplace product listings. In this session, we will share what strategies and content are needed for buyers to more easily discover and evaluate your products, helping you drive higher conversion rates. Learn about AWS Marketplace features that you can utilize to help accelerate customer time-to-value, including standard contracts, vendor insights, free trials, and more.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Marketplace
2. Knowledge of product listing optimization strategies
3. Familiarity with AWS Marketplace features

title: Maximize the value of cold data with Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes
description: The majority of the world’s data is cold, but with advanced analytics and increased demand for machine learning, it could be put to work at any time. In this session, learn how to use Amazon S3 Glacier storage classes to modernize your data archive and store long-term data without worrying about expensive tape drives or off-premises archival data. Discover options for ingesting and restoring your data at petabyte scale while taking into consideration cost and retrieval performance.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data storage and archiving concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and S3 Glacier
3. Experience with data ingestion and retrieval processes
4. Knowledge of machine learning and data analytics techniques
5. Awareness of cost optimization strategies for long-term data storage

title: Maximize your data performance with Amazon EMR on EKS
description: In this chalk talk, explore the benefits of leveraging the managed experience provided by Amazon EKS to scale, operate, and manage Apache Spark workloads running on Kubernetes. Learn how to launch Spark workloads using our Amazon optimized Spark engine, provision and manage EKS clusters, and ensure efficient resource utilization and cost optimization across a range of data processing and machine learning tasks. You will also learn about best practices on co-locating multiple EMR workloads and centralizing resource management to further maximize your Amazon EMR on EKS experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
2. Experience with Apache Spark
3. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
4. Knowledge of data processing and machine learning tasks

title: Maximizing AWS: Strategies for sustainable business growth in the cloud (sponsored by Classmethod)
description: In this session, explore how Classmethod, with experience supporting 4,000 customers, helps businesses maximize the benefits of AWS. Discover practical strategies for sustainable growth through deep AWS expertise, addressing technical challenges and fostering cloud-native approaches. Learn how Classmethod’s proven methods empower companies to effectively utilize AWS, enhance competitiveness, and achieve business goals. Gain insights into best practices and real-world examples that demonstrate how to use AWS as a powerful tool for driving business success. This presentation is brought to you by Classmethod, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS (Amazon Web Services)
2. Interest in cloud computing and cloud-native approaches
3. Desire to learn about practical strategies for sustainable business growth

title: Maximizing data potential: A journey to data-driven success (sponsored by Capgemini)
description: Modernizing and transforming the data ecosystem can significantly enhance a company’s operational efficiency and market agility. Join this session to learn how Cox Communications is transforming its vast data into a powerful asset, enabling insights into customer behavior, network performance, and operational metrics to make faster, smarter decisions. This empowers Cox to personalize customer experiences, optimize network operations, drive revenue growth, and reduce costs. The fundamental capabilities of the data ecosystem provide governed and trusted data on an open architecture that is scalable and secure. This transformation is fueling a culture of innovation, driving real, measurable business impact. This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management and data ecosystem concepts
2. Knowledge of customer behavior analysis and network performance optimization
3. Familiarity with data governance, data architecture, and data security
4. Awareness of the role of cloud technologies in data transformation
5. Interest in driving business impact through data-driven innovation

title: Maximizing performance for high-intensity workloads using Amazon EBS
description: Amazon EBS handles over 140 trillion I/O operations daily. Performance matters, but it’s not just about average performance. It’s also about stable, ultra-low latency that minimizes outliers or tail latency. io2 Block Express volumes are designed with consistent sub-millisecond latency and 99.999% durability for critical applications, such as SAP HANA, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, and more. Learn how performance characteristics optimize compute utilization, leading to cost efficiency and the success of many demanding use cases. Explore how the support for Multi-Attach NVMe reservations, Amazon EC2 Nitro system-based instances, and Amazon RDS drives new innovations and architecture enhancements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS)
2. Knowledge of I/O operations and their importance in data-intensive applications
3. Familiarity with critical applications such as SAP HANA, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, etc.
4. Understanding of performance characteristics and their impact on compute utilization and cost efficiency
5. Knowledge of Amazon EC2 Nitro system-based instances and Amazon RDS

title: Maximizing secrets management
description: This code talk discusses how to manage secrets at scale using AWS Secrets Manager. Learn how to enable your developer teams with cross-Region replication, cross-account IAM permissions and policies, access controls, secret rotations, and integration with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The talk also covers how to take advantage of recent AWS Secrets Manager features and innovations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS services and concepts
2. Knowledge of IAM (Identity and Access Management)
3. Familiarity with AWS Key Management Service (KMS)
4. Experience with secret management and security best practices
5. Understanding of cross-Region and cross-account operations

title: Measure and improve cloud ROI with generative AI
description: The cloud promises lower costs, greater innovation, higher resiliency, and other benefits for customers who make the investment to adopt cloud. But how can a customer measure the ROI of their cloud investment? This session will guide customers on how to use the Cloud Value Framework (CVF) to measure the ROI of their cloud investment. It will start with an overview of the CVF, lead into an example Balanced Scorecard with CVF-aligned KPIs, and then end with a whiteboard session on using generative AI and relevant services to improves costs, agility, productivity, resilience, and sustainability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and its benefits.
2. Familiarity with the concept of return on investment (ROI).
3. Interest in measuring the impact of cloud adoption on an organization.

title: Measure your operational excellence with service level objectives [REPEAT]
description: Designing highly available and resilient applications is often an incremental journey. You want to ensure you are delivering the experience your customers are expecting. Collecting the right data helps you identify positive impacts and where improvements are necessary. Data about your systems’ and applications’ health, performance, and end user experience are key. In this chalk talk, learn to define the right service level objectives (SLOs) tied to business outcomes and how to collect the relevant metrics to determine application health. Explore patterns and tips for setting up effective SLOs using Amazon CloudWatch that can help you set up an effective observability platform.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and services.
2. Familiarity with application architecture and design principles.
3. Knowledge of performance monitoring and observability tools.
4. Familiarity with Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and their importance in application design.
5. Exposure to Amazon CloudWatch and its capabilities.

title: Measure your operational excellence with service level objectives [REPEAT]
description: Designing highly available and resilient applications is often an incremental journey. You want to ensure you are delivering the experience your customers are expecting. Collecting the right data helps you identify positive impacts and where improvements are necessary. Data about your systems’ and applications’ health, performance, and end user experience are key. In this chalk talk, learn to define the right service level objectives (SLOs) tied to business outcomes and how to collect the relevant metrics to determine application health. Explore patterns and tips for setting up effective SLOs using Amazon CloudWatch that can help you set up an effective observability platform.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and services.
2. Familiarity with application design and development principles.
3. Knowledge of performance monitoring and observability tools.
4. Basic understanding of service level agreements (SLAs) and service level objectives (SLOs).
5. Experience with Amazon CloudWatch or similar monitoring services.

title: Meeting customers where they are with a global SaaS analytics platform (sponsored by Deloitte)
description: SAS Institute, a leader in advanced analytics and business intelligence, is partnering with Deloitte to develop their platform on AWS and AWS Marketplace. In this session, discover how they are building their architecture with high availability, resiliency, and security. Learn how they set up automations using Terraform and Ansible and incorporated best practices from the AWS Well-Architected Framework, leveraging Amazon EKS, AWS WAF, AWS Security Hub, AWS Cloud WAN, AWS IAM Identity Center, and others while adhering to NIST SP 800-53. Learn about architecting reliable environments, operational efficiency, compliance, and multicloud deployments of containerized solutions and how Deloitte, SAS, and AWS are transforming SaaS delivery. This presentation is brought to you by Deloitte, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services
2. Knowledge of containerization and Kubernetes
3. Familiarity with infrastructure as code tools like Terraform and Ansible
4. Awareness of security and compliance standards like NIST SP 800-53
5. Experience in SaaS delivery and multicloud deployments

title: Meeting your business goals with AWS cryptographic services
description: Solving business problems related to regulatory compliance requirements, digital identity, and software integrity all rely on cryptographic primitives such as digital signatures or encryption. In this chalk talk, uncover how these primitives are used to build digital passports, enable business-to-business ownership of data, and protect automotive telemetry data utilizing AWS services
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cryptographic principles and concepts.
2. Knowledge of digital signatures and encryption.
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their applications.
4. Background in regulatory compliance and data management.
5. Experience in software development and integration.

title: Merck advances healthcare data extraction using text-to-SQL on AWS
description: Merck, a leading pharmaceutical company, constantly seeks new ways to speed its R&D. Its data and analytics team faced significant challenges extracting insights from its massive healthcare databases and found that writing complex SQL queries was time-consuming and error-prone. To address this, Merck collaborated with the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center to implement a generative AI text-to-SQL solution using Anthropic's Claude models on Amazon Bedrock. This innovation enables analysts to generate SQL queries from natural language with over 95% accuracy. Data workflows are now significantly streamlined, allowing Merck's scientists to make faster, more confident decisions and easily scale to incorporate additional databases.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Massive healthcare databases
2. Challenges in extracting insights from the databases
3. Time-consuming and error-prone SQL queries
4. Collaboration with AWS Generative AI Innovation Center
5. Implementation of a generative AI text-to-SQL solution using Anthropic's Claude models on Amazon Bedrock

title: Microservices, API, cloud-native, and headless swappable architectures
description: In this session, learn about adopting Microservices, API-first, Cloud-native SaaS, and Headless (MACH) architectures. By embracing MACH architectures, organizations can transform their business to be more resilient, scalable, and able to achieve their desired business outcomes. MACH solutions support a swappable enterprise tech stack in which every component is pluggable, scalable, replaceable, and continuously improved through agile development to meet evolving business requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of software architecture principles
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and cloud-native technologies
3. Knowledge of modern software development practices (e.g., agile, DevOps)
4. Exposure to microservices and API-based architectures
5. Awareness of headless and SaaS-based solutions

title: Migrate and modernize a Microsoft-based banking solution with AWS
description: To enhance customer service, risk management, and back-office optimization, 81% of global banks plan to adopt AI/ML by 2026. To adopt these new technologies, many banks need to address a significant challenge: getting their data out of siloed legacy platforms into the cloud. In this session, learn about recommended migration, optimization, and modernization activities to move an on-premises Microsoft-based application stack to AWS. Learn how to evaluate your technical and licensing options to run your Windows Server, SQL Server, .NET, and Active Directory workloads on AWS. Become equipped to help your organization drive better business outcomes with data-driven decision-making.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would include:

1. Understanding of legacy on-premises Microsoft-based application stacks.
2. Knowledge of cloud migration strategies and best practices.
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities for hosting Windows Server, SQL Server, .NET, and Active Directory workloads.
4. Awareness of technical and licensing considerations for running Microsoft-based workloads on AWS.
5. Interest in leveraging data-driven decision-making to drive better business outcomes.

title: Migrate and modernize mission-critical SAP landscapes on AWS
description: Explore proven approaches to accelerate your move to cloud-based enterprise-resource planning (ERP). In this chalk talk, learn oft-overlooked architectural practices that can help you maximize the performance, reliability, and extensibility of your SAP environment, including RISE with SAP. Learn best practices for networking, high availability, disaster recovery, immutable backups, connecting to adjacent SAP systems, and innovating with SAP Business Transformation Platform (BTP) and 200+ AWS offerings. Discover how AWS can run any SAP workload in this interactive session.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of enterprise-resource planning (ERP) systems
2. Familiarity with SAP and its ecosystem
3. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud-based architectures
4. Experience with networking, high availability, and disaster recovery concepts
5. Familiarity with AWS services and offerings

title: Migrate and modernize your containerized workloads with AWS Fargate
description: AWS Fargate helps customers reduce the operational burden of deploying and monitoring their container workloads so they can focus on building applications and running their businesses. In this chalk talk, learn about design considerations for migrating workloads from Amazon EC2 to AWS Fargate serverless compute running on Amazon ECS.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk on AWS Fargate would be:

1. Basic understanding of containerization and Docker.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS).
3. Knowledge of Amazon EC2 and its deployment models.
4. Familiarity with serverless computing concepts.
5. Understanding of the benefits and trade-offs of migrating from EC2 to serverless compute.

title: Migrate and modernize your web application with AWS Elastic Beanstalk
description: Moving classic web applications to the cloud can be a complex task for customers. In this chalk talk, operators and developers can learn the benefits of using AWS Elastic Beanstalk to upload and deploy web applications in a simplified, fast way and integrate with your existing CI/CD. Remove the undifferentiated work of provisioning and maintaining infrastructure. The talk will review how adjustable settings can help scale your application for handling peaks in traffic, while minimizing costs. See how the migration process can be the start of a modernization journey to serverless and containers starting with Elastic Beanstalk.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of web application development
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Basic knowledge of AWS services

title: Migrate any VMware workload from anywhere to improve your TCO
description: Challenged with complex VMware environments driving up costs and increasing management overhead? In this session, discover strategies to improve manageability and reduce total cost of ownership by migrating VMware workloads. Join the conversation and learn how to migrate to Amazon EC2 for compute with Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP serving block storage over iSCSI. Get guided through the architecture before and after migration, offering a step-by-step approach to executing a seamless lift-and-shift – no matter where your workloads reside. Leave with actionable insights into how this migration delivers enterprise-grade performance, cost efficiency, and simplified operations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Familiarity with VMware environments
2. Understanding of cost and management challenges in complex VMware environments
3. Interest in migrating VMware workloads to cloud platforms
4. Basic knowledge of Amazon EC2 and Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP
5. Desire to learn a step-by-step approach to executing a lift-and-shift migration.

title: Migrate to an open source database on AWS using .NET and PostgreSQL
