description: Many .NET applications use SQL Server as a backend database. However, moving to an open source database can reduce your costs and unlock new capabilities in your applications. In this workshop, learn how to move a .NET application database from SQL Server to open source using Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL and AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS). Leave this workshop with an understanding of what refactoring is needed in both the code and database and how to overcome common challenges with repeatable and scalable techniques and solutions. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of .NET development
2. Familiarity with SQL Server and database concepts
3. Access to a laptop for hands-on activities

title: Migrate to QuickSight: Reduce costs and increase productivity
description: In this session, discover best practices for migrating from legacy business intelligence (BI) to Amazon QuickSight. Learn how transitioning to the AWS cloud-based BI service can help you reduce costs, increase productivity, and improve performance. Planning migrations involves more than validating technology. You need a sound plan around what processes, governance strategies, and assets will be converted like-for-like versus refreshed or consolidated. We’ll cover proven strategies for structuring your migration process to QuickSight.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of business intelligence (BI) concepts.
2. Familiarity with legacy BI tools and technologies.
3. Knowledge of the AWS cloud platform and its services.
4. Experience in data management and governance.
5. Project management skills for migration planning and execution.

title: Migrate while optimizing cost, performance, and energy use with AMD (sponsored by AMD)
description: Migration without cost and performance optimization can lead to increased costs that are unnecessary. Join AMD to see how choosing EPYC CPU–powered instances helps you simultaneously optimize cost, performance, and energy consumption. Also explore the robust ecosystem of tools and partners to help assess your applications for optimization as well as migrate your infrastructure to help you stop unnecessary spend. This presentation is brought to you by AMD, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and migration
2. Familiarity with cost optimization and performance optimization
3. Knowledge of CPU architectures and their impact on application performance
4. Awareness of the AWS ecosystem and partner network

title: Migrating an energy trading application to AWS [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, hear how an international energy company migrated its business-critical energy trading and risk management system, Openlink Endur, to AWS. This talk dives into the technical and strategic aspects of this migration, showcasing how the organization used AWS services to enhance performance, scalability, and resilience. Learn about the challenges faced, the innovative solutions implemented, and the tangible business benefits realized, including faster feature delivery, improved developer experience through enabling rapid provisioning of dedicated environments, and increased global availability. Come discover how this migration to AWS has positioned the company for long-term success in the dynamic energy market.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Knowledge of energy trading and risk management systems
3. Experience in system migration and cloud adoption
4. Familiarity with Openlink Endur or similar trading platforms
5. Interest in enhancing performance, scalability, and resilience of critical business systems

title: Migrating an energy trading application to AWS [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, hear how an international energy company migrated its business-critical energy trading and risk management system, Openlink Endur, to AWS. This talk dives into the technical and strategic aspects of this migration, showcasing how the organization used AWS services to enhance performance, scalability, and resilience. Learn about the challenges faced, the innovative solutions implemented, and the tangible business benefits realized, including faster feature delivery, improved developer experience through enabling rapid provisioning of dedicated environments, and increased global availability. Come discover how this migration to AWS has positioned the company for long-term success in the dynamic energy market.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Openlink Endur, an energy trading and risk management system
2. Understanding of cloud migration strategies and AWS services
3. Experience in overcoming technical challenges and implementing innovative solutions
4. Familiarity with the energy market and its dynamic nature
5. Interest in learning about the business benefits of cloud migration

title: Migrating applications to AWS Graviton on Amazon EKS
description: AWS Graviton processors are designed to deliver the best price performance for your cloud workloads running on Amazon EC2. During this hands-on workshop, walk through the steps for migrating a workload running on x86 to AWS Graviton-based instances including performing tests locally and modifying the CI/CD pipeline to build and deploy the application in Amazon EKS using Karpenter. Learn how you can deploy applications in an efficient way by mixing AWS Graviton-based instances and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Amazon EC2 and Amazon EKS.
2. Familiarity with containerization and Docker.
3. Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
4. Basic knowledge of AWS services and concepts.
5. Laptop for hands-on activities.

title: Migrating from self-managed Apache Kafka to Amazon MSK
description: Migrating between Apache Kafka clusters while ensuring minimal downtime can be challenging when replicating large amounts of data. This workshop demonstrates a proven method for building a resilient migration pipeline to move data from an Apache Kafka cluster to Amazon MSK. Gain hands-on experience with practical strategies and code examples to simplify real-world replication and migration use cases. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Apache Kafka
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon MSK
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python, Java)
4. Ability to set up and configure development environments on your laptop

title: Migrating from self-managed InfluxDB to Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB
description: In this chalk talk, demystify the process of migrating your self-managed InfluxDB open source database deployment to Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB. Whether you're currently running InfluxDB versions 1.X or 2.X, discover the various options and steps to make the transition seamless. From upgrade strategies to migration best practices, this session covers it all. In addition, experience a real-world example of migrating a live workload to Timestream.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with InfluxDB
2. Understanding of self-managed database deployments
3. Knowledge of Amazon Timestream
4. Awareness of InfluxDB version 1.X and 2.X
5. Experience with database migration processes

title: Migrating regulated workloads on to AWS at scale [REPEAT]
description: In this session, you'll learn how customers are building regulated landing zones and using AWS services like AWS Config, AWS Security Hub, and Landing Zone Accelerator on AWS to migrate life science workloads at-scale while ensuring data integrity and taking modern approaches to regulatory controls like GxP.
prerequisites:
Potential prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS cloud services and architecture
2. Familiarity with regulatory compliance frameworks (e.g., GxP)
3. Experience with data migration and workload management
4. Knowledge of AWS Config, AWS Security Hub, and Landing Zone Accelerator

title: Migrating regulated workloads on to AWS at scale [REPEAT]
description: In this session, you'll learn how customers are building regulated landing zones and using AWS services like AWS Config, AWS Security Hub, and Landing Zone Accelerator on AWS to migrate life science workloads at-scale while ensuring data integrity and taking modern approaches to regulatory controls like GxP.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS services and their use cases
2. Knowledge of regulatory requirements in the life sciences industry
3. Familiarity with cloud migration strategies and best practices
4. Exposure to AWS Config, AWS Security Hub, and Landing Zone Accelerator

title: Migrating to Amazon Bedrock and accelerating gen AI app development
description: Hear from two AWS customers as they discuss their journey migrating to Amazon Bedrock and finding success in developing generative AI applications on AWS. Leaders from Forcura, a healthcare workflow management company headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, share how they facilitate continuity of care and improve business performance for providers using automated workflows, collaboration, and analytics SaaS solutions. Additionally, leaders from Cencosud S.A., the largest retail company in Chile and second-largest in LATAM, discuss how they created an assistant to support their grocery customers' digital shopping journeys.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon Bedrock
2. Knowledge of generative AI applications on AWS
3. Familiarity with the healthcare industry and workflow management
4. Understanding of the retail industry and digital shopping experiences
5. Knowledge of SaaS solutions and their implementation

title: Migrating your microservices to a Zero Trust architecture
description: In this workshop, get hands-on with AWS developer tools as you migrate your frontend and backend microservices to a Zero Trust architecture. Explore existing patterns for connectivity and the functionality and services in the console. Learn how to augment your connectivity strategy using newer AWS services that improve visibility and security between the users of your application and the microservices that power it—all while simplifying and standardizing your connectivity approach. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of microservices architecture.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS Management Console.
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., JavaScript, Python, Java).
4. Experience with containerization and container orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
5. Familiarity with network and security concepts.

title: Migration and modernization strategies to grow your business
description: Business leaders now require more than just the cost savings realized from cloud migrations; they are creating strategies that are dependent on modernized, innovative solutions. Hear how Fullsteam CTO Sajan Sankaran developed a strategy that delivered both pragmatic migrations and a modernized platform to unlock the company's next wave of growth.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its benefits
2. Knowledge of business strategies and growth initiatives
3. Experience in developing and implementing modernized, innovative solutions
4. Familiarity with the challenges and opportunities associated with cloud migrations
5. Ability to balance pragmatic migrations with a modernized platform approach

title: Migration and modernization with Amazon CloudFront
description: Migrating to AWS provides significant opportunities to improve the security, performance, and availability of your web applications. While moving applications from data centers can be a lengthy process, one of the fastest ways to realize value from the cloud is by leveraging AWS's global network to deliver these applications. In this session, we dive into strategies for migrating and modernizing web applications with services like Amazon CloudFront, Amazon Route 53, and AWS Global Accelerator. Also learn about Booking.com’s journey in moving 100% of their web traffic to Amazon CloudFront, deprecating multiple data centers in the process.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with web application architecture and deployment
2. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and services
3. Knowledge of AWS services like Amazon CloudFront, Amazon Route 53, and AWS Global Accelerator
4. Exposure to Booking.com's cloud migration experience

title: Migration strategies for your VMware workloads
description: While most VMware workloads can be easily migrated to the cloud, some need to stay on premises due to application interdependencies, data residency requirements, or timeline constraints. Join this session to learn how AWS hybrid and edge services like AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones allow you to migrate in place and modernize at your own pace. Dive deep on various migration pathways with Outposts and the migration tools and programs that you can use to simplify and accelerate transition to the cloud.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of VMware workloads and their migration challenges.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
3. Knowledge of application interdependencies, data residency requirements, and timeline constraints.
4. Awareness of AWS hybrid and edge services, such as AWS Outposts and AWS Local Zones.
5. Interest in learning about migration pathways and tools to simplify and accelerate the transition to the cloud.

title: Mindfulness made easy – Smart sand art [REPEAT]
description: A metal sphere carves mesmerizing sand patterns, creating mindful moments. Discover an integration of tech and AI with a Raspberry Pi app managed by AWS IoT Greengrass. A gen AI frontend uses Amazon Bedrock for visuals based on user input and captures real-time patterns. This experience highlights Amazon's mindfulness focus and end-to-end security and demonstrates secure cloud-based gen AI app building.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Raspberry Pi and IoT development
2. Understanding of AWS IoT Greengrass and its capabilities
3. Experience with Amazon Bedrock and generative AI
4. Knowledge of cloud-based application development and deployment
5. Awareness of Amazon's focus on mindfulness and secure cloud services

title: Mindfulness made easy – Smart sand art [REPEAT]
description: A metal sphere carves mesmerizing sand patterns, creating mindful moments. Discover an integration of tech and AI with a Raspberry Pi app managed by AWS IoT Greengrass. A gen AI frontend uses Amazon Bedrock for visuals based on user input and captures real-time patterns. This experience highlights Amazon's mindfulness focus and end-to-end security and demonstrates secure cloud-based gen AI app building.

2. Familiarity with AWS IoT Greengrass
3. Experience with front-end development and integration with AI/ML models
4. Understanding of Amazon Bedrock and its capabilities
5. Awareness of cloud-based application development and security best practices

title: Mind-reading marvel: Can you outsmart generative AI? [REPEAT]
description: Using AWS generative AI offerings, this project creates a mystical mind-reading machine inspired by Zoltar, the fortune-telling animatronic character from the movie “Big.” Participants enter a mysterious booth, interact with the puppet, and think about a person, place, object, or vacation. The puppet will ask yes/no questions to guess the thought. A scoreboard tracks puppet versus participant victories. The booth, enhanced with dry ice for atmosphere, immerses users in a fortune-telling experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS generative AI offerings
2. Experience in creating interactive and immersive experiences
3. Understanding of natural language processing and dialogue systems
4. Familiarity with animatronics and special effects
5. Expertise in user experience design and interactive storytelling

title: Mind-reading marvel: Can you outsmart generative AI? [REPEAT]
description: Using AWS generative AI offerings, this project creates a mystical mind-reading machine inspired by Zoltar, the fortune-telling animatronic character from the movie “Big.” Participants enter a mysterious booth, interact with the puppet, and think about a person, place, object, or vacation. The puppet will ask yes/no questions to guess the thought. A scoreboard tracks puppet versus participant victories. The booth, enhanced with dry ice for atmosphere, immerses users in a fortune-telling experience.

2. Familiarity with the movie "Big" and the Zoltar character
3. Ability to create an interactive booth or enclosure
4. Expertise in integrating dry ice for atmospheric effects
5. Proficiency in developing a scoreboard system

title: Minimize downtime with plug-and-play anomaly detection for industrial
description: In this workshop, learn how to reduce downtime by implementing anomaly detection for industrial assets using AWS IoT SiteWise. Through a step-by-step, plug-and-play approach, gain practical experience in enabling anomaly detection without requiring deep machine learning expertise. Walk through the process of solving real-world challenges related to reducing downtime across various asset types while using the powerful capabilities of AWS IoT SiteWise. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with industrial IoT concepts
3. Hands-on experience with data analysis or visualization

title: Mitigate zero-day events and ransomware risks with VPC egress controls
description: In this network security workshop, learn how to implement AWS best practices for egress controls to mitigate risks from software supply chain dependencies, zero-day events, cryptocurrency mining, and ransomware. Also, explore a new security use case enabled by TLS decryption of outbound network flows. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and architecture
2. Familiarity with network security concepts
3. Experience with network traffic monitoring and analysis
4. Proficiency in using a laptop for hands-on activities

title: Mitigating climate change with methane detection solutions on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Methane is a potent greenhouse gas with high global warming potential. Effectively managing and reducing methane emissions is crucial for climate mitigation efforts. Learn how remote sensing, Internet of Things, and AI technologies on AWS can be used to detect and quantify methane sources, offering a cost-effective and efficient approach to scalable environmental monitoring. These technologies are crucial for industries and governments aiming to reduce methane emissions, providing actionable insights that contribute to global climate change mitigation efforts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of greenhouse gases and their impact on climate change
2. Knowledge of methane as a potent greenhouse gas
3. Familiarity with remote sensing, Internet of Things, and AI technologies
4. Understanding of the importance of scalable environmental monitoring for climate mitigation efforts
5. Awareness of the need for cost-effective and efficient approaches to detecting and quantifying methane sources

title: Mitigating climate change with methane detection solutions on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Methane is a potent greenhouse gas with high global warming potential. Effectively managing and reducing methane emissions is crucial for climate mitigation efforts. Learn how remote sensing, Internet of Things, and AI technologies on AWS can be used to detect and quantify methane sources, offering a cost-effective and efficient approach to scalable environmental monitoring. These technologies are crucial for industries and governments aiming to reduce methane emissions, providing actionable insights that contribute to global climate change mitigation efforts.

1. Understanding of greenhouse gases and their impact on climate change
2. Knowledge of methane as a potent greenhouse gas
3. Familiarity with remote sensing, Internet of Things, and AI technologies
4. Understanding of the importance of scalable environmental monitoring
5. Interest in climate change mitigation efforts

title: Mitigating OWASP Top 10 CI/CD security risks using AWS services
description: In October 2022, the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) released a list of Top 10 on CI/CD risks highlighting specific areas affecting software build and deployment infrastructure. This session focuses on how AWS services can be configured to mitigate the OWASP-identified risks.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) principles.
2. Familiarity with OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) and its security recommendations.
3. Knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) services and their security features.

title: ML infrastructure at Zoox that powers autonomous driving of robotaxis
description: Zoox's mission is to make personal transportation safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable for everyone. Zoox aims to accomplish this by providing mobility-as-a-service in dense urban environments. Take, for example, its recently deployed and purpose-built robotaxi in Las Vegas. In this talk, learn how they built the ML Infrastructure that powers autonomous driving and other ML use cases. Hear context on how data is collected from robotaxis and how the company built their compute, training, and serving infrastructure leveraging various OSS tools and AWS services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of autonomous driving technology
2. Understanding of machine learning infrastructure and its components
3. Familiarity with data collection and processing in the context of autonomous vehicles
4. Experience with open-source tools and AWS services used in machine learning and infrastructure development

title: Mobile robot teleoperation with interactive instruction feature [REPEAT]
description: See a demo of mobile robot teleoperation with real-time video streaming. With interactive instruction feature, the robot understands natural language instructions such as "Move to the right slowly", "tell me your battery level", "tell me where you are", "what object are you seeing and how is the condition?", etc. We showcased parts of this demo in AWS Summit Japan, and this time show how the robot executes the given task using Amazon Bedrock Agents.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of mobile robot control and teleoperation
2. Familiarity with real-time video streaming technologies
3. Understanding of natural language processing and conversational AI
4. Experience with Amazon Bedrock Agents
5. Expertise in integrating various technologies to create a comprehensive demo

title: Mobile robot teleoperation with interactive instruction feature [REPEAT]
description: See a demo of mobile robot teleoperation with real-time video streaming. With interactive instruction feature, the robot understands natural language instructions such as "Move to the right slowly", "tell me your battery level", "tell me where you are", "what object are you seeing and how is the condition?", etc. We showcased parts of this demo in AWS Summit Japan, and this time show how the robot executes the given task using Amazon Bedrock Agents.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with mobile robotics and teleoperation
2. Knowledge of real-time video streaming technologies
3. Understanding of natural language processing and conversational AI
4. Experience with Amazon Bedrock Agents or similar conversational AI platforms
5. Proficiency in integrating various technologies to create a cohesive demo

title: Model evaluation for responsible development: Best practices and tools
description: With the rapid release and deprecation of large language models (LLMs), evaluating these models is necessary to ensure optimal performance while mitigating risks across applications that use these models. This session covers the best practices and tools for model evaluation using AWS services and open access libraries and how LLMs fit the needs of different use cases. Dive deep on performance metrics, such as accuracy, robustness, and toxicity; manual and programmatic evaluations; automatic and human reviews; the role of test data; and how to extend these practices to common LLM-based architectures like RAG and agents.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Basic understanding of large language models (LLMs).
2. Familiarity with AWS services and open-access libraries for model evaluation.
3. Knowledge of performance metrics, such as accuracy, robustness, and toxicity.
4. Experience with manual and programmatic evaluations, as well as automatic and human reviews.
5. Understanding of the role of test data in model evaluation.

title: Model your business structure with Amazon DataZone
description: Amazon DataZone enables organizations to model their business structure effectively, aligning data with operational domain units, authorization policies, and business context. Learn how to organize, create, search, and find data assets and projects associated with business units or teams while setting access policies for creating projects, glossaries, and using compute resources within Amazon DataZone. Join this chalk talk to gain new insights, optimize processes, and deliver data-driven decision-making.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management concepts
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) ecosystem
3. Knowledge of data governance and access control policies
4. Experience in organizing and managing data assets
5. Desire to optimize data-driven decision-making processes

title: Moderna and dbt Mesh: Bringing people and data together (sponsored by dbt Labs)
description: In this lightning talk, discover how Moderna was able to connect all their different data systems to create a single view of the data with dbt Mesh. Learn from the team at Moderna how you can move from Amazon Redshift to Amazon Athena and back again. This presentation is brought to you by dbt Labs, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of data integration and data management
2. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena
3. Understanding of dbt (data build tool)

title: Modern CI/CD with GitHub and AWS CodePipeline [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, learn how to build modern continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines using GitHub and AWS CodePipeline through the AWS Management Console. Learn how to work with monorepos and branching strategies. Explore advanced features such as automatic rollbacks, pipeline parameters, stage level conditions, and concurrent execution modes to improve your pipeline performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of software development and deployment processes.
2. Familiarity with Git and GitHub.
3. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS CodePipeline.

title: Modern CI/CD with GitHub and AWS CodePipeline [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, learn how to build modern continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines using GitHub and AWS CodePipeline through the AWS Management Console. Learn how to work with monorepos and branching strategies. Explore advanced features such as automatic rollbacks, pipeline parameters, stage level conditions, and concurrent execution modes to improve your pipeline performance. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of software development and version control.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and the AWS Management Console.
3. Proficiency in using GitHub for code management and collaboration.

title: Modern data patterns for modern data strategies
description: CTOs and CDOs must adapt their data strategies to manage both the explosive growth of data and its mission-critical usage to drive application experiences that span personalized user experiences, petabyte-scale business analytics, and real-time AI inference in applications in every industry. To keep pace and optimize for the business, leaders must balance governance with flexibility and scale by separating data growth from data usage using emerging patterns like data semantic layering. In this talk, discover how AWS customers manage data growth and usage at exabyte scale, and explore AWS capabilities to evolve your data strategy for this rapidly changing landscape.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management strategies
2. Knowledge of data governance and data usage patterns
3. Familiarity with emerging technologies and trends in data management
4. Experience in managing large-scale data environments
5. Awareness of AWS capabilities for data management and strategy evolution

title: Modern data strategies with generative AI for next-generation missions
description: Nonprofits face numerous challenges in using their data to differentiate their missions and make informed decisions. In this chalk talk, learn how to build a modern data architecture on AWS. Bring your use cases, such as donor engagement, fundraising intelligence, omnichannel communications, mission branding, research collaboration, or others, to this talk to explore. See a whiteboarding session on architectures using scalable data lakes, purpose-built analytics, unified data governance, and generative AI. Leave this talk with a reference architecture for an end-to-end data strategy and a mental toolkit for becoming a thought leader ushering in a data-driven organizational culture that amplifies mission impact.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data management and analytics
2. Familiarity with AWS cloud services
3. Interest in leveraging data to drive organizational impact
4. Willingness to explore and discuss use cases related to nonprofit operations

title: Modernization at scale made easy with Netflix and Pinterest (sponsored by AMD)
description: In this session, join AMD, Netflix, and Pinterest to discover how modernizing to AMD EPYC processor–powered instances helps improve the user experience for hundreds of millions of users while minimizing cloud costs. Find out how Netflix delighted their users with service latency reduction and improved throughput, and learn how Pinterest enhanced their application performance while simultaneously reducing costs. Come see how you can achieve similar results by choosing AMD EPYC processor–powered instances while maintaining x86 compatibility and access to a vast and stable x86 ecosystem. This presentation is brought to you by AMD, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud infrastructure
2. Understanding of processor performance and its impact on user experience
3. Familiarity with AWS and its partner ecosystem
4. Interest in optimizing cloud costs and application performance

title: Modernize and simplify ETL with AWS Glue
description: Legacy data integration and transformation solutions are often complex, consisting of multiple components stitched together. This complexity makes them expensive to manage and maintain. As a result, data engineers frequently struggle with the administrative overheads of running Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data discovery, data movement, data transformation, and data cataloging. This chalk talk delves into the engineering details of migrating from traditional ETL solutions to AWS Glue, a serverless data integration service. It explores how you can modernize your data integration approach using AWS Glue, thereby reducing operational costs and streamlining your data management processes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of traditional ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and their challenges.
2. Familiarity with data integration, data discovery, data movement, data transformation, and data cataloging concepts.
3. Basic knowledge of AWS services and cloud computing.
4. Experience with data engineering or data management practices.
5. Interest in modernizing data integration approaches and reducing operational costs.

title: Modernize Apple platform development with AWS and EC2 Mac
description: EC2 Mac instances allow you to run on-demand macOS workloads in the cloud and extend the flexibility, scalability, and cost benefits of AWS to all Apple developers. This session shares the latest features and advancements for EC2 Mac and how customers are benefiting from them. Learn about Apple application development in the cloud using EC2 Mac instances and hear firsthand how an AWS customer optimized its Apple development workflow and benefited from Apple application development in the cloud.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of AWS EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud)
2. Familiarity with macOS and Apple development
3. Knowledge of cloud computing concepts and benefits

title: Modernize application security and resiliency with AI-assisted DevOps
description: Nonprofits are faced with increasingly challenging security risks while continuing to push forward their missions. To meet this challenge, nonprofits must modernize their mission-critical workloads and build resiliency into their applications so they can continue to serve their members. In this hands-on workshop, learn the basics of application modernization through container technology, and explore how to use AI-powered AWS services to make your application more secure and resilient at all stages of the development lifecycle. Learn the skills you need to deploy modern, secure, and resilient applications that will help you maximize your mission impact. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of application development
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Interest in improving security and resilience of mission-critical applications

title: Modernize apps with containerization, VPC Lattice & generative AI
description: In this hands-on workshop, learn how to modernize legacy Java 8 applications on AWS seamlessly. Containerize and deploy to Amazon ECS, integrate with Amazon VPC Lattice for secure microservice communication, and upgrade to Java 17 using Amazon Q. Explore blue/green deployments for smooth transitions, leveraging AWS services to containerize, manage, and upgrade applications. Discover centralized inspection benefits for legacy protocols with VPC Lattice integration. Leave equipped to modernize legacy applications on AWS without downtime or undifferentiated heavy lifting. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Java programming
2. Familiarity with Docker and containerization
3. Exposure to AWS services, such as Amazon ECS, Amazon VPC Lattice, and Amazon Q
4. Experience with application deployment and management

title: Modernize managed file transfer with SFTP
description: Managing file transfers can come at a high cost as you maintain infrastructure, licensing, resources, and adherence to regulatory and business requirements. In this session, learn how AWS Transfer Family provides fully managed, highly available file transfers over protocols such as SFTP and AS2. Hear how Transfer Family helps make sure that your data arrives on time, that it is secure and compliant, and that performance and costs scale with your workflows. Learn about these benefits while also considering how you can break down data silos and redirect resources to focus on adding value to your business.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of file transfer protocols (e.g., SFTP, AS2)
2. Knowledge of data security and compliance requirements
3. Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure and services
4. Experience in managing file transfer workflows and associated costs
5. Interest in optimizing data management and focusing on core business activities

title: Modernize multi-tenant monolithic apps with AWS purpose-built databases [REPEAT]
description: Multi-tenant architectures provide agility and scalability by sharing data storage resources for all tenants. In such environments, isolating tenant data is fundamental for application builders. It is critical to implement an effective data isolation model while retaining the agility gained from consolidating tenants. In this workshop, learn how you can achieve both a shared database for your tenants and centralized isolation enforcement using Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, and AWS DMS. Learn how to use zero-ETL to consolidate tenant data and take advantage of Amazon Redshift read scalability. Explore best practices for tenant isolation, partitioning, database operations using infrastructure as code, and tenant portability. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this workshop:

1. Basic understanding of database concepts and relational databases.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon Redshift.
3. Knowledge of infrastructure as code (IaC) tools, such as AWS CloudFormation or Terraform.
4. Experience with data migration and ETL processes.
5. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on exercises.

title: Modernize Windows applications on your own terms
description: Do you have applications that need to be modernized, but aren’t sure about how to get started? If so, this workshop is for you. You will be given a mandate to modernize a set of applications. First, learn about your applications and their dependencies. Then, decide which application you want to modernize and the path you want to take; for example, containerize your application and run it on Amazon ECS or Amazon EKS, or refactor your .NET code to run on Linux. The choice is yours. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of application development and deployment.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and services.
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., .NET, Java, Python).
4. Ability to use a command-line interface and basic DevOps tools.
5. Willingness to actively participate in the workshop and work on a hands-on project.

title: Modernize your connected vehicle platform with new AWS IoT features
description: A connected vehicle platform is critical for delivering innovative features like remote start from a mobile app, electric vehicle battery range estimation, and video streaming for enhanced vehicle security. Join this chalk talk to learn about the newest capabilities from AWS IoT FleetWise, AWS IoT Core, and Amazon Kinesis Video Streams that can help you modernize your connected vehicle platforms and drive innovation. Walk through how to build for key use cases using features and methods that optimize for secure connectivity, low latency, cost efficiency.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of connected vehicle technologies.
2. Familiarity with AWS IoT services (AWS IoT FleetWise, AWS IoT Core, Amazon Kinesis Video Streams).
3. Knowledge of secure connectivity, low latency, and cost-efficient solutions for connected vehicle platforms.

title: Modernize your data warehouse by moving to Amazon Redshift
description: Are you spending too much time on data warehouse management tasks like hardware provisioning, software patching, and performance tuning and not enough time building your applications and innovating with data? Tens of thousands of AWS customers rely on Amazon Redshift every day to run and scale analytics in seconds on all their data without managing data warehouse infrastructure. In this session, hear from AWS customers who share their journeys moving to a modern cloud data warehouse and analytics with Amazon Redshift. Learn best practices for building powerful analytics and machine learning applications and operating at scale while keeping costs low.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with data warehouse management tasks
2. Interest in cloud-based data warehousing solutions
3. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift or desire to learn about it
4. Desire to optimize time spent on analytics and innovation
5. Interest in learning best practices for building analytics and machine learning applications

title: Modernizing a spin-off in the cloud: Allspring’s journey with AWS
description: When the asset management unit at Wells Fargo spun off to form a new company, Allspring Global Investments, it faced a tight timeline to move its financial data from Wells Fargo’s on-premises data center. Allspring’s IT leadership identified its path forward with AWS, using Amazon EC2 and Amazon EBS as a foundation, while creating operational efficiency with managed services like Amazon RDS for its SQL Server and Oracle data. Allspring is now focused on modernizing its Microsoft- and Oracle-based applications and databases to speed up innovation by using open source and AWS cloud-native services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services (Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, Amazon RDS)
2. Familiarity with on-premises data center migration to the cloud
3. Experience with Microsoft and Oracle-based applications and databases
4. Understanding of cloud-native services and open-source technologies
5. Ability to work within a tight timeline for the spin-off transition

title: Modernizing banking with AWS and Visa’s cloud-native operations (sponsored by Visa)
description: Visa’s Pismo cloud-native solution helps banks scale their banking and card operations on AWS. Using AWS multi-Region support, Pismo assists in the enhancement of banking resilience and enables seamless cloud-based card processing and issuance. By offering improved security, scalability, and availability, Pismo helps banks differentiate services and optimize operations. Cloud migration is an ongoing journey. Discover how Visa’s Pismo solution simplifies cloud adoption in the banking sector, guiding you from discovery to implementation, achieving global scale, maintaining agility, and sustaining innovation. This presentation is brought to you by Visa, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Knowledge of banking and card operations
3. Familiarity with cloud-native solutions and their benefits
4. Interest in enhancing banking resilience and cloud-based card processing
5. Desire to optimize banking operations and differentiate services

title: Modernizing digital operations for efficiency and resilience (sponsored by PagerDuty)
description: High customer expectations and increasingly distributed systems mean that disruptions to digital services can have catastrophic effects on revenue, brand reputation, and costs. In this panel discussion, hear from top enterprise leaders about how they’re partnering with PagerDuty to modernize digital operations to mitigate business risk while unlocking efficiencies and accelerating productivity. Learn how teams are automating issue resolution with minimal human interruption—improving system resilience and team capacity while reducing the strain of operational complexity. Get insights on how AI and automation are deflecting unnecessary work from teams so they can focus on delivering business value. This presentation is brought to you by PagerDuty, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this panel discussion may include:

1. Experience in digital service operations
2. Understanding of the challenges posed by high customer expectations and distributed systems
3. Interest in modernizing digital operations and mitigating business risk
4. Familiarity with PagerDuty and its solutions
5. Desire to learn about AI and automation in operational management

title: Modernizing & integrating ExxonMobil's ERP systems & apps with ROSA (sponsored by Red Hat)
description: How does an energy company with the scale and complexity of ExxonMobil modernize its ERP (enterprise resource planning) systems and legacy processes? What is essential for simplifying and rationalizing mission-critical applications that are fundamental to its operations? In this microservices era, seamlessly integrating best-of-breed products and end-to-end business solutions have become crucial. ExxonMobil uses Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS (ROSA) to host an API integration and management platform that delivers efficiency, portability, speed to market while accelerating accretive business value. Join ExxonMobil and Red Hat as they discuss surmounting technical challenges while building this production ROSA environment. This presentation is brought to you by Red Hat, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the presentation would likely include:

1. Understanding of enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems and legacy processes.
2. Knowledge of microservices architecture and integration of best-of-breed products.
3. Familiarity with Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS (ROSA) and its capabilities.
4. Experience in overcoming technical challenges in building a production ROSA environment.
5. Awareness of the importance of efficiency, portability, and speed to market in delivering business value.

title: Modernizing Java applications with Amazon Q Developer [REPEAT]
description: In this builders’ session, use Amazon Q Developer Agent for code transformation to modernize a Java application. Learn how Amazon Q Developer can leverage generative AI to automate common language upgrade tasks like updating your code, conducting unit tests, and verifying deployment readiness starting with Java. Save days' or even months' worth of the undifferentiated work involved in moving from older language versions. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Java programming language
2. Basic understanding of code transformation and modernization
3. Access to a laptop for participation

4. Access to a laptop for the hands-on session

title: Modernizing microservices with event-driven architecture [REPEAT]
description: Tight coupling of your microservices is the operational path to pain. In this chalk talk, explore event-driven architecture (EDA) techniques to reduce application complexity, increase performance, and improve reliability using asynchronous design patterns. Through interactive discussions and whiteboarding, see how to identify dependencies in microservices and redesign point-to-point integrations to use loosely coupled techniques using AWS Lambda, Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, and Amazon EventBridge.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of microservices architecture
2. Familiarity with asynchronous communication patterns
3. Basic knowledge of AWS services (Lambda, SQS, SNS, EventBridge)
4. Experience with event-driven design principles
5. Ability to identify and analyze dependencies in microservices

title: Monday Night Live with Peter DeSantis
description: Join Peter DeSantis, Senior Vice President of AWS Utility Computing, as he continues the Monday Night Live tradition of diving deep into the engineering that powers AWS services. Get a closer look at how our unique approach and culture of innovation help create leading-edge solutions across the entire spectrum, from silicon to services—without compromising on performance or cost.

2. Interest in the technical aspects of AWS infrastructure and engineering
3. Familiarity with the Monday Night Live event series

title: Monitor and manage data quality
description: The quality of data powers business decisions that drive outcomes. Successful businesses run on trusted data that is reliable and accurate. Join this session to learn how to apply Amazon DataZone and AWS Glue to deliver data integrity and consistency through precise data transformation, data cataloging, data governance, and data lineage, as well as to set up data quality checks, automate validation processes, and manage metadata.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data management concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of data transformation and data quality processes

title: Monitor end user experience with Amazon CloudWatch [REPEAT]
description: By extending application performance monitoring to end users as well as frontend experiences, AWS digital experience monitoring enhances customer experiences with an outside-in perspective of application performance across all user touchpoints. Such user experience data provides a complete picture and helps organizations turn frontend performance, user behavior, and APIs into actionable KPIs such as release velocity, adoption rate, and conversions. In this builders’ session, learn how applications behave by monitoring both real and synthetic user activity and behavior, using data from ISPs and AWS, and capturing insights from backend infrastructure and devices as well as digital user metrics. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with application performance monitoring
2. Understanding of user experience and digital metrics
3. Knowledge of real and synthetic user monitoring
4. Familiarity with AWS services and infrastructure
5. Ability to use a laptop for participation
