title: Monitoring and troubleshooting your cloud network on AWS
description: In the cloud, make failure your friend. When network issues arise on and off the cloud, having the right diagnostic tools is crucial for quick resolution. In this interactive session, discover how to proactively monitor and swiftly troubleshoot cloud and hybrid networks on AWS. Learn to leverage services like Amazon CloudWatch Network Monitor, Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor, Infrastructure Performance, VPC Reachability Analyzer, and VPC Flow Logs to gain deep visibility, identify impairments, and resolve problems efficiently. Walk away empowered to maintain a bird's eye view and optimize your cloud network's reliability, performance, and cost-effectiveness.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with network monitoring and troubleshooting concepts
3. Experience with AWS networking services and tools

title: Monitoring event flows: Observability for event-driven architectures
description: Event-driven architectures (EDAs) offer scalability and promote loose coupling between components of a system, leading to greater agility. However, EDAs bring with them observability challenges. Gain visibility into complex event flows in an asynchronous architecture that involves messaging services. In this interactive chalk talk, explore tracing with OpenTelemetry to view the full event journey. Also, learn how to assemble metrics and logs for insights into sharding, performance, and root cause analysis along with best practices for popular EDA patterns.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of event-driven architectures (EDAs)
2. Familiarity with messaging services and asynchronous communication
3. Basic knowledge of observability and tracing concepts
4. Exposure to OpenTelemetry or similar observability tools
5. Interest in exploring best practices for EDA patterns

title: Monitor microservice applications with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch
description: This lab uses AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch to visualize and monitor the usage of a customer-facing web application. As a cloud architect or cloud operations specialist, create a service map and visualize end-to-end application requests. Also, broaden your understanding on general monitoring concepts, cloud operations, and generating insights for the Operations teams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.
2. Understanding of cloud architecture and cloud operations concepts.
3. Experience with web application development and deployment.
4. Knowledge of monitoring and observability practices.
5. Ability to analyze and interpret application performance data.

title: More than just chatbots: Connecting AI to the real world
description: Overcome a key challenge in developing AI-enhanced applications — extending their capabilities beyond simple text generation. This session demonstrates how to connect LLMs to external services and APIs and unlock capabilities like real-time data retrieval, dynamic content generation, and automated task execution. Join as attendees learn the the hands-on knowledge needed to build more powerful, context-aware AI applications that connect to and interact with the real world.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of language models and their capabilities.
2. Familiarity with APIs and external services integration.
3. Basic programming skills, preferably in a language like Python.
4. Willingness to explore and experiment with new technologies.
5. Curiosity to expand the capabilities of AI-enhanced applications.

title: Morning yoga session
description: Start your week with an early morning yoga session. Come dressed in your fitness gear and wind down before a full week of re:Invent.
prerequisites:
1. Yoga experience or willingness to learn
2. Comfortable fitness attire
3. Availability for an early morning session
4. Desire to start the week with a relaxing and rejuvenating activity
5. Attendance at the re:Invent event

title: Move and improve at scale using AWS Application Migration Service
description: Are you looking to migrate your workloads to the cloud while unlocking their full potential? AWS Application Migration Service helps you migrate and modernize your applications seamlessly at scale. Be prepared to immerse yourself in a hands-on learning experience. In this workshop, learn how to address common challenges like upgrading operating systems, optimizing infrastructure, and auto scaling after completing your migration. Go beyond simply moving your applications—explore how AWS Application Migration Service can help you improve performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Experience with application migration or modernization

title: Move data to Amazon S3 and kick-start gen AI workflows with Amazon Q
description: Learn how to ingest data into Amazon S3 from on premises, other clouds, and third-party sources using AWS Storage Gateway, AWS DataSync, and AWS Transfer Family. This hands-on workshop guides you through setting up data pipelines and utilizing Amazon Q to parse and analyze your data with generative AI. Gain practical experience in configuring AWS data movement services and harnessing AI for data processing. Leave this workshop equipped to build a scalable Amazon S3 data lake with advanced AI-driven insights. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with data storage and data processing concepts.
3. Experience with AWS management console or CLI.

title: Move to containers with Amazon ECS
description: This bootcamp provides an immersive experience through five hands-on labs that empower developers, architects, and modernization enthusiasts to build modern applications on AWS or modernize existing applications by leveraging Amazon ECS and other container services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Basic understanding of containerization and Docker.
3. Experience in software development or application architecture.
4. Willingness to engage in hands-on learning and problem-solving.

title: Move your data efficiently & securely between apps, clouds & devices (sponsored by Console Connect)
description: Data is abundant and valuable, especially in the context of gen AI. The problem is getting it to the right place at the right time, without increasing risk or cost. Surveys show that 73% of business data remains untapped. It’s scattered across unique and complex environments—legacy on-premises systems, clouds, and your edge. And it remains that way largely because of slow, costly, and insecure transfer methods. In this session, learn how Console Connect helps businesses safely move their data around to wherever it is needed for whatever the use case. This presentation is brought to you by Console Connect, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management and storage environments (on-premises, cloud, edge)
2. Awareness of data transfer challenges (slow, costly, insecure)
3. Interest in exploring solutions for efficient and secure data movement

title: Moving from naive benchmarking to application performance engineering
description: When asked to compare performance at the infrastructure level, many people are running benchmarks. Most of the time, benchmarks aren’t representative of their applications’ behaviors. In this chalk talk, learn the tools and best practices that will help you understand your applications’ performance behaviors on Amazon EC2 instances, which will ultimately allow you to maximize your applications’ performance.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and Amazon EC2.
2. Basic knowledge of application performance and benchmarking.
3. Familiarity with performance monitoring tools and techniques.

title: Multicloud data movement best practices with AWS DataSync
description: Join this chalk talk to learn how to perform multicloud data transfers with AWS DataSync. This talk provides the expertise to leverage AWS DataSync as a powerful data transfer solution, allowing you to efficiently migrate and synchronize data between Amazon S3 compatible storage on other clouds and AWS storage services. AWS experts guide you through the unique requirements, best practices, endpoint connectivity, and cloud-specific nuances. Harness the ability to move your object data at scale, securely transferring it to cost-efficient AWS storage classes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud storage and data management
2. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
3. Knowledge of data transfer and migration strategies
4. Awareness of cloud-specific storage and connectivity requirements
5. Interest in leveraging AWS DataSync for efficient multicloud data transfers

title: Multi-container AV/ADAS simulations with Autoware and AWS Batch
description: It can be complex, time-consuming, and error-prone to run autonomous vehicle and advanced driver assistance system (AV/ADAS) simulations using a single container due to the diversity of simulation components (simulation environment, test scenarios, software under test). In this hands-on workshop, learn how to use AWS Batch to run your AV/ADAS simulations as logical independent containers, in parallel, at scale. Build a CARLA simulation in an Amazon ECS/Amazon EC2 compute environment using separate containers for the simulation and autonomy stacks. Run multiple scenarios, upload the results to Amazon S3, and view them in a dashboard. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of autonomous vehicles and ADAS
2. Familiarity with Docker and containerization
3. Knowledge of AWS services (AWS Batch, Amazon ECS, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3)
4. Laptop to participate in the hands-on workshop

title: Multimodal semantic search for generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, acquire the skills to ingest information from a wide range of data sources, such as videos, PDFs, and images, into a unified knowledge repository for generative AI use cases. Leverage AWS generative AI services to build a robust vector search engine capable of retrieving different data types based on semantic similarity. Through hands-on exercises and real-world use cases, including AWS DeepRacer, gain practical experience in data ingestion, vector embedding creation, and search optimization. This knowledge empowers you to unlock the full potential of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for enterprise-level generative AI applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data ingestion and processing
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Hands-on experience with machine learning and natural language processing
4. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python)
5. Willingness to actively participate in hands-on exercises

title: Multimodal semantic search for generative AI applications [REPEAT]
description: In this workshop, acquire the skills to ingest information from a wide range of data sources, such as videos, PDFs, and images, into a unified knowledge repository for generative AI use cases. Leverage AWS generative AI services to build a robust vector search engine capable of retrieving different data types based on semantic similarity. Through hands-on exercises and real-world use cases, including AWS DeepRacer, gain practical experience in data ingestion, vector embedding creation, and search optimization. This knowledge empowers you to unlock the full potential of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for enterprise-level generative AI applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data ingestion and knowledge management
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Experience with machine learning and natural language processing
4. Ability to work with different data formats (videos, PDFs, images)
5. Desire to learn and apply Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for enterprise-level generative AI applications

title: Multi-Region or single Region? Considerations and architectures [REPEAT]
description: With AWS, builders can create highly resilient workloads in the cloud. Learn how to reason about single-Region and multi-Region architectures. Watch experts walk through and whiteboard architectures that take advantage of AWS services that support multi-Region capabilities, and discuss what a failover scenario would look like in real life. Leave with an understanding of what it takes to run a multi-Region architecture on AWS.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this course would be:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their capabilities
3. Knowledge of high availability and fault-tolerance principles
4. Experience with designing and deploying cloud-based applications
5. Familiarity with networking concepts and AWS networking services

title: Multi-Region or single Region? Considerations and architectures [REPEAT]
description: With AWS, builders can create highly resilient workloads in the cloud. Learn how to reason about single-Region and multi-Region architectures. Watch experts walk through and whiteboard architectures that take advantage of AWS services that support multi-Region capabilities, and discuss what a failover scenario would look like in real life. Leave with an understanding of what it takes to run a multi-Region architecture on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Knowledge of high availability and fault tolerance principles
4. Familiarity with AWS Region and Availability Zone concepts
5. Understanding of disaster recovery and business continuity planning

title: Multi-tenant Amazon SQS queues: Mitigating noisy neighbors
description: This chalk talk explores advanced strategies for managing multi-tenant Amazon SQS queues, discusses the challenges posed by noisy neighbors, and shares effective mitigation techniques, including shuffle sharding and overflow queues. Gain insights into optimizing queue performance, ensuring fair resource allocation, and maintaining service quality across tenants. Walk through best practices for implementing these solutions, potential trade-offs, and examples of multi-tenant Amazon SQS architectures.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service)
2. Understanding of multi-tenant architectures
3. Knowledge of queue management strategies
4. Awareness of performance optimization techniques
5. Experience with cloud infrastructure and service management

title: Must-know techniques to optimize your AWS environment [REPEAT]
description: This workshop equips you (particularly if you are new to AWS) with essential tools and techniques that can be used to optimize your environments, even before changing a single line of code in your applications. Using hands-on exercises, learn to leverage AWS Compute Optimizer, AWS Cost Explorer, AWS Trusted Advisor, and additional resources to identify cost savings, improve performance and resilience, and strengthen your security posture. Leave equipped to take full control of your AWS environment and unlock its full potential. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS
2. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
3. Ability to access and navigate the AWS Management Console

title: Must-know techniques to optimize your AWS environment [REPEAT]
description: This workshop equips you (particularly if you are new to AWS) with essential tools and techniques that can be used to optimize your environments, even before changing a single line of code in your applications. Using hands-on exercises, learn to leverage AWS Compute Optimizer, AWS Cost Explorer, AWS Trusted Advisor, and additional resources to identify cost savings, improve performance and resilience, and strengthen your security posture. Leave equipped to take full control of your AWS environment and unlock its full potential. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Ability to access an AWS account
4. Laptop for hands-on exercises

title: National Australia Bank: Achieving operational excellence with gen AI (sponsored by Accenture)
description: Generative AI (gen AI) is revolutionizing the way National Australia Bank (NAB) interacts with technology—offering innovative solutions that improve customer experiences, streamline operations, and drive business growth. In this session, NAB executives share key learnings from their innovative gen AI deployment that focused on enhancing decision-making, investing in developer tools, fostering a culture of innovation, and collaborating with technology partners to create a more inclusive and efficient financial environment. Also learn how AWS technologies like Amazon Q helped NAB stay ahead in the rapidly evolving landscape of financial technology. This presentation is brought to you by Accenture, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given session would be:

1. Understanding of Generative AI and its applications in the financial industry.
2. Knowledge of National Australia Bank's (NAB) digital transformation initiatives and their focus on enhancing customer experiences.
3. Familiarity with AWS technologies, particularly Amazon Q, and their role in the financial technology landscape.
4. Interest in learning about NAB's innovative deployment of Generative AI and the key learnings from their experience.
5. Curiosity about the collaboration between NAB, Accenture, and AWS in creating a more inclusive and efficient financial environment.

title: NatWest: Personalizing customer experience with Amazon Connect & AI/ML
description: NatWest has been at the forefront of innovating with new Amazon Connect features and capabilities to improve the customer experience. In this session, learn how NatWest is using richer data and generative AI within its contact center to innovate faster and drive business value. Explore how NatWest uses Amazon Connect data and analytics capabilities, including Contact Lens, to analyze customer sentiment and inform agent decisions using data points like call volume, handle time, and transfers. Hear how NatWest is using Amazon Q in Connect to improve customer intent detection and deliver more personalized customer interactions at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Amazon Connect
2. Knowledge of contact center operations and customer experience
3. Familiarity with data analytics and sentiment analysis
4. Awareness of generative AI and its applications in customer interactions
5. Experience with implementing and leveraging contact center technologies

title: Navigate Multi-Level Protection Scheme compliance in AWS China Regions
description: This chalk talk shows you how AWS simplifies your journey to Multi-Level Protection Scheme (MLPS) compliance in AWS China Regions. First, we introduce you to the MLPS standards for scoping, classifying, implementing, and evaluating your security controls. Next, we demonstrate how to leverage the MLPS Level III certification when you build on AWS, mapping security controls to AWS services and features. Risk owners hear how building on AWS makes it simple to be MLPS compliant. Solutions architects learn how to design solutions that use AWS services and features to meet MLPS requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS services and features
2. Knowledge of Multi-Level Protection Scheme (MLPS) standards and requirements
3. Experience in designing and implementing secure cloud solutions

title: Navigating Amazon RDS and Aurora as a non-DBA: A decade-long journey
description: Join this session to learn lessons from my experience managing (without database administrator expertise) dozens of production databases for over a decade. First, hear about my mistakes: I triggered storage auto scaling during maintenance, crashed my first Amazon RDS instance on AWS Graviton due to a suboptimal configuration, and ran out of IOPS multiple times. While attempting to outsmart the automated backups, my storage costs skyrocketed, surpassing other expenses associated with the Amazon RDS instance. Also, learn from my successes: I doubled the DML per second by switching to io2 Block Express volumes and experimented with methods to optimize the storage of fragmented tables.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of database management
2. Familiarity with cloud-based database services (e.g., Amazon RDS)
3. Interest in learning from real-world experiences and mistakes in database management

title: Navigating cloud migration: Planning a move from another cloud to AWS [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk pulls back the curtain on cloud-to-AWS migration challenges and successes, featuring real-world experiences of customers who moved from other clouds to AWS and offering best practices from the trenches. Discover the strategic considerations that prompted migration, as well as technical hurdles and innovative solutions to overcome them. The talk covers aspects of networking, data migration, application refactoring, and architectural optimization, equipping you with knowledge and tools to navigate your migration journey.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Experience with cloud migration or application modernization

title: Navigating cloud migration: Planning a move from another cloud to AWS [REPEAT]
description: This chalk talk pulls back the curtain on cloud-to-AWS migration challenges and successes, featuring real-world experiences of customers who moved from other clouds to AWS and offering best practices from the trenches. Discover the strategic considerations that prompted migration, as well as technical hurdles and innovative solutions to overcome them. The talk covers aspects of networking, data migration, application refactoring, and architectural optimization, equipping you with knowledge and tools to navigate your migration journey.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Experience in cloud migration or application modernization

title: Navigating the AI model ecosystem with Amazon Bedrock
description: Discover a vast ecosystem of models tailored for production use cases. Seamlessly integrate and explore a wide range of cutting-edge offerings through a unified API. Leverage an intuitive testing environment to evaluate and select the right model for your needs. Refine and optimize model performance with advanced tools, enabling innovative solutions while maintaining the highest standards of quality and reliability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with machine learning and AI concepts
2. Experience in integrating and deploying AI models in production environments
3. Understanding of software development and deployment processes
4. Proficiency in using APIs and working with various data formats
5. Ability to evaluate and select appropriate models for specific use cases

title: Navigating the AWS network with the right tools for the job
description: Gain a comprehensive understanding of AWS network monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Join this session to explore a range of AWS observability tools and discuss their ideal fit based on the scale and requirements of your infrastructure deployment. In this session, you see examples, learn best practices for network visibility and efficiency, and get insights into using generative AI for troubleshooting. By the end, you are empowered to make informed decisions about selecting and implementing the right solutions for your network environment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS cloud infrastructure
2. Familiarity with network concepts and troubleshooting
3. Experience with cloud-based monitoring and observability tools

title: Navigating the AWS security controls toolbox
description: In this lightning talk, explore three powerful AWS services—AWS Config, service control policies (SCPs), and AWS CloudFormation Guard—and how to leverage them to strengthen your cloud security posture. This talk covers configuring AWS Config for continuous monitoring and compliance, deploying SCPs to enforce security standards, and using AWS CloudFormation Guard to define and validate security rules in your infrastructure as code. Leave with a comprehensive understanding of navigating the AWS security toolbox to maintain a secure, well-governed cloud environment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the lightning talk:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services and cloud computing concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS security and governance best practices.
3. Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) using AWS CloudFormation or similar tools.

title: Navigating the cloud compute landscape with Amazon ECS
description: Amazon ECS gives architects choice when designing robust and scalable compute environments for containerized applications. In this session, explore the different compute options available in Amazon ECS and dive deep into the technology that supports each compute type. In this session, gain insights into Amazon ECS capacity providers for both Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate and learn the architectural trade-offs involved in supporting a range of use cases and workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of containerization and container orchestration.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services.
3. Knowledge of application architecture and scalability concepts.
4. Experience with Docker or other container technologies.
5. Familiarity with cloud computing and infrastructure-as-code principles.

title: Navigating the enterprise journey of quantum computing with AWS
description: Quantum computing is a rapidly evolving field that presents both exciting opportunities and unique challenges for organizations. Whether you’re just beginning to explore quantum technologies or you’re already pushing the boundaries with advanced research, AWS provides tailored engagement options to support your journey. In this session, explore how AWS helps enterprises at every stage, from those just starting out to those running cutting-edge research, including options for embarking onto a quantum journey for the first time, hosting crowd-science challenges, and collaborating on in-depth quantum research together with AWS experts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of quantum mechanics
2. Familiarity with computer science and programming
3. Interest in emerging technologies and their applications

title: Navigating the journey to becoming a cloud solutions architect
description: Are you ready to thrive as a cloud solutions architect and have a resounding impact on your organization, other people, and your career? The role of a cloud solutions architect is both challenging and rewarding and comes with a bright career path. In this session, you learn the essential skills required to become a cloud solutions architect, including how to embrace ambiguity; solve complex business, people, and technology problems; and create beautiful designs that solve real-world issues for your customers and teams.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Proficiency in cloud computing technologies and platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
2. Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
3. Ability to work with ambiguity and adapt to changing requirements.
4. Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
5. Familiarity with software design principles and architecture patterns.

title: Navigating your migration journey: Overcoming challenges
description: When it comes to AWS migrations, knowledge is power. This chalk talk explores and discusses migration pathways and challenges and how to get the data you need to support decision-making factoring in application architecture, dependencies, performance requirements, and licensing implications. Hear stories of how customers have navigated compelling events to successfully migrate to AWS and receive tips for your own migration.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the chalk talk:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
3. Experience with application migration or deployment
4. Knowledge of application dependencies and performance requirements
5. Awareness of software licensing implications

title: Netflix’s efficient network configuration for millions of containers
description: Netflix operates a highly efficient cloud computing infrastructure that supports a broad range of applications crucial for our SVOD (Subscription Video on Demand), live streaming, and gaming services. Titus, Netflix’s container management platform, is instrumental in managing business-critical containers within the AWS cloud environment. Proper network configuration for each container is essential to ensure seamless communication between services and connectivity with the external world. This chalk talk discusses IPMan, a system specifically designed and developed by Netflix to address the network setup requirements of millions of containers running daily.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and container technologies
2. Knowledge of container management platforms like Titus
3. Familiarity with AWS cloud environment
4. Comprehension of network configuration and connectivity requirements for containerized applications
5. Awareness of Netflix's IPMan system for managing container network setup

title: Netflix's massive multi-account journey: Year two
description: Two years ago, Netflix introduced the idea of decoupling AWS Identity and Access Management roles from applications’ underlying compute infrastructure in order to house those identities in workload-specific AWS accounts. This session will describe our approach for transparently replacing workloads’ AWS IAM identities without involvement from application owners, as well as the data and tools needed. Based on Netflix’s learnings from the past two years of implementation and migration work to make this vision a reality, this session discusses the capabilities other AWS customers should prioritize to find success in their multi-account efforts and the quantified risk reduction.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
2. Knowledge of multi-account AWS architecture
3. Experience with application infrastructure and deployment
4. Familiarity with data management and tooling
5. Awareness of risk management and mitigation strategies

title: Network-attached storage in the cloud with Amazon FSx
description: Do you need to migrate file-based workloads to the cloud at scale? Amazon FSx is a family of fully managed services that deliver shared storage, data resiliency, and management compatibilities without application or code changes. In this session, learn from industry experts how you can improve agility, reduce costs, and scale automatically by exploring examples of use cases from media and entertainment, education, healthcare and life sciences, and telecommunications customers. Leave this session feeling more confident to create your own migration plan.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of file-based workloads
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and storage services
3. Interest in improving agility, reducing costs, and scaling automatically
4. Desire to learn from industry experts and customer use cases
5. Willingness to create a migration plan

title: Networking strategies for Kubernetes on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Kubernetes is a widely accepted standard for container orchestration, allowing organizations to deploy and manage containerized applications at scale. Deploying Kubernetes clusters requires close collaboration between cluster operators, network administrators, and security teams. This chalk talk, intended for developers, system administrators, and DevOps engineers, explores strategies, best practices, and considerations for networking on Kubernetes. Key topics include pod networking models, service discovery mechanisms, cluster network policies, load balancing techniques, and service meshes. Join this talk to learn how to enhance observability, traffic management, resilience, and security.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with containerization and Docker.
2. Understanding of basic networking concepts (e.g., IP addressing, routing, load balancing).
3. Experience with Linux system administration or DevOps practices.
4. Familiarity with Kubernetes concepts (e.g., pods, services, networking).
5. Interest in container orchestration and distributed application deployment.

title: Networking strategies for Kubernetes on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Kubernetes is a widely accepted standard for container orchestration, allowing organizations to deploy and manage containerized applications at scale. Deploying Kubernetes clusters requires close collaboration between cluster operators, network administrators, and security teams. This chalk talk, intended for developers, system administrators, and DevOps engineers, explores strategies, best practices, and considerations for networking on Kubernetes. Key topics include pod networking models, service discovery mechanisms, cluster network policies, load balancing techniques, and service meshes. Join this talk to learn how to enhance observability, traffic management, resilience, and security.

3. Experience with Linux system administration
4. Knowledge of networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, load balancing)
5. Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools

title: Networking strategies for Kubernetes
description: This deep-dive session explores networking considerations that Amazon EKS cluster operators must navigate. Examine pod communication, service discovery, and policy enforcement in depth, and hear about advanced strategies for load balancing and application networking. Leave this session armed with the technical knowledge and best practices needed to successfully deploy and manage resilient, secure workloads on Amazon EKS using services like Amazon VPC, Elastic Load Balancing (ELB), and Amazon VPC Lattice. Join this session to learn more about Kubernetes networking on AWS.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
3. Knowledge of networking concepts

title: Network packet capture using Mountpoint for Amazon S3 and Karpenter
description: Incident response is crucial for detecting, containing, and recovering from cybersecurity threats. At its core lies data analysis, which requires timely capture and delivery of relevant data for forensic analysts and incident responders to act upon. This chalk talk demonstrates Mountpoint for Amazon S3, a high-throughput open source file client, combined with Karpenter—an open source Kubernetes scaling solution. Together, they offer a powerful approach to deliver network data in near real time to Amazon S3, empowering forensic analysts with the essential information needed for swift and effective investigative work.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of cybersecurity threats and incident response
2. Understanding of data analysis and forensic investigation
3. Familiarity with Amazon S3 and Karpenter
4. Experience with open-source file clients and Kubernetes
5. Ability to integrate and configure these technologies effectively

title: Never a slow news day: Transforming 24/7 news operations
description: News organizations face an increasing number of challenges including streamlining content production, coordinating efforts across distributed teams, driving audience engagement on a growing number of platforms, improving content and resource efficiency, and adopting new tools and workflows—all while covering breaking news. Learn how CBS News and Stations uses AWS to overcome these challenges while providing 24/7/365 news to their viewers. Learn about the technical and transformation strategies for maximizing the value of current and archival content, accelerating workflows, effectively using ML and generative AI, and increasing viewer engagement.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of news production workflows
2. Knowledge of content distribution platforms and audience engagement strategies
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
4. Awareness of emerging technologies like machine learning and generative AI
5. Interest in news industry transformation and innovation

title: New cost reporting and planning tools for FinOps
description: Learn how you can improve the accuracy of your cost analysis and forecasting with the latest advancements in AWS Cloud Financial Management services. Enhance cost accountability within your organization by empowering the right people with the right tools to make data-driven decisions.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services
2. Basic knowledge of financial management and cost analysis
3. Familiarity with AWS cost management and optimization tools
4. Ability to interpret and analyze financial data
5. Effective communication and collaboration skills

title: New innovations for monetizing video streams and generating revenue
description: Generate additional revenue from video streams by implementing advanced techniques such as server-guided ad insertion (SGAI), ad overlays, squeeze-back ads, prefetching ads, and shoppable ads. In this chalk talk, discover how using AWS Elemental MediaTailor and other AWS and AWS Partner services can boost the profitability of your video content and audience. Learn to architect and implement these monetization strategies cost-effectively, using the power of AWS to maximize your video streams’ revenue potential, engage viewers effectively, and accelerate time to market.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Understanding of video streaming technologies and architectures.
2. Familiarity with advertising models and monetization strategies for video content.
3. Basic knowledge of AWS services and their capabilities.
4. Experience in video content management and delivery.
5. Familiarity with server-side ad insertion and other advanced video monetization techniques.

title: New ways of educating with generative AI
description: Join this interactive chalk talk to dive deep on design patterns for implementing generative AI in education. Learn how to use large language models and agents to create solutions that improve learner outcomes as well as reduce administrative time across the education sector, allowing teachers to focus on delivering excellent content and interacting with learners. Explore topics such as lecture summation, virtual tutoring, question and answer generation and evaluation, and curriculum planning support.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with design patterns and software architecture principles.
2. Understanding of large language models and their applications.
3. Knowledge of the education sector and its challenges.
4. Experience with natural language processing and generation.
5. Familiarity with curriculum design and learner-centric approaches.

title: New York Life: Data platform modernization to generative AI innovation
description: New York Life (NYL) modernized its on-premises data platform to enhance analytics, performance, and automation for its critical insurance operations. To meet these objectives, NYL built a scalable data lake and reporting platform on AWS using AWS Lambda, AWS Glue, Amazon RDS, and Amazon Redshift. In this session, NYL shares lessons learned from moving off its legacy platform to a modern data lake and how having a modern data foundation accelerated their generative AI journey. Learn how NYL is using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock to improve employee productivity and front-line agent experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given scenario:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Knowledge of data engineering concepts and technologies
3. Experience in data lake and data warehouse architecture
4. Familiarity with machine learning and generative AI
5. Ability to manage and optimize critical insurance operations

title: Next-generation CDK development with Amazon Q Developer
description: The AWS Cloud Development Kit (AWS CDK) has emerged as a powerful infrastructure as code tool, but building custom high-level constructs can be challenging. This session demonstrates how to leverage Amazon Q Developer, an AI-powered assistant for software development, to create tailored CDK constructs that encapsulate cloud architecture patterns. Learn to design effective constructs, utilize Amazon Q's features for automated documentation and testing, and explore customization options to optimize the developer experience with infrastructure as code using AWS CDK and Amazon Q Developer.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS CDK
2. Familiarity with cloud architecture patterns
3. Familiarity with software development practices
4. Familiarity with Amazon Q Developer or willingness to learn

title: Next generation SaaS: Scale, resilience, and operational efficiency
description: Multi-tenant SaaS builders need to address a challenging set of scaling, resilience, automation, and operational efficiency challenges. Tools exist but it’s time to ask "what’s next?" In this session for AWS Partners, we’ll outline new multi-tenant architecture and operational strategies that transcend the current boundaries. Get a deeper look at the data you need to collect, insights you should be gathering, and emerging tools and mechanisms. We explore new approaches to multi-tenant operations, looking at how generative AI can enrich views of your scaling, resilience, isolation, and tiering policies that impact the operational profile of your SaaS business.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience in multi-tenant SaaS architecture
2. Understanding of scaling, resilience, automation, and operational efficiency challenges
3. Familiarity with existing tools and technologies for multi-tenant SaaS
4. Knowledge of data collection and insights for multi-tenant operations
5. Interest in exploring emerging tools and mechanisms for multi-tenant operations

title: Next generation SaaS tenant isolation strategies
description: Every SaaS provider must have a tenant isolation strategy. This is especially challenging for organizations trying to maximize cost efficiency by relying on shared tenant infrastructure. This session goes beyond the basic isolation schemes, looking at new technologies and techniques that can be used to isolate tenant resources. Explore a range of different isolation models, including RBAC, ABAC, dynamic policies, fine-grained authorization, and Amazon Verified Permissions. Attendees learn how to leverage these techniques to maintain security and access control of their multi-tenant environments while minimizing operational overhead.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of multi-tenant architecture
2. Knowledge of access control models (RBAC, ABAC)
3. Familiarity with cloud security concepts
4. Experience with cloud infrastructure management
5. Awareness of emerging isolation technologies

title: NHL Unlocked: Live cloud production, sports data, and alternate feeds
description: As the first professional sports league in North America to produce and distribute a live game entirely in the cloud, the NHL is on the cutting edge of sports production innovation―lowering costs, reducing carbon emissions, and increasing flexibility and creativity. Join this session to hear how the NHL’s investment in live cloud production and the development of engaging analytics allows them to nimbly provide new, creative, and engaging content for fans.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and its applications in media production
2. Knowledge of sports production and broadcasting
3. Familiarity with the NHL and its initiatives
4. Interest in innovative approaches to content creation and distribution
5. Desire to learn about the benefits of cloud-based production in the sports industry

title: No-code customer engagement design with Amazon Connect flows [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, you learn to create and manage dynamic contact flows using the no-code, drag-and-drop interface of Amazon Connect flows. Through guided practice, you design interactive voice response (IVR) systems, chatbots, and step-by-step guides, automating tasks that integrate with existing applications and systems. You also build personalized, end-to-end customer experiences across self- and agent-assisted channels, automate agent workflows, and use AWS services integration. Come gain practical skills to iteratively update your omnichannel cloud contact center, deliver tailored customer journeys, enhance customer satisfaction and agent productivity, and reduce operational costs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of contact center operations
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Hands-on experience with web development or software engineering

title: No-code customer engagement design with Amazon Connect flows [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on workshop, you learn to create and manage dynamic contact flows using the no-code, drag-and-drop interface of Amazon Connect flows. Through guided practice, you design interactive voice response (IVR) systems, chatbots, and step-by-step guides, automating tasks that integrate with existing applications and systems. You also build personalized, end-to-end customer experiences across self- and agent-assisted channels, automate agent workflows, and use AWS services integration. Come gain practical skills to iteratively update your omnichannel cloud contact center, deliver tailored customer journeys, enhance customer satisfaction and agent productivity, and reduce operational costs. You must bring your laptop to participate.

Prerequisites for this workshop:

1. Basic understanding of contact center operations and customer service.
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services.
3. Hands-on experience with web development or programming concepts.

title: No code, yes efficiency: CATCHTABLE’s data & ML journey [Korean]
description: This lightning talk is delivered in Korean. CATCHTABLE is a leading dining reservation service in Korea, and they launched a wait time prediction feature on AWS using ensemble methods to enhance user experience. In this talk, learn how CATCHTABLE used Amazon SageMaker Canvas to build a data pipeline that seamlessly integrates data preparation, model creation, and deployment to production. Discover the journey of developing machine learning (ML) models using a no-code approach, and learn how to customize the code to meet specific requirements and use natural language–based querying (text-to-code) to reduce the coding time required for preprocessing.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Korean language
2. Understanding of dining reservation services
3. Familiarity with AWS and Amazon SageMaker
4. Experience with ensemble methods in machine learning
5. Exposure to no-code and natural language-based approaches in ML development

title: No-compromise security on AWS with HAProxy’s app delivery platform (sponsored by HAProxy Technologies)
description: Security is usually a trade-off between performance, accuracy, and simplicity. But who wants to compromise when dealing with bots and threat actors? Join this lightning talk to learn how HAProxy Technologies provides next-generation protection for AWS applications. Explore their platform’s multilayered security capabilities including application DoS mitigation, bot management, API and AI gateways, and WAF. Learn about the speed and accuracy of HAProxy’s platform, including its more than 98.5% WAF-balanced accuracy with ultra-low latency—all done at the proxy layer. Finally, learn about HAProxy’s simple integration with AWS, including central management, Kubernetes service discovery, AMI deployment, and Auto Scaling groups. This presentation is brought to you by HAProxy Technologies, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of web application security concepts
2. Knowledge of AWS services and their integration
3. Familiarity with load balancing and proxy technologies
4. Interest in improving security for AWS applications

title: Non-custodial blockchain wallets with AWS Nitro Enclaves
description: This Web3 workshop offers a hands-on approach to creating robust, user-friendly cryptocurrency wallets with enhanced functionality and reduced complexity. Learn how to build a non-custodial blockchain wallet using AWS Nitro Enclaves. Discover how to maintain user control over keys and funds while using a backend signing service. Explore how enclave-based solutions can simplify client-side operations and enable advanced features like social recovery, all while preserving user privacy and security. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies
2. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., JavaScript, Python)

title: No Python? No problem! Generative AI for the rest of us [REPEAT]
description: Learn to integrate AI into applications built with languages beyond Python. This session demonstrates using foundation models on Amazon Bedrock with hands-on examples in Java, JavaScript, C#, and PHP. Gain practical knowledge for implementing AI features in your existing tech stacks, and get access to a demo repository to jumpstart your own AI integrations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with at least one of the following programming languages: Java, JavaScript, C#, or PHP.
2. Basic understanding of machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts.
3. Experience in building web or desktop applications.

title: No Python? No problem! Generative AI for the rest of us [REPEAT]
description: Learn to integrate AI into applications built with languages beyond Python. This session demonstrates using foundation models on Amazon Bedrock with hands-on examples in Java, JavaScript, C#, and PHP. Gain practical knowledge for implementing AI features in your existing tech stacks, and get access to a demo repository to jumpstart your own AI integrations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

2. Basic understanding of machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts.
3. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Amazon Web Services (AWS).

title: NVIDIA accelerated computing platform on AWS (sponsored by NVIDIA)
description: Explore how the NVIDIA accelerated computing on AWS—featuring the latest Blackwell, Hopper, and Ada Lovelace platforms—addresses the challenges of generative AI workloads. This session spotlights Project Ceiba, a supercomputer featuring NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 that scales to 20,736 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs and 10,368 NVIDIA Grace CPUs, delivering 414 exaflops of AI performance with Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) networking and cutting-edge liquid cooling solutions to achieve unparalleled performance, efficiency, and scale. Also see a demo of security solutions that integrate Blackwell encryption with the AWS Nitro System, AWS KMS, and EFA to ensure end-to-end encrypted data protection. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session may include:

1. Understanding of NVIDIA accelerated computing
2. Familiarity with AWS cloud services and infrastructure
3. Knowledge of generative AI workloads and their challenges
4. Awareness of Project Ceiba and its technical specifications
5. Interest in exploring security solutions that integrate NVIDIA Blackwell encryption with AWS services

title: NVIDIA AI startups: The future of intelligent enterprises (sponsored by NVIDIA)
description: Join this insightful session, hosted by NVIDIA Inception, to explore how three innovative companies are using AI and NVIDIA NIM inference microservices on AWS to deploy and scale generative AI applications. This session delves into cutting-edge solutions that enhance efficiency, optimize processes, and drive digital transformation across industries. This presentation is brought to you by NVIDIA, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AI and machine learning
2. Familiarity with NVIDIA Inception and NVIDIA NIM inference microservices
3. Interest in deploying and scaling generative AI applications
4. Curiosity about innovative solutions that enhance efficiency and drive digital transformation

title: O2 Telefónica Germany: 5G Core on AWS
description: Hear from O2 Telefónica about the world's first 5G mobile core network running entirely on AWS Cloud with Nokia. Discover how this cloud-native 5G Core deployment enables superior network agility, scalability, security, and accelerated innovation cycles. Learn how the cloud’s flexibility can transform 5G economics through streamlined operations and new revenue opportunities. Explore the vast possibilities by bringing the 5G core to the cloud, providing an enhanced customer experience, service resilience, and quicker software updates.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of 5G technology
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud-native architectures
3. Familiarity with network infrastructure and operations

title: Observability-driven development [REPEAT]
description: Operational excellence is a must-have for a well-architected workload and is integral to delivering a fault-tolerant, resilient, and performant workload. In this builders’ session, learn architectural best practices to help develop a workload health dashboard using AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch. Insights from the dashboard can help teams to track, inspect, and ingest continuous improvement toward operational excellence. Explore features such as machine learning (ML)–based anomaly detection to help identify abnormal usage patterns; a dark launching technique to help experiment with new, innovative features; and multi-tenant cost allocations based on usage. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this builders' session would be:

1. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.
2. Understanding of software architecture principles and best practices.
3. Experience with developing and deploying workloads on AWS.
4. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and techniques.
5. Willingness to actively participate and bring a laptop to the session.

title: Observability-driven development [REPEAT]
description: Operational excellence is a must-have for a well-architected workload and is integral to delivering a fault-tolerant, resilient, and performant workload. In this builders’ session, learn architectural best practices to help develop a workload health dashboard using AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch. Insights from the dashboard can help teams to track, inspect, and ingest continuous improvement toward operational excellence. Explore features such as machine learning (ML)–based anomaly detection to help identify abnormal usage patterns; a dark launching technique to help experiment with new, innovative features; and multi-tenant cost allocations based on usage. 1. Familiarity with AWS services and architecture
2. Basic understanding of cloud computing concepts
3. Proficiency in programming or scripting languages
4. Experience with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch
5. Interest in developing a workload health dashboard

title: Observability-driven development [REPEAT]
description: Operational excellence is a must-have for a well-architected workload and is integral to delivering a fault-tolerant, resilient, and performant workload. In this builders’ session, learn architectural best practices to help develop a workload health dashboard using AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch. Insights from the dashboard can help teams to track, inspect, and ingest continuous improvement toward operational excellence. title: Observability strategies for Amazon EKS workloads
description: Containerized applications deployed on Amazon EKS present unique observability challenges. This lightning talk explores effective strategies to gain visibility into your Amazon EKS workloads. See a complete observability strategy with AWS services like Amazon CloudWatch Container Insights, application signals, and Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights. See how these services can be used to track down and quickly gain insights into your Amazon EKS workloads. Leave this talk with a toolkit to proactively monitor the health and performance of your Amazon EKS–hosted applications. This talk equips you with the observability foundation needed to ensure reliability and quick issue resolution in your Kubernetes environment.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes and container technologies.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon EKS.
3. Knowledge of observability concepts and monitoring tools.
4. Desire to improve the reliability and performance of Kubernetes-based applications.
5. Interest in leveraging AWS services for comprehensive observability.

title: Observability strategies for distributed applications on AWS
description: In the era of modern, cloud-native applications, distributed systems have become the norm, offering scalability, resilience, and agility. However, with this architectural paradigm shift comes a new set of observability challenges that can hinder effective monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. This talk dives deep into the intricacies of observability in distributed systems and explores strategies for leveraging AWS services to overcome these challenges.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud-native applications and distributed systems
2. Familiarity with observability concepts and challenges
3. Knowledge of AWS services and their capabilities

title: Observability the open source way
description: Interested in using open source tooling for observability? Setting up an effective observability solution with open source tools can be challenging due to their rapid pace of development. AWS offers the flexibility to implement observability with AWS managed versions of open source tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and OpenTelemetry. This session shows how managed open source services enable a standardized approach to instrumentation, collection, and analysis. Discover recommended architecture patterns for each observability stage, including instrumentation with OpenTelemetry, ingestion with Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus and Amazon OpenSearch Service, and insights with Amazon Managed Grafana.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of observability principles and the role of open-source tools.
2. Familiarity with AWS services and their integration with open-source observability tools.
3. Knowledge of instrumentation and data collection using OpenTelemetry.
4. Familiarity with data ingestion and storage using Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus and Amazon OpenSearch Service.
5. Experience with data visualization and analysis using Amazon Managed Grafana.

title: Observing serverless applications (sponsored by Cloudflare)
description: For serverless architectures, traditional monitoring approaches aren’t sufficient for finding the root cause of an issue. Challenges may arise because you don’t own the architecture, serverless applications by nature are ephemeral and stateless, and communication often goes through event brokers. However, moving to a serverless architecture shouldn’t mean that you lose visibility into your application. In this session, learn best practices for serverless observability and how distributed tracing, logs, and metrics from OpenTelemetry can help. Discover how using tools with high cardinality and dimensionality to search and query against everything can help you efficiently identify where problems are located. This presentation is brought to you by Cloudflare, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of serverless architectures
2. Familiarity with traditional monitoring approaches
3. Knowledge of event-driven communication and ephemeral, stateless applications
4. Awareness of the importance of observability in serverless environments
5. Familiarity with distributed tracing, logs, and metrics from OpenTelemetry

title: Onboarding and optimizing AI/ML workloads with Amazon S3 & Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Join this workshop to learn about a solution to onboard and optimize distributed ML training workloads that use Amazon S3. Learn how to use the power of Amazon S3 as scalable storage for different types of ML training workloads, and harness the orchestration capabilities of Amazon EKS. Discover how these services, coupled with the Mountpoint for Amazon S3 CSI driver, enable Kubernetes applications to access S3 objects through a file system interface. Also, for PyTorch workloads, explore the efficient data loading and model checkpointing capabilities of the S3 Connector for PyTorch. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Kubernetes
2. Experience with Amazon S3 and its use cases
3. Understanding of machine learning and data processing workflows
4. Basic knowledge of PyTorch or other ML frameworks

title: Onboarding and optimizing AI/ML workloads with Amazon S3 & Amazon EKS [REPEAT]
description: Join this workshop to learn about a solution to onboard and optimize distributed ML training workloads that use Amazon S3. Learn how to use the power of Amazon S3 as scalable storage for different types of ML training workloads, and harness the orchestration capabilities of Amazon EKS. Discover how these services, coupled with the Mountpoint for Amazon S3 CSI driver, enable Kubernetes applications to access S3 objects through a file system interface. Also, for PyTorch workloads, explore the efficient data loading and model checkpointing capabilities of the S3 Connector for PyTorch. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
2. Familiarity with Amazon S3 and its use cases
3. Experience with machine learning and PyTorch (for the S3 Connector for PyTorch)

title: OpenSearch: A journey from fork to Linux Foundation
description: OpenSearch is an open source search and analytics suite. In 2021, AWS created the OpenSearch project as a fork of Elasticsearch, to preserve a permissively licensed, open source option for all. Since then, the project has matured with a diverse set of contributors and collaborators, over 600 million downloads from a broad user community, and a rapid pace of innovation. In September, AWS donated the project to the Linux Foundation so it could take the next step on its journey with independent governance and leadership. Come hear about OpenSearch’s journey over the last 3 years and what’s next for the project.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of open-source software
2. Familiarity with search and analytics technologies
3. Knowledge of Elasticsearch and its ecosystem
4. Interest in the evolution of open-source projects

title: Open source tools for data-driven innovation on Amazon S3
description: Explore open source tools that make it easier to innovate with your data on Amazon S3. Through whiteboarding examples, this chalk talk offers insights into integrating open source implementations like S3A, S3FileIO, and Mountpoint for Amazon S3 with applications and data pipelines. You discover how to use Amazon S3’s industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance with the community-driven innovation of open source to accelerate machine learning and data processing workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Amazon S3
2. Familiarity with open-source tools and technologies

title: Operate and scale managed Apache Kafka and Apache Flink clusters
description: Enterprises use Apache Kafka and Apache Flink for an increasing number of mission-critical use cases, real-time analytics, application messaging, and machine learning. As this usage grows in size and scale, so does the criticality, scale, and cost of managing the Kafka and Flink clusters. Learn how AWS customers can achieve the same or higher availability and durability of their growing clusters, both at lower unit costs and with operational simplicity, with Amazon MSK and Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Apache Kafka and Apache Flink
2. Experience with real-time analytics, application messaging, and machine learning
3. Knowledge of the challenges in managing Kafka and Flink clusters at scale
4. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon MSK and Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink
5. Desire to achieve higher availability, durability, and cost-effectiveness in managing Kafka and Flink clusters

title: Operating your fleet of resources at scale is easier than you think!
description: In the past, operating a fleet of AWS, multicloud, and on-premises resources across an organization and at scale often required many tools and manual processes. Increase efficiency and reduce costs with automation. In this session, you learn how AWS Systems Manager, Amazon CloudWatch, and other AWS services can be used across your compute fleets to easily automate and manage your resources. Thousands of AWS customers already use these services to operate millions of resources across their AWS, multicloud, on-premises, and even Internet of Things (IoT) fleets for patching, application deployment, issue resolution, and much more. Now AWS has made it even easier!

2. Understanding of multicloud and on-premises infrastructure management
3. Experience with automation and orchestration tools
4. Knowledge of AWS Systems Manager and Amazon CloudWatch

description: In this chalk talk, learn how operational practices such as logging, health checks, and safe deployment affect the resilience of well-architected applications. Explore use cases demonstrating potential implications of poor operational practices on system availability and analyze these use cases in line with well-architected principles. Learn about improvement strategies and best practices to enhance the resilience of your AWS architecture. Session goals include understanding how different operational practices can affect the resilience of well-architected applications, exploring and analyzing different use cases impacting resiliency with AWS experts; and learning about operational best practices in line with well-architected principles to improve resilience of your AWS architecture.

Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS architecture and services
2. Understanding of software development lifecycle and deployment practices
3. Basic knowledge of system monitoring and logging

description: Contact center optimization is essential for maintaining a competitive edge, but it can often be a time-consuming and resource-intensive undertaking. In this session, learn how Amazon Connect's AI-powered optimization features empower supervisors and managers to more easily handle forecasting, capacity planning, scheduling, agent coaching, and quality management. Learn from a customer's real-world experience on leveraging these features for unparalleled efficiency.

title: Optimize clinical documentation with generative AI: NextGen case study
description: Healthcare providers face mounting documentation burdens, leading to burnout and poor patient experience. This chalk talk explores how to use services like Amazon Bedrock to develop generative AI–powered solutions targeting tasks like ICD-10 coding, lab and diagnostic orders, and medication orders. As a real-world case study, explore how NextGen Healthcare approached their generative AI–powered solution using advanced NLP and ML to alleviate this critical issue in healthcare documentation.

title: Optimize cost & performance in Amazon RDS & RDS Custom for SQL Server
description: Cost and performance are top of mind for customers, and these topics go hand in hand. In this chalk talk, learn to deploy a performant and cost-effective Amazon RDS for SQL Server or Amazon RDS Custom for SQL Server solution to fit your needs. title: Optimize cost-performance using Amazon SageMaker Inference
description: Amazon SageMaker’s inference optimization toolkit helps reduce how long it takes to optimize foundation models and achieve the best price performance for your use case. You can choose from a menu of optimization techniques, apply them to your models, validate performance improvements, and deploy the models in a few clicks. Employing techniques like speculative decoding, quantization, and compilation, SageMaker Inference delivers up to two times higher throughput while reducing costs by up to 50% for models like Llama 3, Mistral, and Mixtral. It significantly reduces engineering costs by eliminating the need for research, experimentation, and benchmarking predeployment resources for developers.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the described capabilities of Amazon SageMaker's inference optimization toolkit would be:

1. Knowledge of foundation models
2. Familiarity with optimization techniques like speculative decoding, quantization, and compilation
3. Understanding of model deployment and performance requirements
4. Experience with cost optimization and price-performance trade-offs
5. Familiarity with engineering workflows and resources required for model optimization

title: Optimize data lifecycle management for regulatory compliance at scale
description: Financial institutions want to take advantage of the exponential growth of data while also complying with regulatory requirements. In this chalk talk, learn how you can effectively manage your data lifecycle, from the data lake to regulatory compliance. Explore a solution that persists Oracle databases in Amazon S3 while leveraging AWS Lake Formation for granular entitlements. Streamline workforce management through AWS IAM Identity Center with permission sets for access controls. Also, dive deep into Iceberg tables, which enable concurrent row-level operations—including inserts, updates, and deletions—to meet regulatory retention obligations and provide atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability (ACID) transactions to maintain data integrity.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk may include:

1. Understanding of data management principles and data lifecycle management.
2. Familiarity with Oracle databases and Amazon S3 storage.
3. Knowledge of AWS services, such as AWS Lake Formation and AWS IAM Identity Center.
4. Familiarity with Iceberg tables and ACID transactions.
5. Experience in regulatory compliance and data governance.

title: Optimize data processing with built-in AWS Step Functions features
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to optimize your serverless data processing workflows at scale. Dive into utilizing AWS Step Functions and its features, including intrinsic functions and Distributed Map state. Review common applications and examples of these features to understand when to use them, and learn how they can help you save processing time, resources, and money. Gain insights on how to efficiently orchestrate and parallelize your data processing pipelines using powerful Step Functions capabilities.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly AWS Lambda and AWS Step Functions.
2. Understanding of serverless computing and data processing concepts.
3. Basic knowledge of AWS IAM (Identity and Access Management) and permissions.
4. Familiarity with data processing workflows and pipeline orchestration.
5. Experience with programming languages used in AWS Lambda functions (e.g., Python, Node.js).

title: Optimized RAG pipelines using AWS Graviton: VectorDB and LLM endpoints
description: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) enhances generative AI inference by augmenting pretrained FMs and LLMs with current information that is contextual and relevant to the query. Learn from AWS experts about efficient RAG deployment options for use cases that optimize cloud resource usage and costs. Graviton-based instances are designed to deliver the best price performance for cloud workloads running in Amazon EC2 and use up to 60% less energy than comparable instances for the same performance. Learn what’s possible when using AWS Graviton to power your RAG-optimized generative AI inference workloads.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and its role in enhancing generative AI inference.
2. Knowledge of AWS cloud services and deployment options.
3. Familiarity with Graviton-based instances and their advantages for cloud workloads.
4. Experience with optimizing cloud resource usage and costs.
5. Interest in leveraging AWS Graviton to power RAG-optimized generative AI inference workloads.

title: Optimize FMs with AWS purpose-built accelerators for industry apps
description: Join this workshop to learn how to use AWS purpose-built accelerators and Amazon SageMaker to optimize FMs from Hugging Face for real-world industry use cases. Learn how to effectively utilize AWS purpose-built accelerators to train the models, enabling more efficient deployment and inference on a sample platform. This workshop also focuses on cost optimization and ROI from utilizing these accelerators for training and inference. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Basic understanding of machine learning and natural language processing.
2. Familiarity with Hugging Face models and their usage.
3. Knowledge of AWS services, particularly Amazon SageMaker and AWS purpose-built accelerators.
4. Experience with cost optimization and deployment strategies in the cloud.
5. Ability to work with a laptop during the workshop.

title: Optimize gen AI apps with durable semantic caching in Amazon MemoryDB
description: Generative AI has introduced new query patterns as customers seek to leverage their data to customize customer experiences. With new vector search query patterns, vector data types and indexing, there's now a new frontier to consider for performance and cost optimization. In this session, learn how you can use Amazon MemoryDB to reduce latencies to single-digit milliseconds from single-digit seconds in generative AI workloads using durable semantic caching, while also reducing the cost incurred from your foundation models.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Knowledge of Generative AI and its applications
2. Understanding of vector search queries and vector data types
3. Familiarity with performance and cost optimization techniques
4. Awareness of Amazon MemoryDB and its capabilities
5. Experience with durable semantic caching and its benefits

title: Optimize multi-tenant serverless architectures for agility and scale
description: In this session, explore key best practices for building multi-tenant solutions using AWS serverless services. Dive deep into leveraging AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, and Amazon EventBridge to achieve data isolation while scaling with performance efficiency. Learn how a serverless-first approach enables faster time-to-market for multi-tenant architectures. Leave with practical insights into designing and implementing serverless multi-tenant solutions that ensure proper data separation and meet scalability and performance requirements.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS serverless services (AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, Amazon EventBridge)
2. Familiarity with cloud architecture and design principles
3. Experience with software development and deployment

title: Optimize performance and cost for archival data in Amazon S3
description: Amazon S3 storage classes deliver the best price-performance object storage and are uniquely architected to deliver industry-leading functionality. In this chalk talk, learn how to analyze data access frequencies with native S3 tools, optimize archival storage using the S3 Glacier storage classes, and automate storage cost savings with S3 Lifecycle policies and S3 Intelligent-Tiering. Also explore how to get the best price-performance and integrate data restore processes into applications when designing and implementing archival restore workflows for data in the S3 Glacier storage classes, including through the use of S3 Batch Operations to make restores even faster and S3 Event Notifications to increase process efficiency.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given chalk talk:

1. Understanding of Amazon S3 storage classes and their characteristics.
2. Familiarity with S3 Glacier storage classes and archival data management.
3. Knowledge of S3 Lifecycle policies and S3 Intelligent-Tiering.
4. Experience with data restore processes and integration into applications.
5. Familiarity with S3 Batch Operations and S3 Event Notifications.

title: Optimize performance with observability, security, and log analytics
description: In today’s data-driven world, effective monitoring and log analytics are crucial for managing performance, ensuring reliability, and resolving issues efficiently. Join this session to discover how Amazon OpenSearch Service optimizes application performance and enhances reliability with advanced observability capabilities, including distributed tracing, real-time metrics collection, and customizable dashboards. Learn how to use OpenSearch Service security features such as fine-grained access control, encryption, and audit logging to protect your data and ensure compliance. Gain practical insights into optimizing performance, securing your data infrastructure, and efficiently managing your OpenSearch Service cluster to ensure your applications run smoothly and efficiently.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Basic understanding of application monitoring and log analytics.
2. Familiarity with cloud-based data services and infrastructure.
3. Interest in optimizing application performance and enhancing reliability.
4. Desire to learn about advanced observability capabilities, such as distributed tracing and real-time metrics collection.
5. Need to secure and manage data infrastructure, including access control, encryption, and audit logging.

Proactively diagnose and resolve errors and networking issues, provide guidance on architectural best practices, analyze billing information and trends, and use natural language in chat to manage resources in your AWS account.
