Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud networking concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and security features
3. Knowledge of network security best practices
4. Experience in implementing and managing security controls
5. Desire to align security strategy with the principle of least privilege

title: Reducing cost by optimizing your supply chain [English]
description: This lightning talk is delivered in English. Optimize supply chain with data: Increase visibility into the complete supply chain to improve the accuracy of demand forecasting, improve warehouse logistics, and mitigate risks. Join to learn more about this topic from an EMEA perspective.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of supply chain management
2. Familiarity with data analysis and optimization techniques
3. Interest in improving supply chain efficiency from an EMEA perspective

title: Reducing hallucinations in your generative AI applications
description: While LLMs are getting better at producing factually correct answers to prompts with scientific advancements, they are still susceptible to generating wrong statements known as hallucinations. This is one of the biggest practical obstacles that organizations face when they are deciding whether they can trust and deploy their generative AI application. In this workshop, learn how to detect and reduce hallucinations. Take advantage of the best available techniques and latest features, including prompt templates, fact-checking models, and retrieval augmented fine-tuning in services such as Amazon Bedrock and Amazon SageMaker, leading to measurably enhanced truthfulness. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this workshop would be:

1. Basic understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs)
2. Familiarity with the concept of hallucinations in AI systems
3. Interest in deploying generative AI applications
4. Access to a laptop to participate in the hands-on activities

title: Reducing the risk of sensitive data exposure [REPEAT]
description: As a data steward, you are responsible for the lifecycle of data in your data lake. You must ensure that sensitive data does not unintentionally enter your data lake or become exposed. In this hands-on builders’ session, learn to apply techniques like data masking, filtering, and redaction. Discover how to scan for sensitive data, redact it, and store the redacted data in your data lake. Also learn how to mask sensitive data in use and apply redaction on existing data. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management principles
2. Familiarity with data lake architecture
3. Basic knowledge of data security and privacy concepts
4. Ability to work with data processing tools and technologies
5. Hands-on experience with data manipulation and transformation

description: As a data steward, you are responsible for the lifecycle of data in your data lake. You must ensure that sensitive data does not unintentionally enter your data lake or become exposed. In this hands-on builders’ session, learn to apply techniques like data masking, filtering, and redaction. Discover how to scan for sensitive data, redact it, and store the redacted data in your data lake. Also learn how to mask sensitive data in use and apply redaction on existing data. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data management principles
2. Familiarity with data lake architecture
3. Basic knowledge of data security and privacy concepts
4. Proficiency in using data processing tools and technologies
5. Ability to work with a laptop during the hands-on session

title: Refactoring Java applications to serverless
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to refactor three common enterprise design patterns to use serverless services. Learn how to use Amazon EventBridge Scheduler and AWS Lambda for scheduled tasks, Amazon API Gateway and Lambda to handle synchronous web service requests, and Amazon SQS and Lambda to work through asynchronous tasks. Using these patterns, this talk dives deep into the architectural trade-offs of where and when you should separate business functionality into separate Lambda functions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of enterprise design patterns
2. Familiarity with AWS services (Amazon EventBridge Scheduler, AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, Amazon SQS)
3. Experience with serverless architecture
4. Knowledge of architectural trade-offs and decision-making

title: Refactor mainframe applications faster with AI and managed services
description: Innovations in AI open up opportunities to refactor legacy applications such as COBOL, RPG, and others to modern languages like Java faster and more efficiently than before. Discover how AWS Mainframe Modernization Refactor with AWS Blu Age uses generative AI, AI, and fully managed cloud services for assessment, transformation, project management, and compliance. Learn about the scalability, reliability, security, and agility enabled by the fully managed service environments, and hear from Transamerica on how they have refactored mainframe applications with AWS Blu Age.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of legacy programming languages (COBOL, RPG, etc.)
2. Knowledge of modern programming languages (Java, etc.)
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
4. Experience in application modernization and refactoring
5. Awareness of AI and generative AI technologies

title: Refine RAG performance: Use Unstructured for enhanced data ingestion (sponsored by Unstructured)
description: Globally, more than half of organizations have increased their investment in generative AI programs over the past year, but the rise of this transformational technology presents a massive data challenge. While the advent of the modern data stack over the past decade unlocked structured data for advanced analytics, until now, there hasn’t been an equivalent set of tooling for the more than 80% of enterprise data that is unstructured. Join this lightning talk to discover how Unstructured is addressing this critical gap and how it can ingest and pre-process all unstructured data into formats ready for use with foundation models. This presentation is brought to you by Unstructured, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data types (structured and unstructured)
2. Familiarity with the modern data stack and its limitations
3. Knowledge of foundation models and their applications
4. Interest in advancements in generative AI and its impact on organizations
5. Awareness of the need for tools to process unstructured data

title: Reflection room
description: The reflection room provides a dark, quiet space for meditation, prayer, or yoga, or to find resources for sensory needs. The room is equipped with semiprivate meditation pods, prayer rugs, yoga mats, comfortable seating, puzzles, and coloring supplies. The reflection room also includes sensory bags containing noise-cancelling headphones, fidget tools, and other resources for attendees with sensory needs, and a sensory tent that provides a safe and calming environment to help attendees that might be feeling overwhelmed or overstimulated.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Dedicated space for the reflection room
2. Appropriate lighting and acoustic considerations
3. Availability of meditation pods, prayer rugs, yoga mats, and other necessary equipment
4. Provision of sensory bags and a sensory tent
5. Staffing or supervision to ensure the proper use and maintenance of the reflection room

title: Reimagine a mainframe application using generative AI
description: Are you looking to transform your mainframe COBOL applications? In this builders’ session, learn practical techniques to migrate your legacy batch workflows into a modern, event-driven architecture using the power of generative AI and AWS Mainframe Modernization tools. Discover how to reduce the time and effort required to migrate COBOL applications to the cloud, and learn hands-on methods for automating code and data conversion using the latest AI/ML technologies. Don’t miss this opportunity to accelerate your cloud migration journey. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with COBOL programming
2. Experience with legacy batch workflows
3. Interest in cloud migration and modernization
4. Basic understanding of event-driven architecture
5. Laptop for hands-on participation

title: Reimagine business intelligence with generative AI
description: In this session, get an overview of the generative AI capabilities of Amazon Q in QuickSight. Learn how analysts can build interactive dashboards rapidly, and discover how business users can use natural language to instantly create documents and presentations explaining data and extract insights beyond what’s available in dashboards with data Q&A and executive summaries.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data visualization and business intelligence tools.
2. Familiarity with Amazon QuickSight or similar data analytics platforms.
3. Familiarity with natural language processing and generative AI concepts.

title: Reimagine customer service for financial services with Amazon Connect
description: In this chalk talk, you will discover how to deliver re-imagined customer service interactions for Financial Services use cases using Amazon Connect. Attend this session to learn how to apply artificial intelligence (AI) to deliver faster, more accurate financial services interactions, including processing, fraud reduction, and improved experience for your customers and agents.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of customer service and contact center operations.
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services.
3. Knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) and its applications in financial services.

title: Reimagine developer experience using Amazon Q Developer
description: In this lab, onboard the Amazon Q Developer service to your IDE. As a developer tasked with optimizing an existing e-wallet application, use Amazon Q Developer generative AI tools to develop, fix, and enhance the code base. This includes leveraging prompt engineering to generate unit tests, add new features, optimize the application code to meet application requirements, and support accelerated development activities. Workstations are provided for you; a laptop is not required.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Amazon Q Developer service
2. Experience in prompt engineering and generative AI tools
3. Knowledge of e-wallet application development
4. Understanding of unit testing and code optimization techniques
5. Familiarity with accelerated software development practices

title: Reimagine your mainframe applications with generative AI
description: In scenarios where reimagining a mainframe application is the best approach for modernization, the complexities involved in extracting business rules, decomposing monolithic codebases, transforming legacy code, and comprehensive testing can pose daunting hurdles. During this session, discover how generative AI services including Amazon Bedrock can introduce intelligence and automation into your modernization journey, helping you overcome these challenges. This can also make the process of reimagining and transforming mainframe systems more flexible and dependable. Also explore how AWS customer, U.S. GSA, used generative AI tooling to accelerate mainframe application modernization and reduce costs and risks.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the session would be:

1. Understanding of mainframe application modernization challenges.
2. Familiarity with generative AI services, such as Amazon Bedrock.
3. Interest in exploring how generative AI can be leveraged for mainframe application modernization.
4. Awareness of the U.S. GSA's experience in using generative AI for mainframe application modernization.

title: Reimagining IT: From cost center to innovative product builder
description: This session shares insights from Amazon's enterprise-wide approach to product management, covering core elements like product-driven mental models, defining the product manager role, organizing and enabling product teams, and applying customer-centric strategies for aligning priorities. Discover how an iterative approach to launching and scaling products and services drives innovation. Explore the power of finding insights in exceptions, using data to drive behavior change, and leveraging generative AI for personalized analytics. Gain a fresh perspective on transforming IT from a helpdesk to a product builder, fundamentally reimagining the cloud as a driver of value-added services and industry-first offerings.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of product management principles and practices
2. Familiarity with enterprise-level organizational structures and processes
3. Experience in data-driven decision making and customer-centric strategies
4. Knowledge of cloud computing and its role in product development
5. Openness to exploring innovative approaches to IT transformation

title: Reimagining product culture: Scaling and migration on AWS with Smarsh (sponsored by Smarsh)
description: Smarsh, a leader in communications intelligence, transformed its platform product culture while migrating to Amazon EKS. This lightning talk explores Smarsh’s approach to scaling and resilience by migrating from VMware Tanzu to Amazon EKS, enhancing observability, ensuring consistent deployments, and implementing self-healing services. Learn how the formation of product-focused teams within the platform engineering framework fostered a culture of customer-centricity, ownership, and continuous innovation, ensuring Smarsh continues to meet evolving customer needs. This presentation is brought to you by Smarsh, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of VMware Tanzu
2. Understanding of platform engineering frameworks
3. Familiarity with Amazon EKS
4. Experience with observability and self-healing services
5. Background in product-focused team structures and customer-centric culture

title: Reimagining the developer experience at AWS
description: Software development is undergoing a huge shift driven by generative AI, which is transforming how developers work, what they build, and who can become a developer. AWS empowers developers to fearlessly embrace this evolution, integrating cutting-edge yet responsible generative AI agents across the development lifecycle. In this talk, explore real-world use cases that accelerate legacy modernization, elevate cloud-native innovation, and unlock remarkable results. Gain insights into the pragmatic approach by AWS that fuels creativity and customer impact. Generative AI agents are redefining software development, opening new frontiers for innovation, and democratizing access to coding for diverse creators, shaping technology’s future.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of software development principles and practices
2. Basic knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services
3. Familiarity with generative AI and its applications in software development

title: Reimagining Toyota’s supply chain with AI on AWS (sponsored by IBM)
description: Businesses that adopt digital-first operations by combining AI, analytics, and data can drive competitive advantage and growth. In this session, learn how leading organizations such as Toyota are using IBM’s consulting expertise and AI capabilities to reinvent their supply chain and drive better customer engagement. In addition, hear from experts on the key drivers of effective and trusted generative AI. This presentation is brought to you by IBM, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Understanding of AI and analytics
2. Interest in supply chain optimization and customer engagement
3. Familiarity with IBM's consulting services and AI capabilities
4. Awareness of the importance of effective and trusted generative AI
5. Familiarity with AWS and its partner ecosystem

title: Reinventing entertainment
description: The entertainment industry is undergoing a seismic shift, driven by changing audience preferences and new technologies. Organizations are innovating with AWS to captivate audiences through video, gaming, music, and film. Generational preferences for user-generated content and livestreaming have accelerated this evolution, with gaming emerging as a dominant force. Additionally, generative AI is revolutionizing the industry, enabling innovation in advertising, content monetization, and experiences. As consumers demand more interactive experiences, traditional companies are diversifying and exploring new partnerships. Attend this talk to gain insights into the latest trends and learn how industry leaders are using cloud technologies to enhance engagement and monetization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of the entertainment industry and its evolving landscape.
2. Familiarity with the impact of new technologies on audience preferences and industry trends.
3. Knowledge of cloud computing and its applications in the entertainment industry.
4. Awareness of the role of generative AI in transforming the industry.
5. Interest in exploring innovative approaches to engagement and monetization in the entertainment sector.

title: Relax and let the data flow: A zero-ETL pipeline [REPEAT]
description: Discover how to build a real-time data visualization pipeline using Amazon OpenSearch Service, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon DynamoDB, without the complexity of traditional ETL processes. Learn how to use Amazon Redshift and OpenSearch Ingestion to efficiently process and transform data, and implement a serverless architecture using AWS CDK. Explore how this zero-ETL solution can enable faster, more informed decision-making by letting you focus on deriving insights from data rather than managing infrastructure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of data pipelines and data processing
2. Familiarity with AWS services (Amazon OpenSearch Service, Amazon Redshift, Amazon DynamoDB, AWS CDK)
3. Experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript)

title: Relax and let the data flow: A zero-ETL pipeline [REPEAT]
description: Discover how to build a real-time data visualization pipeline using Amazon OpenSearch Service, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon DynamoDB, without the complexity of traditional ETL processes. Learn how to use Amazon Redshift and OpenSearch Ingestion to efficiently process and transform data, and implement a serverless architecture using AWS CDK. Explore how this zero-ETL solution can enable faster, more informed decision-making by letting you focus on deriving insights from data rather than managing infrastructure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of data engineering concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services (Amazon OpenSearch Service, Amazon Redshift, Amazon DynamoDB)
3. Experience with AWS CDK (Cloud Development Kit)

title: Replatforming for reinvention: Modernizing mainframes at Goldman Sachs
description: Goldman Sachs’ asset management ledger, InvestOne, is the heart of their middle office and responsible for calculating and maintaining their investment portfolio positions. In this session, Goldman Sachs walks through how they migrated this mission-critical mainframe while overcoming challenges such as scale, cost, and technical debt. Gain insights into their COBOL development and deployment framework, as well as how they expedited the migration without compromising their commitment to their customers and business. Learn how their platform ensures scalability, availability, and security using Amazon EBS, AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery, and Amazon RDS and establishes a path for future migrations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Understanding of financial services industry and investment portfolio management.
2. Knowledge of mainframe systems and COBOL development.
3. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
4. Interest in large-scale system migrations and overcoming technical debt.
5. Desire to learn about enterprise-level migration strategies and best practices.

title: re:Play party
description: Eat. Drink. Party. Unwind. Year after year AWS re:Invent brings in some of the best talent for the re:Play party. Enjoy a dynamic musical lineup with a live band and noteworthy DJ performances. If you need a break from the tunes, relax in our central courtyard, skate the night away on the new roller-skating rink, play an AI drawing game, or compete in giant four in a row. Shuttles to the Las Vegas Festival Grounds start at 7:00 PM.
prerequisites:
1. Attend AWS re:Invent conference
2. Obtain a ticket or pass for the re:Play party
3. Be present at the event location (Las Vegas Festival Grounds)

title: Resilience of AWS Cloud [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, discover how AWS builds an AWS Region, starting from a two-data-center environment and adding infrastructure until it becomes a complete Region. Learn about the resilience benefits this infrastructure provides. Learn how AWS services sit on top of the physical infrastructure and are designed to be resilient. Explore how our service teams operate the services and the mechanisms used to keep them running. Ask questions and get answers about the resilience of AWS infrastructure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the "In this chalk talk, discover how AWS builds an AWS Region, starting from a two-data-center environment and adding infrastructure until it becomes a complete Region. title: Resilience of AWS Cloud [REPEAT]
description: In this chalk talk, discover how AWS builds an AWS Region, starting from a two-data-center environment and adding infrastructure until it becomes a complete Region. Learn about the resilience benefits this infrastructure provides. Learn how AWS services sit on top of the physical infrastructure and are designed to be resilient. Explore how our service teams operate the services and the mechanisms used to keep them running. Ask questions and get answers about the resilience of AWS infrastructure.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with data center infrastructure and networking.
3. Knowledge of high availability and fault tolerance principles.

title: Resilience solutions for cohesive application protection
description: AWS services often have their own resiliency solutions. However, applications can span multiple AWS resources and creating a unified runbook for addressing business continuity events can be daunting. In this code talk, discover several common architectures comprising multiple AWS services resources and learn the best ways to create cohesive and simple resiliency plans.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AWS services and their resiliency solutions.
2. Knowledge of application architecture and how to design solutions that span multiple AWS resources.
3. Familiarity with business continuity planning and disaster recovery strategies.
4. Experience in creating and implementing runbooks or playbooks for incident response.
5. Familiarity with AWS networking, security, and monitoring services.

title: Resilient and resourceful: Balance compute resiliency and costs
description: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling helps you maintain application availability and automatically add or remove Amazon EC2 instances using scaling policies that you define. In this chalk talk, dive deep into Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling innovations and best practices designed to increase the resiliency of your applications while meeting your cost-efficiency objectives. Learn how your deployment patterns and tools such as Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling instance maintenance policy and instance refresh rollback can help you achieve the exact balance of healthy compute capacity needed.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk on Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling would be:

1. Understanding of Amazon EC2 and its basic concepts.
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and scalability.
3. Familiarity with AWS services and their integration.
4. Experience in application deployment and management.
5. Awareness of cost optimization strategies in the cloud.

title: Resilient by design: Building robust disaster recovery on AWS
description: In today’s always-on business environment, having a reliable disaster recovery (DR) strategy is essential. In this chalk talk, explore how to use the power of AWS to build a robust, resilient DR architecture for your applications and data. Learn proven techniques for implementing multi-Region failover, automating failover and failback processes, and ensuring seamless business continuity. Discover how to use AWS services like AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery to create a comprehensive, cost-effective DR solution. Walk away with an actionable blueprint to design, implement, and test your AWS powered disaster recovery plan, ensuring your organization can withstand even the most severe disruptions.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services.
2. Basic knowledge of disaster recovery planning and business continuity strategies.
3. Familiarity with AWS networking and security services.
4. Experience in application architecture and deployment on AWS.
5. Familiarity with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery or similar disaster recovery services.

title: Resilient cloud, rapid response: Incident management on AWS
description: This chalk talk helps attendees learn incident management on AWS by leveraging key services such as AWS Systems Manager (SSM) Incident Manager and Automation. Attendees learn how to utilize Incident Manager to streamline the entire incident response lifecycle, from rapid detection to automated remediation. Additionally, the session addresses security benefits including enhanced operational security and auditing through Amazon CloudWatch logs. Learn how to use automation to simplify resiliency operations. Through live demos and best practices, attendees gain the knowledge and tools necessary to establish a robust, scalable, and security-focused incident response approach for their AWS-powered cloud operations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and cloud computing concepts
2. Understanding of incident management and incident response processes
3. Basic knowledge of AWS Systems Manager and AWS Automation

title: Reskilling at the speed of cloud: Turning employees into entrepreneurs
description: The cloud unleashes your organization’s talent to innovate at speed, but there’s a challenge. With people at the heart of agile organizations, how do you establish the skills you need throughout your company, from the boardroom down, in order to release this potential? In this session, find out why agility is at the heart of digital transformation and why it can be a powerful measure of your organization’s future success. Learn about patterns and approaches that can help you create the time and momentum to reskill your entire organization, so you can capitalize on the potential of the cloud.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding the importance of agility in digital transformation
2. Recognizing the need for skills development throughout the organization
3. Willingness to invest in reskilling and upskilling initiatives
4. Commitment to creating a culture that embraces continuous learning and adaptation
5. Familiarity with patterns and approaches for effective organizational reskilling

title: Responding to cloud incidents: Tales from the front lines (sponsored by CrowdStrike)
description: As teams accelerate their cloud adoption, threat actors are quickly learning how to use cloud-specific features to gain access to your resources and disrupt operations. To maintain a high security bar, security teams must understand how unauthorized users leverage cloud features to reach their targets. In this session, learn about the cloud-specific tactics, techniques, and practices recently observed by CrowdStrike’s incident response teams, and explore best practices for prevention, detection, and response. See a brief demo of threat hunting queries that can reveal malicious behavior in the cloud environment. This presentation is brought to you by CrowdStrike, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and cloud-based infrastructure
2. Knowledge of common cloud security threats and vulnerabilities
3. Familiarity with incident response and threat hunting processes
4. Awareness of CrowdStrike's services and their partnership with AWS

title: Responsible AI: From theory to practice with AWS
description: The rapid growth of generative AI brings promising innovation but raises new challenges around its safe and responsible development and use. While challenges like bias and explainability were common before generative AI, large language models bring new challenges like hallucination, toxicity, and intellectual property protection. Join this session to understand how your organization can begin its responsible AI journey. Get an overview of the challenges related to generative AI and learn about the responsible AI in action at AWS, including the approach taken by AWS and the tools it offers.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with the recent advancements in generative AI, such as large language models.
3. Interest in exploring the challenges and considerations around the responsible development and use of generative AI.
4. Desire to learn about the approaches and tools offered by AWS for responsible AI.

title: Responsible AI with Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
description: As AI systems become more ubiquitous, ensuring their responsible development and deployment is crucial. This lightning talk explores the power of Amazon Bedrock Guardrails and how it can be used to promote ethical and trustworthy AI practices. Learn how Amazon Bedrock Guardrails can benefit everyday users, from mitigating biases to upholding privacy and security standards.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AI systems and their increasing prevalence
2. Awareness of the importance of responsible AI development and deployment
3. Knowledge of Amazon Bedrock Guardrails and its capabilities
4. Interest in exploring ethical and trustworthy AI practices

title: Responsible generative AI [REPEAT]
description: As companies use generative AI workloads in the cloud, it is imperative to align with environmental, social, and governance principles for sustainable growth. In this lightning talk, explore how to transform responsible AI from theory into practice, avoid unintended harm, which is crucial for maintaining public trust, and steer innovation responsibly. Learn how AWS takes a comprehensive approach to responsible AI, spanning safety, fairness, explainability, veracity, privacy, governance, transparency, and controllability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of generative AI and its applications in the cloud.
2. Knowledge of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) principles.
3. Awareness of the importance of responsible AI and maintaining public trust.
4. Familiarity with AWS's approach to responsible AI.
5. Interest in learning how to transform responsible AI from theory into practice.

title: Responsible generative AI tabletop: Strategy creation [REPEAT]
description: Explore the ethical dimensions of AI governance and join forces with top-tier executives to steer the course of a fictional organization's generative AI journey through high-stakes decision-making. This immersive experience offers a rare chance to glean insights and lessons typically accrued over years, empowering participants to refine their management approaches, crystallize visionary strategies, and champion responsible generative AI practices. Seize the opportunity to deepen your understanding of ethical generative AI usage and pave the way for impactful and sustainable generative AI innovation within your own organizational framework.

2. Interest in generative AI and its governance
3. Experience in decision-making and management

description: Immerse yourself in the world of artificial intelligence governance with a “generative AI from a board perspective,” tabletop. Join fellow industry luminaries in shaping the strategic trajectory of a fictional organization's generative AI initiatives through board-level decision-making. This engaging exercise offers a unique opportunity to glean insights and lessons typically garnered through years of experience, empowering participants to refine their oversight approaches, crystallize visionary strategies, and fortify their organizations against emerging AI risks. Don't miss this chance to accelerate your understanding of generative AI governance dynamics and chart a course toward responsible and impactful AI deployment. You must bring your laptop to participate.

title: Retail revolution: AWS IoT & computer vision for frictionless stores
description: In today’s retail landscape, consumers expect seamless shopping experiences. In this chalk talk, dive into how AWS IoT and Amazon Kinesis Video Streams help retailers enhance in-store interactions using computer vision. Explore how to integrate AWS IoT Core with in-store cameras and sensors and use Kinesis Video Streams for real-time cloud video streaming. By deploying advanced computer vision algorithms, retailers can create automated stores, bypassing traditional checkout processes. This talk covers the architecture of frictionless store solutions and practical strategies for overcoming deployment challenges, illustrating how these technologies boost customer satisfaction and operational efficiency in contemporary retail settings.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of retail industry trends and customer expectations
2. Knowledge of AWS IoT and Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
3. Familiarity with computer vision and its applications in retail
4. Experience in integrating IoT devices and sensors with cloud platforms
5. Understanding of real-time video streaming and processing

description: Imagine a world where every customer call is answered instantly, issues are resolved swiftly without any human intervention, and the entire experience feels personal and seamless. In this builders’ session, develop a fully automated generative AI assistant, harnessing the power of Amazon MemoryDB vector search capabilities to provide an unparalleled customer experience at high speed and recall rates. You must bring your laptop to participate.

Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with generative AI models
2. Understanding of Amazon MemoryDB and vector search capabilities
3. Experience in building conversational AI assistants
4. Knowledge of natural language processing and understanding
5. Proficiency in programming languages and development tools

title: Revolutionize Kubernetes management with Zesty's optimization platform (sponsored by Zesty)
description: Discover how Zesty’s cloud optimization platform is transforming Kubernetes management with advanced insights and automation. Learn about Zesty’s unique approach and innovative solutions to cut costs and optimize resource utilization, including cluster headroom reduction, PVC auto scaling for block storage, and Amazon EC2 Spot Instance automation. Join us to explore how these features can significantly lower your Kubernetes costs and enhance the efficiency of your cloud infrastructure. This presentation is brought to you by Zesty, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
2. Familiarity with cloud infrastructure and cost optimization
3. Interest in advanced Kubernetes management solutions

title: Revolutionize mission experiences through targeted digital engagement
description: Nonprofits face many challenges when engaging with members. Embracing emerging technologies and trends and promoting personalized and targeted messaging can simplify and scale mission outreach and impact. In this chalk talk, see a whiteboarding session on how digital engagement platforms built on state-of-the-art data and personalization ML services, generative AI, and omnichannel technologies can deliver targeted mission experiences. Bring your use cases, such as improving fundraising campaigns, retaining donors, increasing member outreach, enhancing member experiences, and others, to this talk to explore. Leave this talk with reference architectures, tools, technologies, and lessons learned from other nonprofits to help you become a digital thought leader in your organization.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of nonprofit operations and challenges
2. Familiarity with emerging technologies (e.g., data and personalization ML services, generative AI, omnichannel technologies)
3. Interest in leveraging digital engagement platforms to enhance mission outreach and impact
4. Willingness to share and explore use cases (e.g., fundraising, donor retention, member outreach, member experiences)
5. Desire to become a digital thought leader within the nonprofit organization

title: Revolutionize your search applications for generative AI
description: Join this session to discover how vector search can revolutionize your business's search capabilities compared to traditional keyword search. Vector search plays a critical role in enhancing generative AI applications and solutions by enabling more accurate and context-aware search results. During this session, explore the implementation of vector search using Amazon OpenSearch Service, understanding its advantages in improving search relevance, handling unstructured data, and delivering personalized user experiences. Gain critical insights into practical applications, including enhanced recommendation systems and semantic search, and learn how to address common business challenges more effectively.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of search technologies and their applications in business
2. Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
3. Basic knowledge of data structures and algorithms
4. Awareness of cloud computing services and their capabilities
5. Interest in exploring innovative search solutions for business challenges

title: Revolutionizing compassion: AWS and Vasion automate donor-child review
description: Learn how Vasion and AWS are revolutionizing nonprofit donor communication management to empower diverse communities and promote equitable access to education. Vasion's SaaS platform enables organizations to digitize content and automate workflows. With integrated Amazon Textract and Amazon Comprehend for natural language processing and Amazon Recognition for image/video analysis, the platform is a scalable solution for managing donor-to-child communications and supports underrepresented NPOs like B.A.S.I.C.S. International, located in Ghana. AWS provided technical resources, funding, and GTM support to help Vasion develop and deploy the platform, which also automates content review to ensure transparency and safety in donor-child interactions.
prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of nonprofit organizations and their operations.
2. Knowledge of cloud computing and software-as-a-service (SaaS) platforms.
3. Familiarity with natural language processing, image/video analysis, and workflow automation technologies.
4. Awareness of the challenges faced by underrepresented nonprofit organizations and the importance of promoting equitable access to education.
5. Interest in learning about how technology can be leveraged to revolutionize donor communication management and empower diverse communities.

title: Revolutionizing edge computing: Enhancing resilience and intelligence
description: Edge computing brings data processing closer to the source, reducing latency and bandwidth usage, which is crucial for real-time applications like autonomous vehicles and IoT devices. According to Fortune Business Insights, the global edge computing market size was valued at $15.96 billion in 2023 and is projected to grow from $21.41 billion in 2024 to $216.76 billion by 2032. This underscores the increasing demand for efficient, immediate data processing capabilities and the shift from centralized to distributed computing frameworks. In this session, learn how deploying models and transaction applications at the edge on small form-factor computers can help businesses continue operations during connectivity disruptions, forecast inventory, reduce losses, and improve customer experience through enhanced edge intelligence.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of distributed computing frameworks
2. Knowledge of real-time applications and their requirements
3. Familiarity with edge computing and its benefits
4. Awareness of the growth and potential of the edge computing market
5. Interest in deploying models and transaction applications at the edge

title: Revolutionizing multimodal data search with Amazon Q Business
description: Today’s enterprises deal with data in various formats, including audio, image, video, and text, scattered across different documents. Searching through this diverse content to find useful information is a significant challenge. This workshop explores how Amazon Q Business transforms the way enterprises search and discover data across multiple formats. By utilizing cutting-edge artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, Amazon Q Business helps enterprises navigate their content seamlessly. Find out how this powerful tool accelerates real-world use cases by making it easier to extract actionable insights from multimodal datasets. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with data formats (audio, image, video, text)
2. Interest in enterprise-level data search and discovery
3. Basic understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning
4. Laptop for participation in the workshop

title: Revolutionizing supply chain: Jabil's journey with Amazon Q Business
description: Discover how Jabil, a global manufacturing solutions provider, is harnessing the power of generative AI with Amazon Q Business to transform its supply chain operations. This session explores Jabil's rollout of innovative applications, enhancing factory operations and delivering customer insights across the Jabil supply chain. Gain insights into Jabil's strategies for measuring success, including their goal to use generative AI in new revenue streams. Join us to see how Amazon Q Business and AWS services are helping Jabil build an AI-driven supply chain solution, improving decision-making, efficiency, and market intelligence globally.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of supply chain management and operations
2. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications
3. Familiarity with Amazon Q Business and AWS services
4. Interest in innovative manufacturing solutions and digital transformation
5. Curiosity about Jabil's strategies and experiences in leveraging AI for their supply chain

title: Right-sizing your application services: Rethinking microservices
description: The mental model for microservices has some builders putting excess emphasis on the count of services they have in their system. In this session, learn to better weigh the size, scope, and count of services, and factor in the realities of real-world environments, striking a balance between service consumption profiles/roles and service size, deployment, and operational complexity. Getting this right can simplify implementation, deployment, and operations for a system. It allows teams to use real data to drive their service decomposition and let services earn their way out based on observed bottlenecks and scaling needs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of microservices architecture
2. Familiarity with service decomposition and service design principles
3. Knowledge of real-world deployment and operational challenges

title: Rightsizing your ERP with SAP on AWS (sponsored by SAP)
description: Whether your business needs ready-to-run or a tailored-to-fit cloud ERP, SAP has a solution for you. In this lightning talk, learn how SAP solutions on AWS can transform your business, while maximizing performance and business resilience. This presentation is brought to you by SAP, an AWS Partner.

title: Robotic simulation with NVIDIA Isaac Lab on AWS Batch
description: Simulation-based reinforcement learning (RL) has benefited the field of robotics, helping manufacturers automate complex tasks. With generative AI, robotic simulation has accelerated the development and training of models. NVIDIA Isaac Lab enables RL with realistic physics and high fidelity virtual worlds to train and test robots. This builders’ session dives deep into NVIDIA’s Isaac Lab, AWS Batch, and Amazon EC2 instances powered by NVIDIA GPUs. Through hands-on exercises, learn distributed training for robots across multiple GPU nodes, and explore the crucial sim-to-real transfer, sharing insights and strategies for effectively translating simulation learnings to real-world robotic applications. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with reinforcement learning (RL) concepts and techniques.
2. Basic understanding of robotics and robotic simulation.
3. Experience with Python programming and machine learning frameworks.
4. Access to a laptop to participate in the hands-on exercises.

title: RoboTic-tac-toe [REPEAT]
description: Imagine tic-tac-toe brought to life with dynamic robot movements, engaging gameplay, and celebratory dances. Utilizing two commodity toy robots and AWS IoT, AI/ML, and generative AI services, play tic-tac-toe by instructing the robots in natural language to activate their markers (X or O) on the game board. Players can compete against each other, challenge an LLM, or watch as two LLMs compete against each other.

title: Robust strategies for testing serverless and event-driven workloads
description: Elevate your automated testing skills for serverless and event-driven applications in this highly anticipated, interactive chalk talk. Explore strategies and best practices through code samples and whiteboard demos. Learn techniques like emulation, mocking, and testing in the cloud. Gain insights into common structures and patterns that make your tests effective, useful, and easy to understand. Leave equipped with practical knowledge to future-proof your cloud-native applications by implementing robust automated testing.

Prerequisites:

3. Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud-native application development

title: Rolling with resilience: An AWS tabletop adventure
description: Improving resilience is a continuous process that should be incorporated into how you build and operate applications, and AWS offers a robust arsenal of tools and services to help. In this immersive workshop, embark on a journey through a series of simulated crises, where you’ll assume the roles of various incident response personas. Situations and results change with the roll of the dice. As the story unfolds, discover how AWS services like AWS Resilience Hub, AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery, Fault Injection Service, and more can empower you to bolster your organization’s bulwarks against potential disruptions. title: Run containerized workloads efficiently on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Containers offer scalability and flexibility, enabling seamless deployment, management, and scaling of applications in any environment. Using containers on AWS can help you improve your efficiency and achieve your price performance goals. In this chalk talk, explore how you can take advantage of solutions such as AWS Graviton–based instances and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances to boost the efficiency of your workloads. Learn how to build, test, and deploy containers using a multi-architecture approach that gives you the flexibility to deploy virtually anywhere on AWS with Amazon ECS, Amazon EKS, and AWS Fargate.

Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of containerization and its benefits.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, such as EC2, ECS, EKS, and Fargate.
3. Knowledge of multi-architecture deployment and its advantages.
4. Awareness of AWS Graviton-based instances and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances.
5. Desire to improve the efficiency and cost-effectiveness of your workloads.

title: Run containerized workloads efficiently on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Containers offer scalability and flexibility, enabling seamless deployment, management, and scaling of applications in any environment. Using containers on AWS can help you improve your efficiency and achieve your price performance goals. In this chalk talk, explore how you can take advantage of solutions such as AWS Graviton–based instances and Amazon EC2 Spot Instances to boost the efficiency of your workloads. title: Run high-performing FMs at scale with Amazon SageMaker HyperPod [REPEAT]
description: This workshop explores the end-to-end workflow of managing foundation models (FMs) on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod. The discussion covers four critical aspects: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT), model deployment, and serving. Additionally, dive into operational aspects, including system observability and the resiliency features of Amazon SageMaker HyperPod, such as recovery from failure and job auto-resuming. Leave this hands-on session with a robust understanding of managing and deploying foundation models efficiently on AWS. Learn to use cutting-edge techniques and tools to ensure high performance, reliability, and scalability in FM development. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for this workshop:

1. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and terminology.
2. Basic understanding of AWS services, particularly Amazon SageMaker.
3. Experience with Python programming and working with Jupyter Notebooks.
4. Familiarity with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
5. Ability to bring and use a laptop during the hands-on session.

title: Run high-performing FMs at scale with Amazon SageMaker HyperPod [REPEAT]
description: This workshop explores the end-to-end workflow of managing foundation models (FMs) on Amazon SageMaker HyperPod. The discussion covers four critical aspects: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT), model deployment, and serving. Additionally, dive into operational aspects, including system observability and the resiliency features of Amazon SageMaker HyperPod, such as recovery from failure and job auto-resuming. Leave this hands-on session with a robust understanding of managing and deploying foundation models efficiently on AWS. Learn to use cutting-edge techniques and tools to ensure high performance, reliability, and scalability in FM development. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and foundation models.
2. Experience with Amazon SageMaker or cloud-based machine learning platforms.
3. Basic understanding of model deployment and serving.
4. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python).
5. Laptop for hands-on participation.

title: Running a complex design environment on AWS
description: Fab (fabrication facility) design requires a complex and sensitive user experience and strong security regulations. In this session, learn how Samsung Electronics, the world-class semiconductor company, has built and operated a design platform on AWS while adhering to high performance and advanced security standards.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of semiconductor manufacturing processes.
2. Knowledge of user experience design principles.
3. Familiarity with security regulations and compliance requirements.
4. Experience in cloud-based platform development.
5. Awareness of Samsung Electronics' semiconductor business and operations.

title: Running generative AI inference on Amazon EKS
description: Some of the most innovative AWS customers are using Amazon EKS to train and run inference for cutting-edge generative AI workloads. In this workshop, learn how to train and serve LLMs on Amazon EKS. Discover how to deploy the JARK stack (Jupyter, Argo Workflows, Ray, and Karpenter) into an Amazon EKS cluster, and learn how to use these tools to train a publicly available model from Hugging Face. This workshop is intended for AWS Partners.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and concepts
2. Basic understanding of Kubernetes and containerization
3. Experience with machine learning and deep learning frameworks
4. Knowledge of Jupyter, Argo Workflows, Ray, and Karpenter

title: Running Streamlit applications on AWS
description: Streamlit is the open source Python framework that turns data scripts and LLM models into web applications. In this chalk talk, explore how to design, create, and securely deploy Streamlit applications on AWS. Topics include basic architecture, authentication, and AWS CDK deployment and lifecycle.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Python programming
2. Familiarity with web development concepts
3. Knowledge of AWS services and deployment
4. Experience with data analysis and machine learning models

title: Run workloads efficiently on EKS with Karpenter and EC2 Spot Instances
description: This session covers how Karpenter can help you reduce complexities and improve efficiency in Kubernetes clusters. Explore how to leverage Amazon EC2 Spot Instances as a purchase option, and learn how AWS Graviton-based Amazon EC2 instances help further optimize your workloads while improving sustainability.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Kubernetes
2. Understanding of Amazon EC2 and Spot Instances
3. Knowledge of AWS Graviton-based instances
4. Awareness of Kubernetes cluster management challenges

title: SaaS and RAG: Maximizing generative AI value in multi-tenant solutions
description: Generative AI will clearly have significant impact on the footprint and experience of SaaS applications. The question is: How does generative AI influence the multi-tenant design of your SaaS architecture? In this workshop, look at how generative AI can be used to deliver new experiences. This includes building out tenant-specific RAG experiences, configuring and managing per-tenant RAG data, metering tenant consumption of models, implementing tenant isolation with generative AI constructs, and so on. The goal is to guide you through end-to-end design and development of a working multi-tenant generative AI solution. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the workshop would be:

1. Understanding of SaaS (Software as a Service) architecture and multi-tenancy.
2. Familiarity with generative AI concepts and technologies.
3. Experience with cloud-based application development and deployment.
4. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python, JavaScript) and relevant frameworks.
5. Willingness to actively participate in the workshop and bring a laptop.

title: SaaS architecture patterns: What tools/strategies belong on my radar? [REPEAT]
description: There is no one-size-fits-all SaaS architecture. Instead, architects must find the unique mix of multi-tenant strategies that address the needs of their specific application. This chalk talk outlines the core SaaS patterns that architects can use to compose their multi-tenant architectures. Which isolation and deployment models best meet the needs of your solution? What strategies to orchestrate the onboarding and provisioning of tenants? These are all examples of areas where you need to determine which tools, services, technologies, and strategies you should have on your radar when designing a SaaS solution.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Software as a Service (SaaS) architecture.
2. Knowledge of multi-tenant strategies and their associated benefits and challenges.
3. Familiarity with different isolation and deployment models for SaaS applications.
4. Experience in tenant onboarding and provisioning processes.
5. Awareness of various tools, services, and technologies used in designing SaaS solutions.

title: SaaS architecture patterns: What tools/strategies belong on my radar? [REPEAT]
description: There is no one-size-fits-all SaaS architecture. Instead, architects must find the unique mix of multi-tenant strategies that address the needs of their specific application. This chalk talk outlines the core SaaS patterns that architects can use to compose their multi-tenant architectures. Which isolation and deployment models best meet the needs of your solution? What strategies to orchestrate the onboarding and provisioning of tenants? These are all examples of areas where you need to determine which tools, services, technologies, and strategies you should have on your radar when designing a SaaS solution.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and SaaS (Software as a Service) concepts.
2. Knowledge of multi-tenant architecture patterns and strategies.
3. Familiarity with different isolation and deployment models for SaaS applications.
4. Experience in tenant onboarding and provisioning processes.
5. Awareness of various tools, services, and technologies used in designing SaaS solutions.

title: SaaS architecture pitfalls: Lessons from the field
description: The last 7+ years spent helping companies build SaaS solutions has been eye-opening. AWS has gotten great insights into the dynamics, challenges, and pitfalls that teams often face when building SaaS solutions. In this session, explore a range of different patterns, including common technical and business themes that have impacted the scale, growth, and cost efficiency of SaaS offerings. This is about capturing these trends and outlining guidance that can help teams avoid falling into these same traps. Hear about the technical nuances, architecture challenges, and operational impacts that undermine the success of SaaS businesses.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience in building SaaS solutions
2. Knowledge of AWS and its services
3. Understanding of the dynamics, challenges, and pitfalls in the SaaS industry
4. Familiarity with technical patterns, architectural challenges, and operational impacts in SaaS businesses
5. Ability to analyze and synthesize industry trends and provide guidance to teams

title: SaaS meets cell-based architecture: A natural multi-tenant fit
description: Building a multi-tenant SaaS architecture is a balancing act. Finding the right blend of cost efficiency, scale, resilience, and operational agility can be challenging. It’s here that a cell-based architecture can often be a natural fit. The cell-based model gives you new ways to approach tenant isolation, deployment, scaling, regional distribution, and tiering, bringing a range of new possibilities to your SaaS architecture and operational footprint. In this session, dive deep on cell-based multi-tenant architecture and discover the strategies, patterns, and considerations that come with employing this model.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of multi-tenant architecture
2. Knowledge of cloud computing concepts and services
3. Experience with software design patterns and architectural principles
4. Familiarity with deployment strategies and scaling techniques
5. Awareness of operational considerations in a SaaS environment

title: SaaS meets testing: Validating multi-tenant scale, resilience, and operations
description: Multi-tenant SaaS environments must be able to efficiently react and respond to a diverse and shifting set of workloads. It’s your job to implement scaling, onboarding, tiering, data partitioning, tenant isolation, and other multi-tenant strategies that can gracefully support these workloads. Building it is one thing. Knowing it works is another. In this session, examine a range of strategies to exercise and simulate your multi-tenant architecture, testing its ability to achieve the security, operational, scale, and resilience goals that you’ve targeted with your design. The goal is to validate architectural policies and assumption before they’re released into the wild.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given scenario:

1. Familiarity with multi-tenant SaaS architecture.
2. Understanding of scaling techniques, onboarding processes, tiering models, data partitioning, and tenant isolation strategies.
3. Knowledge of performance testing and simulation tools.
4. Expertise in defining and validating architectural policies and assumptions.
5. Understanding of security, operational, scalability, and resilience requirements for multi-tenant environments.

title: SaaS microservices deep dive: Multi-tenancy meets microservice
description: Microservices represent the area of your SaaS application where multi-tenant context meets the everyday coding needs of SaaS developers. The microservices of your SaaS environment are where you’ll ultimately apply or use the constructs that will address tenant isolation, accessing data with tenant context, recording tenant-aware metrics, integrating with billing systems, interacting with other multi-tenant microservices, and a long list of other considerations. In this workshop, create real-world microservices that cover a broad spectrum of multi-tenant use cases and implementation strategies. The goal is to see firsthand the way SaaS influences the inner workings of your microservices. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Experience with microservices architecture
2. Familiarity with SaaS (Software as a Service) concepts
3. Basic understanding of multi-tenancy
4. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Java, Python, Node.js)
5. Laptop for hands-on coding and participation

title: SaaS migration and modernization: Balancing strategy and reality
description: The path to SaaS is different for many organizations. There are a range of different business and technical factors that influence how you choose to move an existing application to a multi-tenant delivery model. This chalk talk looks at a range of SaaS modernization strategies and patterns, exploring the challenges and trade-offs associated with different approaches. How and where should you rewrite or refactor your code? How do you inject tenant context into your experience? What parts of the SaaS control plane are needed? These are sample questions that this talk covers.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of software architecture and design principles
2. Knowledge of multi-tenant application design
3. Familiarity with cloud computing and SaaS delivery models
4. Experience in software development and deployment
5. Awareness of common SaaS modernization strategies and patterns

title: SaaS storage strategies: Scaling, securing & tuning multi-tenant data
description: SaaS builders must balance a range of competing needs when selecting a multi-tenant storage strategy. How you'll scale, how you'll prevent noisy neighbor, how you'll isolate tenant data, how you'll support remote data, how you'll shard workloads—these are among the many factors you must consider. This session examines the different strategies and patterns that are applied when designing a scalable multi-tenant data architecture that can evolve as your business evolves. This goes beyond data partitioning, looking into the details of how you address challenging multi-tenant storage models and balance cost, operational, and performance efficiency.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given topic would be:

1. Understanding of multi-tenant architecture
2. Knowledge of data partitioning and sharding techniques
3. Familiarity with storage strategies and their trade-offs
4. Experience in designing scalable and efficient data systems
5. Understanding of performance optimization and cost management in cloud-based environments

title: SaaS survivor: Building a rich multi-tenant operations experience
description: Building a multi-tenant SaaS offering is just part of the job. Once your environment is loaded up with tenants, you still need rich, proactive tooling and mechanisms that allow you to analyze, troubleshoot, and evaluate the state of your system. This workshop takes you through a series of simulated operational events (noisy neighbor, isolation violations, and so on), creating the tools you need to track and analyze the activity of individual tenants and tiers. The goal is to highlight the operational challenges that can surface in multi-tenant environments and explore approaches to creating the tenant-aware operational mechanisms that can support this experience. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of multi-tenant SaaS architecture
2. Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools
3. Experience with troubleshooting and analyzing system performance
4. Ability to work with programming languages and tools for building custom solutions
5. Willingness to participate in simulated operational events and create tenant-aware operational mechanisms

title: Safeguard and audit data protection with AWS Backup [REPEAT]
description: Backup is critical for organizations to meet business operation and regulatory compliance needs. It also helps protect against disasters, accidental deletions, and ransomware. In this workshop, explore different scenarios using AWS Backup. Find out how you can define policies to centrally protect and restore AWS services; choose among Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon EBS volumes, Amazon S3 objects, Amazon Aurora databases, and Amazon EFS file systems; configure AWS Backup Vault Lock to enable write-once, read-many (WORM) backup data; and deliver simple, auditor-ready compliance monitoring and reporting with AWS Backup Audit Manager. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with backup and recovery strategies
3. Ability to access an AWS account
4. Laptop for hands-on activities

title: Safeguard and audit data protection with AWS Backup [REPEAT]
description: Backup is critical for organizations to meet business operation and regulatory compliance needs. It also helps protect against disasters, accidental deletions, and ransomware. In this workshop, explore different scenarios using AWS Backup. Find out how you can define policies to centrally protect and restore AWS services; choose among Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon EBS volumes, Amazon S3 objects, Amazon Aurora databases, and Amazon EFS file systems; configure AWS Backup Vault Lock to enable write-once, read-many (WORM) backup data; and deliver simple, auditor-ready compliance monitoring and reporting with AWS Backup Audit Manager. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services.
2. Familiarity with data backup and recovery concepts.
3. Access to an AWS account with appropriate permissions.
4. A laptop to participate in the hands-on activities.

title: Safeguard sensitive data: Zero Trust data protection for your mission [REPEAT]
description: Data protection is paramount, especially with generative AI’s rapid evolution. Organizations seek strategies for fine-grained control over sensitive information. Learn about the Zero Trust Data Format, a multinational standard empowering organizations to securely protect and share critical data assets. It offers a comprehensive data security approach, extending control beyond traditional boundaries. Explore the format’s core principles and the data types it can protect. Discover how to implement Zero Trust Data Format on AWS through architectural patterns and real-world use cases demonstrating its effectiveness in protecting and sharing sensitive data securely. Gain insights into this robust standard for maintaining data sovereignty.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data protection principles and challenges in the context of generative AI.
2. Familiarity with data security concepts and the need for fine-grained control over sensitive information.
3. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services.

title: Safeguard sensitive data: Zero Trust data protection for your mission [REPEAT]
description: Data protection is paramount, especially with generative AI’s rapid evolution. Organizations seek strategies for fine-grained control over sensitive information. Learn about the Zero Trust Data Format, a multinational standard empowering organizations to securely protect and share critical data assets. It offers a comprehensive data security approach, extending control beyond traditional boundaries. Explore the format’s core principles and the data types it can protect. Discover how to implement Zero Trust Data Format on AWS through architectural patterns and real-world use cases demonstrating its effectiveness in protecting and sharing sensitive data securely. Gain insights into this robust standard for maintaining data sovereignty.
