title: Scale procurement governance and reporting insights in AWS Marketplace
description: As organizations scale, software and services procurement can become complex and can limit strategic decision-making due to the lack of data and insights. Organizations want to reduce vendor risk, CFOs want spending visibility, and procurement and legal teams need to manage and govern across teams. In this session, learn how AWS Marketplace enables you to synchronize procurement workflows and gain consolidated views of spend, usage, and licenses. Gain insight into features like private marketplace, and dashboards available to help you overcome governance and reporting challenges.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of software and services procurement processes
2. Familiarity with the challenges faced by organizations as they scale
3. Knowledge of the role of procurement, finance, and legal teams in managing vendor relationships and spend
4. Awareness of the need for data-driven decision-making in procurement
5. Interest in exploring solutions to improve procurement workflows and governance

title: Scale procurement governance and reporting insights in AWS Marketplace
description: Software and services procurement can get complex as organizations scale, and companies can struggle to assess and manage risks and costs. Cloud marketplaces can help organizations reduce their risk profile. In this lightning talk, learn about advanced capabilities offered by AWS Marketplace to synchronize existing procurement workflows with AWS Marketplace processes. See how you can use dashboards to get a consolidated view of spend, usage, and licenses across multiple accounts.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud marketplaces
2. Familiarity with procurement processes and risk management
3. Knowledge of AWS Marketplace and its features
4. Experience with managing multi-account environments in AWS

title: Scale streaming workloads with AWS Lambda
description: In this chalk talk, learn how to optimize your streaming data processing with AWS Lambda. Explore scenarios where default processing speeds may bottleneck workloads consuming messages from Apache Kafka, Amazon DynamoDB, or other sources—especially when data enrichment is required. Learn how to implement parallel processing techniques for ordered and unordered use cases to address throughput limitations. See a live demo showcasing performance improvements in an example message processing pipeline. Leave this talk with practical strategies for achieving high-throughput, scalable streaming workloads on Lambda.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS Lambda
2. Familiarity with Apache Kafka or Amazon DynamoDB
3. Knowledge of data processing and streaming concepts

title: Scale with self-service analytics on AWS
description: Self-service analytics empowers users to independently access, explore, and analyze data to accelerate decision-making. It’s a foundational step for organizations to democratize the use of data for business growth with easy-to-use, simple-to-understand, and quick-to-deliver tools. Interactive querying, SQL analytics, data preparation, data transformation, data workflow orchestration and search analytics are some of the key day-to-day functions that data users need from self-service solutions. Learn how AWS analytics services like Amazon Athena, AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow, and Amazon OpenSearch Service enable data-driven decision-making through self-serve analytics.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given self-service analytics scenario:

1. Data Literacy: Users should have a basic understanding of data concepts, analysis, and interpretation.
2. Access to Data Sources: Users should have access to the relevant data sources, whether it's on-premises or in the cloud.
3. Familiarity with Analytics Tools: Users should be comfortable using self-service analytics tools, such as SQL, data preparation, and visualization.
4. Organizational Support: The organization should have a culture that encourages and supports self-service analytics.
5. Data Governance: The organization should have established data governance policies and processes to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.

title: Scale your high-traffic events to gen AI deployments with AWS Support
description: Ready to elevate your generative AI investment from prototype to full-scale deployment, or gearing up for a marketing event that’s set to drive significant customer traffic? In this session, explore how customers leverage AWS Countdown and AWS Countdown Premium to strengthen resilience and scale effectively. AWS Countdown Premium is a game-changer for customers migrating and modernizing both traditional and generative AI workloads. With proactive planning, execution, and cut-over across all phases of the cloud, AWS Countdown Premium ensures that customers achieve the desired business outcomes. Learn how Georgia-Pacific successfully scaled its workloads with AWS Countdown Premium.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Experience with AWS services and cloud infrastructure
2. Familiarity with generative AI and traditional workloads
3. Understanding of cloud migration and modernization strategies
4. Knowledge of resilience and scalability best practices

title: Scale your SMS strategy with AWS End User Messaging
description: Executing an effective SMS strategy can be a game changer, requiring careful planning, understanding of user preferences, and adhering to best practices. This session guides you through the entire setup process, covering business use cases, country-level restrictions, and the registration and management of originating numbers and sender IDs. Additionally, gain insights into the timeline for number procurement and explore utilizing AWS End User Messaging features like pool management, opt-out handling, and two-way messaging. Leave this session equipped with the knowledge to set up a successful SMS strategy, whether you’re a seasoned SMS professional or new to the field.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of SMS marketing and its business applications
2. Knowledge of country-level regulations and restrictions for SMS communication
3. Familiarity with SMS originating numbers and sender ID management
4. Awareness of AWS End User Messaging features and their capabilities

title: Scale your software company with AWS growth programs
description: With growth being a top priority for organizations, it’s important to identify programs that can help you scale. In this session, learn from AWS executives about how to expand into new markets with AWS, use the AWS sales team to co-sell your solution, run co-marketing campaigns, and sell on AWS Marketplace. Explore next steps for how and who to engage with at AWS to accelerate your growth in 2025 and beyond.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with business expansion strategies
3. Experience in co-selling and co-marketing partnerships
4. Knowledge of AWS Marketplace and its capabilities
5. Willingness to engage with AWS executives and explore growth opportunities

title: Scaling 3D content creation with open source technologies
description: This chalk talk explores 3D Gaussian Splatting as an emergent 3D reconstruction technique and how AWS can accelerate and scale the generation, management, and consumption of digitalized real-world assets in enterprise contexts, from virtual production to immersive commerce. Learn how 3D Gaussian Splatting differentiates itself as a state-of-the-art reality capture technique, how distributed computing and orchestration can reduce asset creation times, and how generative AI can improve visual fidelity. Explore integration with the AWS Visual Asset Management System (VAMS), allowing for centralized digital asset storage and management, to help power immersive 3D experiences using this technology at scale.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the chalk talk:
1. Understanding of 3D reconstruction techniques
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and distributed processing
3. Knowledge of generative AI and its applications in visual fidelity
4. Awareness of virtual production and immersive commerce
5. Experience with digital asset management systems

title: Scaling and evolving media storage at Netflix with Amazon S3
description: Studio applications at Netflix generate petabytes of data consisting of billions of multimedia assets, such as images, videos, and text, that are delivered and stored securely in Amazon S3. In this session, explore the evolution of the media storage layer at Netflix, including organizing, tracking, and managing the access control and lifecycle of these assets. In addition, Netflix’s ever-growing content landscape has presented several challenges in scaling their storage backend infrastructure. Gain valuable insights into how Netflix tackled scaling challenges, and learn what media-specific features they added to effectively serve their media partners and applications.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud storage solutions (e.g., Amazon S3)
2. Knowledge of media asset management and content delivery
3. Familiarity with scaling and infrastructure challenges in the media industry
4. Experience with media-specific features and requirements

title: Scaling and securing private workloads using Amazon API Gateway
description: In this session, explore how Amazon API Gateway private REST APIs can help organizations address the challenges of managing internal API workloads at scale. Learn about capabilities like access control, resource isolation, and scalability for securing and maintaining consistent API strategies across teams. Discover the latest enhancements for private REST API endpoints. Gain insights from real-world experience using these APIs to streamline workflows, enhance collaboration, and build a secure, scalable API ecosystem. Leave with a deeper understanding of how to secure your APIs and practical approaches for building these endpoints.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of API management
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Knowledge of API security and access control

title: Scaling Epic's Unreal Engine on AWS with Linux containers
description: Discover how Epic Games uses Unreal Engine on AWS to create immersive 3D content for their own projects and for other creators. Learn how this compute-intensive workload is optimized to run in containers and orchestrated with standard tools. Explore the modernization of GPU-based tasks for Windows using Linux, enabling them to run at the scale and efficiency needed to support Epic Games' expanding creator ecosystem.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Unreal Engine
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Knowledge of container technologies and orchestration tools
4. Exposure to GPU-based workloads and their optimization
5. Familiarity with the Windows and Linux operating systems

title: Scaling for enterprise: Insights from New Relic's AWS journey (sponsored by New Relic)
description: New Relic started migrating its entire industry-leading observability platform to AWS in 2020 to support unprecedented growth. Since then, New Relic's engineering team has used its own intelligent observability platform and AWS capabilities to continue scaling to cater to a growing enterprise and meet aggressive growth targets. In this session, Suraj Krishnan, GVP Engineering at New Relic, shares insights on unlocking scalability and accelerating innovation with AWS services and discusses key achievements like saving operational time, increasing focus on core competencies, and developing new opportunities for product innovation. This presentation is brought to you by New Relic, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the presentation:

1. Understanding of observability platforms
2. Knowledge of cloud migration and AWS services
3. Familiarity with software engineering and scaling challenges
4. Interest in learning about New Relic's journey with AWS

title: Scaling from monoliths to microservices with Amazon Aurora
description: In this session, learn to modernize legacy monolithic applications to microservices architectures and migrate large volumes of data using Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL. Features like Aurora Global Database, Optimized Reads, and Query Plan Management are integral to achieving high resilience and scalability. Discover how Intuit uses these capabilities to modernize workloads with hundreds of terabytes of data and tens of millions of tenants.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with monolithic application architecture.
2. Understanding of microservices architecture and its benefits.
3. Basic knowledge of Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL.
4. Exposure to data migration techniques.
5. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and AWS services.

title: Scaling gen AI: Tackling operational challenges with Kubernetes (sponsored by NetApp)
description: As the gen AI revolution unfolds, organizations must navigate the operational challenges of scaling GPU workloads in the cloud. When it comes to AI inference or how AI analyzes and draws conclusions from new data, Kubernetes offers a compelling yet challenging solution. Optimizing AI inference workloads requires deep understanding of Kubernetes and AI models. Setting appropriate resource requests and limits for containers, especially for AI workloads, is tricky. Incorrect settings lead to cost overruns, and/or inefficient resource utilization. In this session, learn how to leverage the power of Kubernetes with AWS and NetApp to overcome the challenges of optimizing GPU infrastructure. This presentation is brought to you by NetApp, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Understanding of Kubernetes
2. Knowledge of AI models and inference workloads
3. Familiarity with resource management in Kubernetes
4. Experience with cloud infrastructure, particularly AWS
5. Awareness of the role of NetApp as an AWS Partner

title: Scaling generative AI in enterprise: Insights from the energy sector (sponsored by Capgemini)
description: Join this insightful lightning talk to explore two compelling case studies from the energy sector. This talk covers the critical considerations for scaling generative AI within enterprise environments, focusing on technology, architecture, design, and essential guardrails. Listen to these concepts and valuable insights gained from Capgemini’s extensive experience with generative AI implementations to help you navigate the complexities of generative AI. This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI
2. Interest in enterprise-level implementation of generative AI
3. Familiarity with the energy sector
4. Desire to learn from real-world case studies
5. Curiosity about the technical, architectural, and design considerations for scaling generative AI

title: Scaling generative AI models for millions of users in Roblox
description: Generative AI is the bleeding edge of innovation but can be challenging to build and operate at scale. Discover how Roblox, a large online metaverse platform, identifies and forms their use cases for generative AI applications. Deep dive into Roblox’s integration of AWS services like AWS Deep Learning Containers, Amazon EKS, and Amazon EC2 UltraClusters to rapidly scale ML infrastructure. Learn about the solution architecture, training and serving environments, compute orchestration, and ML application development SDKs. Gain insights into best practices to speed up development and improve model training efficiency for large-scale multi-node distributed workloads serving millions of users.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given topic:

1. Understanding of Generative AI and its applications.
2. Knowledge of cloud computing platforms and services, particularly AWS.
3. Familiarity with distributed computing and scalable infrastructure.
4. Experience in machine learning model development and deployment.
5. Understanding of the Roblox platform and its use cases.

title: Scaling GPU infrastructure and using LLMs for Roblox's metaverse
description: Roblox, one of the largest online metaverse platforms, has experienced unprecedented growth in recent years, attracting millions of users to its immersive virtual world. With such a massive user base, ensuring a seamless and engaging experience for all players requires substantial computational resources, particularly for rendering complex 3D environments and facilitating real-time interactions. Gain insights into Roblox's approach to forecasting GPU requirements, enabling proactive resource provisioning and efficient utilization. Learn more about the challenges and opportunities in scaling GPU infrastructure and using LLMs for metaverse applications to meet the ever-increasing demands of their metaverse platform.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of 3D rendering and real-time interactive environments
2. Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and resource provisioning
3. Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in metaverse platforms

title: Scaling IAM: Advanced administration and delegation patterns [REPEAT]
description: Join us on a journey to scalable IAM administration and delegation patterns. Discover innovative strategies for effective access management, balancing security and agility as your organization expands. Learn from real-world scenarios, best practices, and cutting-edge techniques to optimize your IAM infrastructure for scalability, performance, and future growth.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of Identity and Access Management (IAM) concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and cloud-based IAM solutions
3. Experience in managing user access and permissions in an enterprise environment
4. Knowledge of security best practices and compliance requirements
5. Willingness to explore innovative strategies and techniques for IAM administration and delegation

title: Scaling IAM: Advanced administration and delegation patterns [REPEAT]
description: Join us on a journey to scalable IAM administration and delegation patterns. Discover innovative strategies for effective access management, balancing security and agility as your organization expands. Learn from real-world scenarios, best practices, and cutting-edge techniques to optimize your IAM infrastructure for scalability, performance, and future growth.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Identity and Access Management (IAM) concepts and principles.
2. Understanding of cloud computing and cloud-based infrastructure.
3. Experience with user and role management in enterprise environments.
4. Awareness of security best practices and compliance requirements.
5. Desire to optimize IAM processes for scalability and efficiency.

title: Scaling industrial transformation with the AWS Digital Twin Framework
description: In this chalk talk, discover how the AWS Digital Twin Framework helps organizations build and deploy digital twins at scale, unifying capabilities across IoT, AI/ML, simulations, and spatial data planes. Learn best practices for using the framework to systematically add capabilities for common industrial use cases, such as asset performance management, production optimization, and product design. Work through flexible pathways to collect and contextualize data, overlay visual assets, deploy predictive models and simulations, and build actionable applications. Find out how the framework can help organizations overcome obstacles to deploying digital twins at scale, including integration with existing systems, information models, synchronization, and closing the loop.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of IoT (Internet of Things) concepts and technologies
2. Familiarity with AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning) principles and applications
3. Knowledge of data management and spatial data processing
4. Experience with industrial use cases and operational challenges

title: Scaling machine learning with containers on AWS: Lessons learned
description: Explore how serverless containers revolutionize machine learning (ML) deployment at scale. This session showcases Instrumental’s journey in using serverless technologies for deep learning, creating a simple, scalable, and cost-effective architecture. Learn how we combined Amazon SageMaker and AWS Lambda to scale training jobs and predictions. Delve into serverless options for ML use cases and discover strategies to implement this serverless approach and optimize your MLOps for both internal and external users.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
2. Familiarity with AWS services, particularly Amazon SageMaker and AWS Lambda.
3. Knowledge of serverless computing and its advantages.
4. Experience with MLOps and the challenges of scaling ML deployments.

title: Scaling multi-tenant SaaS with a cell-based architecture
description: It can be difficult to strike a balance between complexity, efficiency, and flexibility. In this workshop, see how cell-based architectures provide you with new ways to group, deploy, scale, and operate your multi-tenant workloads. Take a close look at a working SaaS cell-based architecture, and implement provisioning, configuration, routing, and dynamic sharding of tenants. Also see how this approach influences the tiering, scaling, and resilience profile of your SaaS architecture. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts
2. Basic understanding of software architecture
3. Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python, Java, or Go)

title: Scaling on AWS for the first 10 million users
description: In this session, learn about patterns and techniques for architecting to handle rapid growth and success of your business’s infrastructure on AWS. Learn how to think about when to scale up versus when to scale out, where caching can help you best, and common points on the journey where breaking up your application into new services makes sense. From utilizing already highly scalable AWS services to architecting distributed system patterns, there are a number of choices you can make early on to help you overcome some common infrastructure challenges later. Come learn how to be ready to overcome the infrastructure challenges that can come with success.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Familiarity with web application architecture and design patterns
3. Exposure to concepts of scalability, availability, and performance optimization

title: Scaling Prime Video for peak NFL streaming on AWS
description: Streaming live sports at scale is critical to meeting viewer expectations in today’s digital age. Prime Video, as the exclusive home of Thursday Night Football, ensures a seamless experience during peak NFL game times by leveraging a combination of multi-Region traffic routing and elastic compute on AWS. In this session, learn how Prime Video uses multiple AWS Regions, scheduled AWS auto scaling to pre-scale capacity, and dynamic auto scaling to respond to unanticipated viewership spikes. Discover best practices for managing large-scale streaming workloads with Amazon EC2, AWS Lambda, Amazon ECS/AWS Fargate, and Amazon DynamoDB, ensuring that millions of fans enjoy uninterrupted game-time coverage.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and AWS services
2. Knowledge of streaming technologies and protocols
3. Familiarity with video encoding and transcoding
4. Experience with large-scale distributed systems and load balancing

title: Scaling private marketplaces across organizations
description: In this lighting talk, explore how you can manage private marketplaces across your organization using a distributed serverless solution. See the step-by-step deployment and configuration of this distributed solution to enable centralized management and governance of products for your enterprise. This solution addresses the challenges of maintaining governance and compliance in complex, multi-account and organizations environments, empowering organizations to streamline their procurement and compliance processes.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given lightning talk would be:

1. Understanding of serverless architecture and its benefits.
2. Knowledge of distributed systems and their management.
3. Familiarity with enterprise procurement and compliance processes.
4. Experience with cloud-based infrastructure and services.
5. Awareness of the challenges in managing multi-account and complex organizational environments.

title: Scaling secure large language models with Robinhood
description: This lightning talk shares the design and techniques that form the foundation of Robinhood’s large language model (LLM) platform, which is built on AWS. Learn how the company uses LLM gateways and Amazon Bedrock to deliver private inference, preserving customer confidentiality without sacrificing performance. Gain insights into Robinhood’s architecture and operational model, which enable the company to scale its AI capabilities. Hear how Robinhood uses the security features in Amazon Bedrock to process sensitive data while complying with evolving regulatory standards.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of large language models (LLMs)
2. Knowledge of AWS services, particularly Amazon Bedrock
3. Familiarity with Robinhood's business model and AI capabilities
4. Awareness of data privacy and regulatory compliance in the financial industry

title: Scaling technology for millions of cricket fans on AWS
description: In India, cricket has been called a religion and has an army of passionate fans. Discover how Dream Sports leverages AWS to serve India’s cricket frenzy by sharing insights on architecting for 15 million concurrent fantasy sports users during the Indian Premier League (IPL) with microservices, AI/ML, custom security controls, and more. This session unveils architectural strategies for reliable, high-scale operations catering to dedicated sports fans, as well as how to deliver a multimillion-fan experience.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of microservices architecture
2. Knowledge of AWS services and their applications
3. Familiarity with AI/ML and its use in sports analytics
4. Experience in designing secure and scalable systems
5. Insights into the Indian cricket fan base and their engagement patterns

title: Scaling to 1000s of containers in minutes with Amazon ECS
description: Auto scaling is the ability to increase or decrease the desired count of tasks in your Amazon ECS service automatically. In this chalk talk, dive deep into the auto scaling mechanisms of Amazon ECS, including capacity provider and Amazon ECS Service Auto Scaling, for both Amazon EC2 and AWS Fargate workloads. Through real-world use cases, this talk highlights auto scaling options with various metrics specific to different workloads.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given "Auto scaling" chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service)
2. Knowledge of Amazon EC2 and AWS Fargate
3. Familiarity with capacity providers in Amazon ECS
4. Understanding of Amazon ECS Service Auto Scaling
5. Exposure to real-world use cases and workload-specific metrics

title: Scaling to new heights: Coinbase migrates to Amazon EKS and scales 10x
description: In this session, explore how Coinbase successfully scaled multiple strategic initiatives by using AWS Professional Services. This session covers the evolution of Coinbase and AWS Professional Services work streams, highlighting how this cross-organizational collaboration created a marked transformation in terms of Coinbase’s cost optimization and ability to scale. Coinbase’s scaling requirements are based on extremely unpredictable market movements. The Coinbase and AWS Professional Services teams were able to implement a migration from Amazon EC2 virtual machines with controlled scaling to achieve massive cost optimization, AWS Graviton capability, and scaling characteristics to meet Coinbase’s traffic needs and customers’ high uptime expectations.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Knowledge of Coinbase's business and scaling requirements
3. Familiarity with cost optimization strategies in cloud environments
4. Experience with AWS Professional Services and their engagement models
5. Understanding of migration strategies from traditional infrastructure to cloud-based solutions

title: Scaling to new heights with Amazon Redshift multi-cluster architecture
description: AWS customers use Amazon Redshift to modernize their data analytics workloads and deliver insights for their businesses. Learn how to design your analytics system to scale with your business needs. Explore the different patterns of multi-cluster architectures and best practices to deploy them cost-effectively. Explore how GE Aerospace overcame challenges with its on-premises system by using a combination of architectural patterns to create an extensible design that met strict compliance and security requirements, achieved performance targets, and shared data across its enterprise.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data analytics concepts
2. Knowledge of Amazon Redshift and its capabilities
3. Familiarity with multi-cluster architectures
4. Experience in designing scalable and cost-effective analytics systems
5. Understanding of compliance and security requirements in data analytics

title: Scepter’s data fusion platform using monitoring in the cloud
description: Methane is the second-largest contributor to climate change behind carbon dioxide. In this session, hear how Scepter Inc., ExxonMobil, and AWS are developing a data analytics platform to characterize and quantify methane emissions. Learn how Scepter data fusion collects and aggregates ground-based, airborne, and in-orbit sensors. Find out how Scepter uses the AWS Global Infrastructure, AWS Lambda, and Amazon API Gateway to process and aggregate large amounts of data, pinpoint emissions, and help organizations like ExxonMobil enable more rapid and effective mitigation. Discover how this solution can also help agriculture, waste management, healthcare, retail, and transportation industries monitor carbon dioxide and air particulates.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Understanding of climate change and the role of methane emissions.
2. Knowledge of data analytics and sensor technologies.
3. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, such as AWS.
4. Interest in emission monitoring and mitigation strategies across various industries.

title: Seamless data migration to AWS
description: Data is the lifeblood of modern organizations, powering critical business decisions and fueling innovation. AWS offers seamless solutions for migrating some of the largest and most diverse datasets to the cloud. In this hands-on builders’ session, learn how to migrate data with AWS DataSync and integrate that data with upstream and downstream applications and workloads. Also explore the application of AI services on datasets to unlock the true potential of your data. Walk away with solutions, use cases, and best practices to make more informed decisions and to differentiate with generative AI. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the session:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with data management and migration concepts.
3. Interest in leveraging AI services for data-driven decision-making.

title: Seamless data sharing with Amazon Redshift [REPEAT]
description: Data copying is time-consuming and can introduce errors and consistency issues. Organizations are looking for an easy way to share data in a well-governed way across accounts, AWS Regions, partners, and vendors. Join this hands-on builders’ session to learn how to easily and securely share live data across Amazon Redshift clusters. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for this session would be:

1. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift
2. Basic understanding of data sharing and governance
3. Ability to access and use a laptop during the session

title: Seamless data sharing with Amazon Redshift [REPEAT]
description: Data copying is time-consuming and can introduce errors and consistency issues. Organizations are looking for an easy way to share data in a well-governed way across accounts, AWS Regions, partners, and vendors. Join this hands-on builders’ session to learn how to easily and securely share live data across Amazon Redshift clusters. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift
2. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts
3. Ability to access an AWS account and launch resources

title: Seamless data sharing with Amazon Redshift [REPEAT]
description: Data copying is time-consuming and can introduce errors and consistency issues. Organizations are looking for an easy way to share data in a well-governed way across accounts, AWS Regions, partners, and vendors. Join this hands-on builders’ session to learn how to easily and securely share live data across Amazon Redshift clusters. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift
2. Basic understanding of data sharing and governance
3. Ability to access and use a laptop during the session

title: Seamless data sharing with Amazon Redshift [REPEAT]
description: Data copying is time-consuming and can introduce errors and consistency issues. Organizations are looking for an easy way to share data in a well-governed way across accounts, AWS Regions, partners, and vendors. Join this hands-on builders’ session to learn how to easily and securely share live data across Amazon Redshift clusters. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with Amazon Redshift
2. Basic understanding of data sharing and governance
3. Access to a laptop for the hands-on session

title: Seamless large-scale migration and modernization with hyperautomation
description: Large-scale migration and modernization initiatives often involve intricate complexities like integrating with multiple on-premises systems, using diverse toolsets, and coordinating numerous processes. In this immersive workshop, learn how to build an orchestration platform that can hyperautomate processes and efficiently integrate multiple migration tools to improve performance and prevent prolonged cutover windows throughout your migration project. Whether you're migrating mission-critical workloads or modernizing legacy applications, this workshop offers the tools and knowledge needed to navigate these transformative journeys with confidence. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the workshop would be:

1. Familiarity with cloud computing and migration concepts.
2. Experience with integration and automation tools.
3. Understanding of legacy application modernization.
4. Proficiency in using a laptop for hands-on exercises.
5. Interest in learning about orchestration platforms and hyperautomation.

title: Seamlessly migrating VMware workloads to AWS: A success story (sponsored by Capgemini)
description: Join this lightning talk to learn about migrating VMware workloads to AWS to manage a hybrid infrastructure effectively. This approach maximizes cloud operations, automation, and financial analytics across AWS environments. It ensures quick time-to-value, robust technical support, advanced enterprise capabilities, cost-effectiveness, disaster recovery, optimized performance, and flexible deployment choices. This presentation is brought to you by Capgemini, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of VMware infrastructure
2. Familiarity with AWS cloud services
3. Exposure to hybrid cloud architectures
4. Interest in cloud migration and operations
5. Desire to optimize costs and performance

title: Seamless migration: Safely transitioning large IoT fleets to AWS [REPEAT]
description: In an era where managing extensive fleets of IoT devices and backend systems poses significant challenges, transitioning to managed solutions like AWS IoT Core becomes imperative. In this chalk talk, dive into the intricate process of migrating vast numbers of devices and backend services from self-managed brokers to AWS IoT, enabling a controlled and risk-free transition. Learn essential techniques to seamlessly migrate to AWS IoT Core without perceptible impact, minimizing error surfaces and enabling quick rollbacks in case of failures. Leave this talk with expert-level guidance on how to safely and efficiently migrate to the cloud, empowering your IoT infrastructure for the future.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Experience with IoT device management and backend systems
2. Understanding of self-managed IoT brokers and their limitations
3. Familiarity with AWS IoT Core and its features
4. Knowledge of migration strategies and techniques
5. Desire to improve the scalability and reliability of your IoT infrastructure

title: Seamless migration: Safely transitioning large IoT fleets to AWS [REPEAT]
description: In an era where managing extensive fleets of IoT devices and backend systems poses significant challenges, transitioning to managed solutions like AWS IoT Core becomes imperative. In this chalk talk, dive into the intricate process of migrating vast numbers of devices and backend services from self-managed brokers to AWS IoT, enabling a controlled and risk-free transition. Learn essential techniques to seamlessly migrate to AWS IoT Core without perceptible impact, minimizing error surfaces and enabling quick rollbacks in case of failures. Leave this talk with expert-level guidance on how to safely and efficiently migrate to the cloud, empowering your IoT infrastructure for the future.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with IoT device management and backend systems
2. Understanding of self-managed brokers and their limitations
3. Knowledge of AWS IoT Core and its capabilities
4. Experience in large-scale system migrations and deployments
5. Awareness of best practices for risk mitigation and rollback strategies

title: Seamless self-service to agent-assisted support with Amazon Connect
description: In this interactive chalk talk, you explore how businesses can seamlessly bridge between AI-driven interactions and human agent support to create delightful customer experiences. Dive into the architectural patterns and best practices for creating these experiences with Amazon Connect, including how seamless handoffs and a unified agent workspace can help boost agent productivity and help agents deliver great customer experiences. You learn how to blend AI automation and human expertise to ensure faster issue resolution, enhanced customer experience, and cost savings through efficient resource allocation.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the interactive chalk talk:

1. Understanding of customer experience management
2. Familiarity with Amazon Connect or similar cloud-based contact center solutions
3. Knowledge of AI and automation technologies in customer service
4. Awareness of architectural patterns and best practices for integrating AI and human agents

title: Searching images through patterns: An AI-powered serverless solution
description: Discover how we leveraged Amazon Bedrock with Claude 3 Haiku to simplify image searching in the textile industry. This session describes the implementation of a scalable, secure, and cost-effective solution for searching textile patterns using AI-driven attribute recognition. We'll explore the use of AWS Lambda, Amazon Aurora Serverless, AWS Step Functions, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon Bedrock to process and index thousands of images. Gain insights into applying cutting-edge AI and serverless technologies to solve industry-specific challenges while maintaining security and optimizing costs.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of AWS services (Lambda, Aurora Serverless, Step Functions, API Gateway, Bedrock)
2. Understanding of AI and machine learning concepts
3. Experience with image processing and attribute recognition
4. Familiarity with the textile industry and its challenges
5. Familiarity with serverless and cost-optimization strategies.

title: Secure access to enterprise generative AI with serverless AI gateway
description: In this chalk talk, explore how to architect a serverless AI gateway on AWS to securely integrate and consume large language models from multiple providers. Explore model abstraction, monitoring, observability, governance, security, compliance, and auditing. Empower your organization to innovate with generative AI while maintaining control and mitigating risks. Leave this talk with real-world practices that you can put into action today.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Familiarity with AWS services and serverless architecture
2. Understanding of large language models and their integration
3. Knowledge of security, compliance, and governance best practices

title: Secure by design: Enhancing the posture of root with central control
description: From Day 1, AWS has been built to be secure by design and by default. Securing the credentials of your most privileged users is a critical element in your comprehensive security strategy. This session explores how to manage root access securely across your AWS environment, while maintaining centralized control and governance. Additionally, discover the latest tools and initiatives AWS offers to enforce MFA, align with industry initiatives, and ensure your environment remains secure.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and architecture
2. Knowledge of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
3. Familiarity with AWS security best practices
4. Understanding of multi-factor authentication (MFA)
5. Awareness of industry security initiatives and standards

title: Secure cloud workloads and data against ransomware and cyber threats (sponsored by Zscaler)
description: With 45% of cyberattacks being cloud-based and 80% of organizations having experienced at least one cloud security incident in the last year, it’s clear that securing your cloud workloads and data is of paramount importance. Join this lightning talk to learn how Zscaler, a leader in cloud security, is leveraging Zero Trust and AI to mitigate risk in cloud environments. Discover best practices on how you can build a Zero Trust-based segmentation architecture. This presentation is brought to you by Zscaler, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud security challenges
2. Interest in Zero Trust architecture
3. Familiarity with cloud-based cyber threats
4. Desire to learn about Zscaler's cloud security solutions
5. Affiliation or interest in AWS Partner ecosystem

title: Secure connectivity patterns from your AWS network to external parties
description: Your cloud network is more connected than ever before. You may face requirements to privately and securely consume services from external parties, while also needing to expose access to your own services with similar requirements. In this chalk talk, explore the common patterns and services that allow you to meet your requirements at cloud scale. Learn how to explore considerations of traffic inspection when architecting connectivity to external parties, using services like AWS Transit Gateway, AWS Cloud WAN, and more.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the given chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of cloud networking concepts
2. Familiarity with AWS services and architectures
3. Knowledge of security and compliance requirements in cloud environments
4. Experience with private and secure connectivity between cloud networks
5. Awareness of traffic inspection and monitoring in cloud-based architectures

title: Secure containers from supply chain attacks
description: Software supply chain attacks have become increasingly prevalent, and organizations of all sizes need to be prepared. Outside parties can inject malicious code into software packages during the development process, which can then be unwittingly distributed to users. In this workshop, explore how you can integrate Amazon Inspector into your CI/CD pipeline to scan for vulnerabilities in the container image. Learn how a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) and container image signing can prevent deploying code with vulnerabilities. Also see how AWS Signer can be integrated into a CI/CD pipeline for image signing. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the workshop:

1. Basic understanding of software development and CI/CD pipelines.
2. Familiarity with container technologies (e.g., Docker).
3. Knowledge of cloud computing and AWS services.
4. Laptop for hands-on exercises.

title: Secure your AI application ecosystem from development to runtime (sponsored by Palo Alto Networks)
description: As AI applications introduce new components like models, plugins, and datasets, each element presents unique risks. Discover how Palo Alto Networks and Precision AI can help you manage risks throughout the AI lifecycle and also detect and prevent polymorphic threats. Explore Palo Alto Networks’ Secure AI by Design offerings: AI Security Posture Management and AI Runtime Security. These solutions protect your entire AI stack—covering data, supply chain, applications, and runtime—ensuring your AI/ML environments are secure, compliant, and resilient. This presentation is brought to you by Palo Alto Networks, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of AI applications and their components (models, plugins, datasets)
2. Knowledge of risks associated with AI lifecycle
3. Familiarity with Palo Alto Networks and Precision AI
4. Awareness of Palo Alto Networks' Secure AI by Design offerings
5. Interest in securing AI/ML environments

title: Securing 50 million requests per month with AWS-based authorization
description: Discover how to use Cedar, an open source language for access control, with Amazon Verified Permissions to build a centralized authorization system for all applications of a high-traffic enterprise organization in a regulated industry. Learn crucial considerations, including the importance of caching for cost optimization and performance enhancement. See how you can improve the developer experience and build components that can be reused by different teams for multiple apps. Additionally, get an honest assessment of the current limitations and areas for improvement.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of access control and authorization concepts
2. Familiarity with cloud computing and AWS services
3. Experience with software development and building enterprise-level applications

title: Securing AI-driven applications with Auth0 by Okta and Amazon Bedrock (sponsored by Okta)
description: In today’s digital landscape, securing applications is crucial. This lightning talk explores how developers can use Auth0 by Okta’s identity management solutions alongside Amazon Bedrock to build and scale secure applications. Learn how to integrate Auth0’s authentication, authorization, and user management features with Amazon Bedrock’s secure infrastructure. The talk also covers how AWS Amplify simplifies development by integrating frontend and backend services with robust identity management. Gain practical knowledge of key use cases, best practices, and technical integrations to build modern, secure applications efficiently in the cloud. This presentation is brought to you by Okta, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of identity management
2. Familiarity with AWS services (Amazon Bedrock, AWS Amplify)
3. Basic knowledge of application development and deployment

title: Securing Amazon ECS workloads with AWS Signer and Amazon GuardDuty
description: In this session, explore the essential steps for implementing robust security measures for workloads on Amazon ECS, including best practices for host, network, and runtime security. Delve into the process of verifying and signing container images using AWS Signer to mitigate the risks of running untrusted or vulnerable software. Examine the power of Amazon GuardDuty and Amazon Inspector to detect potential threats and assess applications for vulnerabilities within your Amazon ECS environments.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with Amazon ECS
2. Understanding of container security concepts
3. Knowledge of AWS services like AWS Signer, Amazon GuardDuty, and Amazon Inspector

title: Securing Amazon Q Business applications with APIs
description: Learn how to securely extend Amazon Q Business applications using APIs. In this workshop, build a single-page web application along with the infrastructure necessary for user authentication via an identity provider. The application will exchange identity tokens with AWS IAM Identity Center to obtain identity-aware AWS Signature V4 credentials. These credentials will then be used to securely interact with the Amazon Q Business APIs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Familiarity with web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
2. Understanding of AWS services, such as IAM, API Gateway, and Lambda
3. Basic knowledge of identity and access management concepts
4. Ability to set up and configure an AWS account
5. Laptop with a web development environment and access to the AWS Management Console

title: Securing Amazon S3: Learn Red Team exploits and Blue Team defenses
description: In this talk, learn advanced Amazon S3 security techniques, moving beyond basic settings. Gain insights into Red Team exploitation tactics and Blue Team defenses, understanding real-world misconfigurations and vulnerabilities. Cover practical examples, including secure bucket policies and AWS Config rule implementation. The session provides hands-on experience with exploit simulations and proactive defense strategies, equipping participants to enhance their S3 security posture and protect their environments from sophisticated threats.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Fundamental understanding of Amazon S3 and AWS services.
2. Basic knowledge of cloud security principles and best practices.
3. Familiarity with common security threats and attack techniques.
4. Experience with AWS configuration and management tools.
5. Willingness to engage in hands-on learning and security simulations.

title: Securing and observing Amazon EKS clusters [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on session, explore how to automate the identification, analysis, and mitigation of risks in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) clusters. Learn how to implement robust security controls—including role-based access control (RBAC), EKS Pod Identity, and service accounts—to apply least-privilege access and secure workload isolation. Also discover how to use AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch to gain deep visibility into EKS cluster activities, enabling real-time monitoring and automated risk detection. Learn the skills to automate risk management processes, helping your Kubernetes workloads remain resilient against evolving threats. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the hands-on session:

1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
2. Familiarity with AWS services
3. Experience with command-line tools and scripting
4. Access to an AWS account with appropriate permissions

title: Securing and observing Amazon EKS clusters [REPEAT]
description: In this hands-on session, explore how to automate the identification, analysis, and mitigation of risks in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) clusters. Learn how to implement robust security controls—including role-based access control (RBAC), EKS Pod Identity, and service accounts—to apply least-privilege access and secure workload isolation. Also discover how to use AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch to gain deep visibility into EKS cluster activities, enabling real-time monitoring and automated risk detection. Learn the skills to automate risk management processes, helping your Kubernetes workloads remain resilient against evolving threats. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of Kubernetes
2. Familiarity with AWS services (e.g., EKS, CloudTrail, CloudWatch)
3. Experience with command-line tools and scripting
4. Ability to bring a laptop to the session

title: Securing and optimizing your software supply chain with Amazon ECR
description: Raise the bar on your software supply chain security with AWS. This chalk talk session discusses DevOps security best-practices, threat detection and incident response in a container world, and how to leverage Amazon ECR, Amazon GuardDuty, Amazon Inspector, and other security services to protect your Amazon EKS workloads throughout your software development lifecycle. Discover how to ensure CVE patching while optimizing storage to accelerate image delivery via seamless integration with open source tools for publishing and deploying containerized workloads at scale. Attendees learn how to efficiently streamline software supply chains while mitigating risks.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of DevOps principles
2. Familiarity with container technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
3. Knowledge of AWS services (e.g., Amazon ECR, Amazon GuardDuty, Amazon Inspector)
4. Experience with software development lifecycle and deployment processes
5. Familiarity with open-source tools for container management and deployment

title: Securing application networking with Amazon ECS Service Connect [REPEAT]
description: In today's cloud-native environment, secure and efficient application networking is essential for reliable distributed systems. This workshop explores key topics including Amazon ECS Service Connect, end-to-end encryption, certificate management, and observability. Learn how to simplify service discovery using Amazon ECS Service Connect, establish reliable and secure network communication, and protect data in transit with encryption. Also learn practical guidance on certificate management and improving observability for effective network monitoring and troubleshooting. Gain a comprehensive understanding of how to build secure, scalable, and observable cloud-based application networking solutions. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts
2. Basic knowledge of container technologies (e.g., Docker)
3. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) services and concepts

title: Securing application networking with Amazon ECS Service Connect [REPEAT]
description: In today's cloud-native environment, secure and efficient application networking is essential for reliable distributed systems. This workshop explores key topics including Amazon ECS Service Connect, end-to-end encryption, certificate management, and observability. Learn how to simplify service discovery using Amazon ECS Service Connect, establish reliable and secure network communication, and protect data in transit with encryption. Also learn practical guidance on certificate management and improving observability for effective network monitoring and troubleshooting. Gain a comprehensive understanding of how to build secure, scalable, and observable cloud-based application networking solutions. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and containerization
2. Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its services
3. Knowledge of networking concepts and protocols

title: Securing applications with AWS and Palo Alto Networks (sponsored by Palo Alto Networks)
description: As businesses increasingly adopt hybrid and multicloud environments, they must take steps to mitigate risk and maintain a high security bar. Protecting your applications and data from sophisticated cyber events is more important than ever. Join Rich Campagna, VP of Network Security Products at Palo Alto Networks, and a Palo Alto Networks' customer as they delve into the specific network security challenges faced in hybrid cloud environments. This session also explores strategies for deploying and seamlessly managing Palo Alto Networks’ leading network security solutions on your AWS and hybrid cloud environments. This presentation is brought to you by Palo Alto Networks, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of hybrid and multicloud environments
2. Awareness of cybersecurity challenges in cloud environments
3. Interest in network security solutions for AWS and hybrid cloud

title: Securing AWS Managed Microsoft AD the AWS Well-Architected way
description: Safeguarding your identity on AWS is paramount, and securing AWS Managed Microsoft AD is crucial. This workshop guides you through the AWS Well-Architected Framework’s security pillar design principles to help you fortify your managed AD environment. Explore how to use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), AWS CloudTrail, Amazon VPC settings, and more to achieve defense in depth and compliance with AWS security best practices. Walk away with practical strategies to enhance the security posture of your AWS Managed Microsoft AD design and deployment. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and concepts
2. Familiarity with Active Directory and Microsoft AD
3. Familiarity with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
4. Ability to access an AWS account with appropriate permissions

title: Securing generative AI in automotive: The Security Scoping Matrix
description: As generative AI ignites innovation across a wide array of automotive use cases, it is essential to prioritize security. This chalk talk reviews the Generative AI Security Scoping Matrix, which is designed to provide a mental model for the five types of generative AI solution patterns in automotive and the unique security considerations for specific example applications. Then, learn how to apply the scoping matrix to an automotive generative AI use case, leveraging best practices for securing the example application using AWS services and techniques that support responsible generative AI adoption.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI and its applications in the automotive industry.
2. Familiarity with security considerations for technology adoption.
3. Basic knowledge of AWS services and their role in securing applications.
4. Awareness of responsible AI practices.

title: Securing generative AI on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Join this chalk talk to better understand security considerations for generative artificial intelligence (AI). Dive into customer challenges with securing generative AI, see how partners can enhance their technical capabilities around data security and authorization for sensitive data, walk through where partners can add value to customer workloads, and get details on what AWS is doing in this space. Bring your questions to explore in detail through interactive conversations and whiteboard viewing through a partner lens.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI
2. Knowledge of data security and authorization
3. Experience in customer workloads and challenges
4. Familiarity with AWS offerings in the generative AI space

title: Securing generative AI on AWS [REPEAT]
description: Join this chalk talk to better understand security considerations for generative artificial intelligence (AI). Dive into customer challenges with securing generative AI, see how partners can enhance their technical capabilities around data security and authorization for sensitive data, walk through where partners can add value to customer workloads, and get details on what AWS is doing in this space. Bring your questions to explore in detail through interactive conversations and whiteboard viewing through a partner lens.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of generative AI
2. Knowledge of data security and authorization
3. Familiarity with customer challenges in securing generative AI
4. Interest in exploring technical capabilities around data security and authorization
5. Desire to understand how partners can add value to customer workloads in the context of generative AI security

title: Securing Iridium’s satellite communications services with Fortinet (sponsored by Fortinet)
description: Iridium is a global satellite communications company, providing reliable and critical access to low-latency voice and data services in the world’s most remote places through its constellation of 66 interconnected low Earth orbit (LEO) satellites. Iridium’s on-premises application is built over overlay constructs such as GRE for routing of voice, data, and control traffic. The hybrid cloud architecture developed by Fortinet’s Cloud Consulting Services maintained these constructs, emphasizing conformance to the AWS Well-Architected Framework. This innovative solution for the aerospace vertical enables a scalable, consistent, and reliable framework that's easy to implement both on premises and on AWS. This presentation is brought to you by Fortinet, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given scenario:

1. Knowledge of satellite communications and low Earth orbit (LEO) satellite technology.
2. Understanding of network routing protocols, such as GRE (Generic Routing Encapsulation).
3. Familiarity with hybrid cloud architectures and the AWS Well-Architected Framework.
4. Experience in cloud consulting services and cloud-based application development.
5. Expertise in the aerospace industry and its specific requirements.

title: Securing Kubernetes workloads in Amazon EKS
description: Kubernetes clusters can be complex environments with multiple components and configurations. Securing your software supply chain, control plane, worker nodes, and pod security policies is essential to prevent unauthorized access, resource exploitation, and data breaches. In this session, learn about features that can help you secure your Amazon EKS clusters. Get guidance on how security and platform administrators can protect information, systems, and assets that are reliant on Amazon EKS while delivering business value to their customers. This session covers security guidance specific to Amazon EKS, Amazon ECR, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), and network security.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Understanding of Kubernetes architecture and components
2. Knowledge of Amazon EKS and its features
3. Familiarity with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
4. Basics of network security and pod security policies
5. Experience in software supply chain management

title: Securing sensitive data processing with AWS Nitro Enclaves
description: To maintain data privacy and comply with regulations, financial institutions must proactively reduce the attack surface area of their data-processing applications. This chalk talk explains how to leverage AWS Nitro Enclaves to enhance security for sensitive data such as personally identifiable information (PII). Explore best practices for securely storing and processing sensitive data, including encryption, secure data storage, and isolated compute environments applied to payment authorization processes and cardholder information protection. Learn to navigate the complexities of data protection and secure payment processing using AWS services including Amazon API Gateway, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of data privacy and compliance regulations
2. Knowledge of AWS services and their security features
3. Familiarity with secure data processing and storage techniques
4. Experience with payment authorization processes and cardholder information protection
5. Familiarity with AWS Nitro Enclaves and their use in enhancing security for sensitive data

title: Securing the software supply chain with AWS and SUSE (sponsored by SUSE)
description: In an era where software development and deployment are increasingly reliant on containerized applications, securing the software supply chain has never been more critical. This lightning talk offers an in-depth exploration of best practices and advanced strategies to safeguard containerized environments. Gain practical insights on implementing automated security controls, integrating threat intelligence, and maintaining the integrity of their software supply chain. This presentation is brought to you by SUSE, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of containerized applications and software development lifecycle
2. Knowledge of security best practices for containerized environments
3. Familiarity with threat intelligence and supply chain security concepts
4. Interest in implementing automated security controls and maintaining software supply chain integrity

title: Securing your generative AI applications on AWS
description: In this workshop, discover how to secure generative AI applications using AWS services and features. Explore how to deploy a vulnerable sample generative AI application and then layer security controls to protect, detect, and respond to security issues. Learn how to apply similar controls to the generative AI applications in your organization. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services and features
2. Familiarity with generative AI applications
3. Ability to use a laptop for hands-on activities

title: Security and compliance considerations using Amazon Q Business
description: Amazon Q Business is a generative AI–powered assistant that can answer questions, provide summaries, generate content, and securely complete tasks based on data and information in your enterprise systems. And, as with any technology that involves sensitive data and potentially confidential information, it's crucial to understand and implement proper security measures when using Amazon Q Business. This chalk talk covers best practices for securing your Amazon Q Business application, including access control, data protection, and compliance considerations.
prerequisites:
The prerequisites for the "Amazon Q Business" chalk talk would be:

1. Understanding of enterprise data and information security principles.
2. Knowledge of access control mechanisms and their implementation.
3. Familiarity with data protection techniques and compliance requirements.
4. Experience in deploying and managing AI-powered applications in an enterprise environment.
5. Awareness of the specific security considerations for generative AI-based assistants.

title: Security and governance: Safeguarding your data with Amazon QuickSight
description: In this chalk talk, explore security best practices for Amazon QuickSight, with a focus on access control and data protection. Learn how to use AWS IAM Identity Center integration to simplify and secure user experiences. Understand techniques for propagating identities to other services and data sources, enabling streamlined user access and data security. Gain insights into implementing robust access controls and safeguarding sensitive information. Discover advanced security features of QuickSight, such as row-level/column-level security and encryption.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the chalk talk:

1. Basic understanding of Amazon QuickSight
2. Familiarity with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
3. Knowledge of data security and access control concepts

title: Security best practices that accelerate mission impact
description: Strong security practices are critical for protecting data, ensuring business continuity, and maintaining user trust, but they’re often seen as barriers to innovation. In this lightning talk for nonprofit technologists, explore how AWS services can help accelerate your cloud development without requiring you to compromise on security best practices. Discover techniques to streamline security, including automating processes, centralizing logs, and using generative AI in development. You leave the session with actionable steps to securely encourage innovation, improve developer experiences, and efficiently scale your security processes.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of cloud computing and AWS services.
2. Familiarity with security best practices and their importance.
3. Interest in exploring techniques to streamline security in cloud development.
4. Desire to learn how to securely encourage innovation and improve developer experiences.
5. Willingness to efficiently scale security processes.

title: Security insights and innovation from AWS
description: Get insights from AWS CISO Chris Betz on how you can capitalize on transformative security innovations from AWS to move fast and stay secure. Learn how AWS empowers organizations to confidently integrate and automate security into their products, services, and processes so security teams can focus their time on work that brings the highest value to the business. Hear how AWS applies its experience, knowledge, and best practices to remove the undifferentiated heavy lifting of security. Chris also shares how AWS is helping to make the internet more secure by scaling security innovation and investing in the security community.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing and AWS services
2. Interest in security and compliance in the cloud
3. Desire to learn about AWS security innovations and best practices
4. Familiarity with security integration and automation in product development
5. Curiosity about the role of a CISO and their perspective on security challenges

title: Security invariants: From enterprise chaos to cloud order
description: Security invariants are critical guardrails in cloud environments, but implementing them at scale is challenging. Deploying them into existing environments without breaking things is even harder. This session defines invariants and demonstrates how to build and deploy them at scale. Learn how to use account and org-level settings like BPA and IMDSv2 and empower automated remediation before we get into the details of IAM and SCP creation. This session is filled with practical examples, including automated testing and AI generation support.
prerequisites:
1. Understanding of cloud computing concepts and architectures.
2. Familiarity with security best practices and principles.
3. Knowledge of cloud-based security tools and services.
4. Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) and automation.
5. Familiarity with AWS services and features.

title: Securonix: Achieving significant savings through app-level optimization (sponsored by Intel)
description: In the rapidly evolving cybersecurity landscape, Securonix faced challenges scaling its Spark streaming and patch processing tasks on Amazon EC2 instances using Amazon EMR. Inefficiencies and high costs made it difficult to keep up with increasing demand. Learn how Securonix turned the tide by deploying Intel Tiber App-Level Optimization software and leveraged AI across their entire Amazon EMR fleet and saw a 33% core reduction, 15% cost savings, and enhanced performance. From using traditional APMs to deploying autonomous optimization tools, learn how Securonix overcame the challenges and how their key learnings can help you achieve better performance goals. This presentation is brought to you by Intel, an AWS Partner.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Knowledge of Spark streaming and patch processing tasks
2. Familiarity with Amazon EC2 instances and Amazon EMR
3. Understanding of cost and performance challenges in the cybersecurity landscape
4. Awareness of Intel Tiber App-Level Optimization software
5. Experience with autonomous optimization tools

title: Select and launch the right instance for your workload and budget
description: AWS continuously innovates to meet customer needs. It now offers more than 800 instances for various use cases—including instances best for common workloads, like web application workloads, and those more appropriate for workloads with specific requirements, like SAP workloads. How do you choose instances? This session covers the latest compute innovations such as Amazon EC2 Flex instances and the new generation of Amazon EC2 instances powered by custom Intel Xeon Scalable processors (Sapphire Rapids), AMD EPYC processors (Genoa), and AWS Graviton. Learn how to determine which instance is best for your specific use case and budget.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites for the given session:

1. Basic understanding of Amazon EC2 instances
2. Familiarity with different workload types (e.g., web applications, SAP workloads)
3. Knowledge of the latest compute innovations from AWS, such as EC2 Flex instances and new generations of EC2 instances
4. Awareness of the different processor architectures used in AWS instances (Intel Xeon Scalable, AMD EPYC, AWS Graviton)
5. Ability to evaluate and choose the appropriate instance for a specific use case and budget.

title: Send high-volume one-time passwords via SMS and email
description: Join AWS SMS experts as they dive into the world of one-time password (OTP) applications using AWS End User Messaging SMS APIs and Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES). Explore setting up OTPs for multi-factor authentication, payment verification, and account recovery. Gain insights into configuring SMS and email for high-volume, international, and resilient OTP sending.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:

1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with SMS and email communication
3. Knowledge of multi-factor authentication and payment verification concepts
4. Familiarity with AWS IAM and security best practices

title: Serverless data ingestion and processing using containers on Amazon ECS
description: Unlock the power of serverless data engineering using containers and event-driven architectures on AWS. In this chalk talk, learn how to architect a scalable, cost-efficient serverless solution for data ingestion using Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Transfer Family. Gain practical knowledge through a real-world retail use case that demonstrates how data can be ingested from third-party sources and transformed with AWS serverless services.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of AWS services
2. Familiarity with containerization and Docker
3. Knowledge of data engineering concepts
4. Exposure to event-driven architectures
5. Familiarity with AWS Fargate, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Transfer Family

title: Serverless data processing with AWS Lambda and Apache Kafka [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to easily process data on an Apache Kafka stream using AWS Lambda in this hands-on session. You will use Lambda's built-in support for Kafka as an event source to process streaming analytics data and publish it to a live dashboard. Learn practical skills for tuning data processing workloads across Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) and self-managed Kafka clusters. Understand how to effectively handle errors and automatically retry failed jobs. You must bring your laptop to participate.
prerequisites:
Prerequisites:
1. Basic understanding of Apache Kafka
2. Familiarity with AWS Lambda and its event sources
3. Experience with data processing and analytics
4. Ability to use a laptop for the hands-on session

title: Serverless data processing with AWS Lambda and Apache Kafka [REPEAT]
description: Learn how to easily process data on an Apache Kafka stream using AWS Lambda in this hands-on session. You will use Lambda's built-in support for Kafka as an event source to process streaming analytics data and publish it to a live dashboard. Learn practical skills for tuning data processing workloads across Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) and self-managed Kafka clusters. Understand how to effectively handle errors and automatically retry failed jobs. You must bring your laptop to participate.

1. Basic understanding of Apache Kafka
